Mini fridge in room which was stocked up each day with one large bottle of water . Iron and ironing board in swim up room which. Safe which was free to use . Our air conditioning wasn‚Äôt great whereas as sons was really good . We had a bath and shower but could only use the bath water if we filled it up with the shower head . TV didn‚Äôt have many English channels apart from 2 . 2 pools one quiet with swim up bar , this pool is lovely but does need a little tlc . The guests spoil it sometime as they leave empty glasses all round the pool side and this attracts the bees which are everywhere as it is . The louder pool was actually cleaner looking but I do not put this down to staff but to the guests returning the glasses . Bees are a problem around the snack bar area especially and my husband was stung . I don‚Äôt know if there were epi pens if he had a reaction but I‚Äôm glad we didn‚Äôt need to find out . Restaurant food is plentiful and so much choice I really don‚Äôt understand people saying there isn‚Äôt choice . Staff all pleasant especially zizu in lobby bar and the 2 ladies on the snack bar . We had new bath towels everyday and new dressing gowns too . The pool staff are attentive and if they see you struggling with the umbrellas they help straight away . The entertainment team work hard but we don‚Äôt get involved as our holidays are for relaxing we do enough at home ! One thing is that you can only have 2 drinks at a time so you have to make journeys together if you want to get drinks for all family and there was always a queue . This was my big gripe as I saw some staff giving the holiday makers 4 at a time then refusing the next person . This happened on our last day but one when one guest asked for 4 drinks and as refused then sad they had been there 12 days already and they had never refused before she got her 4 drinks but I only had 2 . This is where it needs to be consistent and fair to all . The gardens are kept immaculate and the garden team work extremely hard and probably don‚Äôt get the credit they deserve . Evening entertainment was ok nothing special but sitting in the lovely lobby bar was very nice . There is a resident hotel cat and another 2 cats on hotel grounds one being a small kitten . I grew very attached to the kitten and I really hope that the hotel staff look after them . I did feed them every day . I would definitely go back . What i would change is have more sport on in sports bar, get more staff to help on the snack bar, try to reduce the amount of bees, allow the guests to have more than 2 drinks per visit to bar or bigger glasses . Introduce sparkling wine, more up to date entertainment on evening and rota every 2 weeks and a better toaster in the main restaurant. Big big shout out to the pasta station the food was incredible. All in all we had a fab 2 weeks holiday . Thank you

place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
review title: The wonderful team and fantastic holiday
review:
The entertainment team was brilliant always smiling and friendly 
The daytime activities fantastic I like darts, archery, belly dancing, salsa and beer pong 
In Saturday pool party is wonderful 
Thanks for all the Team specially Emma see you next time

place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
review: The entertainment was just perfect. Fun little games like darts and p√©tanque kept the mood light and happy. Nothing forced, just pure good vibes. We didn‚Äôt join everything but still felt included and part of the fun. It made our days better without needing to plan anything. Really good job to the team.

place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
review: 2nd time to the hotel. The animation team really make this hotel 5/5. We will definitely return for a 3rd visit. Jiji, chinwi,pitshu,smily,fairouz are the most beautiful kind people and really make the stay exceptional. We have had the best time as a family

place name: Be Live Collection Marrakech Adults Only
review:
We spent 2 weeks EN July beautiful, in this wonderful hotel; very kind and very helpful staff; special mention to RAJAA who greeted us at every meal with smile, kindness and always showed DE kindness to us; big thank you to BOUCHARA who amazed us with beautiful decorations in our room. 
Thank you to all the staff and see you soon!!!!
Chris and Dom

review title: Unforgettable honeymoon with great food and amazing staff!
review:
We had a fantastic honeymoon here. If you're looking for an all-inclusive right in the middle of a city, this is the place to go. You'll be pampered by all the staff, fun activities are organized, the food is amazing, and the staff are incredibly friendly.

And if you want the best cocktails, make sure to visit Hamza and Abderahmane. Wow, such great guys and their cocktails are truly the best in the resort!

Thank you to everyone at TUI Medina Gardens for an unforgettable week.

review title: Shocking decline in the space of 12 months
review:
We came back to Medina gardens for the second year in a row, having had such an amazing time last year. The 2 experiences couldn‚Äôt have been further apart. 

The air conditioning in the room was all but useless, even after having it on all night the temperate was still 21-22 degrees, with 40 degree plus heat outside it was extremely uncomfortable and difficult to sleep. We spoke to reception, someone came to clean the filter, which was absolutely filthy, but it made no difference. 

We purchased day beds so we could have some shade. On the Sunday, the beds by the main pool were all booked so we booked a bed by the relax pool. When we got to the bed, not only was it completely broken but there were no cushions on it. The bed was broken in the middle so both sides tilted towards the middle, the back section was completely broken off so we had nothing to lean up against. When we spoke to the lifeguard and asked for some cushions, he told us they were in the laundry. 

Upon check out we told the receptionist we didn‚Äôt use the bed on Sunday and asked them to remove it. I then had to wait over 30 mins on our last day for the manager to seek out the lifeguard and ask him. She then came back and told me they could not remove it from my charge as we didn‚Äôt let them know on the day and that it had already been charged to my room. We had booked a bed for the final day, so I asked if that could be refunded, the manager agreed, I paid the bill. 

Twenty minutes later the same manager came out to the pool to our bed and told me we had to pay for the bed! I refused. 

Service in the main restaurant was slow and poor, as was the food. 

We paid for a jacuzzi for our balcony; hardly any of the jets worked, the plastic surround was tatty and dirty, we only used it once. 

The WiFi was shocking. At least 50% of our stay we had none. It kept going in and out which was frustrating when you‚Äôre trying to listen to music or an audiobook by the pool. 

The resort wreaks of cost cutting and is no longer a premium facility. 

The only positive was the service of the guys making cocktails in ‚Äòthe bar‚Äô they were brilliant, so friendly and excellent service. 

Needless to say we will not be returning next year.

Third time here but first time during Summer as usually come for New Year's Eve. Staff are friendly and helpful. They really do want you to enjoy your time. Food is excellent with great selection and very fresh. I did email hotel 3 times over a 4 month period before arriving in order to request room upgrade but never had response. Our room experience has got worse each time we come here.  Another thing to note is we asked for late check out and paid for this but was only given one option till 6pm. When looking on app we saw we could have checked out 2 hours earlier (which fitted with our flight) and it would have been cheaper. We did tell reception and they apologised. Entertainment staff seem to be enjoying themselves but could have done more to involve people during Entertainment nights. We feel this was much better at new year.  There is unfortunately the same age old issue of the reserving sunbeds at crack of dawn which is a pain and have seen this done so much better at other hotels with app reservations etc. The one morning that the sunbed policy was followed through was much better to avoid the sunbed hoggers who leave the towel and disappear back to bed etc.  Overall this is a beautiful hotel with very hard working friendly staff and we will most likely return again in the future.

Just back from our fourth stay here and it just gets better each year. 
Hotel is in a perfect position for exploring the souks and riads and a very short taxi ride to some of Marrakech‚Äôs best spots such as plus61 restaurant or Al Fassia Aguedal. 

We knew that there had been a change of manager this year and with that some staff changes, so wondered if it would have the same family ran feeling, but there were no issues at all. In fact the whole team were incredible. 
From Chef Said and his hard working squad delivering amazing quality hotel food (wait til you see the desserts!) to Aazzedine and Fatima ü•∞ looking after us superbly. They have all been here years now and are an example to all in terms of service, politeness and friendliness. 
I swam every morning and called in to the restaurant for a coffee before going back to the room and the daily greeting from Abdullah is worth coming back here alone. Top top guy. 
Moroccan hospitality takes some beating, and this goes for outside of the hotel environment too, but if this hotel lacks in any 5star refinery then it‚Äôs made up for in spades by the people. 
From the warm welcome by Abir, Chawki and the management team after a late arrival, to the great service by the pool bar squad including Abdulwahid and Reda, topped off by the best bar staff in the city in Ahmed, Mohamed and Omar. 
There have been changes to the nightly entertainment, not something we‚Äôre huge on, but definitely better, and overall lots of little improvements around the whole hotel which are noticeable. There are even a peacock and hen wandering the superbly kept gardens now, which is a strange sight at first but really adds to the character of the place. 
Padel courts, a heated quiet pool for laps and a great gym keeps you in cake credit (you‚Äôll need it), but if you just want to come away to switch off, enjoy some glorious uninterrupted sunshine with only a 15 minute airport transfer then this is the spot. ( RAK airport was great this year too, so it looks like they have addressed the queuing complaints)
There are so many amazing places to visit in the city and using Medina Gardens as a base is perfect. 
Trips to the secret garden, El Fenn, Kabana, Nobu are all within walking distance and Majorelle area with shops and museums is a 5 minute taxi trip.  Just beware of using InDrive as an uber alternative. Some of the drivers are lunatics! Better to pay the local taxis a bit more for a safer, more enjoyable trip. 
Not sure there‚Äôs much more to add and sorry if I‚Äôve missed anyone out but I‚Äôm really struggling to think of anything negative to say. 
I miss lazing in the pool with the city sounds and the call to prayer floating over the garden walls. 
My wife and I will definitely be returning a fifth time.

This hotel is serene relaxing and stress free with immaculate grounds comfortable and clean rooms and beautiful sunshine. The hotel is in a great location to explore Marrakech.
My husband and I have recently returned from our third visit to Medina Gardens and it continues to amaze me how in the middle of a city the beautiful gardens and the hotel are so peaceful and relaxing. Both pools are of a temperature that you can get straight in and swim and are of a size that they do not get overcrowded.
The restaurant serves a variety of different foods and they are not the same every night as there are different themes.  The head chef Said serves up delectable delights every night and would give Gordon Ramsey a run for his money.
All the staff are amazing and cannot do enough for you to make your stay memorable.  The pool bar staff led by Mustafa and assisted by cheeky boy Reda, Bada and Omar are contantly walking around the hotel grounds with drinks for the guests and they also remember your favourite tipple.  The restaurant servers Fatima and Armin are quick to fill your drinks glass and clear your table and are friendly polite and professional and nothing is too much trouble for them. Abdula the restaurant cleaner is constantly on the go keeping the restaurant clean and hygeinic.  The restaurant manager Chawki who is new to the hotel and had only joined the staff 2 days before we arrived goes above and beyond with his excellent hospitality. The reception I only visited to change currency and the staff member Moad was extreamly helpful and engaging.
The Tui rep Zenib is very knowledly if you have any questions about places to visit and she does not just sell trips if they are not  suitable and she is always on site at the time her notice states.  And last but not least the owner of the hotel Hassan who also comes on site most days and speaks to the quests to make sure eveything is going well.  The hotel has 24 hour security and the head guard Hassan keeps everyone safe.
I have travelled to many countries and only once in Thailand returned to the same hotel, but for a short flight, a beautiful hotel and grounds, relaxation, excellent food, amazing staff this for me is a hotel I can visit time and time again. We will be back for a forth visit

review title: Good Stay At TUI BLUE Medina Gardens
review:
My wife & I have just returned from a two week stay at TUI BLUE Medina Gardens. Flying time was three hours five minutes from Bristol and Transfer time to the hotel was twenty minutes or so. We arrived at 21:30 but the restaurant remained open for our evening meal. During check-in you are fitted with your AI wristband.
 
We booked a jacuzzi room and were shown to room 2004.  The bed was large and comfortable - air conditioning worked well and was not noisy. Sleep quality was good although we heard loud music 01:20 one morning but didn't know the source.  Room servicing by the household staff was excellent!    I requested extra coat hangers via the Tui blue app - you can make maintenance and housekeeping requests via the app.
 
Wi-Fi - this was free and good within the hotel buildings but was patchy in the garden area.

Money exchange - change your GB pounds to Dirams in reception - we got and exchange rate of 11.8 to the pound. Don't take Dirams home - it's a closed currency. There is a charity box at the airport .

Pools - we used the quiet pool or the surrounding garden area during our our stay as the main pool was loud and busy.  Reserving of sunbeds is supposed to be against the rules but everyone did it.   Depth was 1.5M all areas .Get pool towels from the towel hut with your blue card.  Towels can be well used but are okay.

There is no drinks service at the quiet pool - you need to walk to the main pool bar for drinks or coffee. Nearest toilets were behind the Culinarium restaurant.

Food - we booked one evening meal at the Culinarium via the Tui Blue App - It wouldn't let us book again during our second week as it says one booking only via the app. We found the Culinarium okay but didn't worry about visiting again as we thought the main restaurant was much better for variety. We didn't use the Culinarium lunchtime for the same reason.

The Restaurant is the main place we ate all our meals - Breakfast was very good for choice with live cooking stations for eggs / omelettes etc. Staff were quick to serve Tea or coffee and clearing the used plates . Juices and various fruits available.

Evening meals at The Restaurant are themed - International , Moroccan,  Indian and seafood to name a few. No dress code is in operation here. Choices again are wide and varied. Fish was always available usually at the live cooking stations- The tagines were always worth a look as they contained meats , fish or vegetables cooked with preserved lemons.   Staff serving wines and water were prompt to ask you what you wanted to drink - All the wines including red, rose ,white and Prosecco were very drinkable.  Bottled or draught beer was good too. There was live music, violin and Moroccan, here some evenings too which was nice to listen to as you ate your meal.

Bar - the main bar and the Piano bar are nice and air conditioned, ( lovely when outside it was 40 degrees) although the piano person only appeared a couple of times a week we really enjoyed listening to him .  Service was good here as were the gin & tonics. AI Cocktails are available - the Pina coladas were very nice.

Entertainment - some nights a quiz or musical bingo was available at 21:00 before the main show at 21:45 in the fountain bar. These acts were mostly good. Bar service was ok. Shows include Moroccan show, live music or live act with belly dancers with fire!

Tours - we booked the 09:30 half day historical tour costing approx ¬£30 each - this included a guide and coach - we visited the mosque you see and hear from the hotel (not inside) - we were then taken to the rear of our hotel (dropped behind the wall at the back of the Padel court to continue on foot)  We then walked through the arch across the road to enter the souks (no stopping to look at the stalls)  to visit  Medersa Ben Youssef Marrakech, a historic Islamic school located in the heart of Marrakech and the Bahia Palace. We walked 5.1 miles in total in the heat of Marrakech, so would not recommend if you have mobility issues.  The coach returned us at 12:30 approx - value 5/10.

Checkout - our hotel pick-up was 17:35  - we asked for a late checkout and this was granted at no cost.  

 There are tip boxes in in reception to tip the various departments.
 
We enjoyed our stay at TUI BLUE Medina Gardens and would recommend it as a destination for your stay.

I hope you find my review helpful!

This hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. If you're looking for a relaxing stress free holiday this is the hotel for you.
Rooms- Very comfortable beds and all the essentials you need. Cleanliness is excellent.

Gardens/Pools- Perfect. There is something for everyone. Busy main pool but still relaxing. Private and relaxing garden spaces to sunbathe in and a lovely relax pool. The hotel was full capacity and there are no sunbed wars unless you specifically want a certain bed, however that is your choice and there are always plenty of beds available in the beautiful garden areas which I preferred as they had natural shade under the lovely garden trees. 

Restaurant- Could not have asked for more. The main buffet restaurant (the only one we use on our 4nts stay) was faultless. The food was varied and very tasty. Plenty of choice for everyone. What I appreciated the most though after staying in numerous AI hotels is that this one did not have the over busy canteen feel, it is an oasis of relaxation. I can not explain enough how relaxing meal times was at this hotel compared to other AI hotels I have stayed in.

Staff- Amazing!! All of them. I can not name just one, they were all as friendly and helpful as each other and this is the first time I have experienced this in a hotel. They are so helpful and always have a smile on their face despite how busy. They work long hours in high heat and I never heard anyone complain. They are a true credit to this hotel. 

Gardens- Beautiful. The resident cats I loved (as a cat lover) to fellow cat lovers that have stayed here mum cat is doing well and her kittens, saw the staff feed them and they truly do look after the animals there which I appreciated.

Entertainment- The usual AI entertainment which was pretty good. The Moroccan night was a highlight.

Spa- A friend and myself visited and the massage was amazing. The price is very reasonable and the staff were so friendly and accommodating. I would highly recommend a visit.

If you stay here you will not be disappointed. Proximity to Marrakesh is perfect. The staff are all amazing and friendly. Not once did I feel the need to tip all the time, it mode no difference to the experience I received and in turn I made sure that I tipped well in the very convenient tip box for all staff in the reception area. This made the whole tipping process so much more easier and relaxing and to be honest all hotels should adopt this practice, as I am sure people tip much better this was if they do not feel harassed to do so. Please if you stay here tip generously at the end of your stay using this method as all the staff here deserve praise.

I stayed here with friends but will definitely be back soon with my husband who will absolutely love this hotel.

A charming and serene spot hidden within the hustle of Marrakech. The garden is beautifully maintained with vibrant colors and traditional decor. A great place to relax and take in the atmosphere. Perfect for photos and a short break from the busy souks.

review title: The best holiday for Peace & Tranquility
review:
Very quick through airport & leaving on the bus within 30 mins, very impressed with this hotel as soon as we walked in, we were led to seats with mint tea offered before being given our room allocation.
The restaurant was left open for us to eat which was lovely after all the travelling 

On our first night we initially had problems with the air conditioning not working, it took 3 phone calls and 2 visits to reception and nothing was sorted. We spent our first full morning trying to sort it out & It took me eventually going to our tui rep who immediately jumped in and offered another room which we accepted, they were amazing both Abir & Zineb very patient with us. It wasn't fun having to repack and move everything but we were so grateful in having air conditioning the rest of the week.
The hotel is absolutely stunning, we loved the gardens and spent most of our time there as it was slightly cooler that the main pool but we used both pools for swimming, no problems getting a sunbed at any time of day. 

Wifi very good - usually get an esim but wasn't needed this time
We ate every day at the restaurant, food was nice and a good variety, our waiter yasine was very efficient and friendly, we really enjoyed getting to know him over the course of the week and nothing was too much trouble for him. 

We dont drink alcohol but soft drinks all from a bottle and quite lukewarm, a pump tap would've been much better for both staff and guests but we did get ice cold still & sparkling water from the machine. 

We did some of the classes with Laura, she is wonderful really put us at ease and was great with the classes. We had no plans to go to the medina square as we were honestly really anxious about it, she really encouraged us to go even just to walk around and gave us lots of tips and we ended up going, she needs a medal for that üòÇ
We also had a lovely massage, absolutely incredible experience.
Overall this place is all about peace and tranquility with still lots going on, I've never been to the same place twice but I will definitely be returning here and recommending to other friends.
Best holiday I've ever had ‚ù§Ô∏è 

Some niggly bits 
The partition wall between the bedroom & shower needs more privacy, for those staying who are not couples it can be a bit awkward having to undress to get in the shower.
Needs more hooks in the room as there was absolutely nowhere to hang any towels or anything.
Mealtimes constantly having to ask for bowls and spoons as they are not on the table
Shower tray needs some antislip on the gloss white tray so slippery

review title: Some like it HOT! Moroccan magic...
review:
Probably best to start with what's great about this characterful place:
- general vibe. Chilled, no pressure to do anything. If you want/need a place to just 'splat' then you got it. Hearing the daily calls to prayer from within the hotel was fascinating and reminded you where you were -  in the heart of a bustling North African city which is right on your doorstep if you want to explore
- mostly extremely pleasant, friendly staff who clearly work very hard and put in the hours to look after both the customers and the hotel itself. The gardens are lovely with real points of interest and the pool is clean and well kept. 
- the food is great, and I like that if you want 'UK' food (which you really shouldn't whilst here) it's lunchtimes only for chips! 
What could be better...:
- Rooms are a bit tired. Hit with the smell of stale cigarette smoke upon entry. And bits just periodically fell off during our stay - the patio lock, the door lock, the shaving mirror landing in my hand. Our shower door didn't work properly and the handle was covered in limescale. The safe deciding it wasn't letting us in. Minor gripes but expected a bit better. Also, unless you're with your true love, there's not much in the way of privacy with the bathroom being quite exposed to the bedroom area. Towels could do with a refresh, as well, they were quite rough and threadbare. 
- The bar service overall was pretty good, if you're not in a hurry. But the inconsistency in what you asked for (unless it was wine or beer), was quite dramatic. Some times mindblowingly strong cocktails and others had us questioning if there was any alcohol in them. And the pool bar staff were almost mute in their interactions - at least with me. To be fair, I think I'd be a bit naffed off if all carbonated drinks had to be served from plastic or glass bottles and not on tap. Come on TUI, this is a busy hotel, you can't expect staff to serve drinks like they're at a kids' party! Same for the restaurant area. The poor servers have tiny little workstations - no wonder there were a few spectacular crash/tinkles.
Overall, however, it's a lovely hotel, with some fun - but not too full on - entertainment, and quiet spots for those that want it. Add on the Lionesses winning whilst we were there which turned the Fountain Bar into an impromptu jamboree venue and would I recommend this place to friends and family? Yes!

We‚Äôve stayed at quite a few all-inclusive resorts over the years, and overall, this one ranks pretty highly, I‚Äôd have given it 3.5 stars if that were an option. The setting is gorgeous, the food was genuinely impressive, but a few recurring issues held it back from being a full 5-star experience.

üåü Highlights
Food: Easily one of the best food offerings we‚Äôve had at a resort like this. The tagine station was consistently delicious, the daily BBQ was a treat, and the desserts were indulgent. The later meal times were handy too. The only downside was that the menu could‚Äôve used more variety over the week.

Grounds & Pools: Beautifully kept with lots of greenery. The Zen Pool lives up to its name, very relaxing. The main pool was lively but never chaotic.

Atmosphere: Outdoor dining was really great with mist sprays keeping things cool. The bar area had a charming ‚Äútown square‚Äù vibe with blooming bougainvillea, really lovely.

Staff: Warm, friendly, and helpful overall. A special shout-out to the on-site medical team who helped me free of charge out with an eye infection and a wasp sting (those little guys are everywhere and i ended up in hospital last time I was stung). On one occasion, however a barman at the Zen bar did mock my accent, which wasn‚Äôt great.

Entertainment Team: Loads going on during the day and early evening. The main evening shows weren‚Äôt to my taste, I went once and slipped away after 15 minutes, but others seemed to enjoy them. During their weekly White Party they started packing up half way, which was a bit strange!

üòï Letdowns
Drinks Offering: This was the biggest disappointment. Very limited spirit choices (many common ones missing), weak pool cocktails that tasted like squash, and staff often unwilling to make drinks they had the ingredients for. Self-serve drink stations often had no cups, and replenished meal-time wine was warm once the chilled bottles were gone. With just a few more staff and better stock management, this could be vastly improved.

*Beds & Room Comfort: The bed was really uncomfortable, two small mattress protectors that did not fit and a loose sheet that ruffled up nightly. Not ideal for restful sleep. Other minor room issues (balcony door didn‚Äôt lock, safe didn‚Äôt work, shower gel holder fell off the wall) were eventually fixed, but still frustrating.

üìù Things to Keep in Mind
*Shuttle bus drops you about 25 minutes‚Äô walk from the Medina centre.
*The hotel is a bit remote, some activity providers won‚Äôt do pickups from here.
Had to go back several times to get room cards reactivated.
Noticed some guests getting preferential treatment, sunbed and table service, while we were overlooked entirely. It could‚Äôve been language-related, but it didn‚Äôt feel great.
Very limited shade by the pools, and fixed umbrellas mean little flexibility.
Management was open to feedback when I submitted a form on our last day, which is a good sign.

This is a lovely hotel in many ways, the food, the setting, the friendly staff really stand out. I just wish the drinks had lived up to the standard set by everything else. A few tweaks would take this from good to great.

review title: This hotel lived up DE my expectations, including the exceptional staff, and of course, the animation and the team DE chef
review: This hotel lived up DE my expectations, including the exceptional staff, and of course, the animation and team DE chef emmy, who was up to the task, very friendly and helpful, the food more than correct and the hotel EN general very nice.

Absolutely amazing hotel, entertainment staff were incredible, made you feel extremely welcome and remember you daily even tho they see hundreds of people a week!
food was amazing and different everyday
Kids club looked great we just didn‚Äôt use it.
There was a subbed war towards the end of our stay as it got busier only for the ones closest to the pool steps, they were the best ones if you have young kids!
Bar staff work extremely hard especially in the heat. 
Room‚Äôs cleaned daily the hotel was very clean intact
Night time entertainment was great but it was extremely hot when we went and it‚Äôs of course outside so 36¬∞ at 9pm it‚Äôs the best! So much to do there! highly recommend and would definitely go back

Our 4th visit to Marrakech with kappa club a l Iberostar la palmeraie an always pleasant stay of the animators Soufiane Abdel hytam mousse Olya at the top always present to please you super excursions. review title: Lovely hotel, brilliant staff, drinks could be better.
review:
This is a really nice hotel and we‚Äôve had a great week as a family of 5. 
There are a few pros and cons‚Ä¶ 
Pros - there was never a fight for sunbeds we always managed to get one at the kids pool at 9.30 and no drama going to reserve one and then for breakfast. 
The restaurant times were good so you could have a little lie in and still get decent food, same in the evening if you like staying in the pool until closing time there was still hot food being brought out at 9-9.30pm. 
The entertainment team are fabulous they work so hard all day and night getting people involved without being overbearing, round the pool and in the evening. 
The staff are all so nice, friendly, helpful and I didn‚Äôt see any bias towards French or anything but obviously they can all communicate much better. If you can tip the bar and waiting staff they are so appreciative and they work so hard! 
The food is always plentiful‚Ä¶ at times a little repetitive but I‚Äôm a fussy eater and always managed to find something. 
Cons - the drinks‚Ä¶ we are familiar with the Iberostar brand and this is why we booked this particular hotel as we know the food and drink is always good however sometimes the beer was flat and cocktails were pre mixed. Brands were extra. 
The food truck only did burgers at lunch and then waffles/pancakes in the afternoon and it wasn‚Äôt self serve so resulted in long queues. Same with the drinks it‚Äôs help yourself but waiting in long queues to ask for a cup - the bar staff seemed stressed at times. This could be avoided by having paper cups for soft drinks. 
I felt there could have been more of a kids station in the restaurant as we had a 4 year old with us and sometimes we would take a burger in with us for lunch so she could eat with us. 
Overall it‚Äôs been a lovely week and the staff really made it so lovely. 
Side note which is nothing to with the hotel but wish id known - the airport is awful, long queues for long times and no air con.

Amazing stay at the Iberostar Hotel with the Kappa Club!
Many thanks to the exceptional animation team ‚Äì Haytam club teens, Yousef and Mouss ‚Äì you made our holidays unforgettable.
The activities were varied and very lively every day.
Our room was always clean, spacious and comfortable.
The food was delicious with lots DE choices for all tastes.
The staff DE the hotel were friendly and always available.
We will return without hesitation ‚Äì ideal for families and couples!

Stay it was very exceptional unforgettable.the staff is very nice smiling the hotel is quiet.various meals,clean.
Thank you very much.
OUHAKKI El Mustapha.

Animators kappa club top Yousef ,haytam Mouss ,and responsible Soufiane üëå 
Family atmosphere rather unfortunate for stays with friends which therefore lacks animation in the evening. Young people who want to party should avoid it. 
Hosting servers, nice iberostar team. 
Lots DE cameras, too much security surveillance.
Animators can't party with customers too bad that's what would make customers come back.

review title: Stay was exceptional. Thank you bcp
review: Mohamed from 25/07/2025 to 31/07/2025 room 1120 and 1122: Exceptional stay! The welcome was perfect, EN starting with the people DE reception Ssi Zakaria,Ssi Rabie, their colleges and the person in charge Mrs. Amina. Staff always listening and smiling, EN addition the staff DE catering Mrs Rachida , Mrs Kaoutar, Mr Mohamed, Mr Hicham and the others are very kind people . the animators very helpful and smiling. The room was perfect, very large, spacious and very clean. The hotel is amazing, beautiful, large and luxurious and the room service DE great. The food is also very good and varied. review title: I like the show in the night and the activities in the pool ,the food was great the service was too good the animation
review: I like the show in the night and the activities in the pool ,the food was great the service was too good the animation team was adorable and silly I wish I go to ebirostar marakkesh every year

Everything about the hotel is fantastic from the staff to the rooms to the facilities. 
On arrival all
The staff are very welcoming and helpful with luggage. We were given welcome drinks from the bar before heading to the room where are luggage had already arrived. 
The room was huge with the garden view situated on the ground floor. 
Walk in shower and separate bath were excellent. Double sink with large mirror covering the walls. 
Walk-in wardrobe also included within the bathroom area. 
The pools were huge, apparently largest in Marrakech. Pool are was kept clean with a lot of maintenance staff constantly up keeping the grounds. 
The hotel was quiet during our stay so plenty of sun lounges. 
The staff couldn‚Äôt do more to help and we had a good chat with imad behind the bar. 
The concierge arranged private taxis to and from the city with pre agreed rate. This was helpful as we were advised the small yellow taxis aren‚Äôt allowed to leave the centre of Marrakech. 
The taxi service was excellent and highly recommend all travel using them. We were given a WhatsApp chat to communicate to driver so we could arrange pick up spots in centre. 
The restaurants were all serving amazing food from Italian to Lebanese with prices being reasonable considering the hotel rating. 
The hotel amenities were excellent from the gym to tennis courts. The gym had a good mix of free weights and machines. The spa looked good although we didn‚Äôt use this. 
Would highly recommend staying here if planning a trip to Marrakech. The hotel is set within a large complex and there are 2 security barriers before arrival where drivers have to report in making the resort feel extremely safe.

The hotel, its staff and its golf course are really good. We had a garden suite which was excellent and the room servicing was almost too good. Staff seemed to be checking if we wanted anything almost hourly !!
The bathrooms are enormous and the bed mega comfortable. Endless N'espresso coffee pods and bottles of water. All by charming staff. 
The lighting system in our suite is so complicated. We didn't really understand it after 12 days üòÇ
We stayed half board and the breakfasts were wonderful but the sparrows and flies on the open food were a worry. We both had upset tummies early on. 
The blurb told us we had three restaurants to choose from but in fact there are only two. A very good Italian   one that serves Moroccan/ Lebanese. Both were very rich food so on reflection we would have done better to go B & B and popped into town for dinners. 
The golf course is really well maintained and suitable for me off 9 and Susie off 25. They try to insist you have a caddy every round, even if you are in a buggy. You can refuse however at ¬£18 a round so what.  
During our stay my wife had a bad fall that required stitches in her head. The hotel were wonderful. They arranged for a doctor to visit immediately who drive us to the local medical centre for scans and tests and the stitches. He then visited us in our room on three further occasions. Very impressive. 
Minor gripes. Hardly any English TV,
No book of what to see and do. You have to ask the concierge everything. 
We had a his/hers massage. Without asking they added 10% service and then lefta space for 'tips' A pet dislike of mine. 

All in all a great hotel.

Sublime hotel , from arrival you can feel the greatness of the spaces and the majestic entrance. The great highlight DE the hotel is its exceptional service. DE the reception to the housekeeping, the staff of the breakfast restaurant and those DE the pool I highly recommend this magical place for an unforgettable stay in Marrakech.
All my very warm thanks go to SOUAD our kind maid DE kind and with full DE little intentions she really deserves all the attention DE her superiors.
At breakfast HASSAN a man with a big heart available smiling at the Fairmont DE la chance to have a staff DE this standing there, without forgetting of course his colleague SAMIR, a passionate customer service very professional and always attentive.
I also thank MOUAD and ABDLEGHNI pool staff, two very dynamic young men and on the lookout for all our requests, they deserve special attention from their management, I enjoyed talking with them and I wish them success.

Great friendly service, fantastic pool and the food is some of the best we have ever tried. Highly recommend 

We have a few excursions yet to do, excited to see what else Morocco has to offer!
Ilham,Samir and Hassan have provided a top service. My family and I felt very comfortable. The hotel is very family friendly.

Excellent service! Thanks to Abdelaziz and Karim for the breakfast service. And welcome DE Ghita and Mouloud. A perfect hotel on every point. We recommend this magnificent hotel with its exceptional services for an unforgettable experience

Thank you to Samir for his breakfast service.
The quality DE the bedding is amazing.
Hotel that deserves its 5 stars.

came here for a day visit and omg what an experience. The staff the food the attentiveness of the team was 10/10. 
Abdelaziz was our restaurant waiter and he was simply amazing. His attention to detail and recommendations were fabulous

Excellent service. Room was always left looking beautiful and neat, water constantly getting topped up in the fridge, beds fresh and clean. The ladies were very polite and trustworthy, very impressed. Thank you so much Khadija, Mazaine and Halimah!

Very good meal the servers Aziz and amine very professional and kind! 
Welcoming , I highly recommend this place
Best hotel I stayed in, perfect in every detail. The service providers are extremely kind and attentive.

I have wanted to experience The Royal Mansour Hotel for myself for a long time. I have been fortunate enough to travel extensively throughout my life, staying at hotels of all grades, though my appreciation of those at the luxury end of the spectrum has increased as I have grown older. I have reviewed and assessed hotels for many years and sharing my findings and impressions with people is something I find very pleasurable. Hopefully I have been able to share insight and ideas with my 0.8 million readers.

I saw a documentary about The Royal Mansour several years ago and it certainly captivated my imagination. The hotel is located in the heart of The Medina and is actually a medina within the medina. I found the website to be very helpful in assisting me select the most suitable riad for myself and customer services were very swift in coming back to me with answers to a few questions. I opted for the Premier Riad since it had the highest specifications for one or two persons. I usually travel solo, particularly when I am researching venues.

Whenever possible I like to book directly with a venue rather than through an agency. There are advantages to both methods however this reviewer finds that venues are getting much more competitive in their offers in an attempt to attract customers to book direct. My package gave me a 4-night stay for the price of 3 and I found that to be perfect. Return airport transfers were included, as was fast track through passport control both ways. Breakfast was also included as well as soft drinks from the mini bar. This last point was the only aspect of my stay that did not happen with perfection without the need for me to make daily follow-up requests. The hotel contacted me a few days ahead of my arrival to confirm the arrangements and to identify any specific requirements that I might have. Before I left home I already felt valued.

My arrival was seamless, and as I exited the aircraft and moved towards immigration, I was met en route by the airport fast track representative, who spoke excellent English and was lively and animated. It was a delight to be escorted immediately to an immigration officer who admitted me. I was then handed over to the Royal Mansour driver, Abdelanti, who took me to the awaiting Bentley for the 20-minute drive to the hotel. He was friendly and once again spoke excellent English. He advised me that he has worked for Royal Mansour for 16 years so I believe that says something positive from both sides of the equation.

As I approached the hotel entrance and exited the car, the senior staff from each department were lined up to greet me individually. This was an incredibly personalised and delightful touch. I was seated by a concierge, Mahdi, who served me with mint tea and completed the check-in formalities. He escorted me around the principal locations of the hotel such as the spa and the restaurants, and we then moved on to my riad. I was immediately impressed by the sheer opulence of the building and the high standards to which it was designed, built and furnished. The official check-in time was 15:00 however my riad was ready on my arrival at 11:00 and this was very greatly appreciated.

The ground floor of the riad consisted of a tiled entrance hall leading into an open roofed lounge that had a small fountain. There were comfortable chairs and huge plants and I became instantly aware that I was effectively in my own house. Sliding doors lead into a large sitting room where any guests could be seated comfortably. This led into an internal lounge that was traditionally furnished to an incredibly high standard with tiled floors and high-quality fabric curtains. There was a floral arrangement that was changed during my stay, and a fireplace, a separate table and a fully stocked minibar. The soft drinks were replenished daily, though I did need to remind the hotel each day. The was a high-quality writing desk. All rooms had incredibly high ceilings, and the temperature was individually controlled to a comfortable standard. There was a separate kitchen room that had a microwave and a fridge and more bottled water. There was a toilet on this level and a tiled winding staircase led up to the first floor.

This first floor had an extensive wardrobe and dressing room that was curtained off. A short corridor led to the opulent bedroom that had a wooden parquet floor. The bed was huge and extremely comfortable, with high quality fabrics, pillows and cushions. The bed, linens and pillows were very high quality with a high thread count. There was a small vanity desk by the window and the curtain fabrics were high quality and very effective for blackout. The room benefited from atmospheric lighting that could be individually controlled and had a huge armchair with foot rest. This chair formed a central feature. Again, there was plentiful storage space. Very attractive, floor-to-ceiling carved wooden doors separated a further dressing room that contained a safe. A few rugs and mats were scattered around the room. More carved wooden doors lead to a huge tiled bathroom with a separate toilet and bidet room and a massive shower room. High quality weighing scales were in the room. Two bathrobes were provided and a generous supply of extremely soft and fluffy towels. The room had a massive tiled bath, providing every comfort that could be desired. High quality toiletries were provided.

A further winding staircase led to the third floor, where there was another toilet and a door leading out to the terrace. Views from here were over the roofs of adjacent riads but structured in such a way as to provide complete privacy. It became extremely hot up there during the day and I learned very quickly to be sure I wore the slippers which were provided. On the terrace was a private cabana that provided some protection from the heat during the day. Four attractive tiled steps lead to an upper level, which consisted of two loungers with an umbrella, a fireplace for cooler months and extremely attractive potted plant arrangements. There was a shower and a medium sized plunge pool, which was sun heated and this retained the temperature at night. In colder months the water temperature can be manually adjusted upwards by the hotel. Subtle lighting on the terrace made for a very pleasant experience during hours of darkness. Pool towels were provided and the entire terrace area was extremely relaxing and comfortable. Palm trees were interspersed between the raids.

All rooms had a at least one wall-mounted tablet from which the temperature and the lighting could be individually controlled. There is also a button that control the entire riad with do not disturb signs to the staff. Staff accessed the riad via external and underground tunnels. It took a little adjustment to get used to this but it worked extremely well and the staff were courteous and discreet.

Malika Gargour was my principal housekeeper and she really was sunshine on legs; radiating joy and happiness constantly. My riad was maintained to the highest conceivable standards of cleanliness and brilliance.

There is a large outdoor pool in the complex and also a spa. I did not use these.

There are four restaurants available and breakfast is taken in a delightful outdoor one that provides plenty of shade if desired. A large menu is available and this contains an extensive range of options. The service could not be more welcoming however special mention must go to Mustaffa, who is without doubt especially strong for his warmth and attention to detail. For example, I liked sparkling water to drink and asked for plenty of ice to be provided. A few minutes later, Mustaffa returned proactively not only with ice, but with a small plate of sliced lemon to add to the ice and water. He was the only server to do this during my stay and he displayed an exemplary work ethic. Nothing appeared to be too much trouble for the staff and all requests were received positively. Food items were very fresh and plentiful and refills of anything were freely offered.

I dealt with the reception staff and concierge staff on several occasions and I found these to be extremely accommodating and helpful. Foreign currency could be exchanged at reception and the rate was very fair.

When making arrangements to leave, I was delighted to receive a personalised 6-hour extension to my checkout time as I had a mid-evening flight. This was so helpful and enabled me to take afternoon tea before my departure.

The afternoon tea was extensive and served delightfully, with very fresh products provided. Staff were again attentive.

My stay at Royal Mansour was a true delight and genuinely deserves the five-star rating I have given for the facilities, cleanliness, service and sheer opulence. Although some might consider stays to be expensive, I would defend this by saying that it was perfectly and fairly balanced with extremely high standards that guests enjoy. There are three hotels that stand out with me for providing a complete five star or even six-star experience and both on different continents. Royal Mansour is in joint first place with the other two. I sincerely appreciate the facilities and hospitality that has been offered to me by the management and staff over a most delightful four-night stay.

We did have some reservations when we booked this trip, but these disappeared immediately on arrival.  Wow, what a wonderful hotel and city. The hotel is magnificent, staff were wonderful and accommodation impeccable. if you ever get the chance to visit this amazing city, we could not recommend this hotel more highly.
Thank you for making our first trip to Marrakech truly unbelievable.
Amazing okace service and property. The only bad thing is the housekeeping people sneaking in your room from the secret passage ways without knocking. Bizzare. The rest top notch.

review title: Most Beautiful and Best Luxury Hotel
review:
Excellence at all levels Great friendliness and availability of staff
We will be back with pleasure

We knew the Royal Mansour Marrakech would be an incredible hotel, but it surpassed our very high expectations. 

Words and photos cannot accurately convey how beautiful every detail of the hotel is ‚Äî not surprising given that it‚Äôs the King‚Äôs hotel. All the tiling and carvings were done by hand and the riad is a truly special home away from home. We have stayed in many luxury hotels ‚Äî from well-known brands to boutique resorts ‚Äî and none come close to the Royal Mansour. The food, service and amenities were excellent and the staff were the best of the best. 

We particularly liked how private the hotel is. Each riad has its own pool on the roof. Housekeeping enters through a special entrance and travel via tunnels and passageways so they are never seen when you‚Äôre walking around the hotel. No carts in the hall at Royal Mansour!

We were at Royal Mansour for 5 nights, and it was not enough time to see all the amazing sights in Marrakech, go into the desert and Atlas Mountain, and relax by the pool and spa. HIGHLY recommend staying for at least 7 nights, especially if this is your first trip to Marrakech. (Also recommend Adil from Marrakech Desert for an excursion to the desert/mountains.)

In short, the only negative about the Royal Mansour is that it will ruin all of your future hotel stays!!!

You won‚Äôt be disappointed! 

Shukran, Royal Mansour, for an excellent stay! Can‚Äôt wait to visit again!

Truly a masterpiece of Moroccan luxury. The riads offer unmatched privacy and elegance, the service is discreet and personalized, and the spa is absolutely world-class. Dining is refined, though pricey. A serene escape for those seeking absolute indulgence.

The most amazing experience. The riad accomodation was next level.  Such a huge complex for a romantic getaway. So many room, day beds, spaces to relax in with so much opulence, day beds on rooftop pool area. Could not fault anything. Food was some of the best I have had ever.
Amazing in all regards!! Without a doubt one of the best properties we have stayed at, if not the best. The service is impeccable. Highly recommend.

This hotel is quality the staff and service is the best I have experienced outside on the UAE all the staff are amazing with the service food is fantastic and the hotel is spotless  it‚Äôs walking distance from the souk and has so much privacy also lovely to see families here. This is my first time in the city and will be back to have the the warm welcome and experience

I came to surprise my wife for our 10 year anniversary. She had the time of her life. We really enjoyed our Pool Villa. It was a shame we could only do 1 night but in future we plan to do 3 nights. We most definitely have to come back. We absolutely loved our butler Yassine. What a great guy!! If we come back we will definitely be requesting Yassine. The breakfast was the best we have ever had. The staff were so accommodating.  Dinner at the Ling Ling was incredible with an incredible view of the poolside. That pool Villa is the best room we have ever experienced. That was incredible. Wow. Thank you so much Mandarin Oriental. I have told so many friends about how great this trip was.

Beautiful establishment, we had lunch at Pool gar DEn the staff is very caring, Oualid was extremely responsive and helpful thank you very much for the surprise of my birthday I had a good time with my friends.
Thanks to Mohcine too who always DE asks if we need anything.
I recommend restaurant , we will come back to taste the other dishes.

Not quite sure where to start with this review‚Ä¶words like exceptional, incredible, stunning and so so special just don‚Äôt do this hotel justice.

Yes it is pricey, probably the only con I can think of because everything else just blew us away. A real life oasis.

From the moment we arrived, we were made to feel so special and the service is incomparable. All the staff, everyone, thank you so much ‚ò∫Ô∏è .

Then you have the villas of course that kind of takes your breath away.

The hotel gardens, which of course you can‚Äôt get a sense of how truly beautiful they are, as you walk towards your villa, all you can smell is jasmine and roses, genuinely, I kid you not.

The main pool is stunning, (I‚Äôm running out of adjectives) we had it to ourselves pretty much the whole day we sat by it.

The spa‚Ä¶.my fianc√© and I both had the traditional hamman which was the perfect way to kick off our holiday, clean off the London grime and prep our skin for some sun.

The food was delicious, our 15 year old son loved Hakasan most, I loved the breakfast, my fianc√© loved it all.

Last but not least, Oussama, our Butler, was INCREDIBLE, thank you for looking after us and making our holiday so special.

We went there for our mini moon. Our butler Amine was great and the villas are gorgeous. You are however on the landing path to the airport so you get woken up from 6am. The breakfast was delicious but the service can be quite long. We had an issue with the noise from the AC in the villa but this was resolved by the hotel.
I had one of the best experiences of my life. A spectacular service and the maid Amine is an added value for the Hotel.

A timeless stay, the most beautiful hotel we stayed in. The staff is very attentive all your requests are complete.  The whole complex is very clean, bikes available, breakfast is fantastic.  We come back very happy every year!

We absolutely loved our stay at the Mandarin Oriental Marrakech ‚Äî truly a five-star experience from start to finish! The property is stunning, the service impeccable, and every detail thoughtfully curated to make guests feel special.

The hotel‚Äôs location is perfect: just a quick 10-minute drive from the Medina, and the staff seamlessly arranged tours, transfers, and all the details that made our trip so memorable and effortless. The hotel is quiet, peaceful, so pretty and has everything you need!

During our stay, we visited several other high-profile and popular hotels for dinners and drinks ‚Äî and we were so happy we chose to stay at the Mandarin Oriental. Without question, we would stay here again in a heartbeat.

A special thanks to Amine, who was incredible ‚Äî always accessible, endlessly helpful, and who made everything so easy, fun, and stress-free. His care and attention truly elevated our experience. We cannot give enough praise to Amine -- he even helped us find the channel showing the Wimbledon final and picked up medicine for my son. 

The best stay we could have imagined ‚Äî can‚Äôt wait to come back!

We had an unforgettable daypass, a real moment of happiness and serenity.
I would like to warmly thank Mr. Lyazidi Mohssin for his impeccable welcome, benevolence and exemplary professionalism, a big thank you also to Salah pool 
A big congratulations to the whole team for the quality of the service and the attention to the smallest details. An experience to renew without hesitation!

From arrival to departure attention to detail was very impressive. Especially around the pool where the Lifeguard was very attentive, ensuring that shade was always provided where requested, even moving umbrellas to cope with movements of the sun.
The villa was spotlessly clean, and the restaurants likewise, where the food choices were very impressive.
All round an excellent stay

Mandarin Marrakesh hotel is amazing.
Hotel's design, rooms, villas and location are perfect.
Room Service dining service and food were exceptional. Quick service, super friendly staff, tasty food.
I also want to brag about Usama, our Butler. 24/7 available, very professional and friendly.

review title: Great Family stay with excellent service
review:
We stayed for 7 nights as a family (my wife, two kids, and I) and had a great time. The staff were really friendly and helpful. We arrived a few hours before check-in, but they got us into our room within 40 minutes‚Äîand even gave us a free upgrade.

The pool was excellent, like a little oasis in the desert. Some people mention the location, but we didn‚Äôt find it an issue. It‚Äôs only about 20 minutes from the city center, and there‚Äôs a free shuttle running throughout the day.

Big thanks to Hamza in catering, Ahmid by the pool, and the cleaning team‚Äîeveryone went above and beyond. 
I would highly reccomend this hotel.

review title: A wonderful hotel where you are completely looked after.
review:
Sirayane is a beautiful, small hotel on the outskirts of Marrakech. The rooms are very clean, well maintained and generous in size. Our room had its own pool and garden, which was wonderful, although for rooms without a pool there was a good selection of other pools; a heated pool, a kids' paddling pool, an unheated pool and an adults only pool. There were plenty of loungers available for the size of the hotel, so no need to 'reserve' beds with towels. There was also a spa and small gym at the hotel. 
The gardens around the hotel were beautifully maintained - an oasis in the desert.
On our arrival we were greeted with mint tea and there was water, fresh fruit, nuts and moroccan biscuits to welcome us to our room. Each evening a small bottle of water for each guest was delivered to our room for the night/morning. And it was this attention to detail and the extremely high level of customer service that was the stand out for our stay at Sirayane.
The food at Sirayane was delicious with a good selection of moroccan and international fare to choose from. A wonderful selection of fruit, pastries, sweet treats, bread, eggs (cooked however you wished) etc was available at breakfast.  We could not fault either the food or the staff.
Whilst the hotel is a 20 minute drive from Marrakech, the hotel provides a complimentary shuttle bus into and back from the town centre, meaning you can get in and out with ease with minibuses running from morning through to late in the evening.
I have no reservations in recommending this hotel to anyone.

I went with my son recently (19th July - 26th). Excellent facilities and location. Staff so friendly. A shout out goes to Saleh (restaurant manager) and his team. Saleh went above and beyond to help my son who is a fussy eater. Dishes were altered etc. 
Food at the Hotel again is excellent. Being a smaller hotel they do not offer a big variety of food as some places do but the difference is they offer a smaller choice and variety but the difference is in the quality. The quality is so much higher and well worth it. I went with Saleh's daily recommendations and they were always so delicious! i recommend the aubergine in the Moroccan starters. 
Check in and out was a breeze and the free shuttle service was frequent and much appreciated!!
Thank you Sirayane for such a wonderful experience! My son loved the garden and the pool!

We have just returned from seven nights at this hotel. A little worrying when driving to the hotel. In the middle of an area that‚Äôs under construction but don‚Äôt let that worry you. The hotel, rooms, staff, pool and spa are all fantastic. Food / drinks are a little pricey compared to other places but great quality. The pool team are simply the best! Everyone so friendly. The Hammam experience in the spa is a must try!

review title: Lovely hotel but could be improved
review:
I‚Äôve recently returned from a 4 day break with my adult son. The hotel is lovely. The whole hotel is kept very clean, the rooms are very nice with a fridge and you‚Äôve given a small bottle of water every evening. 
We went half board and the food was excellent however when we did buy lunch it was rather expensive. 
The pool men and the restaurant waiters were superb. I couldn‚Äôt fault their service. However the bar staff and the reception staff were rather hit and miss with the pool staff often chasing the bar staff for service. 
The reason I haven‚Äôt given 5 stars is its location. The hotel is in the middle of no where and next to a building site. So although they put on a free bus to the centre you can‚Äôt walk anywhere at all. There is no shop onsite so you can‚Äôt buy drinks or snacks anywhere nearby and have to buy the expensive drinks. The air conditioning unit is in the hall so whilst great it doesn‚Äôt blow into the bedroom area meaning that when the heat hit 45 during over visit the bedroom was extremely hot

review title: A perfect location for a Marrakesh break
review:
Absolute perfection for a restful week in the African sun

The hotel is stunning!!  In a remote location - don‚Äôt be put off by the journey in, there is a lot of local construction due to the upcoming location, but the hotel is set back from the main roads and construction sites - and only a 20 min cab ride from the airport 

Once checked in the team got us into our room early, a pool side room with direct access to the pool thru the small garden terrace. The rooms are spacious, well equipped and impeccably clean with a great AC supply that is definitely needed

The pool area is stunning. With ‚Äòdouble bed‚Äô sunbeds with a great mattress & pillows. The 3 pool guys are incredibly attentive - will supply towels and move that parasols as often as the sun moves round thru the day. If the main 2 pools get busy there is a smaller adults only pool tucked away  if ever needed - but the main pool area is large enough and quiet enough not to have ventured in ourselves

We stayed half board. Lots on offer at the buffet breakfasts with pancakes and eggs made to order upon request. The evening meals are fantastic. A mixed menu of international and local dishes across all 3 courses - enough for something different every day. The food & beverage team again are incredibly attentive and have impeccable manners - particularly calling the 3 younger waiters who are there for every pouring of wine or water needed!!  Their grasp of the menu is great and can explain the dishes to you- in at least 3 languages!!   Particularly recognise Hatim who looked after us for most of the week - a real credit to the team

We also took advantage if the Spa facilities- clean and cool for a relaxing massage or treatment 

The hotel offers a free shuttle service into the City that is pre booked at reception 2 hrs or more before needed. The cars are punctual and clean - well worth a trip to experience the madness of the souks!!!

Nothing is too much trouble for the staff at the hotel in any position or role they cover. Their good nature and manners are almost embarrassing to cope with, but they deliver it with ease

If we could rate this hotel more than 5 stars we would. Highly recommended and worth the money for such an experience

review title: Excellent hotel but with the sound of construction in the background
review:
Very nice hotel with excellent staff and very nice food. The evening menu should offer more salads on the menu like the lunch menu, they‚Äôd get more people using the restaurant. 

The down side of the hotel is the construction traffic you can hear with loud reverse bleepers whilst sat by the pool, plus the construction going on around the area.

review title: Perfect Retreat for and from Marrakesh City Centre
review:
We chose this hotel because of its good reviews - now we would like to leave our own.
We confirm the following highlights:
- Staff are unassuming and attentive
- Rooms are comfortable, clean and spacious
- The combination of the location and free shuttle bus into the centre worked well. Not too far (about 15 min) and it served as a welcome retreat from the heat, hustle and bustle in the city centre.

A couple of tips:
- Yes, the timings of the free hotel shuttle buses into the city can be limiting but we found a good routine with two round trips a day that served us well and meant we avoided too many private trips at about EU20 a time. Used the mid-morning shuttle into the city to see sights and returned on the mid-afternoon shuttle to relax in the hotel, use the pools and play pool/table tennis. Then used the evening shuttle to return to the city for dinner, returning on the last or second-to-last one back to the hotel.
- Pick up large bottles of drinking water at a kiosk near the shuttle pick-up on your return journey for a fraction of the hotel prices. :)

review title: Absolutely Exceptional ‚Äì A Magical Stay in Marrakesh
review:
Our stay at this hotel in Marrakesh was simply unforgettable. It‚Äôs tucked away in a peaceful location that feels like the middle of nowhere, yet it‚Äôs conveniently close to the city center. The atmosphere was calm and relaxing, and every corner of the hotel was spotless. You can really see how much care and attention they give to every detail.

The service was truly outstanding. Everyone made us feel welcome and well taken care of throughout our stay. I especially want to thank Youssef at the pool. He was always smiling and checking on the guests, adjusting the umbrellas to make sure we stayed cool and comfortable. His kindness and attentiveness really stood out.

In the restaurant, we were served by Said, Zuhair, and Hatem , three young and incredibly professional waiters. They were always friendly, patient, and made us feel genuinely welcome every time. Whether we were eating at the restaurant, by the pool, or in our room, they always provided excellent service with a smile.

And the food‚Ä¶ absolutely delicious. Every meal was √† la carte, beautifully presented, and full of flavor. The quality was exceptional, and each dish had that extra touch of luxury that made dining feel like a real treat.

The rooms were perfectly clean, and the free shuttle to the city center made everything even more convenient. There's also a lovely spa on-site that‚Äôs definitely worth discovering if you're looking for some relaxation and self-care.

This hotel is a true gem in Marrakesh. I sincerely recommend it to anyone looking for a peaceful, high-quality experience with authentic Moroccan hospitality. We‚Äôll definitely be coming back.

review title: An exceptional stay, the Sirayane should be the new hotel standard in Marrakech
review:
An exceptional stay, the Sirayane becomes my new hotel standard

I spent 7 nights this week at the Sirayane Boutique Hotel & Spa and I can say, without hesitation, that it was an exceptional experience at all levels. From the moment of booking, the tone was set: in their email, the team wrote to me "we will have the pleasure of welcoming you to our marrakchi paradise to book you the best welcome ever". I thought wow, they‚Äôre setting the bar high. Well... promise kept, it was really the best welcome ever.

Constant smiles, constant attention. Whether it is the reception, restaurant, room service, bar or maids: everyone gives the sincere feeling of being there to please you. Even on the phone, you ‚Äúfeel‚Äù a smile. I‚Äôve never seen a team so warm, so invested.

I was with my son, and they were adorable to him from beginning to end.

We stayed in a suite with private pool: an incredible setting surrounded by olive trees, absolute calm. The rooms are super spacious, very comfortable, very well appointed, tastefully decorated. On the catering side, special mention to the "Weeping Tiger", a dish to fall on the ground.

The hotel manager stopped by regularly to make sure everything was going well. One morning we missed breakfast: the team kindly told us that if we had called, they would have gladly brought it to us. This kind of little attention makes you feel unique. Towels that are brought to the pool with a smile, Moroccan cookies with tea... everything is designed for your comfort, without ever being intrusive.

This is one of the most beautiful hotel experiences I have ever had. I will come back, that is a certainty. The Sirayane has become my new hotel standard.

A huge thank you to the whole team for this holiday of pure relaxation.

review title: A perfect oasis with first class service
review: A beautiful, classical oasis of tranquility in the midst of the old medina.  Stunning grounds, perfect rooms, attentive staff who are generous and friendly to make our stay the very best possible.  Food, pool, spa & bar service are all first class.

review title: Beautiful hotel, an oasis of the medina.
review:
Fabulous hotel in the medina, it‚Äôs a little oasis set in beautiful gardens. Staff were an absolute delight and can‚Äôt do enough for you. Beautiful rooms with pillows that are scented with your choice of smell each night. You are given a bottle of water every day and provided with hats and a bag to use by the pool. Safe and fridge provided free of charge in the room. 
Reasonably priced beer and several cute places in the garden to drink it! 
You get a spa voucher on arrival which we used for a fantastic massage. An absolute must.

review title: A peaceful part of a busy city
review: This is a beautiful riad - and one we would definitely recommend.  It's so peaceful - waking up to the sound of birds, surrounded by greenery.  We stayed at the start and end of a two week trip - and were able to enjoy the pool area and the restaurant.  In addition - make sure you enjoy a sundowner on the roof terrace, it's a lovely place.  Our rooms were perfect - we opted for garden rooms and were not disappointed.  Comfortable beds and very spacious.  Most importantly - the staff at this riad are so friendly and helpful.

review title: Great stay at Les Jardins de la Medina
review: Beautiful small hotel/riad within Marrakesh medina. Good sized rooms that are spotlessly kept and the air conditioning works perfectly- much needed. Pool area fantastic and most relaxing. Exceptional pool/restaurant/reception staff, very attentive without being in your face. Food pricey for Marrakesh but the one evening we eat there the standard was high. Would recommend to friends and will go again

This hotel was the perfect location for a week‚Äôs trip to Marrakesh.  It is in the medina and is in walking distance to most attractions.  If you don‚Äôt like to walk then a taxi is very cheap at around ¬£5 per trip.
The staff at this hotel are truly there to give you a wonderful experience and nothing is too much trouble for them.  The hotel is spotless with super comfortable beds and rooms have air conditioning.  Turn down service is available each night where they come and spray your pillows with essential oil of your choice. On arrival you are greeted with a welcome drink and some cookies/ cakes and nuts.
The rooms are all different and unique and this adds to the charm of the hotel.  
The pool area is beautiful and towels available.  If u had to be critical I would say the pool area loungers could be padded which would make them more comfortable but they are fine.  There is an outdoor lounge area on the roof and it is beautiful but not used to its full potential- this should have a bar with drinks and coffee/tea available and more people would use it.
The food including breakfast was delicious and very reasonable. 
I would most definitely stay in this hotel if revisiting Marrakesh.  Well done to all staff absolutely excellent service.

review title: Great city centre hotel. Just perfect !
review: We stayed 3 nights at this beautiful hotel. The location is fantastic in the heart of the city but you can come back to the tranquility of the gorgeous pool. The rooms are in keeping with the beautiful Moroccan architecture and are well equipped and very comfortable and very clean . The breakfast was delicious and lots of variety. The dinner menu had both international and Moroccan cuisine. The reception arranged transport each day for us with English speaking drivers who were always very prompt. The reception also gave great restaurant recommendations and made bookings for us outside the hotel. We also did the city waking tour which was also arranged by the hotel and was a great introduction to this magical city. Finally the staff were incredibly friendly and always willing to help but did seem a little over worked at times. This was a fantastic hotel and great value and I would definitely recommend for your Marrakesh city visit.

A wonderful stay in this haven of peace nestled in the medina! The staff is very attentive from reception to servers, nothing to say and what to say about the excellent cuisine! Nosu were also able to enjoy the spa everything was perfect.
We will come back for sure!

My partner and I had some delicious lunch at the restaurant of Les Jardin De Le Medina Riad. Uppon arrival we were greeted politely, and got sat to our table. Which looked out at the stunning garden and the pool. The service was excellent and our waiter was very attentive. 
I was impressed with the quality of the food in comparison to the price. Would totally come again when visiting Marrakech.

Our stay at the Jardins de la M√©dina was superb!
At the Medina gardens you feel as if you were staying with friends but with 
the attentions and services of a great hotel! 

The professionalism, attention and beauty of the place made our stay an unforgettable one. 

The kitchen is delicious! A well-balanced mix of European and Eastern cuisine! 

We also enjoyed the spa that we greatly enjoyed!  

We will definitely be back! 

If we have a little criticism to make, it‚Äôs about the day pass.The crowd of people from outside the hotel disturbs the tranquility of the place a bit, unfortunately. Especially since often there have been quite a lot of groups.
Nevertheless we were able to enjoy the pool.

Many thanks to the whole team and we hope to see you soon!

Restaurant pool very nice , decent pool with deckchair come early otherwise more place reservation required!, a nice step before leaving discover the souk and the city! 
The Restaurant very good starter flat dessert house Top impeccable service! To do to decompress from the city bazaar.

This is an absolutely stunning property (once you find it!) . We stayed outside the Medina for most of our holiday but wanted to experience the Moroccan culture at its best and chose this Riad from a luxury UK tour operator's brochure. It did not disappoint and as being a surprise for my husband it added to the magic. The members of the team are beyond professional and welcoming. We were shown around and everything was explained into detail from meal and bar hours to pool location and procedures. The room was on the ground floor, very spacious with a sitting area and a  beautiful bathroom. Shower worked to perfection as well as the air con. The Riad is in a quiet location just off one of the main crazy streets with local vendors. It is approx 15 min walk to the main square and maybe 20 min walk to the Koutoubia mosque. 
We chose to have breakfast on the roof top and it was just great. It consisted of plain omelette, yoghurt and cereals, freshly baked breads, jams, local honey and traditional cakes, served with plenty of coffee and tea at your choice. The owner is well known in the area and received many iconic personalities over the years. We had the pleasure to meet him as well as his hard working grandson who is a credit to the business. Presentable and speaking impeccable English. 
All in all a wonderful experience and if given the chance we would return to Marrakech and stay in this Riad a bit longer. Shukram!

It already started with the welcome, delicious mint tea incredibly friendly welcome!!! When then our room was ready, well is more of a suite, very clean they pay attention to every detail, you feel incredibly comfortable here and would like to always stay here. Every day new bathrobe, bath and towels. My dress had to be mended and she there, 30 min hung my dress in the room!!:-) there are not enough stars to rate this riad just awesome riad. LOCATION is also perfect. So we'll be back

I rarely stay at such a nice place like the riad. The room was beautiful. The hotel it‚Äòs self very nice, so were the amenities. The food was just awesome, healthy and authentic.

But out of everything, the service was one of the best services i have experienced in any hotel so far. The staff is very nice, their English is very good and they almost treated us like family

I can recommend anybody to visit the riad kniza if you plan on visiting marrakesh.

review title: Perfect riad in a busy city
review: Everything about this riad was just right. The owner even took the time to tell my husband and I hello. Our room was more than enough and serviced multiple times a day. We sank into our bed--it was so comfortable. I loved that breakfast was served between a wide time frame ending at noon. With the city really coming to life later at night, the later start was welcomed. You can walk to many main attractions from this locations but because of its location outside of the medina it may take 10-20 minutes.

review title: Riad Kniza was a brilliant place to stay in Marrakesh.
review: Riad Kniza was a delightful welcoming place to stay. Any question or request was kindly attended to. The building was a beautiful example of a riad with numerous pleasant spaces to relax and enjoy. The meals were excellent with polite, friendly service and accompanied in the evening with charming, subtle musicians. The highlight for me was visiting the owner's personal museum with a knowledgeable, articulate guided tour by his grandson. The location was very convenient for visiting both the Medina and the Gueliz tights. Altogether a wonderful experience!

What a delightful surprise! The service  levels were amazing. The rooms were wonderful. And the rooftop terrace. WOW! The staff couldn‚Äôt lhave been nicer.
