I was greeted  with mint tea and pastries before being shown to my room. On my final night, my friend and I shared a bottle of wine and a mezza plate on the rooftop for dinner. One of the best meals of our stay in Marrakesh. I HIGHLY recommend this Riad. It is an oasis of calm outside the chaos of the Marrakesh streets.

review title: An absolute gem in the middle of the Medina.
review: A friend and I stayed at Riad Kniza for 3 nights in May 2025 and had the most amazing time there.  The place is absolutely gorgeous, the bedrooms are large and very clean, and the restaurant offers a wonderful menu.  But what made our stay an absolute delight was the staff:  from Lamia and Abdoul at front desk (who took care of all of transfers and reservation), to Samir, and Sidi Mohammed (the owner) who was always available if we had any questions.  We are already planning to go back and this time we will stay longer.

Location was great, compared to other places this Riad was very easy find and get to. Easy walking distance to all the attractions and the main square in the Medina. Riad Kniza staff were very helpful and very professional. They have a nice pool but it is not heated though. They have a good collection of local art related books, a fantastic gallery and lot of art effects to see and appreciate. The room we stayed in was a good size with everything one needs, with air conditioning and a heater. They provide bottled water free of charge and good quality fruit plate in the room. The restaurant menu is static and does not change much, so the same food is on the menu everyday ( At least during our 4 nights stay). A changing menu would have been nice. Overall a great place and we will definitely stay here in the future.

review title: An oasis of hospitality and tranquility in the heart of the medina
review:
It was a wonderful discovery. Welcomed with great kindness and care, we found a place where every detail is thought to make the guest feel special. All staff are extremely considerate, attentive but never intrusive.

The presence of the owner, a man of great culture and rare elegance, is one of the most precious features of the riad. With its discreet attention, it sets the tone for an authentic welcome that is perceived everywhere.

The rooms are spotless, quiet and full of charm, a real refuge in the frenzy of the medina. We had dinner one evening in the charming courtyard: a real experience of relaxation and Moroccan flavors, served with great grace.

A place that knows how to be remembered, and to which we would return with pleasure.
Thank you very much to all the staff.

review title: A stay at Riad Kniza is not forgotten
review:
From arrival to departure we enjoyed a real 5 star service. Staff with little care, availability, kindness and unfailing advice. Ideal location for excursions. 
The calm was there. We will return to 10,000%.

review title: Authentic and charming boutique hotel with the best food you could imagine. It is truly a beautiful experience.
review:
Perfect in every way.
Calm,serene  and picturesque in the middle of a hectic city.
We loved everything about this hotel especially the service and the food is probably the best in the world.
The rooms are authentic and very spacious.
I would recommend a room with a terrace.

review title: Beautiful quiet break in the heart of Marrakech
review:
Charming, quiet and luxurious place 
Nice services and very good reception and good advice
Recommended and booked guide to the city tour was perfect
All co loud and very good breakfast and dinner
Going with your eyes closed

review title: A setting in the heart of the medina
review:
Despite the change of ownership everything is exactly the same.
The staff the food the cleanliness the atmosphere everything is great. The Director and his entire team made a most successful transition.
For us after four visits the Villa is the best Relais castles where we stayed.
Thank you again for this beautiful stay at your side

A break, an oasis in this city in turmoil. We had a very delicious time at the villa. Our thanks and congratulations to the lovely staff and the small care. The place is exceptional, authentic, elegant and warm.

This small riad is an oasis in the middle of Marrakech 
The room has a 5 o‚Äôclock shadow but the service is outstanding
Breakfast and lunch were included in our package and the food was great at all meals
Dinner is around the pool and the food is excellent as are their cocktails which are always served with potato chips and the best olives I have ever had

review title: A Tranquil Oasis in the Heart of Marrakech
review:
Villa des Orangers is a truly charming retreat nestled in the bustling heart of Marrakech. Surrounded by fragrant orange trees, true to its name. This hotel offers an oasis of calm just steps away from the vibrant Medina.

We stayed in Junior Suite 26, a beautifully designed room with its own private terrace. The hotel boasts two stunning pools, including one on the rooftop with sweeping views, perfect for unwinding after a day of exploring.

The service was exceptional from start to finish, with every detail thoughtfully handled. The location is ideal for discovering the Medina and other major attractions in Marrakech.

I highly recommend Villa des Orangers for anyone seeking a luxurious, peaceful stay in the city.

review title: Week at the Villa Des Orangers
review: We stayed at the Villa Des Orangers for nearly a week; it is an absolutely stunning property. The rooms are like small apartments with incredible furnishings and features you don't find in other hotel rooms. We were lucky enough to stay in two suites, and one had two levels with a gorgeous balcony on the second floor, big spacious rooms, and bathroom. The second suite was massive, with your own private terrace with a lounging area and outside shower. The pool is beautiful; the grounds are so well kept that having a cool glass of wine in one of the areas surrounded by greenery after a day at the markets is a beautiful experience. The staff is incredible. Friendly and helpful, and the breakfasts, lunches and dinners all served beautifully and deliciously. We didn't catch her name, but one of the staff at the main reception area is so helpful. She recommended three restaurants in Marakesh and we had dinner at all three and each one was spectacular.  Lounge by the pool for tranquillity between activities or have a traditional hammam in the spa.

Beautiful hotel less than ten minutes walk from Jemaa el-Fna Square and less than 15 from La Mamounia, making the location ideal for going to the old and new areas of the city. The facilities are very well maintained, with patios everywhere. There is a swimming pool in the gardens and our room, very spacious and with access to a private terrace, shared another on the roof with those on the upper floor. Very good restaurant where we dine one night local dishes (magnificent cous cous) and breakfast a la carte in the garden.

review title: This should be your first choice.
review: A must stay in Marrakesh!  What a beautiful Riad with exceptional service.  The staff could not do enough for us.  We checked in to a room that was a bit small for our liking.  We were upgraded to a wonderful room.  When I offered to pay the difference between the two rooms, I was greeted with, "There will be no additional charge".  So nice of them.  The location of the Riad inside the Medina walls was  ideal.  Just a five minute walk to the alley ways and fun shopping that is the heartbeat of Marrakesh.  A wonderful experience.

A surprising entrance that opens onto a beautiful place with several spaces; a very attentive team, sumptuous cuisine and very relaxing massages and very nice pools. 
We will return with great pleasure

A wonderful welcome into a beautiful riad, such attention to detail to create a relaxing and tranquil space. There were a number of different chill out spaces exuding Moroccan charm. We have lasting memories of roof top breakfasts, truly delicious and generous, the best orange juice we've tasted. Aziz and his team were amazing hosts, nothing was too much trouble. He gave great advice which made our stay all the more enjoyable. Would totally recommend and were sad to leave. A great location to access the Medina.

A heartfelt note of thanks to Aziz, Ali, and the entire team at Riad Les Trois Mages. They could not have made our stay more welcoming. From the beautiful breakfasts we enjoyed on the roof terrace each morning to the traditional meal served just off the courtyard, we were truly treated like princesses. On the morning of our balloon ride, Ali graciously accompanied us just before five in the morning and waited with us until our bus service arrived. On my birthday, we were surprised with a pretty banner and cakes left in our room. They also organised a cake for a friend who visited the Riad one evening, allowing us to celebrate his upcoming 40th birthday. This dedicated team made our holiday unforgettable, full of politeness and smiles. Kay and I have never laughed so much. We love this Riad, the staff, and Marrakech as a whole. Thank you :o)

Just returned from a 3 night stay. The Riad was beautiful, you definitely knew you were staying in Marrakech. We were met at the door by Aziz who was incredibly kind and helpful, both with directions, recommdations and the all important map!
Ali and the rest of the team were friendly and happy to serve us coffee whenever we wanted it and served us breakfast on the roof top which was a lovely experience. 
Massive thanks to you all for making it a lovely stay.

review title: Impeccable hospitality in a beautiful setting
review:
This riad is a beautiful oasis of calm and the middle of Marrakesh, with warm and professional staff team who provide incredible hospitality. We stayed for four nights with two small children, and I wish we could have stayed longer.

The location is a short walk from all of the main sites in the Medina, but tucked away from the busiest streets. The rooms and common areas are stunningly decorated, and the breakfasts are generous, varied and delicious. Aziz, the manager, was friendly and very kind to our young children, while Ali who worked mornings and nights was always welcoming and responsive. The whole team was amazing at anticipating what we might need and discreetly providing it before we even knew we needed it. 

The rooftop terrace is a beautiful place to take in the sunset and listen to the call to prayer, and even take a dip (although if you visit in winter note that the pool will be chilly!). I had to work remotely a couple of times while we visited and was always brought a beautiful tray of coffee while I worked, which was much appreciated. We also ordered a dinner at the riad and it was delicious and very generous, and such a special memory to enjoy it on the rooftop terrace. 

We travel independently quite a bit and have stayed in all kinds of hotels around the world, including five star ones, and I can honestly say that we have never received better service and hospitality than we did at Riad Trois Mages. We will return for sure.

review title: Ideal friendly place to stay in Marrakech
review: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Les Trois Mages with a group of friends. The owner/manager Aziz and his team including Ali and the girls made us so welcome. They will do anything to help you get the most out of your visit to Marrakech. They organised a memorable trip to the Ourika valley in the Atlas Mountains for us, and they cooked a Moroccan feast for us one night - this was definitely one of the best meals we had in Marrakech. The location is ideal - it is down a quiet backstreet but two minutes walk to the local square, Place Riad Larousse, from which you can enter the souk. We can't wait to return!

review title: Beautiful Riad with good location and super service
review:
Beautifully furnished Riad with best location close to the Souken, but still very quiet. 
Nice breakfast and overall super good service all days from especially host Aziz, who stood ready with help and advice. 
We would definitely recommend Riad Les Trois Mages.

review title: a comfortable week in the riad of the three wise men
review:
A week in the turbulence of Marrakech but so quiet once back at the riad of the three Magi
A riad where hospitality, kindness, delicacy of teams and professionalism are the keywords.
Thank you AZIZ and your collaborators for surrounding us so well You send a beautiful picture of your country.
Gilles Paccagnini

This Riad is a beautiful haven of tranquillity. From the moment the door is opened by the softly spoken Aziz, to the minute you leave, it is nothing but fabulous. The rooms are stunningly beautiful and styled with Moroccan furniture and artefacts, and the beds are very comfortable. Breakfast is a vast array of breads, jams, eggs, yoghurt etc and to eat it on the rooftop with a view over Morocco is amazing. If you are up early enough, you can watch the hot air balloons rise gracefully into the morning sun.
Aziz is more than helpful,booking restaurants and organising trips, as well as being a fantastic tour guide. The Riad is beautifully clean, the staff are lovely. Book this Riad, you will love it.

review title: Exceptional Riad, perfectly located with wonderful service and interiors
review: There are many riads in Marrakech to choose from, if you‚Äôre reading the reviews for Riad Les Trois Mages you know you need look no further. Set slightly away from the main streets, the peaceful oasis with rooftop pool is the perfect respite from the city with gorgeous interiors and a fantastic breakfast. Aziz has built a safe haven, he provided tips and local knowledge throughout our stay and has a special talent for outstanding service. What a hidden gem!

Excellent stay in beautiful riad.  The decor was perfect and a nice harmony and taste in colours and furniture. The staff was helpful and very service minded. Quality brakfast with Moroccan taste. Easy to go to the market and taxi station nearby.

review title: Fantastic 7 night stay, wish it was longer
review:
We stayed here for a week and we wished it could have been longer. 

1 negative that needs to be addressed imo is the sunbed situation. Our 1st morning there, I woke up at 6.45am and reserved the last 3 sunbeds!! After this, it got earlier everyday, it wasn't great.
The other small negative was lack of bar staff at the pool bar. Very often it would be just 1 person so the queue could become big. 

Hasna at reception was so friendly and helpful. 
Be aware there is a ¬£40 damage deposit which is held not taken from your bank until you check out. Towels are a ¬£20 deposit pp until you hand them back but can be changed daily. Also a tourist tax. We paid ¬£21 for 2 adults and 1 child for a week.
This hotel is very relaxed, great vibe around the pool, this isn't the biggest but it has different levels which is good for adults and kids. Also have the kids pool with 4 slides and water features. There is a relaxed area for over 16's, loads of sunbeds and a help yourself bar. Plenty going on, darts, ping pong, water polo and so on, although the football team was for adults only. Perhaps could have been more for the kids other than kids club.
Entertainment staff are fantastic, Pitchu the stand out. He's brilliant with all the guests and really happy all the time.
Fatima and Omar at the pool bar were great, always smiling, nothing was too much for them. 
There are so many wasps at the pool bar but all they are interested in is the syrup, they are not at all interested in humans. I've never seen anything like it but it really isn't an issue.
Our room was just a double room but was great. Loads of space and a huge bathroom. A safe, which is free to use, we had a garden which was nice too.
Evening entertainment was really good, quiz night was fun, karaoke night was interesting, a welcome show on the Monday (fire show from Pitchu the highlight). 
Soufaine at the inside bar was great, very happy chap, if there was a cocktail you wanted and the ingredients were available he would make it for you.
Drinks in general were really good. Plenty on offer.
Anyone complaining about the food clearly have a boring appetite. There was so much variety, fish, meat, vegetarian etc. kids corner was good also. Loads of desserts and ice-cream.
I read a review about the restaurant that they left because the menu was "small". It was arguably the best meal I had. Food was unbelievable. Highly recommend, book on arrival.
There is a free shuttle to the market, it is chaos but well worth a visit. Do the morning 1st as it's quieter, the evening is very busy. A polite "no thank you" will keep them off your back. Also, haggling is a must as they start high.
We visited the water park and did a camel ride with sunset and a meal. Both superb excursions, booked via the app "get your guide". Very reasonably priced.
We loved Morocco and will look to return one day in the near future. 
Overall, a superb stay for us in a very chilled environment.

review title: A great place to stay for a family but get more sun beds
review:
We had a great holiday. Great food and good shuttle bus into Marrakesh. Friendly staff, great room and great value for money. The camel riding and quad biking excursions were great. 

Cons: music a bit too loud, we had no sunbeds the first few days until we realised you needed to set an alarm at 6am to get a sunbeds. 

The a la carte restaurant was a bit pointless, very few items on the menu and was a bit naff. We left and went to the great buffet instead. 

Pool is a bit too small for the amount of people but overall we had a great time.

review title: Amazing Experience at the resort - 7 Day Visit
review:
Pre-Arrival Information
Check-in: Monday, July 28th at 3:00 PM
Costs to expect upon arrival:
City Tax: 231 MAD for 2 adults and 2 children.
Refundable Deposit: 1300 MAD for the room and 4 towel cards.
Tip: Book the √† la carte restaurant on your first day to avoid delays.
Free Shuttle: The hotel provides free bus tickets to the old town market.

The food was excellent, with a different menu each day. We particularly appreciated how helpful and accommodating the hotel management was regarding my son's nut allergy, ensuring he had a variety of safe meal options throughout our 7-day stay. Drinks and nightly entertainment were also plentiful.

We took part in a number of daily activities, including darts, water pong, water polo, and water aerobics.

On our fourth night, we enjoyed a meal at the √† la carte restaurant. The kids loved the chicken strips, fries, and a vanilla dessert afterward.

We pre-booked the shuttle to the Old Town the night before, as you need a ticket to board. The bus left at 9:30 AM and returned at 12:30 PM, giving us about 2.5 hours to explore and shop. We chose this time because the weather was cooler than midday.

Be aware of vendors with snakes and monkeys on the way to the market. A firm but polite "La Shukran" (No thank you) is all you need to keep them from bothering you. When shopping, remember that prices are aimed at tourists, so be prepared to haggle for at least 70% off the initial asking price.

Noise: Rooms near the main hotel can be loud due to music until midnight, which isn't ideal for families with young children.

Kids' Club: The kids' club could be improved. The staff didn't seem very engaged with the children, leading to a lack of interest. It was also not offered on our first day.

Drinks: The hotel could do with a few more bar staff particular in the morning by the pool as it could take a few minutes for you to get your drinks.

Sunbeds: This was huge. Like most hotels there are not enough sunbeds. Although the hotel has a policy to not reserve we still found everyone would wake up from 4:00 am on ward and lay there towels on the beds.

We (two adults, four children from 17-14) spent 10 days here in July and had a fantastic time. We had two duplex rooms and they were brilliant family spaces, particularly as they had two bathrooms, a must with 4 teenagers. Our rooms were cleaned daily and to a high standard, as were the public areas of the hotel too. It seemed like the cleaning staff never stopped.

We found the food in the restaurant was great and never had any problems finding something we enjoyed, even the fussy 14 year old. The waiting staff were brilliant too, making sure we had what we needed but not hovering over us either. We were also happy with the drinks available too, whether it was the local beer and wine or the soft drinks for the children. The cocktails were fine, much better than in other AI hotels we have stayed in. We ate in the A La Carte restaurant once and it had a limited menu, but everything we had was delicious. 

The entertainment team were fantastic. They were great at getting you involved if you wanted to but equally respected your choice if you didn't want to do the activity on offer. The poolside was definitely lively but not obnoxiously so. The highlight for the 16 and 14 year old was the daily water polo game :-)

The reception team were also great, they had to reset our keys several times and always did it with a smile. They also helped my partner ensure we had the right place pinned on maps when we were off into Marrrakech for a guided tour and booked our taxi for us. We also used the courtesy bus a couple of times to go into the city and it was fine. You do have to book it in advance but this isn't a problem. 

Our main and only gripe was the sunbed situation. I was 'lucky' on two days and managed to get 4 together at about 8:30am but apart from that we never managed it and usually ended up setting ourselves up at a table at the snack bar. This wasn't a major problem for us because the teenagers weren't too fussed but would have been more of a problem if the children had been younger. There clearly aren't enough sunbeds and then some people are selfish and reserve sunbeds early but don't use them at all. We witnessed beds with towels on empty for hours. However, if the pool staff were notified of this they did remove the towels. We actually set up camp in the adult only area on our last two days, despite having two under 16s with us. It is essentially an unused space because there is only one umbrella up there so we were (mostly) the only ones up there. 

Overall, we would recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here again.

We had an amazing stay at this hotel. We came with another family and have children from aged 6-16 years. This resort has something for everyone. 
What stood out the most was the amazing staff they were all so friendly and happy and made it an unforgettable stay. We will definitely be back soon. Food amazing always plenty of choice, rooms large and really clean, pool lovely, plenty of activities. Sunbeds were limited but staff are always on hand to help, most of the problem comes from people saving sunbeds but not using them all day. Looking forward to booking again.

We had a fantastic stay at Be Live Experience Marrakech ‚Äì perfect for families looking for a mix of relaxation, culture, and fun! Here‚Äôs a breakdown of what stood out:
‚≠ê Entertainment & Activities
The hotel offers a great variety of entertainment throughout the day and evening. From morning fitness sessions to pool games, dance classes, and nightly shows, there‚Äôs always something going on. The evening performances were lively and varied ‚Äì traditional Moroccan music, live bands, and even family-friendly comedy. The animation team was energetic and really went out of their way to engage both kids and adults.
Very good hotel, we spend DE good times with the activities on offer, the employees are always helpful, we have a good holiday, I highly recommend
very good all the people were very nice great service. The rooms were cleaned every day and very clean would definitely recommend

An animation team at the top, fairouza, smily, gigi, pitcho, doha , lifeguards always concerned with the well-being and safety of zakaria, and medhi customers.
The team DE restoration extraordinary by their professionalism and smiles, fatima-zahra, salah EN particular. And all the waiters bar and restaurant. 
Many thanks to all, an unforgettable stay thanks to all.

Pros;
The hotel is clean and lovely well kept gardens,  the reception staff are good and will help sort out issues. Most of the bar staff are happy and pleasant except 2 that are rude and clearly favour French & local over the English ( i won't name & shame). Duplex rooms are good   the 2 bathrooms are great for family's. Cleaned daily with fresh towels/water.
Food hit & miss for us as we have a couple of fussy eaters but there is always the snack bar.
The entertainment is not the best they do try and are very enthusiastic. picco ( not sure of his name) steals the show he's so talented and clearly males up the entertainment.
There is nothing for kids out of the pool, the park area is only accessible via the kids club and is in direct sunlight so unable to use it as its only open a few hours a day and it's not the best. Could really do with some children play area in the shade small park for the kids to play.
The gym is small but good equipment and it was never overcrowded. 
We have had 2 good days of music around the pool DJ one day and another day it was English mix from 70s /80s to modern but just 1 day üôÑ.Aqua gym is hit & miss the guys are great. We are still here are having a good time the hotel would be perfect if they addressed a few issues.
Cons;
The sunbed situation is a nightmare, 6am I was up today and there was about 15 beds free I don't blame people as if one does all will otherwise you will be on the grass. There is plenty of area for more beds and considering there is nothing outside the hotel they need to sort this, same in the evening there is clearly not enough tables & chairs but there is room for more.
There is nowhere to have a little walk to nothing for miles the supermarket is about 1 hour round trip ( not woth it ) hence why the hotel shop is very expensive. ¬£16 - ¬£24 for suncream so bring plenty. 
We booked the restaurant last night and have our 2nd visit booked for tomorrow we will be cancelling the food was shocking and my family said the worse they have had since we came üò¨.
Would i come back - not until the sort sunbed & seating. I wouldn't come for our main family holiday as not enough to keep the kids entertained for ourselves, and 10 days here to long without good entertainment.
Overall we have had a lovely family holiday and made happy memories..
Tips: 
Bring  insulated cups with lids ( staff happy to fill ) 
If you can't get q bed borrow the ones from the adult section as its hardly used üòä oh and the tent up there has not been cleaned since we got here vodka bottles and litter been there over a week now..

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review title: Amazing hotel with an even better staff!
review: Wow! This is an amazing hotel!  The staff is incredible and they wanted us to "feel like you were at home".  They were obliging at all times and the breakfast was spectacular!  I highly recommend this hotel for it's location as well. Grocery store right below the hotel ..you don't have to go outside!

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review title: Outstanding Moroccan Hospitality at Its Best!
review:
Our stay at this hotel was exceptional, far better than other hotels we‚Äôve experienced in Casablanca city center. The staff were warm, professional, and genuinely welcoming. The breakfast was delicious, the rooms were spotless, and the reception team exceeded expectations.

A special thanks to Sara, who followed all the standards perfectly during check-in and even upgraded us to a better room, making our stay even more memorable. Ezoubir was also incredibly helpful and cheerful during check-out, leaving us with a smile.

It‚Äôs wonderful to see that Moroccan hospitality remains unmatched. Highly recommended!

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review:
A weekend at the hotel
Nothing to say.
Professional service, great location, unbeatable cleanliness, varied breakfast of quality, a nice pool, friendly and attentive staff

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review:
Had a wonderful and relaxing stay at the Radisson in Marrakech! 
We were pleasantly surprised with a complimentary room upgrade, giving us a lovely pool view. The customer service was excellent ‚Äî staff were always friendly and helpful throughout our stay. The location is great for exploring the city, and the food was consistently good.

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review:
Nothing to say about the club sandwich: excellent!
On the other hand the service is deplorable... Slowly... Long wait for drinks, the starter to share arrives at the same time as the dishes ...
In short the setting is nice the music loop and tiring it is long long long long and it has every time.
Nothing to say about the kitchen is still as good.

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review:
Beautiful hotel
Very helpful and welcoming staff
Thank you very much to Abdel Majid for his services, availability and kindness throughout the stay!

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review: Many thanks to Abdel Majid for his kindness, his availability. The hotel staff is truly worthy of a 5 star rating!  We didn‚Äôt want anything and each request was handled with care! I recommend 10000%

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review: The hotel disappointed a bit, especially when it comes to facilities for children. There was a clear lack of activities and play areas that could engage the smallest. The only pool available was both too small and too deep for smaller children ‚Äì making it stressful and insecure for parents. It seemed as if families with children were not a priority, and the staff did not seem to pay much attention to the needs of the children. There was also no child-friendly entertainment, playground or children's menu in the restaurant. All in all not a child-friendly place and we would not recommend it to families with young children.

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review title: Our favorite stay each visit to marrakech
review: Always a pleasure to return back to this friendly hotel from the door man to the reception staff as well as restaurant personnel and house keepers; very child friendly hotel.  Special thanks to Merouane front office manager and his friendly colleagues . See you soon once again.:)

place name: Radisson Blu Hotel, Marrakech Carre Eden
review title: A quality customer experience - stay from 30 May to 2 June 2025
review:
We stayed three nights at the Radisson Blu in Marrakech as part of a sisters anniversary trip.

Thanks to Mr. Rida Laachari marked our stay. His kindness, hospitality and attention to detail were exemplary.
Also, the breakfast was varied and tasty, served in a pleasant setting.
Special mention also for facial treatment at the spa: it is one of the best I have experienced, with real know-how and a soothing atmosphere.

‚úîÔ∏è What I preferred: the quality of customer service thanks to Mr. Laachari, the exceptional spa treatment, the kindness of the staff at breakfast.
‚ùå What I liked less: the welcome of the first evening, but which was caught up by the smiles and elegant gestures of Mr. Laachari and other staff during the stay.

Thanks again to the team.

An amazing place, well located. Nora, Tom and all of the staff cannot do enough for you, top quality customer care! Lovely food and our room, a suite, was superb. The pool was a godsend in the extremely hot temperatures. Plenty of loungers and food/drinks readily available. If you are planning a trip to Marrakesh stay here.

review title: An Oasis in the middle of Marrakech
review: Visited Marrakech with my daughter.  Les Borjs de la Kasbah was a retreat from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech whilst only a 20 mins walk from the action.  The staff were amazing and the owners we a wonderful family.  The pool was needed when the temperature reached the 40's.  Would definitely go back when visiting Marrakech again

review title: Les Borjs de la Kasbah was outstanding.
review:
My friend & I with our two daughter's aged 17 spent four days at this wonderful hotel.
On arrival we were greeted with warmth & friendliness by the owners Tom & Nora
The hotel is spotlessly clean & the rooms are unique in their design.  We had clean towels daily in the rooms & by the pool
The staff are extremely helpful, always smiling & nothing is too much trouble
The breakfast selection was delicious & had a different fresh juice each day, breads are all made on the premises. The omelettes were delicious too
The pool bar menu was lovely & food truly worth a 5* rating
Wish we had more time to try some beauty treatments, another time as will definitely be visiting again.
I give the hotel a 5* rating, its home from home with a Moroccan twist.
Can't wait to return!

This was the best hotel I have ever been to.  I have been to 4 and 5 star hotels but the Les Borjs de la Kasbah was fantastic.  The place was beautiful and the staff were outstanding...all of the staff.  Thank you once again Les Borjs de la Kasbah.

review title: Stay there - you won't be disappointed!!
review:
Stayed there eleven nignts and myself and my family all loved everything about the accommodation. A good sized sized swimming pool with plenty of very comfortable sun loungers. A lovely restaurant with a great food reasonably priced, lovely air conditioned bar with a good selection of very reasonably priced wine, beer and spirits. Would recommend the seabream with coconut wine and the Merlot. A great 'all you can eat'buffet breakfast. Air-conditioning in our spacious room that worked perfectly, room kept spotlessly clean, fluffy towels and marvellous, helpful friendly staff. 

Will definitely return sometime in the future.

review title: The Borjs of the Kasbah, the charms of the East
review:
The staff, accommodation and facilities aer fabulous.  Nothing is too much trouble for Tom, Nora and their team and they looked after myself and my daughter beautifully.  Friendly and relaxed atmosphere, with just the right balance of peace and quiet, without being dull and repetitive.  I wish some of the other guests had read the blurb about being respectful of everyone's needs, but that is not down to the staff or managers, just a feature of some people when they are on holiday.  

Great location, with easy access on foot to the city centre, souks and sights and a short taxi ride from the airport.

review title: A Long Overdue Thank You ‚Äì A Truly Memorable Stay
review: I would like to thank all the staff and management of the hotel for its very warm welcome and always with the little care towards me! Once again, I had a fabulous time at the Borjs de la Kasbah. The Riad is beautiful with a real attention to detail in its decoration. Its warm and professional team excels so that we live every moment of our day with pleasure and good humor. Fresh, tasty and generous cuisine with friendly service. The Riad is very well located in the Kasbah. I stayed there in peace, thanks to the kindness of its staff and the comfort related to its design and infrastructure. I felt like home!  Thanks to you, Nora, Tom, Nadia, Nawel, Amine, Rachid and all the other members of the team... See you very soon, I hope; Brice...

I‚Äôm 3 months late to write a review , as promised to Nora but better late than never‚Äî this place truly deserves every bit of praise.

On our arrival, we were welcomed with a basket of fresh fruits and a glass of the most refreshing mint tea ‚Äî a perfect introduction to the hotel‚Äôs warm and traditional charm. The interiors are beautifully styled with an old-world aesthetic that immediately makes you feel both relaxed and immersed in local culture.

Nora was an exceptional host ‚Äî always polite, gentle, and genuinely helpful. She guided us on the best places to visit and even shared some practical tips on how to negotiate in the local markets, which made our excursions so much more enjoyable.

One of the highlights came at the end of our trip. Our flight was in the late afternoon, and after an early excursion, we had a few hours to spare in the heat. With our luggage safely stored in their drop-off room, Nora and her husband kindly allowed us to spend the few hours in their library. It was a cool and quiet sanctuary ‚Äî my wife even managed to get a good nap on the couch while the sun blazed outside. It‚Äôs this kind of thoughtful hospitality that really stays with you.

The only thing to keep in mind: if you're taking a taxi from the airport, make sure the driver drops you directly at the hotel, not at the entrance of the kasbah. Otherwise, you may end up walking almost half a mile with your bags ‚Äî not ideal after a long journey.

All in all, I wholeheartedly recommend this hotel for its traditional charm and, above all, its incredibly kind and attentive staff. Thank you again, Nora ‚Äî we hope to visit again someday!

Manish, Manisha and Lara

review title: A wonderful experience at Les Borjs de la Kasbah!
review:
Absolutely amazing experience! The hotel was perfect‚Äî beautifully maintained and very comfortable. The food was delicious, with a great variety to choose from. The service was top-notch; the staff was friendly, attentive, and always ready to help.

The overall atmosphere was warm and welcoming, making our stay truly memorable. The hotel went above and beyond by arranging excellent transfers and even guided us around the city, which made exploring so easy and enjoyable.

Highly recommend ‚Äî everything was just perfect!

Beautiful surroundings, refined decoration, staff with unparalleled care and kindness, high quality food made this stay in Morocco, one of our most beautiful family holidays! Thank you to the whole Borjs de la Kasbah team!

Has to be one of the top restaurants in Marrakech! My wife and I, along with our oldest son, had a wonderful evening. The staff were friendly and attentive; food and drinks were excellent (both in terms of taste and presentation); ambience was pleasant and relaxing. Quite pricey but worth every dollar/euro/whatever you choose to spend there.

A magical place, with a Moroccan-style welcome, very friendly and warm, a gourmet cuisine, very tasty, but also very original, DE dishes very mature and offering very surprising tastes EN ants, all surrounded by dancers Orientales who do the show while being very professional and very pleasant. In short, a place we loved both by the extreme quality DE the cuisine, as well as by the very chic setting and extremely considerate staff. To note, the quality and originality of cocktails EN aperitifs and the richness and diversity of mezz√©s EN entr√©e (to taste absolutely!!!!). We'll be right back. A tip, book and go with your eyes closed....

Again at AZAR and always the same satisfaction. We love the welcome, the menu, the atmosphere, nothing wrong. The service is always impeccable and the rates reasonable. After the belly dance, you can even sing to the sounds DE great French classics (Dalida and A. Delon on Lyrics lyrics) all to tell you that the atmosphere is crazy. We LOVE this property

review title: An unforgettable evening at the restaurant Azar!
review:
We had a great time at the restaurant Azar. Upon arrival, we were very well received, in a warm and elegant setting.
A big thank you to our waitress Fatima, who was a great listener DE good advice, patient, smiling and really nice throughout the meal.

The dishes were served rapidly DE, and despite the music, we were able to enjoy our discussion without difficulty.
The show was very nice and full DE life: the dancers involve the customers in a good mood, always with a smile.
We were also able to take very nice photos to keep a memory of this evening.

A restaurant that I highly recommend for a beautiful evening in Marrakech!

One DE the best restaurants in Marrakech, with Le Safran.
The show of the dancers is great, the food very good. I highly recommend! Special mention to the valet, honest and very friendly.

review title: Stunning restaurant with fabulous show. Highly recommended.
review:
Our first time in Marrakech and i stumbled across the Azar on Trip Advisor.
The restaurant is stunning, the service fantastic, and the show is fabulous.
The food portions are very generous, very tasty and beautifully presented.
I highly recommend the Azar.

Lovely ambiance and great food 
Definitely recommend ‚ù§Ô∏è
Good choice of menu for vegetarians 
Attentive host and great experience with the belly dancing ladies

Great location. Food very good. Staff very attentive!
We were disturbed at the evening show that the dancers were quite intrusive, even if they were clearly made to understand that you want to eat in peace. 
Also noteworthy is that you can smoke in the restaurant Shisha, which is very annoying if you have just received your food and are also non-smoking.

My partner and I booked dinner here in hopes of having at least one good meal while in Marrakech, after realising that the food options at the resort we were staying at left something to be desired to say the least... Luckily we had a lovely final dinner and cocktails here, and received excellent service from Fatima. We enjoyed the shisha and entertainment (although it had unfortunately not occurred to us to withdraw cash to tip the entertainers beforehand), and would definitely come back if we visit again!

review title: Very good Lebanese cuisine but no show/animation proper
review: Excellent Lebanese cuisine - we did not like the show (some dancers "plateau") and no entertainment type disco.

Nice and pleasant setting. Welcome back. A little expensive and not very hearty.
The show is composed of young women in underwear who whisper to men. This is not the oriental dance at all!!!! The dancers had lots of tickets in their panties and bras!!! It looks more like a striptease box than anything else!
Show to review in respect of the Woman!!! They are not pieces of meat!!!

Very nice environment with an exceptional service by all the staff, with highlight for Naima!
The gastronomic experience exceeded our expectations.

review title: A wonderful live entertainment place to eat. A very pleasant and highly recommended restaurant
review:
We booked this restaurant on recommendation and had a wonderful night. The restaurant is very clean including the bathrooms, staff are very attentive and can‚Äôt do enough. The food was excellent well presented hot and fresh. This is a little high end but very worth it. It very disabled accessible with a lift to the bathroom. 
The staff were very kind and helpful, some great cocktails were had. All in all a great night

The food was beautiful and fresh, we didn‚Äôt go on a day for the show but still had a lovely time.

Service was great but a little empty when we booked 7:30pm on a Sunday
Great place for dinner. We had lots of the meze dishes and shared between four. Lovely decor and the candles and belly dancing were great fun. The food was amazing.

review title: Excellent for dine in or takeaway!
review:
I have ordered food to takeaway from this restaurant two times in the last four days because it is so fresh and so reasonably priced. The service is excellent whether you eat in or takeaway. The menu is beautiful, the salads are fresh, and the hummus is the best I have tasted in Marrakech.

They take pride in what you are receiving and tonight the owner or manager made sure that I left happy.

I will definitely recommend this restaurant which is in a fun part of the souk, only 10-15 minute walk from Jemaa El-Fna Square.

5 stars all the way.
Great Lebanese food. Plus, a work of art on your plate. The restaurant is on a main road in the medina. No alcohol is served, but you won't miss it with this delicious food.

Good range of vegetarian/vegan food options which were delicious. Beautiful roof terrace and excellent service from Tahiri...great mint tea puring skills...lots of bubbles! Thank you, would highly recommend

review title: Delicious food that‚Äôs good value for money
review: Good views from the roof terrace and lovely tasting food that was good value for money in comparison to other restaurants. The octopus and hummus dish was delicious.

review title: Great food and cosy rooftop setting
review: Fabulous food. Good quality, decent portions, great staff. Lebanese food done very well. Went for dinner one night and went back for lunch next day. Falafel wrap with salad was superb.

review title: One of the best Lebanese cuisine we have ever tasted!!!
review:
A lunch between 2 visits on this Rooftop that we are not about to forget üòä.
Simplicity, freshness of products and flavors throughout the meal.
An address to keep carefully during each visit to Marrakech.
Bravo, bravo, bravo
First experience with Lebanese cuisine and I must say that it really amazed us! We had a mixed starter and two main courses, the food is great and the rooftop very pleasant. Super recommended.
I went naranj restaurant to try labanes food i really love the food it was super deliclious .the stuff of the restaurant were very friendly and smiling .

review title: Wonderful rooftop in the middle of the Medina
review:
After ten days in Morocco we didn't want to eat tanjin etc., so we decided to go to this Lebanese restaurant! This decision was golden right, a wonderful offer of small food with a very nice roof terrace and a great service.

Located in the middle of the medina, barely recognizable from the outside but the roof terrace is really great!

Lebanese restaurant with tables on the terrace.  Very professional service pleasant environment but, frankly the dishes did not satisfy me very much. The mujadara looked more like a lentil salad and the hummus was not very tasty. The babaganoush is good, the felafel are a bit burned. Interesting the roasted octopus

My family and I ate here twice during our stay in Marrakech as we liked it so much.  Great food and attentive service in a peaceful rooftop setting.  The felafel wraps at lunchtime were a particular hit.

Restaurant Naranj is  super great. The food is really Delicious and beautifully presented. You can't miss this place.
The Rooftop is beautifully decorated, stylish .
The staff was pleasant, attentive and friendly. Service was also available in English and Spanish.
The place is very close to Jemaa el Fna square.Alcohol is not served at this location.
I recommend this place 100%

This restaurant popped up multiple times in my restaurant research - for a reason!  The food was delicious and the menu very inspired.  We were four people ordering different items and each one was very tasty.  The rooftop seating was stylish, although not best rooftop views.  Go for the food! Do not miss out

review title: Like sitting in someone's garage with no beers
review: Spent a long time looking for something special for a birthday dinner. Chose here, regretted it. No atmosphere at all. No background music. Tasteless food, little seasoning. Couldn't be happier to finish as soon as possible and leave this place. They also do not serve alcohol, not that it matters, just so you know. Came for great food, was very disappointed ‚òπÔ∏è

The food was so good that we ate there four times during our stay. The lunchtime wraps were amazing, especially the chicken and cauliflower. The portions were generous, and the presentation was beautiful.
Great value for money too.
We had such a wonderful diner in experience at Pepe Nero. The service, especially by Mr. Toufik, was excellent.  We had a great evening and would recommend it who is visiting Marrakech.
Nice food and good service. Romantic surroundings and Mr. Toufik gave us EN excellent good service, the food was good came quickly and was great
Very good cuisine and quality service DE, the atmosphere is also there in this superb former Ryad that belonged to a Sultan
Excellent quality, thanks to the waiter Mr Rabie who accompanied us.. I recommend .. Moroccan atmosphere
Location and food of high standard. The service with Mr Khalid was just as professional!
Simo was a great server very kind and friendly worked with order alterations very well and brought drinks very quickly recommend this restaurant as it is beautiful and the service is great.
Thanks Mr Rabie for this excellent and very friendly service. We enjoyed our last evening in Marrakech at Pepe Nero. The food was delicious and the atmosphere was just perfect.

It was our first time at Pepe Nero. We went for dinner and the food was amazing. Our waiter Mr Toufik was extremely welcoming and always had a smile on his face. A great meal for our last night in Morocco and I think we will definitely be coming back.

Beautiful surroundings in this building. Both rooms are gorgeous, but the first room with the pool is stunning.  Mr Rabie was our waiter and had excellent recommendations, was truly attentive, and knew a lot about the city.  I had a ribeye, and my husband had the fillet, and both very discerning teenagers got one of the fresh pasta dishes, which was perfectly al dente.  We also had the selection with of Moroccan salads. Also delicious, and the pumpkin salad was very embedded. Lovely night at this restaurant.

We had a perfect evening. Great food! An experience! 
Very friendly staff. 
Greetings from Tyrol 
Barbara & Henrik

If you want an elegant and refined local and Italian cuisine with excellent wine selection (which is very rare here) this is the right place.
Exceptional accompanied meat I'm coming! An excellent Merlot.
Professional service and very nice.

review title: One of the best stays in Marrakech
review: At PepeNero restaurant we ate our best meal in Marrakech. At the Medina but sheltered from noise, the place, setting, food, kindness and professionalism of the waiter Chekfire / Sheriff made us our stay again. This meal was the best of our entire stay, a real treat for the taste buds, I can only advise this restaurant. Must do during a stay in Marrakech.

review title: One of the best places in Marrakech
review:
One of the best places in Marrakech.
Delicious food, beautiful location and excellent service.

Special thanks to Mr. Charaf, who took such good care of us. We felt very comfortable in this wonderful place.

A fantastic place!!
Everything about this restaurant is great. Beautiful surroundings, great food and especially the excellent service of Mr. Charaf! I can highly recommend it.

Fantastic service from you walk in the door and through the whole evening!

Improper service and food! We were so lucky to have the waitress named Rabi. He was absolutely unique!

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review:
Thanks to Youssef we got a place without reservation. I would only be interested in how you can get a price of 75 MAD for an orange juice or 95 MAD for a mixed juice (orange/mango). That's just cheeky. Best of all, my juice hadn't been finished when my glass was cleared.
Otherwise pretty location

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review:
Reading DE la carte, we opt for two white sangrias... What a disappointment!
A sangria, whether red or white, rests on a sweet and fruity base, with fruits that have long macerated.
Here, none DE all this: we are served a dry white wine, decorated DE ron DElles DE cucumber and DE few rose petals thrown EN surface.
No taste, no sweetness, no spirit DE sangria.
Frankly disappointed... This is far DE the traditional recipe!

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review: Stay away! They made me believe that my payment had not come through. I had to pay a 2nd time. I saw on my bank app that the transaction had succeeded. They brought in the manager and I was completely powerless against the whole team. Not professional, very unpleasant feeling.

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review:
Bad woman was disrespectful (the manager of Pergola) . His way DE speaking is unprofessional!
The staff was very good.

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review:
A shame , a rather cold welcome , the cuisine without taste, too spicy and very bad value for money!   
We came last year the kitchen was very good , the welcome very good! What a change DE kitchen team!! And apparently DE cooking! What a disappointment! Avoid! Suck!

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review: What a beautiful place this is. Jazz and drinks. We loved it here. We didn‚Äôt have dinner but the food we saw looked great. Few floors and each one is beautiful.

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review title: What a lovely night full of jazz üòçüòçüòç
review: Tis venue has great ambience, lovely service and great music. The food could have been a bit better but it was fine, we thoroughly enjoyed our evening here.

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review: I had an unforgettable evening at Jungle Rooftop La Pergola! The live jazz music created the perfect atmosphere‚Äîelegant, soulful, and full of good energy. The rooftop setting was absolutely stunning, with a charming ambiance that makes you want to stay all night What truly made the experience special was the amazing team. The staff were incredibly friendly, welcoming, and attentive throughout the night. They really made us feel at home and added to the overall warmth of the place

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review title: Fine dining with amazing jazz band
review: Hard to find but actually very close to the main square. Lovely setting , amazing lay out , great draught beer which is unusual in central Marrakesh, great cocktails , lovely music, reasonable prices , friendly staff.

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review: An unforgettable night in Marrakesh! The fine dining experience was exquisite ‚Äî beautifully plated Moroccan fusion dishes, rich in flavor and creativity. The ambiance was elevated by live jazz, creating a relaxed yet sophisticated vibe.

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review:
Spectacular place in the Medina of Marrakech. Fully recommended to enjoy dinner with friends. And it
Best of all Issa's attention!!!

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review:
Lovely restaurant, tucked away, food was delicious, then there was live music.
would definitely go again for food and drinks.

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review:
Too bad, this is a place that could be very nice! 
La Pergola is on the roof terrace of Riad Monceau, we quickly notice that it is not very clean. 
We were 12 people for a birthday, we arrived around 9:30 pm. We were installed on a terrace with ottomans and coffee tables, it lacks a lot of charm compared to the rest of the terrace. 
Unable to open windows for unknown reason. 
The waiters were unpleasant, it felt like they were getting in the way. Lots of missing in the drinks menu.

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review title: Ideal spot with great food, service and atmosphere
review:
We had a fabulous dinner here, having not booked in advance we were a little worried we wouldn't get a table but they accommodated us downstairs. We were tucked away so dinner was cozy, but near enough the live music to enjoy that.

The food was delicious and the service excellent, nothing was too much trouble for the lovely waiters who looked after us

place name: La Pergola Rooftop Jazz Bar & Restaurant
review: Booked well in advance for 8 people and was given a private space above the rooftop bar with very comfortable sofa style seating. Excellent service, great food, and great vibe with jazz music drifting up from the lower floors. Not inexpensive but well worth the experience. Reservations essential.

Beautiful traditional restaurant. Ideal location. Warm welcome worthy of a star. The dishes are delicious and generous. Although it is not local, I think what the best profiteroles I have eaten DE my life!! I recommend

This is a wonderful restaurant. All the staff wee very friendly and accommodating. I had a mishap with my dress as my zip broke and 4 ladies working there rushed to help me. 
The food was absolutely delicious, I had the lamb chops with couscous and vegetables and my friend had chicken tagine with vegetables. There were lots of different dishes to choose from. The dancers/ entertainment were amazing, they got everyone involved. Me and my friend  thoroughly enjoyed our time here. Thank you all at Comptoir Darna!

Wow! What a lovely restaurant. All the staff are super friendly and very accommodating. Everyone speaks very good English and will provide anything you need. The food was amazing - lots of different dishes to choose from. The dancers/ entertainment were amazing, they got everyone involved. Me and my boyfriend really enjoyed our time here. Thank you all at Comptoir Darna!

review title: Dinner, Photographer and service was great
review: I had a wonderful experience at Comptoir Darna. The dinner was absolutely delicious, and the staff was incredibly welcoming. My friends and I had a great experience. A special thanks to the photographer Ahmed for capturing great memories. Thank you for the excellent service and amazing food!
Restaurant with very good atmosphere!!!... I'm sorry to give 4 *to the table service. ... did not give the help we needed!!! Very good show!!!  Excellent bar
We had a great time, the food the atmosphere and especially our waiter Abdel very nice. Thank you.

review title: Was an exceptional experience from start to finish!
review: Comptoir Darna was an exceptional experience from start to finish! The food was absolutely delicious - every dish full of flavour and beautifully presented. The atmosphere was incredible, with a perfect balance of elegance and a lively party vibe. The music, dancing, and energy of the place made the evening unforgettable. On top of that, the hospitality was outstanding - the team made us feel so welcome and well looked after. A must-visit if you‚Äôre in Marrakech!

Bring a torch‚Ä¶

Heard so many great things about Comptoir, however failed to live up to its expectations for us. The restaurant theming is beautiful, with a great atmosphere and live music. However, lights are not popular here. Be prepared to use a torch light to read the menu. Service was great to start then slowed down considerably when the restaurant got busier. For whatever reason the waitress didn‚Äôt seem best pleased when we asked to pay by card. Must prefer cash tips.. The food itself was okay at best. Lamb tacos were nice, along with the weeping tiger steak, but neither was warm. The meatball tagine was very dry also. The caramel fondant for dessert was the highlight. Beautiful. What you pay for a meal here, in my opinion, doesn‚Äôt compare to what you might find in the Medina. One final point, dress code on their website is not enforced.
Had an amazing evening together with my friends. Really nice music and vibes. Special thanks to Ahmed, who makes amazing pictures and is really kind!

The know-how of French restaurants combined with the flavors of Morocco.
The welcome and service are impeccable, the dishes certainly expensive for Marrakech are delicious, and the show proposed pleasant.
Once the meal is over, the atmosphere heats up and everything ends with a wild evening.
We had a great time.

The restaurant was a little out the way for us but the atmosphere is unmatched. 

The band on the stairs as you arrive is utterly fantastic but the talent truly lies with the dancers they were phenomenal! 

Food and service were both fantastic, we thoroughly enjoyed our evening here!
Very good experience, delicious and hearty meals, atmosphere at the top from 21h45. Very nice place, class. To do again without hesitation!!!
Our third visit and another fab evening. We took our friends for their first time and they loved it. Great cocktails and service. Love this place.

review title: Excellent evening at the Darna Counter!
review:
We ate very well, so much so that we had to take some of the takeaway food, which is how hearty and tasty it was! The place is super classy, with a refined and festive atmosphere. The dancers were beautiful and very pleasant, adding a real touch of elegance to the evening.

The presentation of the plates was neat, and our waiter was just great: attentive, smiling and professional. Honestly, 10/10! Only small downside, a slight waiting time to be installed, but nothing very serious. An address I recommend without hesitation!

Very nice place no doubt about it but if you are looking for something authentic and typical Moroccan, this is not the right place. Menu as expensive as the French Riviera, restaurant completely Europeanized like many establishments in Marrakech. 
That said our waiter was friendly. Fairly haughty hostesses probably thinking they hold a crazy power with the mandatory reservation. 
I wouldn't advise my relatives.
Superb food, especially the confit duck. Excellent service and really good desserts too. Well worth a stop if in Marrakesh.
Anwar and the entitled team were incredible.  They could not be more accommodating.  Food was delicious, best cheese board in Marrakesh - from a connoisseur‚Ä¶.

review title: Drinks, food and staff was perfect
review:
It was so perfect 
Enjoyed the food and drinks and the staff so sweet and friendly, specially our vaitor Mouss. 
I will diffently recomand to others

Amazing experience, the food and drinks were excellent. Waiter Mouss was very attentive and friendly. We had a birthday and the staff came and sang Happy Birthday in English and in Moroccan. We would gladly return.

Food, ambiance and service are in one word: top! DE DJ completes it; delicious music in DE background without being overbearing. In short, if you‚Äôre ever in Marrakech, DAN you should definitely go to DE Pointbar.
Amazing place with a beautiful atmosphere, delicious food, and excellent service. I highly recommend this spot. We were served by Mr. Saad, who was exceptionally professional and attentive.
Amazing food, great cocktails,  amazing experience and great service from Mustafa and the rest of the team. Magic as good as Dynamo and beautiful music from a talented singer / musicians.
Absolutely brilliant service. Very quick service, the food was lovely and all the staff were very welcoming. Would recommend highly
Perfect meal with anouar, very very sociable and very nice, I highly recommend we have very good food.

review title: Very nice experience , very good service , good quality DE cuisine , warm atmosphere .
review:
A beautiful experience in the heart DE the ochre city
Very good food 
Good service 
The magic trick DE was just breathtaking 
Thank you for your warm welcome

An uncontounable rendezvous in Marrakech!
Welcome and professional service really with little care.
DE excellent aperitif & tapas formulas, a crush for the "pointbar" formula
A variety DE menus, from tasty dishes from starter to dessert - with great quality/price
Festive atmosphere without ever being too loud, really congratulations to the DJ.
EN again thank you to the whole team for this wonderful time spent with family ‚ù§Ô∏èüôè

Fantastic food, fantastic service, amazing magician, great music. Best restaurant in Marrakesh. 
Mourad 6/6 waiter gave us a great experience. 
Ahmed the magician was great.

Altogether a very very good experience! Highly recommended.

Very nice atmosphere with a very friendly team. Our waiter Mouss was especially worth mentioning for looking after us. Thanks to the whole team for making our son feel better üòÄ Food was good and cocktails delicious. We were here early, so not yet busy.
Cozy atmosphere, friendly music, amazing service! The food is good, the plates have a very nice composition it is a faultless!

Great service DE Mustapha!
A very friendly atmosphere for a family meal or any other reason. 
A very warm welcome DE all the staff to the attention DE its customers. 
A meal served very quickly we had an aperitif to share as well as dishes and deserts and the food a was excellent from since to the end. A very family atmosphere with a little magic show DE, and very relaxed music. With all this a good value for money, I highly recommend!
Delicious meals , chicken is cooked with many spices DE will revive your taste buds! Not to mention , a server of remarkable kindness.

This restaurant is family run and the staff makes you feel at home right away!
Tucked in the Medina it has an amazing rooftop and the food is reasonably priced while being fresh and packed with flavour
They only accept cash so be sure to carry with you

The food was delicious. We had dinner here two nights in a row. For this price and then delivering this quality is really top! We also want to put the waiter Kenan in the spotlight, he has completed the evening. Highly recommended to go for an evening meal when you are in Marrakech. Note you have to pay cash, but that was no problem.

We relied on trip notes.
Well rather disappointed, chicken meat tasted very special with a lot of spices, it also lacked almost raw cooking in places, fries with small black deposits on them...
Make your own opinion but no one from my family could finish the dishes...
Be careful that cash no cb (and no ATM next door).

Very good food and impeccable service. Everything is delicious and the cocktails very tasty. We will return without problem. You have quesadillas, burritos etc... with or without meat. Very reasonable price compared to what we saw elsewhere

It's sooo gooooddd, 
You guys need to try this place. Their foods are amazing and the ambience of this place is wonderful.

:
"I had the most amazing meal at Roti d'Or! The food was incredibly fresh and flavorful, and the service was top-notch. I highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a delicious and authentic dining experience."
The food at Roti D'or was absolutely delicious! I especially loved the [ quesadilla ]. The flavors were so authentic and the portions were generous.

Horrible! Don‚Äôt go! We got food poisoning from the food at this restaurant, missed half of our vacation in Marrakech because we vomited our stomachs for 2 days, missed also day tours that were already paid. Furthermore, we went to this restaurant on 25 Nov, today is 1st Dec, we got home (after the most horrific flight ever had because once again our stomach killed us for the entire duration) and we are still not fully recovered and still feeling sick.

If you don‚Äôt want to miss your vacation, do not eat here!!!

üá´üá∑ I recommend 100% very good price, impeccable service and very fast on top üëåüèº , very hearty and excellent dishes.  Prices between 40 MAD and 80 MAD 
Bonus point for the terrace and small cats üê±

review title: Delicious food and great value for money.
review:
Lovely rooftop terrace restaurant with plenty of space, but well hidden and easy to miss from the street (just a small doorway and a stairway straight up). 

The waiter was friendly and jovial and the food was delicious and well presented and great quality. 

Great value for money and would definitely recommend.

Really enjoyed our supper here - the Mexican / Moroccan fusion worked very well, and the quality of the food was excellent. Also thought that the service was friendly and super-efficient. All-in-all, we had a great experience and would recommend.
Decent food, not great flavours but edible. Cats again around the food. Staff were nice and accommodating, food had a hair but was remade. Nice rooftop vibe.

review title: Great if you don't expect culinary prowess
review:
When you see the opinions, and the staging of their leadership qualities upon entering, you start to expect a lot, at the risk of being disappointed. If the meat in the Tex Mex burger is good, and the sauces or presentation are nice, the fries are really basic, just like the burger bread or salad. There is not much missing from this address to be in my eyes better, up to its note. Even to raise prices a little but have home fries and baker burger breads.
The roof terrace is nice, when to some reviews read against the humor of the waiter, I always find it better than a formatted service, bringing it a +
The Golden Roti is a real culinary nugget. I was particularly impressed by the authentic flavor of the dishes. Great congratulations to Chef Reda for his talent and creativity

review title: Excellent time, tasty Moroccan cuisine! Thanks to our server Abdou
review:
We had a great time in this restaurant with a warm atmosphere. Moroccan cuisine is simply EN delicious, especially couscous, which was perfectly fragrant and hearty. A real treat!

Many thanks to Abdou, our waiter, for his welcome, kindness and professionalism throughout the meal. It has greatly contributed to making this experience even more enjoyable.
Great lunch spot! Good food, nice ambiance and they offer a happy hour that includes a free plate of tapas with a purchase of a cocktail. Emad was a good server! Would recommend!
Place to get away from the sun and enjoy a good coffe,  waiter Abdou was really nice and friendly. Will come back for sure :)

Atmosphere is excellent and the location is wonderful. Rooftop vibe with a pretty 360¬∞ view, so perfect for sunset. Food was lovely (we recommend the chicken pastilla), and service was excellent - Abdou was very lovely and welcoming! Prices are reasonable for the location and we would return!
Very good restaurant to come eat, a very nice and fresh interior patio, they have air conditioning, which is appreciated, Emad served us, everything is fine, and good amounts DE food

review title: Great good, great value, great service
review: The food was great and the value for money was very good. We had the Chicken Tagine and Chicken Pastilla and both were delicious. Thanks Brahim for the fantastic service.
Brahim is the man. Best waiter best drinks.       Mojito is pretty good. Service is good . The tapas and cocktail happy hour deal is great.

review title: Highly recommended place. Food and top service, and especially to Brahim. Waiter majisimo and super helpful.
review:
I came here with my husband and we had a lovely dining experience. 
The food was delicious and the interior beautiful 
Thank you to the server Abdou for being so professional while also telling us a bit about your Berber culture. 
All the best!

We stayed at Bazaar Caf√© in July 2025 and the experience was excellent. The food is very good, with fresh and authentic flavors, ideal for those looking to taste the best of local cuisine. The service was impeccable, especially thanks to Emad, who attended us very kindly and cordially. He helped us choose what to order and made sound suggestions that further enhanced our experience. Definitely a highly recommended place if you are in the area.
Very pleasant experience, very delicious and tasty food, cold and very good beer. BRAHIM's attention a luxury, recommendable place! Cous cous and tajin TOP!

review title: The best place to eat in Marrakech Medina
review:
I beckoned here for tourism. Eaten divinely, the place quiet and well cared for, great location, very very nice staff (Abdou cute and super friendly)!
I highly recommend :)

great experience in the center of Marrakech, excellent food I think adapted and cooked to perfection and possibility to consume local wine. The staff, especially Abdou, was friendly and helpful. recommended for a Moroccan gastronomic break.
Perfect place for a peaceful evening, quality service, Abu our server was very attentive and responsive. The dishes are hearty, I recommend.
The place is very nice to eat, the food is good and Brahim is very attentive. The patio is very nice

We found this amazing place where we enjoyed delicious Morocco food. The place is gorgeous, the food great and Mustafa gave us such an amazing service. I recommend and will come back! Oh we came with our kids who also loved the food!

Visited for dinner with a table on the roof top terrace in time to see the sunset, which was very special.

Staff very friendly and service excellent.

Small menu but all good choices.  Food was amazing and frozen cocktails good too.

During our visit there was a dj playing good music and also a violinist and some Moroccan dancers.  Our three course meal plus 4 alcoholic drinks and bottle of water came to 176,000 Durham so not the cheapest meal but well worth the money.

Highly recommended and will definitely visit again when next in Morocco.

What a vibe! Great food and really friendly staff! Great entertainment. Book ahead because you don‚Äôt want to miss the sunset. Unfortunately we did because even when trying to book a week in advance it was full! Nevertheless the evening was lovely!

One of the nicest places we've been to in Marrakesch. Beautiful roof terrace, nice restaurant, delicious food and cocktails and very kind and professional service. The prices are European plus, so 15‚Ç¨ for a cocktail, but if you want to treat yourself and enjoy a fancy evening in a nice atmosphere - that's the place to go. Try the veggie couscous - it's amazing!

Unfortunately very overpriced is only hyped by influencers. 
Food nothing special and pretty simple. Waiters very arrogant, guests are watched and laughed at.

review title: Really enjoyed the food, the service and stunning rooftop
review: The service is extremely good and fast and they could put a fair few large hotels to shame.  The food was also very good, but a little on the pricer side.  The sunset from the roof top was spectacular, so reserve early as it is very, very busy.  Depending on whether you want to eat or just take a drink, you have time slots as it is that popular. On the night we went there was live music which was excellent, but we didn't stay too late - it ramps up later into the evening with a DJ, so a good spot for a few cocktails.

Very nice family experience!
Whether the atmosphere, the decor, the view or the food everything was perfect.
If you come to Marrakech, go ahead!

This spot is beautiful, it has such great views and vibes. The food came very quickly with great service and the frozen cocktails were divine !! The food is a great mixture of Moroccan style small plates and familiar favourites ! If we come back to Marrakesh we will definitely be going back !!

A friend recommended dardar for a golden hour sunset spot and it did not disappoint.
Beautiful views across Marrakech and stunning sunset.
The staff were attentive and service was very quick. The food was excellent as was the music choice throughout the evening.
Our table booking for 2.5 hours so we arrived at 7.30 got to see the sunset, had a long relaxing meal and some great drinks.
After food there was a real party atmosphere helped by a couple of birthdays in different groups.
Would certainly come again on our next trip.

What a great rooftop terrace is on restaurant Dardar in the Medina. Take a lunch, dinner or a drink. You never have to sit in the sun, there is enough sun protection. The dishes are fine and the staff is very friendly. Do book in advance for dinner.
All excellent from service to food!!! A rooftop with very good atmosphere!!‚Äôexcellent sunset!!! Near the square.

suggested by our riad this restaurant has a beautiful setting with colorful tiles typical of royal palaces of marrakesh. The show for tourists starts at 8 am. Fast service and friendly staff. Very hearty dishes also have kid menus and for the 9-year-old we managed to have chicken skewers not too spicy. Very tourist restaurant at tourist prices .they also have alcoholic beverages in the menu Moroccan ros√© wine was drinkable. Artists engage guests by asking for tips for the photo.

review title: Beautiful venue for an evening in Marrakech
review:
Great place to dine or drink one of their great and scenic cocktails (one of the few places that serves alcohol in Marrakech). 
We just had dinner and ate very well! The restaurant is cool inside (with air conditioning) and boasts a very nice terrace from which to see the city from above and maybe a nice sunset. The food is very good and after dinner you can attend a dancing show. The bartenders are very nice and the waiters very nice!!

What a disappointment! I couldn‚Äôt wait to test this place, the setting as well as the food seemed to really stick to an interesting dynamic and a search for taste and pleasure for customers. 

Unfortunately, it is quite the opposite. The quantities are ridiculous, but still this could be compensated by an explosive taste, precise seasoning or a fair balance. Except it‚Äôs none of that! Bland, tasteless, flavorless and unbalanced! 
And icing on the cake necessarily the bill! Which hurts extremely considering the experience. 
5‚Ç¨ a bottle of water, for a nice but not crazy setting, a simple service, it gives you an idea! 

I advise against

Dardar came highly recommended per the reviews and didn't disappoint although not quite full marks. Rooftop experience was lovely, it positively served wine and beers which we've found to be uncommon in Marrakech and the food was very tasty. It was a little on the pricey side and our group of 6 were placed on a table in the middle sitting on backless chairs which became uncomfortable after a while. Worth a visit but insist on chairs with backs!

We visited for dinner and drinks as a group of friends on holiday.
Our table on the terrace wasn‚Äôt quite ready so we headed to the bar for a cocktail. Cocktails were of a really good standard! 
We were then shown to our table. Great service.  We had a mixture of starters and mains between the 8 of us, all of which were fantastic.  Belly dancers came out during dinner and performed, with some audience participation. Overall great service, friendly staff, excellent atmosphere and the food to match!

Beautiful setting, excellent DE dishes and superb service!
We recommend this establishment EN colorful and flavorful!

More than a dinner, it is an experience that satisfies all the senses. Sight, smell, hearing, taste enriched DA so kind. DA try. the most appreciated course the Moroccan vegetable appetizer. For those who love spices is 'exceptional. Prices adapted to the level of the room

The food was delicious. 
A beautiful place in Marrakech, with friendly service and lovely atmosphere. 
Would recommend for a cute dinner.

Though it was a little hard to find that made the adventure even better.Once you are inside it‚Äôs like time has stood still the staff were very attentive without being overbearing and the food well if you want authentic Moroccan this is the place to come it‚Äôs wonderful it‚Äôs is on the more expensive end of the spectrum but worth every penny in my opinion üí•

Great atmosphere, great view from the rooftop and very nice staff!
We were already here last year and will come back

review title: To eat while pretending to be a sultan...
review: If you are looking for a place out of the tumult, romantic, neat, in a sumptuous setting: look no further! White tablecloths and rose petals in a beautiful patio. Service to the rider, and excellent food. Plus: the beautiful roof terrace and traditional music some evenings.

A magical moment lived with my best friend, traditional evening with very nice dancer and musician, delicious and hearty meals, and personal care! We had a great evening! We will definitely be back! Do not hesitate to go if you wish to have a beautiful experience!
A wonderful time spent at Dar Zellij restaurant: impeccable service, delicious cuisine, warm and caring staff, exceptional setting.

Great place with nice atmosphere. 
The food is delicious. And they made one specially for children.
