Sossegado for lunch and dinner has live music shows and dancers.

A superb setting, tasty cuisine and attentive service. 
The dinner was sublimated by a magnificent oriental dance performance. 
Special mention for tanjia marrakchia! A delight! A beautiful experience in Marrakech, which I highly recommend!

Excellent restaurant with a really nice atmosphere! The waiters are adorable, professional and very attentive. Big crush for the oriental dancer: a real show, elegant and catchy. Delicious cuisine, perfect service. We recommend 100%!
Typical couple trying new restaurants daily; found the one with the best main courses and atmosphere locally. Portions were large even by American standards so beware.
Dinner without infamy and without praise nice place but food not up to , restaurant hard to find in the alleys of 'Marrakesh price exaggerated disappointment

review title: A must-see restaurant in Marrakech, to do as a couple or with friends!
review:
An intimate and authentic setting, quality cuisine but above all impeccable service.
We enjoyed the inner courtyard at the feet of the orange trees, and the terrace with stunning views of the sunset. This is the second time we have come and it has become for us a must-see restaurant in Marrakech.

The place is a gem, beautiful. We were staying opposite and found out about it at home. The food delicious but the portions really plentiful, I recommend splitting. We had royal couscous and beef (exquisite). You can also have a drink on the terrace, super cute atmosphere

All very good!
We had lunch here looking for a different DA cuisine, we were delighted!

Great experience, there is a real nuance between the restaurant and the street in front of it, burgers are cheap (about 69 dirhams for a single burger ) and they are super good. EN 20 dirhams there are even fries and a drink offered. In short I recommend a lot
Very tasty burgers! Good chips EN great value for money. Friendly staff, friendly staff. Is in a small shopping center with next to this restaurants even more good.
Very nice place. Inside shopping center. Air conditioning and games for children. Very good burgers. We'll repeat for sure.

Great place with good food and nice staff! When you are tired of Morrocan food this place is really recommended üòÑ We ate different burgers and all of them was good. Even our picky 7 years old eat it all.
Friendly english speaking staff, delicious burgers, short waiting time, card payment possible. Would 100% recommend it for a mid day eat.
The best burgers DE Marrakech, very good value for money I highly recommend welcoming staff. Fresh and generous product
Great veggie burger. Very fast service and very large portions. Also excellent is the hamburger with meat and chips.

review title: A must if you are in Marrakech
review:
Great food.. quick service 
Clean and friendly environment also child friendly too
Definitely worth a visit if you are in Marrakech

Medina Buger is definetley a place you should try fast services welcoming staff too I was served by Dunya who was pleasant and made me and partner welcome we ordered the classic cheeseburger and fries cooked to perfection! 
If your in Marrakesh and you visit medina mall they‚Äôre upstairs you can‚Äôt miss it!

Medina burger is a hidden gem that you must try,the food is amazing and welcoming friendly staff.I highly recommend if you are visiting Marrakesh that you come to medina mall and try Medina burger.It won‚Äôt disappoint!

review title: Stop at KFC / Mc Do and make way for Medina Burger
review:
Dear aptes DE la Junk Food, you want to feast and enjoy good Burger. Discover Medina Burger in the Medina Mall not far DE the famous square... Warm welcome, neat decor (and impeccable hygiene compared to KFC üòâ) home fries and Smash Burger üëå
Take 5 minutes to discover this nice gallery and this nice fast food that is also recommended by Michou üòÅ
Very good place to eat or dine. It's not expensive and it's very rich. I highly recommend it, we were very surprised.
how this fast food can be placed in top1! 45‚Ç¨ for 4 really not top burger, a homemade sauce that is simple mayonnaise. But I'm not too demanding. My worst culinary experience in Marrakech

We needed a quick lunch and although there are many places to eat in Marrakech, we fancied a simple burger.  Medina Burger did the job. Pleasant friendly staff, good food, well priced and in an open, well tended restaurant. We had a nice lunch and would come again.

I had so much fun at Palace and enjoying my dinner with shows , it was amazing to live that 1000 night and one night 
Thanks Bajjou for his hospitality and great service that's make my night special
Incredible immersive experience at the Dar Soukkar Palace with quality service near the Amine server, we spent an exceptional evening that makes you want DE come back with friends!

Deposit 51.50 pounds still not refunded despite two emails still no response. Made the experience extremely expensive 209.00 for meal drinks and show for 2 people so total for eve 260 pounds sterling. It was a great evening and fabulous food and entertainment this was a real shame as I could not recommend.

An adorable place but service 0 ... I don‚Äôt see why men are forbidden to enter with sandals when in the world it‚Äôs normal + it‚Äôs 45 degrees in Marrakech so an explanation... I don‚Äôt recommend you because if the service and 0 and no respect for the customer It‚Äôs no use leaving
There is something else better and top price and pleasant service.

review title: Beautiful from afar but far from beautiful
review:
The meal is very good as well as the service .. on the other hand, the show is insipid and interspersed by long bands of music ( DJ ) and it is really very loud!
We were outside, it was very hot (no cooling system ) and the lighting on the stage is catastrophic ..
This place and beautiful I advise you if you are in couple or with friends about the service it great and a big thank you to hamza

Excellent welcome from Nada, extremely kind, helpful and accommodating! Same level service with Khadija who was hyper attentive and attentive. A top team! 
A great time because these beautiful people!

Booking made for 6 adults for 5 months, deposit paid!
We're coming: what's your name?
We repeat the same name 3 times to the reception staff and we are told: no reservation!
We take out the emails, the evidence and suddenly the revelation .... and the destructive look of the receptionist towards her colleagues who finally found the reservation!
We are seated at a table with bench and chairs from another age, below a platform where groups of young people in more than casual clothing are located while a correct outfit is required on the site of the complex!
Cocktails, choice of menu, wines, ok everything now goes well: I specify to the waiter 3 times that I will taste the wine after my cocktail... he nods... serves me wine... and asks me if it suits me: a joke!
The dishes are of average quality and the service pushes for consumption with the wine bottles that empty quickly!
The show finally begins: singer of good level, fire-breather who does not spit anything... dancers dynamic but of average quality: overall duration of the show of 1 hour, dinner finished, coffee and addition! And there, the room manager asks us to clear the table because we learn that the reservation is scheduled for a duration of 2.5 hours at the table, then we have to get out and either go out, or find a table at the bar!
Little text explanation with the manager, discussion and finally he finds us another table at the bar!
Weird but some tables that arrived at the same time as us, remain in place and are not subject to this rule: we quickly realize that indigenous youth groups are not disturbed: cronies and arrangements?
In short, an evening where the negatives follow with a feeling of not being respected as a customer!
Dar Sukar is a must-see in Marrakech but management and customer relations are not up to the task!
The meals are average, the comfort of the tables and chairs is improved, the show is moderately correct!
All this is sold through social networks and the bling bling highlighted by the establishment!

review title: Totally fantastic evening with dinner and show
review: Fantastic evening. Surprisingly top class. Extremely skilled DJs and really professional dancers. Great songs that got the audience. The food was excellent - the best we got in Morocco. Take the ‚Äúexpensive‚Äù menu. The price of food and drink is higher than elsewhere, but the atmosphere and the show you get with - and it's all worth the money. Do not arrive before 21/21.30 and stay for far beyond midnight. The mood is far from the tourist, as one could fear. It is full of joy and really professional. The sound is excellent - outside under the open sky with light shows and lamps and cozy. Forgotten service that is also unrivalled. Strong servants who actually knew something about food and wine - and made the evening perfect.
It was really an exceptional culinary experience thank you dar soukar a big thank you to our host Khadija for his profenalism welcome and recommendations

review title: Thank to our waiter, but not a Moroccan night out.
review:
So I would give this 2 reviews‚Ä¶ firstly to our waiter - 10/10 THANKYOUüëèüèªüåüü§©
Our daughter suddenly, as soon as we ordered, was overcome with heat stroke. This waiter - I wish I had got his name - could not have done more to help us, bringing ice in a napkin, medicine, letting her lie down a different area, thank you again for your kindness‚ù§Ô∏è
My second review is for the experience of Dar Soukkar - it was elegant, the setting was a spectacle, the food good, the service excellent but it wasn‚Äôt 100 per cent a Moroccan experience. The belly dancers were very good, but some of the other entertainment choices I would think would appeal more to young boujee phone scrolling 20 something locals. For us to hear Adele or Amy Winehouse songs or see Chicago dance routines.. not so much‚Ä¶ we can see that at home. So if you are looking for a truly Moroccan Marrakesh night out I would probably look elsewhere.
Best experience in Marrakech for dinner and amazing shows. Singer and performance was great. Food & service was very good.

review title: A mediocre experience despite the festive setting
review:
We had a great time overall thanks to the festive atmosphere and the impressive setting of the Dar Sukkar Palace. However, several points really marred the experience.

The food is correct, without more, certainly not at the level of prices charged. I found a piece of plastic in my dessert, but the waiter was in such a hurry to clear it that I didn‚Äôt even have time to report it.

Barely the last bite swallowed, we were brought the bill without even wondering if we wanted to have something else to drink. Two minutes after paying, a staff member arrived, accompanied by a couple, to ask us to clear the table. No words of apology, just an injunction to "go to the bar".

We stayed 1h20 in all. Being in a hurry to leave the table after spending nearly ‚Ç¨180 on two people is quite shocking. Too bad, because the place has potential, but the purely commercial approach spoils the experience.
We had a beautiful night at dar soukkar its was amazing day with the waiter mehdi he was carful and take care about us all the night the show was great, food was delicious ‚ù§Ô∏è

review title: We spent a wonderful evening at Dar Soukkar as a family
review:
We spent a wonderful evening at Dar Soukkar as a family, and it truly felt like a special occasion from the moment we arrived. The setting is breathtaking ‚Äî a beautifully restored old sugar palace with grand architecture, candlelight, and lush gardens that make you feel like you‚Äôve stepped into a Moroccan fairytale.

We chose it for a family dinner, and it didn‚Äôt disappoint. The atmosphere was elegant but still relaxed enough for us to enjoy with kids. The food was delicious ‚Äî we shared a variety of Moroccan dishes, and everything was flavorful and beautifully presented. The lamb tagine and briouates were especially memorable.

As the evening went on, the live music and traditional performances added even more magic to the night. It was a perfect blend of culture, fine dining, and ambiance.

The service was professional and attentive, making us feel welcome and well taken care of from start to finish.

Dar Soukkar is the kind of place you go to when you want the full Marrakech experience ‚Äî dinner, history, music, and beauty all in one.

We had best cooking class. Staff were amazing, our cooking guide did the best job engaging with everyone. We also got a certificate at the end! Definitely recommend! 

#Morocco#Portuguese

We had a great experience learning to cook tajine from scratch in the restaurant. I definitely recommend it as you learn how to cook moroccan food and also at the end you get to eat it. Thank you Nora for your knowledge and kindness.

What a wonderful experience.
The staff are super friendly and the food is amazing.
Very relaxing music and clean restaurant

It was such a great experience! Would absolutely recommend this restaurant for food, aura and generally a wonderful experience of Morocco! They love celebrating birthdays and anniversaries with their guest by celebrating with cultural music and song!
I loved the experience! Our waiter was lovely and the atmosphere was so fun! The food was also very yummy - would recommend

Thank you very much to Amine for her warm welcome, it was a very pleasant time. 
Delicious meals 
We recommend this restaurant!
Amazing experience. Never done anything like it before and Noura was amazing at explaining the recipes for each meal! Really recommend.

This place is genuinely one of the best restaurants I‚Äôve been to the vibe is amazing the staff are genuinely the best and super welcoming especially zagouri and the manager they was truly very helpful and kind I rate this experience one of the best and will definitely be back in the future and strongly recommend

review title: This place gets A+ from this English teacher üòâ
review: Amazing food and wonderful experience for family. Very welcoming service, especially from our service Zagouri. Very nice

Great hospitality , the host make sure we were pick up from our riad . The place was far , but they have van to pick us up .
Zagouri very hospitable n kind

review title: Great drink selection, and a good waiter
review: Food was good and menu was simple. They had a lot of drinks items that i was impressed with. Zagouri was a good nice waiter, got everything we needed simply and even waited for 1 member of our family to come back to the restroom to take her order.

review title: an unforgettable experience and much learned as non-chefs. Keep it up
review: The cooking class was a success and an unforgettable experience. I would highly recommend ES. Noura implemented ES very well and it was a perfect organization until the meal. Keep it up and maybe you'll see me again at the next class. By Saru & Vithu

The cooking class with Noura was great. She's fun, dynamic and friendly. She's a great girl.
The dishes are simple to make and it was really instructive.

review title: A true little paradise alone inconvenience you have to book to avoid waiting
review: The perfect place to relax and recharge I was very satisfied I will definitely come back and I advise
Noura was amazing, this activity was great! I loved learning about the meals as we created them ourselves, I‚Äôd recommend everyone to try this!
Superb view and atypical restaurant! The food was very good and the service impeccable. I highly recommend! Fog terrace and with views.
Very good cuisine in the form of buffets everything is good from starter to main course and dessert with lots of flavors for a very good price.
Very nice local Berber with various terraces. Quality buffet dinner and very good! Great value for money! We are back for two consecutive nights!

We came to 5 and we discovered a beautiful buffet very fresh and very varied, very professional waiters with their smile mint tea with desserts and blankets because we were cold we recommend this wonderful experience

Beautiful typical restaurant with seats both indoors and on the large outdoor terrace. We were there twice in the same holiday and we had dinner both √† la carte and buffet .. always all very good and with lots of choice! Very pleasant live music and very kind and attentive customer care staff. You can also book online and pay with your card

For about ¬£20 per person, you have unlimited food, including a range of classic Moroccan dishes. We loved the orange sticky chicken and the lamb dish. Everything was super tender and fresh with great flavours. The buffet style is quick and easy dinner place. 

The live music added to the relaxing fun atmosphere. 

Staff are very friendly, just be conscious there are a lot of steep steps to get to where the restaurant is. 

Overall we loved it and will be back. One of the best tasting restaurants in marrakech.
The buffet formula without more, small space with bcp of people... Quality of medium dishes.. good service for drinks and excellent musician singer

review title: Great solution for a restaurant in marrakech
review: Beautiful place, very nice and clean. A lot of customers that guarantees freshness of food. Buffet or √† la carte proposal. Prices more than fair considering the local and the area. A lot of buffet choice that is renewed every night. The owner and her son speak excellent Italian having lived many years in Italy. Local to recommend . Beautiful panoramic terrace
Dinner at this restaurant offering an 'eat-all-you-can-eat' buffet with good Moroccan cuisine and a rich selection of desserts.

review title: A pleasant experience with responsive service
review:
Recommended by my cousins living in Morocco, I had the pleasure of discovering the restaurant Kui-Zin during my stay, and I was not disappointed! We had the opportunity to test several meals, and each time, the quality of the food was there. The dishes are tasty and well presented.

The service is also worthy of mention: fast and friendly staff demonstrate professionalism and friendliness, which makes the experience even more enjoyable. Only small downside... a dish was forgotten during our order, but I want to stress that the restaurant reacted very correctly by apologizing and quickly rectifying the mistake.

I definitely recommend the Kui-Zin for its delicious cuisine and efficient service. A beautiful address to have a good time!
2nd time we come to taste this superb buffet... everything is very good and the staff very kind! Real immersion, we recommend!

review title: An address not to be missed
review: Very pleasant restaurant, very nice staff, nice musical atmosphere, a strong hair maybe. The buffet is super good. Salads are tasty, meat is tender...all on the roof terrace.

review title: Delicious rooftop meals, terrace and cooking classes the next day
review: It‚Äôs simply delicious! We had a very pleasant time on the roof, terrace, the orange lamb is simply exquisite! We also took a small cooking class with Kenza and Amina, at a very pleasant time

review title: Good food, nice terrace, enjoyable lunch
review:
We ate lunch here 1 afternoon.

The Good.

1. The terrace location is very pleasant with shady and sunny tables. Nice views out to the mountains.

2 Service was prompt, friendly, and efficient.

3. The food was very tasty. The chicken brochettes were good, and the pastries for dessert were enjoyable.  Coffees were good.

The Bad.

Nothing really.

Overall

Would definitely recommend for lunch. I see most people go for the buffet, but the daytime menu was also good.

review title: All you can eat a Marrakech
review: Quick dinner all you can Eat. Average food, friendly service. Great for a quick fix in the center.................
A huge thank you to Abdelrahman and Brahim for their warm welcome and impeccable service! Your kindness and professionalism really made a difference. See you soon!

review title: We spent an evening at So Lounge Marrakech and it was the perfect mix of energy
review:
We spent an evening at So Lounge Marrakech and it was the perfect mix of energy, elegance, and fun. The atmosphere is vibrant but still classy ‚Äî with a beautiful outdoor area, chic lighting, and a great crowd.

We had dinner first, and the food was delicious ‚Äî well-presented, with rich flavors and a nice balance between Moroccan and international options. Later in the evening, the music picked up and the live DJ and performances really brought the place to life.

It‚Äôs definitely one of those spots where you can start with a relaxed dinner and end up dancing. The staff were professional and made sure we had a great time from start to finish.

If you're looking for a trendy night out in Marrakech with good food, good music, and a fun vibe, So Lounge is a solid choice.

The atmosphere is the perfect mix of chic and vibrant
 the staff was incredibly friendly and attentive throughout the night. I loved the entertainment too: live musicians, a talented saxophonist, and great DJs that kept the energy high.
Definitely one of the best spots in Marrakech for a classy night out. Highly recommended!!

Just went there two nights ago with friends for the first time <3
The staff were so nice and welcoming, and the attention to detail from the bartenders and waiters was AMAZINGGG!
Definitely coming back xoxo
A good evening in so lounge thank you very much for all the managers and server Mehdi and said with Oussam a smile memory in Marrakech City

Wonderful night and a beautiful welcome from the lovely Oussama
 And I will never forget manager mahdi  and said thanks so longue 
Marrakech is burning

Last night it was nice in so lounge 
the service was good by Mr. Oussama and Manager Mehdi&Said 
So the best Marrakech On fire
We had a great time, from the beginning, Abderhman‚Äôs service was excellent from beginning to end. Definitely would recommend.

The service was excellent, the food delicious and the atmosphere romantic and relaxing, with dim light and a warm atmosphere. The waiter was friendly and polite and made excellent recommendations. The food was varied and delicious, and I enjoyed every bite. It was an unforgettable culinary experience and I will return without hesitation.

review title: An ideal address for a special evening
review:
A real gourmet break at SO, where every detail is taken care of:
tasty dishes, elegant presentation, a cozy atmosphere and impeccable service.
Many thanks to Ayoub for his professionalism and kindness throughout the meal.
An address that I highly recommend for a quality culinary experience.

review title: Rachid is the best waiter ever!
review: My experience at So Lounge was incredible. Really nice atmosphere and the crispy sushi was delicious. Our waiter Rachid was sooo good. Very efficient and friendly. I broke my heel and told Rachid and he went to get superglue and fixed it for me. Lovely experience! Highly recommend! And if you get Rachid as your waiter count yourself incredibly lucky!

Very bad experience, racist staff, they called us dirty and monkey, violent, we are beaten (we are girls) because we have to refuse to pay a tip, juice and cocktails very expensive. 
Never again to flee!!!

The So Lounge Marrakech offers an elegant and refined setting where you can relax and enjoy professional service by M abderhmann and sufiyan and brahim and attentive. The attentive and smiling team takes care of every detail to ensure an exceptional experience, whether for an aperitif, a light dinner or just to spend a moment of calm in a luxurious environment.

I visited so lounge Marrakech with my family a very nice experience a professional service by M.abderhman and Brahim and go up I recommend this place a very interesting animation and very pleasant music I want to thank the managers of so lounge SAƒ∞D AND MEDHI for their welcome and kindness ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

I found a place with my family a lot of the ad With very interesting experience, very fast and professional service by abderrahman and brahim. I recommend to visit this place with your family waiters as brothers, thank you very much for your welcome and thank you very much for the officials due so M SAID And mehd
One of our favorite spots in town ‚Äî amazing drinks by the best mixologist, great music, and top service every time. Always a pleasure to come back!
Different tests and even finding: can see no alcohol, on the other hand, a lot of sugar. Level zero of mixology...
This place is amazing - super understated from the outside but the cocktails are world class. Such a fantastic hidden gem!

I'd heard about the Barom√®tre, Marrakech's first true mixology bar, when it was highly recommended in a podcast. We do like our cocktails and these were the most creative, inspired fun and delicious too. The Churchill is an amazing invention - how it was done, we've no idea.

We had tapas as well - and they were perfect and creatively displayed too.

The staff were friendly and efficient.

And the Ladies - well, I've never smiled so much when visiting a bathroom.

Thank you so much Barom√®tre for a fantastic experience.
Gorgeous cocktails, good atmosphere attention to detail cocktails made with a lot of effort would highly recommend the naughty tequila

Wow.  Right from the start this place has that wow factor, a real speakeasy bar.  Great fun.  Fabulous fun cocktails and amazing food.  All staff were engaging.  One of the best dirty vodka martinis ever.  Quiet mid week but recommend to book at weekends to avoid disappointment.  See you in September.
Very good atmosphere all the staf is great. One more star for the waitress who manages the room admirably. The doorman is also excellent. I recommend 100/100
Absolutely mind-blowing cocktails and decor! Great value too. Went worh a group of 11 and everyone was delighted. This is a can't miss destination in Marrakech!

A place of exception:
a quality welcome,
the cocktail dedicated to Churchill bluffing 
between a perfume and a cinematic image of this man, 
enormous creativity, the entries are perfect, playlist perfect, respectful customer atmosphere, 
and yes I can write it ‚Äòthe class‚Äô.  
It seems that this is a place that speaks so well of Morocco 2025.
Bravo and thank you.

How wonderful! From the moment you enter until you leave, you are very kindly spoken to and pampered. The food was great and the decoration incredibly atmospheric. If you like good food you really should go here!

review title: A must visit for delicious food and speciality cocktails
review: Hidden away this is a real gem of a restaurant. The best food we‚Äôve eaten in Morocco by far‚Ä¶. You must try the lemon pudding, I wanted to lick the plate clean. The staff were amazing, special shout out to Simo who helped to make my birthday extra special. The  cocktails tasted great, overall an exceptional experience.. Highly recommend a visit.

review title: You won‚Äôt be disappointed cool place !
review:
Just go and enjoy ,great fun great food amazing service. We did a selection of sharing plates and mains all beautiful . 
Brie & pear 
Steak and salsa Verdi 
Sardines 
All delicious

review title: A creative and inviting culinary and cock tailexperience in Marrakesh!
review:
If you're looking for an exceptional dining experience in a speakeasy atmosphere, look no further Barometre. Nestled just a short 10-minute taxi ride from the Medina.

The star of the show is the incredibly creative mixologist. With hundreds of bitters and blends at their disposal, the cocktail menu is a playground. Each drink is a masterpiece, not just in flavor but also in presentation. The artistry involved in crafting these cocktails is impressive.

My daughter and I started our meal with some delicious starters. The olive tree was colorful presentation, we paired with a rich beet hummus and a the avocado pellet salad. For our entr√©e, we chose the Asian beef, and it did not disappoint. The beef was flavorful, tender, and simply yummy. Each dish was beautifully presented, showcasing the chef‚Äôs creativity and attention to detail.  Service  was outstanding‚Äîour server was incredibly attentive and offered many great suggestions.
Great experience, from the tasty cocktails, mixologist , great food and service; frat vib, original and well worth a visit ü´∂

Restaurant to do 
Nice setting in a cellar
Cocktail at the top 
Much originality and research 
The service is really perfect: all very pro
The dishes are very good 
Mention for chimichuri beef and pastilla for incredible dessert!

This place is amazing. Such a relaxed atmosphere and every single member of staff is so friendly, attentive and professional- top notch service without being pretentious. The food is utterly delicious and the Moroccan wine was so good. The fact that one of the staff, then walked us home safely- thank you for everything!!!

review title: Transported to the heights of the medina and gastronomy.
review: My last visit was once again more exceptional than the others. we were a little afraid with our friends of the heat for lunch, but finally everything went well thanks to the Mist which refreshes much the ambient area. From reception to service everything was impeccable, you feel the 18 years of experience to make the customer travel. A good part of Moroccan cuisine is represented and fortunately there is also international cuisine which allowed my friends to change a little because they needed it, while staying in a beautiful setting reminiscent of the terraces of the Riads.

From the moment we walked in the service was positive and welcoming. It was 44 degrees, but with water vapour and a bit of a breeze - and the constant topping up of drinks with ice, we were comfortable. The music entertainment added to the atmosphere without being intrusive. . The food is beautifully presented - and whilst not cheap for Marrakech, ceratinly wasn't expensive. Particular thanks to our very attentive waiter,  Haben. So much better than the nearby Cafe Arabe, which we visted just before!

Great atmosphere we arrived in Marrakech for the first time we arrived late from the airport we had a great drink great atmosphere our holidays how there at that time we had not eaten we were offered excellent tapas

We ended up having and unexpected lunch here after we finished our sightseeing tour of the medina. View is nice. Service attentive but a bit overpriced when it comes to food and drinks. Barely seen any local. Just tourists.

review title: a magical moment in the heart of the medina
review:
What a beautiful discovery! The Terrace of Spices is a haven of peace above the bustle of the medina. The setting is beautiful, with breathtaking views of the rooftops of Marrakech and the Atlas Mountains in the distance. The atmosphere is both chic and casual, perfect for a family dinner

The service was impeccable: smiling, attentive and professional from start to finish. We tasted several revisited Moroccan dishes, all delicious and perfectly presented. Special mention for lamb tagine ‚Äî a real delight!

A big congratulations to the whole team for this beautiful experience. We will definitely return during our next stay in Marrakech!

Hidden Gems in middle of old Medina 
High level of service et very friendly management  keep it up  such a unique experience

Booked online for my birthday, the whole team was kind and caring for us...the excellent meal with sought after flavors, very good wine and the terrace is beautifully decorated, no sure view but so cozy...a top music band, could not be more romantic. My favorite place in the Medina, a security guard will accompany you to your Riad in the late evening, Bravo

I booked a table for me and my boyfriend at 18:30, with the intent of drinking something cool on a rooftop that has little and nothing, except the lack of the roof; we were the first customers to access and they made us sit in the center, between black walls and empty tables, despite the ‚Äúbest‚Äù tables were empty. We are provided with menus and we opted for a spritz and a beer (being 18:30), specific that we are Italian, drinks arrive and we are asked if we wanted food, but cordially we say no, having a dinner planned elsewhere; 30 minutes pass and again the waiter comes to urge us to take food, which honestly we do not want, he emphasizes, with an air of conceit and a smile on his face, that the consumption is mandatory; very irritated by the ways we take two tapas, once arrived, my boyfriend wanted to get up and leave, without consuming them, irritated by the behavior of the waiter who treated us like waste that could not afford to eat there and for the failure to communicate this 'obligatory expected consumption' but I urged him to stay; they were about to start the evening with the musician, but just finished the food we wanted to leave, we could not wait. In summary I can say that the waiters make an assessment of customers based on what they wear and treat them differently, the prices are high, exaggeratedly for the place where it is located (terrace with black walls, you can not see anything if they put you in the center) , the food is nothing big, all presentation and scene, common flavor, spritz stretched with water. I honestly advise against it, no plus points. I have to put a star on it, but it deserves zero.

Where to start...  Dinner one evening in June, with two, we think "The Terrace of Spices", it's famous, we should have a good evening...! Hop, I reserve, because the place is stormed so much it is THE PLACE TO BE! 
Arrived at 21:45 (only possible slot for reservation), the restaurant is half empty. Crazy. 
Very nice little live music. Friendly and welcoming staff. 
We are offered the map and LA: surprise!!! we are in Saint Tropez! Exorbitant prices! Well it must be really delicious, typical, authentic, who cares to pay for an amazing rooftop experience with a view (I'm still looking for it), right? 
The dishes are coming. Interest-free dishes. Tourist food! In a well-Europeanized place when we just want to be in Marrakech! Because restaurants like this, I have tons where I live. 
It annoys me that people are laughing! In Marrakech, we want softness, human warmth, we want the typical, we want the authentic, we want to forget that guineaty side that we see everywhere! 
Visitor advice: spend your money elsewhere.

review title: Just excellent. Best in the city
review: Never sure what to expect but this was just excellent in every way. Interesting menu and proof That you get what you pay for and to be fair you do pay quite a bit here. Service and food first class in every respect. The waiter had the measure of us and balanced humour with professionalism. Portions more than adequate. Long wine list (not so everywhere in Morocco of course). Interesting dishes on the extensive menu and caters for veg/gf etc. will be back

review title: Great service, cool ambience and fine food
review: A great location, live music, evening sun, fine food and nice service. We would go back there. Make sure to reserve in advance!

A very nice terrace, but with no great views around. Usually full, there is a need to reserve, has shifts, which implies terms to eat with some hurry to give room to the next.
Friendly and efficient staff, live music but international.
It‚Äôs a very nice place in the middle of the medina, but it‚Äôs more European than truly Moroccan, which doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs not a place to visit.
The food is good but I think the prices are too high and the wine is not even spoken.

We came in for lunch. The staff were friendly- no complaints there. We ordered 3 small starters, a bottle of sparkling water and two ice creams (two scoops each). It came out to $88. The food was good but nothing spectacular. I understand that catering to Western clientele, and paying for a nice (but not spectacular) view. If you don't mind overpaying - it is a good place. But you can get better food for a lot less.

food, excellent service --> recommended!
I ate dinner at the Terrasse des Spices one evening but and I am happy to recommend it! I started with very nice salads and really delicious olives (much better than many!) . John Dory and shrimp puff pastry with a saffron cream sauce was very good, good. I very much appreciated that the restaurant offers the possibility to be escorted, free of charge (tips are welcome) to its accommodation after dinner. Good evening.

review title: A Peaceful Culinary Escape in a Historic Riad
review:
Dining at Restaurant Dar Cherifa was a truly special experience. Set inside a beautifully restored 16th-century riad, the ambiance is serene, elegant, and full of charm. It's the kind of place that makes you slow down and soak in the beauty of Marrakech‚Äôs history and architecture.

The menu offers a refined take on traditional Moroccan dishes. We tried the chicken tagine with preserved lemon and olives, and it was absolutely delicious ‚Äî tender, flavorful, and beautifully presented. The desserts and fresh juices were also a highlight.

The staff were welcoming and professional, striking the perfect balance between attentive and discreet. Whether you're coming for lunch, dinner, or just tea under the lanterns, Dar Cherifa is a hidden gem you shouldn't miss.

Unique atmosphere in this typical Moroccan restaurant inside a Riad.
Attentive and kind service.
Authentic, good and hearty dishes.
The price is certainly higher than what you can find in other restaurants in Marrakech, but the atmosphere, service and quality of what you eat are worth every last Dirham.
Particularly the fact that you eat among the paintings of emerging Moroccan artists and that the same paintings, if you want, you can buy.
The architecture of this building is beautiful, the food was amazing, and staff very attentive. I would highly recommend it.
Had a great time, the cooking lesson was very informative and a lot of fun.  Special thanks to Abderrahim and Kawtar for being so gracious and welcoming!
Delicious food and relaxing environment, so much so that we had dinner twice in this Dar during our stay in Marrakech.

review title: Beautiful gastronomic experience in this beautiful Riad
review:
Beautiful Riad, unusual place in the center of the Medina. We were very well received in the middle of the afternoon, beautiful architecture all in height. 
We were delighted by the quality of the cuisine... the pastilla is top. An incredible dessert, with a perfect balance of spices and sweetness: eggplant crumble. 
I highly recommend

We booked it through our riad on the same day we visited the restaurant. Quiet place to enjoy food in a beautiful building - definitely worth visiting if you're an architecture lover. We were one of the last guests, so we ate peacefully, with delicious food. They have in the menu camel meatballs, which I haven't seen in many other restaurants.
A particularly beautiful, quiet place, with extremely friendly staff, with a very tasty local menu.Harder to find among the narrow streets of the old town, but worth the effort to find it.

review title: beautiful local experience at Dar Cherifa
review:
The welcome was incredibly warm! We were a group of 12 and a small corner had been specially arranged for us, which really made the moment pleasant. The dishes were in line with our expectations, delicious and well presented.

At the end of the meal, we unfortunately dropped a small exhibit on site, but the team showed patience and understanding, a real plus. Only small downside: the waiting time to get our change back was a bit long but we remain honest.

It remains a very nice place, typical, where you eat very well (not everyone liked the dessert but it was atypical a bit sweet). A local address that I recommend to live a beautiful Moroccan experience.
Restaurant located in the Medina in an old renovated riad typical Moroccan cuisine with typical Moroccan dishes fair price excellent quality very kind and helpful staff

review title: Excellent experience in Marrakech of Moroccan cuisine
review: Lovely and elegant location, very welcoming and helpful staff despite being late on booking. We enjoyed exceptional Moroccan cuisine and served with courtesy and kindness.
Wonderful! Excellent service, food, and overall experience. So friendly, caring, and attentive. I highly recommend it!

What a magical setting that mixes history and contemporary with these paintings on display.
The service is impeccable with great kindness and professionalism.
The dishes are well made and with a cuisine that has taste 
Thank you not to miss
Beautiful place. Too bad average service and especially not included in the note (marked nowhere ) as I notified us the waiter without smiling, so savory note to finish for an average meal

A unique experience begins the moment you search for the entrance to the restaurant. Entering through an unassuming door, you step into a true fairytale‚Äînot an artificial, touristy Disneyland, but a genuine gallery of art and architecture. It‚Äôs the perfect spot for a romantic dinner. And a brilliant introduction to Moroccan cuisine‚Äîthankfully, the well-curated menu is the best guide. Bravo!

The staff at this hotel are so attentive. All your requests and needs are met immediately. The rooms are large and decorated in authentic traditional Moroccan style. At first getting to your room is like being in a maze with so many courtyards and corridors but you soon find your way. Very private and no outside noise except you can hear the birds singing. The breakfast and afternoon tea are very refreshing. Two restaurants on site if you arrive jet lagged you don‚Äôt have to go out. All in all a wonderful experience and I would stay there again. Highly recommend this hotel.

Excellent location excellent staff turn to customers, especially Mr. Driss at the front desk. 
We had a great stay thanks to all of you

Very good workshop! We cooked 2 types DE sala DE Moroccans (taktouka and courgettes), a fish tagine, and an almond and orange blossom pastilla. Very good menu that shows the techniques to use to cook a Tajine. We learned a lot DE Moroccan cuisine (not just these dishes). DE addition, it is a wonderful human experience: Naila and Dada are incredibly kind. It‚Äôs a perfect course for all levels, then eating the final product in the beautiful dining room is a sublime experience.

We not only had a wonderful experience at your hotel but your city was amazing. The La Maison Arabe property is very lovely. The spa was under renovation but we had a beautiful experience nonetheless. Each room and nook were beautifully decorated all very traditional and welcoming. We loved wandering through on the way to the piano jazz bar. What an absolute treat to have such talented musicians every night !! The bartenders made exceptionally crafted drinks. We enjoyed many nights at the lounge. Also that cinnamon smell radiating when you walk in reception was yummy. The staff‚Ä¶
All the staff that we encounter were absolutely amazing. They went out of their way to make us feel welcomed and they were so very accommodating to our needs. They truly are the reason we would recommend the hotel and come back to stay. We truly feel they were exceptional. 
The cooking class was outstanding! 
The 3 hours flew by. We all agreed that the cooking experience was the best of all our activities that we scheduled for our entire stay. Walking distance from the markets and Bahia Palace as well as the Saadian Tombs

review title: Magical stay in this historic hotel.
review:
Incredible stay at the hotel. The grounds of this historic hotel can‚Äôt be matched. The staff is so incredibly warm, kind, and knowledgeable. They made my stay one I will remember forever. I traveled alone and felt safe and looked after by the hotel team every day. I will always come back here when I am in Marrakech. Beautiful city with beautiful people. 

If you want a magical visit, this hotel is the place to stay‚Ä¶

Chef Rachida and the sales manager explained the recipes well and it was very rewarding.
Thank you for the tea master DE ceremonies with his captivating explanations.

review title: Second visit to this wonderful hotel.
review:
La Maison Arabe is an excellent and peaceful hotel in a very good location for exploring the Medina and also further afield; we walked to the Jardin Majorelle and Gueliz in less than thirty minutes.
The hotel rooms and public spaces are beautifully decorated in traditional Moroccan style and everything is very clean and well maintained. 
The hotel's country club is a great facility just outside the city, great place to go in the afternoon heat to enjoy the pool and relax. 
The food is great, the breakfast buffet has a very wide choice and the restaurant in the evening has an excellent menu and very interesting wine list featuring mainly Moroccan wines, which we rate highly.  We also enjoyed the roof top bar for more casual dining. 
Although we find everything about this hotel to be excellent, the most impressive aspect of La Maison Arabe is definitely its staff. They could not be any more helpful or friendly, they are a real asset to the hotel.
This was our second visit to this wonderful hotel, and we will definitely return.

I can‚Äôt say enough about Maison Arabe. I have had the great fortune of traveling and it‚Äôs the most wonderful, magical place I‚Äôve ever stayed. The staff is exemplary!!! The food is amazing. My only disappointment is the pool was closed and we learned having dinner there is highly recommended. I can‚Äôt say enough about the staff! I felt like a princess. In fact, I get choked up thinking about how kind everyone was. A special thanks to Hakim, Redwane, the bar tender and another gentleman who also worked at the front desk. Everyone was special!! I hope to return one day!

We were very pleasantly surprised by La Maison Arabe, when booking we didn't study it much but the service was 5* from the moment we booked. The hotel refunded us for an extra day we accidentally booked which was very kind. They knew I'd recently been in a traffic accident in the UK so they organised a 4x4 car to pick us up from the airport for free. The team were highly professional and warm spirited throughout our stay. They helped us organise trips, taxis and offered daily advice. Our room was immaculate, opulent yet homely and felt luxurious. I've tried to recreate our stay at home by buying orange blossom essence, brass hooks and towel robes :)

The hotel has a jazz piano bar and lots of history too. I think Winston Churchill was a frequent visitor. 

As someone who cannot eat gluten or dairy I often find hotel breakfast difficult. However the food was great! I had almond milk in my coffee and plenty of options for food; omelette, fresh figs, fresh beetroot juice, savoury options, fruit, quinoa and more. 

At the time of visiting the pool was under construction so the hotel had an hourly shuttle which took us to their second private property which has a fabulous luxury outdoor pool set in hectors of gardens and in a beautiful setting. I would have liked to have known about this before arriving, but they certainly redeemed themselves. 

My only criticism was that one of the taxis they booked us during the week didn't have seatbelts, but perhaps they didn't know that when booking. And, that the fallback pool didn't serve alcohol like the hotel did. But the lunch we ordered was delicious. 

The hotel is very well located and we mostly walked everyday to our destinations. On arrival we booked a walking tour which was such a great idea as we saw so much of the local area and the guide over indexed on the arts which is our passion. 

I'd definitely return here again!

review title: Unforgettable getaway to the Arab House
review: In addition to being a mythical Palace, the welcome was perfect for all the staff with a welcome mocktail and every day a tea time/pastry served at 5pm in the patio and its fountain. Perfect room and bathroom with welcome bottle Cafe/the.
Wonderful stay .. Special thanks to Sanaa from the reservation service and to the kids club‚Äôs stuff ..words cannot describe my satisfaction üíêüíê

The Sofitel is a great hotel. The staff and service was great. The kitchen was excellent.

Ahmed was always very friendly and helpful.

review title: Magnificent Hotel 2 steps DE the Medina
review:
The Sofitel Marrakech is a magnificent hotel 2 steps DE the Medina.
We appreciated the personal and warm welcome of Amine, the Director DE Accommodation, upon arrival.
We were in an imperial suite, perfect for a family DE 4 people, overlooking the pools and the Atlas DE la Terrace. The suite is equipped with a large living room and a bedroom with double bed overlooking the terrace and a bedroom with 2 single beds, but the suite has only one bathroom DE, with bath and shower.
We liked the special attentions EN when we arrived in the room, attentions that were renewed every day during our stay to our delight.
The breakfast is very hearty with lots DE choices, EN savoury and sweet, very nice breakfast to have on the terrace even in 40¬∞ C.
The hotel has 3 outdoor swimming pools, 1 of which is reserved for Diamond and limitless Accor members, and an indoor pool in the SPA, which is free for Diamond and limitless members.
We enjoyed the entire stay of the infinity pool reserved for Accor members, quieter. We thank Ilham, Manager of the Darkum bar, and his team including Hassan and Abdelghani who were during our stay very attentive to our well-being at the pool.
In the evening, it is very nice DE have a drink at the So Lounge bar with DJ.
We would like to thank Ikram, Director of Operations, and all her teams for making us have a great time during our stay.

The orangery is an extraordinary restaurant with a warm and friendly atmosphere and the service at the top I highly recommend and Oumaima was very welcoming and I thank all the team and especially Mrs. Siham
One of the best experiences I've ever had, spectacular breakfast. We were served by Nacer, Chahira, Iwachian and Manar and all parts of the hotel have attentive, friendly and polite staff.

We had the best experience at Sofitel! The facilities and equipment were top-notch, Oumaima was incredibly nice and kind she made us feel genuinely welcomed. Radouan also treated us with such care. We felt so special the entire time. It was a warm and joyful night that we‚Äôll always remember.

Thank you to the whole Sofitel team we truly appreciated everything!

My forever favourite place to have fun with friends, and what makes it always better is the kindness of its staff, shoutouts to Oumaima for her warm hospitality and kind words, as well as my friend Redouan for his kindness, hospitality and friendly attitude.
If you want to have fun, cocktails and nice conversations this is THE PLACE.
Excellent dinner well set. The service exceeded expectations and they were very friendly. We came with DE wheelchair and provided us with food as much as possible. We would recommend.

Overall, the staff at Sofitel are incredible. They go out of their way to get to know you and make sure you are enjoying yourself from the moment you enter the lobby area. The day begins with brunch. Farah, Karim, Khalid, and Mustafa are just a few of the people who greet you with a smile and make sure you have a table and meal as you like it. The experiences at the pools were special, too. The staff is exceptional here and working in the hot sun did not prevent them from keeping us comfortable. Wassif and Abaayous (sp?) will provide you with water, towels, drinks, and snacks. Tip them well as they work hard! The dinner dining experience at the hotel's restaurant is lovely. I enjoyed sitting on the patio and listening to the band, a very talented group having the perfect set of songs while dining. The food is delicious and offers both Moroccan and French menus. The staff Wiaam, Kebir, and Hicham were always friendly and attentive to our needs.  And Hanane made an effort to remember exactly how I like my salad and make sure the chef prepared it my way! 
Other people at the hotel who frequently approached us to have casual conversation are Ilham and Chaimae. Thank you so much! We will be back!

Welcome, meals and perfect service! Hichem and Oumayma (as well as the whole team present) really have a gift for receiving. 
We had a great dinner not to mention the setting!

review title: Very nice fusion cuisine in Marrakech
review:
Discovered by chance, we enjoyed the cuisine offered by this restaurant, fusion of different gastronomic cultures African, Caribbean, Moroccan and more. Served in pretty dishes.
Our 2 teenagers - 14 and 11 - also liked it very much. 
Very nice staff 
A very pleasant terrace on the 3rd floor overlooking the medina, with backdrop the Koutoubia.
Friendly and helpful staff to advise you. Very nice location and food of excellent quality and variety. Unfortunately it is not possible to pay by credit card but we highly recommend it!

A must at every visit to Marrakech!
The view is absolutely beautiful, especially at sunset, it is magical. The dishes are delicious, always well presented and full of flavors. The staff is attentive without being invasive, we feel really welcome. Frankly, it‚Äôs a successful 200%, and besides, the value for money is excellent. Not to be missed!

Lovely spot and great food - highly recommend 
Interesting fusion food to mix things up in Morocco especially loved the desert!

We thought we'd try this restaurant after reading the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were blown away by the amazing food and friendly service.
The restaurant is on the main street Riad Zitoun el Jadid, leading to the main square. We were staying nearby so it was an easy walk. 
My daughter ordered the Maffe Beouf which she said was really tender and lean, there was a peanut sauce underneath and it was served with rice. I had the Yassa Poulet which although I'm not mad about chicken on the bone, was so tender it literally fell apart. The onions were very sweet and absolutely delicious. They don't serve alcohol but my daughter said banana smoothie was one of the best she'd ever had, I had lemon schwepps. We ordered a bottle of water then two coffees and shared an enormous slice of gooey chocolate brownie which was absolute heaven. The atmosphere was chilled with some great music playing in the background and the young serving staff were friendly and attentive. We thoroughly enjoyed our meal and wish we'd had time to visit again, all the above came to about ¬£42.00 worth every penny.

I found it difficult to book dinner.
Unfortunately no one answers the phone for 2 days, I find it abnormal.

A nice friendly establishment. The staff were attentive, the food was exactly as described and very tasty. The prices were fair.
It‚Äôs a ‚Äúcash only‚Äù restaurant so make sure you have enough.

Great place with good views and the RFISSA BERBERE was excellent 
Friendly staff 
Great place to eat and rest after a long walk by Marrakech
The place and the food was amazing ! We had the pastels-saga, braaibroodjie and yassa poulet. All well served and delicious! If we come back to Marrakech, we will repeat for sure !
Great. Fantastic service and amazing food. The best in Marrakech. Really recommend especially the Kenyan Red Curry..

I went with my partner to dinner, we ordered the camel burger, the rice with chicken curry and the chicken msemen and the three courses were 10, if I had to keep one it would certainly be the rice. 
Generous size, fair price and good treatment and atmosphere, after 8 days in Marrakech we can say that it is the best restaurant we have tried here
We are vegetarian and the food was very tasty. Loved the homemade chips and vegan salads. Warm atmosphere and service excellent.

review title: Gentle music, lovely staff, wonderful food - especially if you need variety in your cuisine!
review:
We spotted this place on our wanders through the souks and were intrigued by the fusion African theme / cuisine. Went back the next day and had a lovely, relaxed lunch and great chat with the staff. 

The drinks (Pinneable and Ginger + Avo smoothie) were wonderful. The 
Pastels-saga and Mafe Boeuf were delicious and we tried the Bissap (hibiscus juice) which was lovely! 

We liked some of their tableware and they told us where to find it and the kind of price range and we managed to acquire a selection to take home!

review title: Delicious food, cosi place and super kind staff!
review:
Delicious food (and generous portions) that changes from moroccan cuisine, 
super nice staff (they made us try their ¬´ bissap ¬ª because we didn‚Äôt know it and where so kind to give us a doggybag with our leftovers),
really beautiful place (we stayed inside because we were cold, but there is also a very nice rooftop),
I would definitely recommend this place !

review title: A little expensive compared to the quantity
review:
Very Good quality but few quantities on plates.
You have to add vegetables and more chicken to the yassi chicken, like Berber Seffa.

We dined twice in this beautiful restaurant. The decor is worthy of a thousand and one nights and the food excellent!
Special mention for Anas, our waiter with little care.
We recommend the superb couscous!
Best restaurant in Marrakech .  We will be back just for this place. Nashville  to morocco  just worth for a great clever meal and perfect service.0

Very nice location, very welcoming staff, excellent dishes suggested by the manager
Super recommended

review title: Beautiful Moroccan cuisine in a traditional setting
review:
We had a great time, we have already come to dinner several times in this restaurant.
Beautiful setting, staff with little care explanations of dishes and superb cuisine, it is a treat.( Moroccan cuisine)
A fairly complete wine list 
You'd think you'd have a high bill, not even.
We even made a New Year's Eve 2 years ago it was a superb moment the whole family enjoyed.
A serious restaurant

A magical setting and a service with little care.
The restaurant‚Äôs menu is short but allows you to find its happiness between traditional local cuisine and French cuisine 
The dishes are well made , the flavors and the cookings at the top. 
Everything is delicious and we let ourselves be taken by the musical atmosphere for a journey at the same time taste , auditory and visual.

A sumptuous and magical place where all the typical Moroccan arts are gathered.... is added to this a very good table that serves you a fair and delicious cuisine.... We made the choice of couscous lamb as a main course...a treat knowing that we are demanding on the subject...beautiful discovery!

Nice courteous staff, nice atmosphere and great value!
Food was also very good. Highly recommended.

Beautiful place. 
We feasted on the dishes served which were exquisitely fine. With delicate attention 
But also and above all our butler and the waiters were very kind, 
I highly recommend this place

review title: Calm and voluptuous, know-how and know-how.
review: In a very nice setting we were able to make an excellent dinner with very kind and attentive service. The couscous was delicious...

An excellent place to discover traditional Moroccan cuisine served by Anas the restaurant manager.
A cuisine prepared with exceptional quality ingredients....
Beautiful decor!
A warm team that takes care of customers with attention and a smile.
We enjoyed couscous lamb, St Pierre, Moroccan salads!
An address of excellence!

High quality catering, "palace" service, typical setting and worthy of a palate of 1001 nights.
To be tested for adoption.
Only regret to have discovered this nugget our last night in Marakech.
The whole family, big and small, Moroccan or Western cuisine, has been won over.
Kitchen to fall on the floor! Professionalism and kindness of service to blush! Decor and room atmosphere to make you travel! In summary 100% successful go there with your eyes closed!!!
We enjoyed the entire restaurant to ourselves one evening in December. Food was delicious and very reasonably priced and the staff were wonderful. We even enjoyed live instrumentation.

review title: Believe the reviews. This is an excellent place to dine.
review: A stunning venue that is a sensory experience for the eyes as well as the tastebuds! Exceptional, timely and friendly service, complemented the delicious food. A good range to suit all tastes and wonderful, free extras that make the experience very good value for money. Well worth the visit!

Beautifully decorated restaurant in the Hivernage area of Marrakesh. Fully tiled walls with Moroccan mosaics.
The food is well presented and service impeccable and prompt. One of the few restaurants with wine on the menu.
It was all very good, the guy who manages the orders was very nice. We ordered a chicken Kabab and a tagine
Amazing food, best spring rolls we have ever had! All the staff were so lovely and friendly. We would recommend to everyone! Great spot
Eaten some amazing falafel and excellent lamb tajine. Lovely staff. Great price 18‚Ç¨ for 2 people.

Passage tasting of Marrakesh. We chose Corner Cafe for lunch break. The most artistic avocado salad I have ever eaten! Very nice place. Very kind manager and excellent kitchen girls. A must for the Medina of Marrakesh
Lunch in Marrakech with family: nice location, small place but very nice. Great local food and very nice manager. Try it!

Small and cozy place with some table in the street. Great reception of the host who has always proved helpful. Moroccan food slightly revisited by the great flavor .. as the environment. Price slightly more than the other places in its fascia..ma highly recommended. Bravo to the manager

5 star from here.
Delicious food cozy atmosphere and 
Good service. Good restaurant for children family. 
It can definitely be recommended.

I had already eaten here in 2018 and as my habit, when the restaurants surprise me, I get my business card. I'm back in Marrakech and I came back here to eat and found it on my business card. The food is very good and presented very well. The staff were very kind.

Lovely casual cafe on a shady alley in the Medina in Marrakech. Small, informal. Very friendly, very welcoming - the service really stood out. The hospitality was warm and authentic. And the food was delicious too! A great place to sit outside and people-watch and take a break and eat good food.

Superb discovery of this small restaurant. We appreciated the quality of the meal and the kindness of the waiter and cooks.... They cooked us a small custom meal üòâ Frankly I recommend this place! Clean, cute, excellent meal.
Thank you for everything!

review title: Oasis of serenity in the alleys of the Medina
review: We stopped by Corner Caf√® by chance and were pleasantly surprised. The restaurant is small and secluded and despite being in the middle of the alleys of the Medina, it is like a small oasis of peace and tranquility. We ate very well, it has typical Moroccan dishes and also other small delicacies (we recommend falafel, a real treat). The owner is exquisitely kind and nice. Highly recommended!

review title: If you come to Morocco come here 100/100 recommended
review:
Super friendly owner very friendly. Super good customer service 
Super-tasty food.

Super recommended 10000

Come here for sure

review title: Wish we found this place sooner!
review:
Such a great place!!!! We went there on the last night of our trip, with only 300 dh left to our names (not exaggerating). The service was absolutely amazing- the servers were sooooooo kind and attentive!!! They made the atmosphere really welcoming. 
We had a delicious starter and two lovely tagines for 250 dh-  then some free tea afterwards. Definitely, definitely recommend. :)

Very good close to the square. Entry by chance and very pleasant surprise. Very good local cuisine and tea offered at the end of the meal.  We have a view of the kitchen which is very clean.  I recommend...

Charming place, delicious cuisine (chicken kebab and the divine Moroccan), the staff is very welcoming and invites us to the heart of its culture. 
I highly recommend it.

Again at Nomad, we are loyal to this restaurant where we are never disappointed.
EN viro DE la scientifique, the staff will do their utmost to ensure that you are not too exposed to the sun. The map is always well realized and the view always beautiful. We love this place which we highly recommend.

review title: Friendly rooftop restaurant with disappointing food
review: Sunset dinner , Polite and friendly staff comfortable seating area on the terrace with partial views over the market square below but mostly roof tops were the only good things about this restaurant. We ate zucchini fritters  and beetroot and goats cheese salad to start which were edible but uninspired and for mains the worst marinated grilled chicken we had in a long time, dry  tough and tasteless. The accompanying roasted carrots were nice as were the French beans . There was no sauce and overall a very boring dish poorly executed. We didn‚Äôt stay for dessert. 82 euro including water and a couple of non alcoholic beers each , there must be a lot better than this in Marrakech.

The worst restaurant experience in Marrakech 
A burger for almost 20 euros with industrial bread and 3 potatoes fighting in a duel , a lentil salad without taste or seasoning and dry bread, not fresh 
FUYEZ!!!!

The place is great for its area in the square , the terrace very well to have a nice time, but when they put the water through your nose and charge you at 4 ‚Ç¨ it starts to anger you, we order dinner for 3, 90 ‚Ç¨, the menu with little variety, we order burger 17 ‚Ç¨, simple without extra ingredients, total disappointment, and chicken with white curries, meaning chicken with cream and green beans, we did not understand, in short do not go, there are better and much cheaper places

review title: Great food - Great location - Great service
review: The rooftop terrace is lovely and music and ambiance are great. Amazing sunset views and nice breeze. Food is ok, nothing special..not worth the price for us but Location and service were excellent so that was worth it. We are vegetarian and both the 2 vegetarians mains weren't available. We ended up ordering the 4 vegetarian appetizers which were good but 3 of them were salads so all kind of the same. A shame as I was looking forward to the cauliflower but it wasn't available. It was very busy so definitely a popular spot,  we just got a bit unlucky with the unavailable dishes.

review title: Cozy rooftop with great food, but could be better
review:
Professional welcome , magical place, clean , dishes dosed with great finesse, we feasted with a fish tagine and a crisp monkfish with a sauce that the taste buds remember! 
Excellent desserts. 
A very pleasant moment

Had the most wonderful meal in the roof terrace. Food was outstanding, great recommendations from the waiting staff, and they were so helpful and attentive. If you want to have a wonderful Moroccan meal in a beautiful location, Nomad is the place to go
We sat on the rooftop, which was packed and was cozy. Friendly service and friendly staff. Food was tasty but there are better options to be found in Marrakech.
Great staff. Fantastic location in the medina. We sat on rooftop which had views of the city and sunset. Food was really good. Well worth the visit

Beautiful place for dinner. 
We had the monkfish (which was amazing. The sauce was to die for! My partner thought it was the best dish of the holiday). 
We also had the curried chicken which was tasty. 
Overall the staff were lovely and we had a great dinner. 
We found the seating to be a little tight however with it being very busy

We stopped in because the sorbet sounded really good. Turns out, it was amazing! It comes with two scoops. We ordered the same two scoops, Berber tea, and raspberry Moroccan rose. While we both loved both flavors, my wife preferred the Berber tea. Meanwhile, I absolutely loved the raspberry Moroccan rose. We are returning tomorrow!

I wouldn‚Äôt come back, as there is a lot of dining in Marrakech at much lower prices. They didn‚Äôt have several of the dishes on the menu, already not too long. On the upside, the food was good and the place is nice.
A nice and beautifully decorated rooftop, modern cuisine, high prices compared to other restaurants of the same "standing"

Nice dinner with friends. 
The kitchen is good. Prices are a bit high especially with the 9% service charge. 
The sunset is beautiful!

Stop for lunch by the way. 
Very nice terrace on the roofs of the medina and from where you can see the mountain. 
Proposal of inventive and beautiful dishes. Particularly good fruit cocktails. And all with a smile.

The restaurant on DE ground floor is beautiful with all DE plants. Because of this the roof terrace is actually a bit disappointing but it is still ok. 
However, the food was quite disappointing. 
Staff was ok.

Why not have lunch in the shade DE the vegetation! Well in this restaurant "Le jardin" it is possible under a lemon or fig tree, the place is beautiful! 
We are not surprised when we know that this establishment belongs to the DADA group (nomadic, spice coffee etc...). The cuisine is tasty and the calm DE the place is interesting. Braised tomato soup, garden grilla DES, couscous, zucchini fritters, fresh cucumber cheese are extraordinary. I recommend this cocoon!
The garden is a green oasis in the city. The food was not bad, but not super either. Our company generally found it too cold and a little under-seasoned.

‚ù§Ô∏è 
Staff with little care, intimate setting very well with family.
The best harness of my life! Grill plate very good.

Very nice setting but tourist factory. Unpleasant young staff, high rates, price of service to add on the final note.
Pretty disappointed, I'm not coming back.

A really cool (literally and figuratively!) place for lunch. Menu was a great blend of traditional Moroccan and European cuisine. Gorgeous mocktails and beautiful decor. It was busy but service friendly and effective.

review title: Very nice and cheap place - GO
review: Very nice rooftop overlooking the market and the other roofs. The staff is super friendly. The food is very good quality and everything is very cheap.

We were a group of 12 who enjoyed lunch downstairs in the garden area.  Staff were friendly and knowledgeable and everyone enjoyed the delicious food.  The setting is calm and peaceful after the buzz of the souk just outside the entrance.  Prices were reasonable and portions adequate.
Our only complaint was the booking process (usually necessary for a downstairs table, although you can walk in for the upper levels which are just as pretty when we ate there last year).  Having to send a bank transfer as deposit was a costly endeavour for us (as we dont have paypal) and we felt other options like giving credit card details should have been adequate like many other cities accept.
However, on the day, it was an enjoyable experience and I would recommend it while in Marrakech.
A cool oasis in the middle of the Medina! We stayed for lunch, varied and delicious food, rabbit at all! average price
We were on the rooftop. Very very hot... disappointed by our meal, composed of patatas bravas (not bad) but the plate of grills was very dry.

review title: Great place for lunch or dinner
review: Very good food and service, great place to have lunch with very fair prices, highly recommended! We went twice, we recommend the octopus

Restaurant very touristic... it took battle to have our table we had booked online, but apparently they do not take into account these reservations...Hospitable staff, especially Maryam who is adorable! 
For the setting, I would say very green, but not at all soothing since we were treated to the work with the jackhammers right next door. And also the music is too loud... At the level of dishes, we really liked the different flavors.
Bad food, really rude staff. Despite the booking they made us wait more than an hour, passing people without reservations. To be in Marrakech is also a very expensive restaurant

Excellent welcome... nice relaxed atmosphere.... cuisine with excellent flavors... tajine and delicious couscous 
And especially a service in kindness and smiles of Hasnaa that allowed us to savor even more this moment

review title: Service to review and fresh juice to improve
review:
We had lunch in the garden for the second time and were disappointed by the service on a part that was a bit long 
Fresh juices are not good and not fresh enough!
You can do better...,
The place remains beautiful and the dishes good and correct in price.
In the end we wanted to pay in euros and a young girl refused 50 euro notes because supposedly damaged... in short elsewhere we did not have this problem!!!!

review title: Nice Atmosphere and Solid Fine Dining Value
Beautiful setting, very good restaurant north of the Medina
The place is closed! But how? We have booked!
A magical corner in Marrakech with delicious dishes, warm treatment and an atmosphere that invites you to stay. To repeat.
ATTENTION! The rest is even if you pay by card
Bad service, menu that lies and sketchy payment. Do Not Go Here.
Unforgettable honeymoon with great food and amazing staff!
review:
We had a fantastic honeymoon here. If you're looking for an all-inclusive right in the middle of a city, this is the place to go. You'll be pampered by all the staff, fun activities are organized, the food is amazing, and the staff are incredibly friendly.

And if you want the best cocktails, make sure to visit Hamza and Abderahmane. Wow, such great guys and their cocktails are truly the best in the resort!

Thank you to everyone at TUI Medina Gardens for an unforgettable week.

review title: Shocking decline in the space of 12 months
review:
We came back to Medina gardens for the second year in a row, having had such an amazing time last year. The 2 experiences couldn‚Äôt have been further apart. 

The air conditioning in the room was all but useless, even after having it on all night the temperate was still 21-22 degrees, with 40 degree plus heat outside it was extremely uncomfortable and difficult to sleep. We spoke to reception, someone came to clean the filter, which was absolutely filthy, but it made no difference. 

We purchased day beds so we could have some shade. On the Sunday, the beds by the main pool were all booked so we booked a bed by the relax pool. When we got to the bed, not only was it completely broken but there were no cushions on it. The bed was broken in the middle so both sides tilted towards the middle, the back section was completely broken off so we had nothing to lean up against. When we spoke to the lifeguard and asked for some cushions, he told us they were in the laundry. 

Upon check out we told the receptionist we didn‚Äôt use the bed on Sunday and asked them to remove it. I then had to wait over 30 mins on our last day for the manager to seek out the lifeguard and ask him. She then came back and told me they could not remove it from my charge as we didn‚Äôt let them know on the day and that it had already been charged to my room. We had booked a bed for the final day, so I asked if that could be refunded, the manager agreed, I paid the bill. 

Twenty minutes later the same manager came out to the pool to our bed and told me we had to pay for the bed! I refused. 

Service in the main restaurant was slow and poor, as was the food. 

We paid for a jacuzzi for our balcony; hardly any of the jets worked, the plastic surround was tatty and dirty, we only used it once. 

The WiFi was shocking. At least 50% of our stay we had none. It kept going in and out which was frustrating when you‚Äôre trying to listen to music or an audiobook by the pool. 

The resort wreaks of cost cutting and is no longer a premium facility. 

The only positive was the service of the guys making cocktails in ‚Äòthe bar‚Äô they were brilliant, so friendly and excellent service. 

Needless to say we will not be returning next year.

Third time here but first time during Summer as usually come for New Year's Eve. Staff are friendly and helpful. They really do want you to enjoy your time. Food is excellent with great selection and very fresh. I did email hotel 3 times over a 4 month period before arriving in order to request room upgrade but never had response. Our room experience has got worse each time we come here.  Another thing to note is we asked for late check out and paid for this but was only given one option till 6pm. When looking on app we saw we could have checked out 2 hours earlier (which fitted with our flight) and it would have been cheaper. We did tell reception and they apologised. Entertainment staff seem to be enjoying themselves but could have done more to involve people during Entertainment nights. We feel this was much better at new year.  There is unfortunately the same age old issue of the reserving sunbeds at crack of dawn which is a pain and have seen this done so much better at other hotels with app reservations etc. The one morning that the sunbed policy was followed through was much better to avoid the sunbed hoggers who leave the towel and disappear back to bed etc.  Overall this is a beautiful hotel with very hard working friendly staff and we will most likely return again in the future.

Just back from our fourth stay here and it just gets better each year. 
Hotel is in a perfect position for exploring the souks and riads and a very short taxi ride to some of Marrakech‚Äôs best spots such as plus61 restaurant or Al Fassia Aguedal. 

We knew that there had been a change of manager this year and with that some staff changes, so wondered if it would have the same family ran feeling, but there were no issues at all. In fact the whole team were incredible. 
From Chef Said and his hard working squad delivering amazing quality hotel food (wait til you see the desserts!) to Aazzedine and Fatima ü•∞ looking after us superbly. They have all been here years now and are an example to all in terms of service, politeness and friendliness. 
I swam every morning and called in to the restaurant for a coffee before going back to the room and the daily greeting from Abdullah is worth coming back here alone. Top top guy. 
Moroccan hospitality takes some beating, and this goes for outside of the hotel environment too, but if this hotel lacks in any 5star refinery then it‚Äôs made up for in spades by the people. 
From the warm welcome by Abir, Chawki and the management team after a late arrival, to the great service by the pool bar squad including Abdulwahid and Reda, topped off by the best bar staff in the city in Ahmed, Mohamed and Omar. 
There have been changes to the nightly entertainment, not something we‚Äôre huge on, but definitely better, and overall lots of little improvements around the whole hotel which are noticeable. There are even a peacock and hen wandering the superbly kept gardens now, which is a strange sight at first but really adds to the character of the place. 
Padel courts, a heated quiet pool for laps and a great gym keeps you in cake credit (you‚Äôll need it), but if you just want to come away to switch off, enjoy some glorious uninterrupted sunshine with only a 15 minute airport transfer then this is the spot. ( RAK airport was great this year too, so it looks like they have addressed the queuing complaints)
There are so many amazing places to visit in the city and using Medina Gardens as a base is perfect. 
Trips to the secret garden, El Fenn, Kabana, Nobu are all within walking distance and Majorelle area with shops and museums is a 5 minute taxi trip.
