Just beware of using InDrive as an uber alternative. Some of the drivers are lunatics! Better to pay the local taxis a bit more for a safer, more enjoyable trip. 
Not sure there‚Äôs much more to add and sorry if I‚Äôve missed anyone out but I‚Äôm really struggling to think of anything negative to say. 
I miss lazing in the pool with the city sounds and the call to prayer floating over the garden walls. 
My wife and I will definitely be returning a fifth time.

This hotel is serene relaxing and stress free with immaculate grounds comfortable and clean rooms and beautiful sunshine. The hotel is in a great location to explore Marrakech.
My husband and I have recently returned from our third visit to Medina Gardens and it continues to amaze me how in the middle of a city the beautiful gardens and the hotel are so peaceful and relaxing. Both pools are of a temperature that you can get straight in and swim and are of a size that they do not get overcrowded.
The restaurant serves a variety of different foods and they are not the same every night as there are different themes.  The head chef Said serves up delectable delights every night and would give Gordon Ramsey a run for his money.
All the staff are amazing and cannot do enough for you to make your stay memorable.  The pool bar staff led by Mustafa and assisted by cheeky boy Reda, Bada and Omar are contantly walking around the hotel grounds with drinks for the guests and they also remember your favourite tipple.  The restaurant servers Fatima and Armin are quick to fill your drinks glass and clear your table and are friendly polite and professional and nothing is too much trouble for them. Abdula the restaurant cleaner is constantly on the go keeping the restaurant clean and hygeinic.  The restaurant manager Chawki who is new to the hotel and had only joined the staff 2 days before we arrived goes above and beyond with his excellent hospitality. The reception I only visited to change currency and the staff member Moad was extreamly helpful and engaging.
The Tui rep Zenib is very knowledly if you have any questions about places to visit and she does not just sell trips if they are not  suitable and she is always on site at the time her notice states.  And last but not least the owner of the hotel Hassan who also comes on site most days and speaks to the quests to make sure eveything is going well.  The hotel has 24 hour security and the head guard Hassan keeps everyone safe.
I have travelled to many countries and only once in Thailand returned to the same hotel, but for a short flight, a beautiful hotel and grounds, relaxation, excellent food, amazing staff this for me is a hotel I can visit time and time again. We will be back for a forth visit

review title: Good Stay At TUI BLUE Medina Gardens
review:
My wife & I have just returned from a two week stay at TUI BLUE Medina Gardens. Flying time was three hours five minutes from Bristol and Transfer time to the hotel was twenty minutes or so. We arrived at 21:30 but the restaurant remained open for our evening meal. During check-in you are fitted with your AI wristband.
 
We booked a jacuzzi room and were shown to room 2004.  The bed was large and comfortable - air conditioning worked well and was not noisy. Sleep quality was good although we heard loud music 01:20 one morning but didn't know the source.  Room servicing by the household staff was excellent!    I requested extra coat hangers via the Tui blue app - you can make maintenance and housekeeping requests via the app.
 
Wi-Fi - this was free and good within the hotel buildings but was patchy in the garden area.

Money exchange - change your GB pounds to Dirams in reception - we got and exchange rate of 11.8 to the pound. Don't take Dirams home - it's a closed currency. There is a charity box at the airport .

Pools - we used the quiet pool or the surrounding garden area during our our stay as the main pool was loud and busy.  Reserving of sunbeds is supposed to be against the rules but everyone did it.   Depth was 1.5M all areas .Get pool towels from the towel hut with your blue card.  Towels can be well used but are okay.

There is no drinks service at the quiet pool - you need to walk to the main pool bar for drinks or coffee. Nearest toilets were behind the Culinarium restaurant.

Food - we booked one evening meal at the Culinarium via the Tui Blue App - It wouldn't let us book again during our second week as it says one booking only via the app. We found the Culinarium okay but didn't worry about visiting again as we thought the main restaurant was much better for variety. We didn't use the Culinarium lunchtime for the same reason.

The Restaurant is the main place we ate all our meals - Breakfast was very good for choice with live cooking stations for eggs / omelettes etc. Staff were quick to serve Tea or coffee and clearing the used plates . Juices and various fruits available.

Evening meals at The Restaurant are themed - International , Moroccan,  Indian and seafood to name a few. No dress code is in operation here. Choices again are wide and varied. Fish was always available usually at the live cooking stations- The tagines were always worth a look as they contained meats , fish or vegetables cooked with preserved lemons.   Staff serving wines and water were prompt to ask you what you wanted to drink - All the wines including red, rose ,white and Prosecco were very drinkable.  Bottled or draught beer was good too. There was live music, violin and Moroccan, here some evenings too which was nice to listen to as you ate your meal.

Bar - the main bar and the Piano bar are nice and air conditioned, ( lovely when outside it was 40 degrees) although the piano person only appeared a couple of times a week we really enjoyed listening to him .  Service was good here as were the gin & tonics. AI Cocktails are available - the Pina coladas were very nice.

Entertainment - some nights a quiz or musical bingo was available at 21:00 before the main show at 21:45 in the fountain bar. These acts were mostly good. Bar service was ok. Shows include Moroccan show, live music or live act with belly dancers with fire!

Tours - we booked the 09:30 half day historical tour costing approx ¬£30 each - this included a guide and coach - we visited the mosque you see and hear from the hotel (not inside) - we were then taken to the rear of our hotel (dropped behind the wall at the back of the Padel court to continue on foot)  We then walked through the arch across the road to enter the souks (no stopping to look at the stalls)  to visit  Medersa Ben Youssef Marrakech, a historic Islamic school located in the heart of Marrakech and the Bahia Palace. We walked 5.1 miles in total in the heat of Marrakech, so would not recommend if you have mobility issues.  The coach returned us at 12:30 approx - value 5/10.

Checkout - our hotel pick-up was 17:35  - we asked for a late checkout and this was granted at no cost.  

 There are tip boxes in in reception to tip the various departments.
 
We enjoyed our stay at TUI BLUE Medina Gardens and would recommend it as a destination for your stay.

I hope you find my review helpful!

This hotel is one of the best hotels I have stayed in. If you're looking for a relaxing stress free holiday this is the hotel for you.
Rooms- Very comfortable beds and all the essentials you need. Cleanliness is excellent.

Gardens/Pools- Perfect. There is something for everyone. Busy main pool but still relaxing. Private and relaxing garden spaces to sunbathe in and a lovely relax pool. The hotel was full capacity and there are no sunbed wars unless you specifically want a certain bed, however that is your choice and there are always plenty of beds available in the beautiful garden areas which I preferred as they had natural shade under the lovely garden trees. 

Restaurant- Could not have asked for more. The main buffet restaurant (the only one we use on our 4nts stay) was faultless. The food was varied and very tasty. Plenty of choice for everyone. What I appreciated the most though after staying in numerous AI hotels is that this one did not have the over busy canteen feel, it is an oasis of relaxation. I can not explain enough how relaxing meal times was at this hotel compared to other AI hotels I have stayed in.

Staff- Amazing!! All of them. I can not name just one, they were all as friendly and helpful as each other and this is the first time I have experienced this in a hotel. They are so helpful and always have a smile on their face despite how busy. They work long hours in high heat and I never heard anyone complain. They are a true credit to this hotel. 

Gardens- Beautiful. The resident cats I loved (as a cat lover) to fellow cat lovers that have stayed here mum cat is doing well and her kittens, saw the staff feed them and they truly do look after the animals there which I appreciated.

Entertainment- The usual AI entertainment which was pretty good. The Moroccan night was a highlight.

Spa- A friend and myself visited and the massage was amazing. The price is very reasonable and the staff were so friendly and accommodating. I would highly recommend a visit.

If you stay here you will not be disappointed. Proximity to Marrakesh is perfect. The staff are all amazing and friendly. Not once did I feel the need to tip all the time, it mode no difference to the experience I received and in turn I made sure that I tipped well in the very convenient tip box for all staff in the reception area. This made the whole tipping process so much more easier and relaxing and to be honest all hotels should adopt this practice, as I am sure people tip much better this was if they do not feel harassed to do so. Please if you stay here tip generously at the end of your stay using this method as all the staff here deserve praise.

I stayed here with friends but will definitely be back soon with my husband who will absolutely love this hotel.

A charming and serene spot hidden within the hustle of Marrakech. The garden is beautifully maintained with vibrant colors and traditional decor. A great place to relax and take in the atmosphere. Perfect for photos and a short break from the busy souks.

review title: The best holiday for Peace & Tranquility
review:
Very quick through airport & leaving on the bus within 30 mins, very impressed with this hotel as soon as we walked in, we were led to seats with mint tea offered before being given our room allocation.
The restaurant was left open for us to eat which was lovely after all the travelling 

On our first night we initially had problems with the air conditioning not working, it took 3 phone calls and 2 visits to reception and nothing was sorted. We spent our first full morning trying to sort it out & It took me eventually going to our tui rep who immediately jumped in and offered another room which we accepted, they were amazing both Abir & Zineb very patient with us. It wasn't fun having to repack and move everything but we were so grateful in having air conditioning the rest of the week.
The hotel is absolutely stunning, we loved the gardens and spent most of our time there as it was slightly cooler that the main pool but we used both pools for swimming, no problems getting a sunbed at any time of day. 

Wifi very good - usually get an esim but wasn't needed this time
We ate every day at the restaurant, food was nice and a good variety, our waiter yasine was very efficient and friendly, we really enjoyed getting to know him over the course of the week and nothing was too much trouble for him. 

We dont drink alcohol but soft drinks all from a bottle and quite lukewarm, a pump tap would've been much better for both staff and guests but we did get ice cold still & sparkling water from the machine. 

We did some of the classes with Laura, she is wonderful really put us at ease and was great with the classes. We had no plans to go to the medina square as we were honestly really anxious about it, she really encouraged us to go even just to walk around and gave us lots of tips and we ended up going, she needs a medal for that üòÇ
We also had a lovely massage, absolutely incredible experience.
Overall this place is all about peace and tranquility with still lots going on, I've never been to the same place twice but I will definitely be returning here and recommending to other friends.
Best holiday I've ever had ‚ù§Ô∏è 

Some niggly bits 
The partition wall between the bedroom & shower needs more privacy, for those staying who are not couples it can be a bit awkward having to undress to get in the shower.
Needs more hooks in the room as there was absolutely nowhere to hang any towels or anything.
Mealtimes constantly having to ask for bowls and spoons as they are not on the table
Shower tray needs some antislip on the gloss white tray so slippery

review title: Some like it HOT! Moroccan magic...
review:
Probably best to start with what's great about this characterful place:
- general vibe. Chilled, no pressure to do anything. If you want/need a place to just 'splat' then you got it. Hearing the daily calls to prayer from within the hotel was fascinating and reminded you where you were -  in the heart of a bustling North African city which is right on your doorstep if you want to explore
- mostly extremely pleasant, friendly staff who clearly work very hard and put in the hours to look after both the customers and the hotel itself. The gardens are lovely with real points of interest and the pool is clean and well kept. 
- the food is great, and I like that if you want 'UK' food (which you really shouldn't whilst here) it's lunchtimes only for chips! 
What could be better...:
- Rooms are a bit tired. Hit with the smell of stale cigarette smoke upon entry. And bits just periodically fell off during our stay - the patio lock, the door lock, the shaving mirror landing in my hand. Our shower door didn't work properly and the handle was covered in limescale. The safe deciding it wasn't letting us in. Minor gripes but expected a bit better. Also, unless you're with your true love, there's not much in the way of privacy with the bathroom being quite exposed to the bedroom area. Towels could do with a refresh, as well, they were quite rough and threadbare. 
- The bar service overall was pretty good, if you're not in a hurry. But the inconsistency in what you asked for (unless it was wine or beer), was quite dramatic. Some times mindblowingly strong cocktails and others had us questioning if there was any alcohol in them. And the pool bar staff were almost mute in their interactions - at least with me. To be fair, I think I'd be a bit naffed off if all carbonated drinks had to be served from plastic or glass bottles and not on tap. Come on TUI, this is a busy hotel, you can't expect staff to serve drinks like they're at a kids' party! Same for the restaurant area. The poor servers have tiny little workstations - no wonder there were a few spectacular crash/tinkles.
Overall, however, it's a lovely hotel, with some fun - but not too full on - entertainment, and quiet spots for those that want it. Add on the Lionesses winning whilst we were there which turned the Fountain Bar into an impromptu jamboree venue and would I recommend this place to friends and family? Yes!

The hotel was reasonable albeit a little out of the way of the main area. 
We had half board. This was disappointing as all the food looked great but was tepid at best. It would have been so much better scoring if there had been hot food. 
The Christmas Eve banquet meal was an added bonus and this was a special occasion but again the food was on the cooler side of my taste. 
Room was clean enough once the dust storm had been cleaned up.

Arrived at this hotel with my friends  and they were totally impressed with everything about  it immaculate rooms the whole place is so clean. Great breakfast lunch and choices during the evening ‚Ä¶.the staff are all very friendly helpful location is within walking distance to the beach front  a lovely quiet clean friendly hotel My friends  all 6 said they will return to the Hotel Timoulay. You won‚Äôt be disappointed..Thank you all staff you made our stay comfortable and enjoyable.

review title: Relaxing Hotel, Wonderful Staff & Great For Beach Holiday!
review:
My husband & I were pleasantly surprised by Timoulay Hotel & Spa. 

From the moment we stepped through the doors, the staff were friendly & easy to talk to, the atmosphere felt warm, relaxing and inviting. 

The rooms were spacious, clean and smelled gorgeous. We had a lovely view overlooking the pool, the sea and Oufella Kasbah mountain side on the 3rd floor. 

We loved that the hotel wasn't too big, so it was lovely to see other guests daily to build a rapport and chat with them. 

All staff, including the cleaning staff, were friendly and professional. One day, the cleaning staff set up an outfit for me on my bed with a face made from grass and flowers!  My husband & I thought it was a charming, creative and funny touch to add to our holiday.

The food selection at breakfast was great and tasted delicious; it set us up for the day. We also loved the lunch and dinner options. 

It was within easy walking distance to the beach - around 5 minutes. A bit further from the city and some other attractions, however, a taxi ride was both easy and quick. 

Easy to set up tours if you need to do so through the brilliant hotel rep. 

We did the camel ride, city tour & quad bikes - all were brilliant tours. 

My husband & I would come back to the Timoulay Hotel, Agadir, and recommend it to others.

Thank you, Timoulay staff, for such a pleasant and wonderful stay!ü•∞

review title: Great Hotel - Great Location - Everything you need
review:
From arriving to departing nothing is too much trouble.

Arrival and check in was super simple - We arrived early before the room was ready we were checked in and offered a drink in the bar where a no pressure excursion guy came to show us what trips we could book and what‚Äôs around the area, no pressure at all to book any just really useful information‚Ä¶ we were given a map with key bits of info should we need them.

Outside the hotel there is always the small orange taxis waiting to take you wherever you want to go.

The location is ok the end of the main promenade up a very slight hill, we walked from the hotel to the very end of the opposite side where the marina is we stopped for a drink half way but was a beautiful flat walk once on the promenade. For the less mobile the taxis are very very cheap.

Hotel 
VERY VERY CLEAN
Breakfast was nice, look outside for the snack hut they serve omelette, fried eggs and waffles on some days‚Ä¶ delish 

We were on B&B ate once at the restaurant for dinner as a buffet style for a set price was ok 

Snack bar open throughout the day serving pizza burgers salads etc, breaks the day up to take shade from the sun for a snack 

Pool 
Pool guys work hard to keep the pool super clean and ensure that everyone has a bed and brolly if you want it, we never had any issue getting a bed and never saw any towels laying about without people on them which makes a refreshing change!  

Rooms
Ours was massive, pool
Facing  large bed and great shower

Would I stay here again if in Morocco? 
Wouldn‚Äôt stay anywhere else now‚Ä¶‚Ä¶so yes yes yes!

The best hotel! Staff were very nice. The rooms where very clean. The 4 lovely ladies at the spa where so good, me and my sister enjoyed the hammam and spa. The best massage we had. I will deffo book this hotel again.

Just returned from a 14 night stay at Timoulay Hotel and Spa and I have to say it is a fantastic hotel. On arrival we were greated at the entrance by security who took our suitcases and directed us to the reception desk, check in was quick and easy. We were shown to our room which was on the third floor,  it was very spacious with a HUGE bed, plenty of storage, a smart TV, spotlessly clean throughput and a balcony with a pool view and a glorious view of Agadir. We had opted for bed and breakfast, which was a buffet with plenty of choices, hot and cold options, was always fresh and a great variety of options. There are plenty of loungers round the pool and again everything was super clean. You dont need to take beach towels to the pool as the hotel provides guests with towels, just ask at reception. The bar is well stocked and food can be ordered too.  Located about a 8-10 minutes walk from the beach and about the same to the nearest restaurants and shops. There's also a ship at reception selling everything from postcards and souvenirs to crisps and chocolate. I know I've said it previously but this hotel is spotlessly clean, our room was tidied and fresh towels supplied EVERY day. All the staff from the doorman to the receptionist, cleaners and waiters were super friendly and helpful.  There is WIFI throughout hotel but if the signal in your room isn't great, the hotel can provide you with an additional router! Also use of the safe and Aircon is included!! Honestly just such a great service all round. We had a fantastic time staying at this hotel. There is only one negative and that's the hotel next door. Hotel Borjs, it has a rooftop bar, which has very loud music pretty much every night of the week and it does go on till about 1am, but if you close your balcony doors it does reduce the noise to a level that allows you to get to sleep. This would not stop us going back, we loved our stay, the hotel, the staff, the food, the high level of service and the cleanliness of the hotel were all top quality.

review title: A little oasis for relaxing and chilling by the pool lazy days and relaxed evenings this is a must go to destination
review: This is possibly the cleanest hotel we have ever stayed in and the staff can‚Äôt do enough for you friendly and welcoming from the moment we arrived till the time we checked out. Highly recommend staying here. Food was excellent and the drinks selection is varied with cocktails and mocktails. Can‚Äôt speak highly enough of this place

My wife and I stayed here for a week in May and we can honestly say that it was a wonderful place. All staff, from the security guards to bar/waiting staff, cleaners just everybody really couldn't be more helpful, polite and caring.
Located just 5 minutes from the beach, the hotel is medium sized, which makes it more personal and pleasant, with great facilities.
The food served was of good quality and plentiful. The outside spaces and pool were spotless and well looked after.
I would highly recommend this hotel and we will book here again.

review title: A lovely quiet hotel with friendly staff.
review:
A gorgeous hotel with friendly staff who will do whatever they can to help and accommodate you. The rooms were big and spacious. 

The pool was checked daily by the lifeguard who took great care in keeping it clean and up to standard. The reception staff were friendly and helpful aswell as the security team which were very welcoming. 

The hotel was lovely and quiet which was very peaceful and made the holiday really enjoyable. It is quite a walk from the main section of agadir beach - possibly 45-60 minutes so something to bare in mind however we walked half way down the beach in 20 minutes to some lovely restaurants and also into agadir bay which had lots of food options also.

Excellent weekend as usual. Super friendly and professional staff.
Very good quality cooking and excellent sleep quality.
Very successful renovation. I wish you every success.
I'll be back soon.

We are here as family of four - 2 teenagers. Having read the reviews prior to arriving, I was concerned about what we might find. Some of these concerns have been experienced - Allegro is very tired. It needs a total renovation. After the first night, I requested a room change. We were originally given two rooms in block 2 that looked out onto a building site. The two rooms we are in now have garden views and a nice terrace. That said, the rooms are very basic and really quite shabby. Stained, old furniture, the curtains are appalling, those in our children‚Äôs room are covered in dirt. There is a stale damp smell in both rooms, worse in our children‚Äôs room. The towels are thread bare - feels like you‚Äôre drying yourself with a Weetabix. The cleaning staff are lovely and do a good job. 
Our children are enjoying the pool area and we haven‚Äôt experienced the Bravo team being too pushy or over zealous. The entertainment is very family friendly and nice to see people having fun. 
I mainly use the beach during the day. It is a gorgeous stretch of sand and lovely to see so many Moroccan families enjoying it. Some of the sunbed covers are filthy. It‚Äôs a real shame because basic cleaning would address this. 
Although I have been very disappointed with just how basic the hotel is, the staff are great. Very helpful and polite. The dining hall is excellent. The food is varied and very tasty. You would have to be very fussy not to find something you liked! 
The gardens are the stand out of the entire hotel. If the rooms and sunbeds were as clean and pristine as the gardens , the Allegro would be fantastic. Although we are having a good time in Morocco, I couldn‚Äôt recommend the hotel. If you don‚Äôt look too closely, you can just about get over your disappointment!
July holidays in Agadir! The hotel is quite nice and the staff is more than welcoming and hard working!  I would repeat again.
Amazing time in Allegro Agadir. The hotel is very well kept and run. Although a bit old, the experience has been more than positive.  I highly recommend it!

Good points, great location, bar and reception staff so friendly and helpful. The gardens are beautiful with tortoises walking round and a hawk comes every morning to scare seagulls.
The food is nice and always plenty of choice.
The rooms are disappointing and very basic, The first room was dirty, stained furniture ripped curtain had had a water leak so wallpaper was peeling off and smelled damp. The bathroom door wouldnt close as it was swollen with water damage. 
Second room was better but the cleaning was minimal our floor was never swept or mopped. Bedding was not changed in 10 days just flipped and rotated even though we requested a change. The bedding doesn‚Äôt fit the size of the beds we had 2 single matress protectors laid across which moved were very uncomfortable. 
Towels are taken early and not returned till late afternoon.
The patio door kept coming off the track and had to be repaired. There was a leak outside in the corridor which ran under our door smelled awful. 
The poor area is dirty and tiles are broken and uneven.  
Evening entertainment is basic, kareoke, white party, Moroccan night which is repeated so if you saw it week one it‚Äôs the same week two. Theres usually only one bar open at a time it‚Äôs very difficult to find a seat, bars are over crowded.
I was most annoyed when I returned from check out to find animation team standing over my teenagers pressuring them to leave good reviews. He told them what to say and gave examples he wanted to take a photo of their phone when they had done it! 
Any good reviews about amazing entertainment team are written by staff! 
Not worth 4 stars in my opinion.

review title: Awful experience will not recommend this hotel to anyone.
review:
Dumped at the gates not shown where to go. 1 out of 4 people on reception seem to know what they‚Äôre doing. No information given about times for meals etc. Room basic with the view of a public path that was constantly noisy 24/7. Food was repeated no variety, poor food hygiene, lady cooking flatbreads was actually scratching her ear and face whilst cooking. Kids allowed to help themselves with their hands and then chuck it back if they don‚Äôt want it. I was ill for 4 days and am sure it was food related. Doctor was called for me. 
Staff really do not seem to want to be there. The towels are collected from your room early and not returned until the afternoon (never stayed in a hotel where they‚Äôve done that before). 
Hats off to the entertainment team they do try and try and try but please shut up!! 
Never recommending this hotel to anyone

If you are coming to the Allegro, im sure you will have a nice time! However, ¬£20 deposit per beach towel, if you dont drink alcahol or fizzy drinks, take a kettle! There is no pure juice, only children's squash. Mostly the bottles of water are not chilled (funny, beer is always cold), you will not get a cup of coffee/ tea in the day unless you walk across the gardens into the main building and up 2 flights of stairs, thats how far it was from our room. There is coffee at breakfast in the dining room, but that's the only time. Otherwise, it's across the gardens into the building and up 2 flights of stairs. There is also huge confusion if there are 4 people in the room (family room). 2 adult beds and a pull out sofa with 1 pillow and 1 single quilt! 3 towel, not 4, 3 glasses in the bathroom, not 4, always 3 toilet rolls which you have to be careful, if your not, wash your hands thoroughly and hope that you managed to get 1 of the 3 hand towels! As i write my review from my bed, im hoping someone from the hotel might again bring an extra bath towel as I've just dried my body and hair on a hand towel so now there is only 1 of those left.
Surely,  it makes sense. we've paid for 4 people. Why do we not have the basic things we need?
Staying in the hotel for 2 weeks. Thx for welcoming thx for all the staff in the hotel they all friendly and helpful. Holiday worth money.

Worst holiday we have ever had, it's not relaxing what so ever, the rave music starts at 10am, stops for lunch then stars again until about 5pm, you can not escape it, we tried the private beach to get away, it was ok but sun beds had seen better days and mattress if you could one were dirty as hell, the food was normally cold, very repetitive, no flavour. The entertainment team are relentless in bothering you, when you politely to leave us alone when we are trying to chill out in the evening they say what's rong with us, when we explain again just here to chill out they don't stop, I wasn't as polite again.

So why is there so many good reviews, well if you like your tattoos, like going on the P at 10am, like filling your plate more than once then this is the place for you, forgot to mention the entertainment crew try to get hold of your phone to right there own reviews. I would never visit this hotel or tbh Morocco again.

review title: Great hotel to stay at while visiting Agadir for the first time. Would definitely recommend.
review: The staff were very friendly and helpful throughout my stay here. They have very nice rooms which are very spacious and a wide variety of food with different types of cuisines each night, I really enjoyed my stay here

Staff is very friendly and always engaging with us, food was delicious and overall Id 100% recommend. Hoping to be back soonü•≥ 
Farah was especially amazing and she should get a raise!üòÇüòÇ

Had a lovely holiday with my family. The staff were so friendly and accommodating. The cleaners did a brilliant job especially Fatima who made our room so clean and decorated it with rose petals and I got a lovely decoration for my birthday. The hotel is a great location close to the beach and lots to do. The entertainment team work hard just not much variety in their shows each night.

review title: First time in Morocco and Iberostar
review:
This was our first time in Morocco and with Iberostar. Everything is completely honest about our time there. 

room: The rooms are exactly like the photos and very large. Our room was cleaned every day to a high standard. The room has a mini fridge that is empty on arrival, a water carafe to fill at the water coolers, and a safe if you decide to pay for this. The bathroom contains shampoo, conditioner, and shower gel that are on the wall in the shower. There is hand soap and body lotion by the bathroom sink. I used these for the week as I am not that picky and found them good enough. If you need them refilled, simply take them off the wall and leave on the bathroom counter. They are a squeeze from the sides, not pushdown. There was no air conditioning when we were there last week as it is their winter, but it was still plenty warm in the rooms and you will more than likely need to leave the balcony door open during the late evening/morning to cool the room down.

staff: The staff are all very friendly, helpful, and cannot do more for you if they tried. If you need anything, just ask and they will do their best to comply to your request. Special shout out to Sa'id in the bar, I shall miss his 'sante!' There are plenty of security staff around the complex so felt very safe. They are good at their job as we didn't have bracelets (reception forgot to give us them) so we were approached about this. Quickly rectified. 

food: There is plenty to choose from even for the pickiest person. Morning involves many different pastries (i.e. croissants, pain au chocolate etc), cereals (corn flake type, cocoa pops, granola etc), yoghurts, fresh fruit, fresh fruit juice, dried fruit, nuts/seeds, bread/rolls, continental meats and cheeses, egg and omelet station, baked beans, mini continental sausages, bacon, large continental type sausages, toastie making station.  There are also a lot of batter type products such as pancakes, crepes etc.  Lunch consists of burgers, chips, toasties, tagines, rice/noodle, pizza, various different meat options, salads, meat/cheeses, fish, chicken, and pastas. The snack bar has the burgers, pizzas, chips, salads, and a few other things if you don't want to go up to the main restaurant. In the evening, similar to lunch, but more options. Some dishes are the same for lunch or dinner, and they can be the same most days. However, a lot of dishes change at the same time. So you might find something you really enjoy and it is always there (chickpeas, onions, raisins, yummy!), and some things you really enjoy may change. Regardless, if you are a typical Brit and don't like to try new things you will be fine and if you like to try new things you will always find new things at each meal to do so. Puddings are also plentiful and varied, and I would recommend the handmade Moroccan donuts which appear at breakfast and during  snack time at the snack bar. There is also plenty of fresh fruit as well at the pudding station. 

The a la carte restaurant is nothing to write home about. You have more choice in the main restaurant. We were expecting different dishes than what you can get in the main restaurant, but this was not the case. If you skip, you're not missing anything and we heard a lot of people the following evening walking out to go to the main restaurant. 

Drinks: If you have the Iberostar app, you will find all the drinks and the drinks menu on this. The menu does not tell you the ingredients for non alcoholic drinks so you will need to ask about this if you are interested in one in particular (recommend San Francisco). If you are looking for something in particular that is not on the menu, I am sure the bartender will make that for you so just ask. The non brand measures are very generous. There is self serve draft beer (5.25%), wines, fizzy drinks, and water at the snack bar, and numerous ones within the main restaurant. There are water coolers on each landing to fill your room water carafe or a refillable bottle if you have brought with you.

entertainment: The team are very hard working, and put on numerous shows and the sports. All very friendly, and I saw many of them taking time out to sit and speak to various guests. We did not partake in the evening events, but everyone that was taking part seemed to enjoy these

Areas for growth
-as someone that has allergies, the additional signs that others have managed to get the hotel to put up was helpful. However, there is no allergy information on the signs apart from the name of the dish. I managed to eat a few mouthfuls of things due to this issue and luckily I do not suffer anaphylaxis, but anaphylactoid so taking antihistamines was helpful. The only place I saw allergen information was in the Moroccan restaurant. This is an area that the hotel can easily remedy by putting allergen symbols on the signs as this will help keep those with allergies safe.
-as someone that has worked in restaurants for a number of years, we were never allowed to wear our aprons etc when going to the loo. I noticed staff going to the loos with their aprons on. This is quite unhygienic, and very easily remedied by enforcing that aprons etc are not worn to the loo. Disposable gloves were still being worn when going to the loo as well. 
-a smoking and non smoking section would be useful, or having all guests that smoke go down to the grounds rather than on the balcony? As non smokers we were constantly being chocked by smoke from smokers that sat near us when on the large balcony. No issue with people smoking, but it would be useful for those that don't smoke to have a section where smoke is greatly reduced. 

General useful information
-the back gate closes at 1am so you will need to use the front gate from that point forward
-the library is located in an alcove behind the ATM in the reception area ( left of the main entrance if coming in to the hotel)
-the petit train appears to come by anywhere between quarter past and half past the hour based on the times I have seen it pass
-rooms ending in an odd number face the back of the hotel (on the left side of the building if coming into the hotel at least).
-As others have mentioned the doors do not close particularly quietly, so be prepared to possibly be woken up by those coming back to their room late
-rooms  located  at the ends of the halls, near the water coolers that are on the landings can be very noisy due to folks coming back to their room and forgetting this area echoes. Be prepared to be woken up due to other guests not being particularly considerate to those that might be sleeping. During our stay, we did not get one full night sleep due to this and the door mechanisms as our room was right beside the landing. 
-when you leave you cannot exchange your money back within the hotel, you will need to do this at the airport. You will need to do this landside as soon as you get to the airport as there is no exchange airside. However, some of the businesses will take your MAD. 
-departure lounge is on the bottom floor on the opposite side of the Moroccan restaurant or just around the corner from the small shops. Plenty of toilets, showers, and a large changing area. There is no shampoo etc or towels so you will need to ask for towels at the reception or use your beach towel before returning, and your own shampoo. 
-Make sure you have a bracelet when you check in otherwise the security staff will stop you. 
-A few evenings a week, there is a few stalls one is jewelry which all looked very nice, and the other is argan oil and soaps etc. 
-There are two outside pools larger one is unheated, the smaller one is heated. 
-there is a list of excursions that you should receive upon arrival. Totally recommend Crocopark even if you don't have children, the guide we had was amazing. We worked out that the price to go there including tickets was cheaper via the rep than trying to get a taxi and pay for tickets. 
-We were told that a taxi to the Souk would cost 30MAD, it probably actually costs about 20, but we always ended up paying 25. 
-plenty of sun loungers still available mid afternoon. There is no need to put towels down, but people kept doing so. 
-Watch out for seagulls, as we were nearly hit twice with their mess

General impression is that this is a good hotel, plentiful food and drinks, and well worth going to particularly for winter sun.

Stayed for 4 nights in room 3140 (pool and partial sea view) thoroughly enjoyed our stay. First impressions, the hotel was extremely clean and the all the staff were very welcoming, courteous and polite. The food was very nice and there was a large variety of cuisine to cater for all tastes. The pools were great and the hotel is located right on the beach with its own private designated area. There is a fantastic promenade which stretches out making for a beautiful relaxing walk. The Moroccan people are extremely warm, hospitable and welcoming. 

This was our second visit to Agadir but we will definitely recommend it and will be coming back. Highly recommend the Spa service at the hotel, Layla was amazing, she arranged for me a  wonderful spa package, It was a real authentic Moroccan spa experience with highly professional staff. Excellent hotel.

Staying here now ..clean .friendly .Staff can't do enough for you .Food choice is amazing   even had king prawns  and oysters on the menu last night .Entertainment team work all day and night  .overall from the minute we checked in its been amazing and don't want to go home  .would 100% return and recommend  to anyone

review title: Title: Honest Review ‚Äì Family of 3 JUST returned Aug25
review:
I‚Äôm one of those people who reads a selection of reviews before booking so not to over whelm but to grab a feel of the place, after all you cant please everyone right? ‚Äì and I have to say, this time the internet didn‚Äôt lie. Everything I read before we came turned out to be pretty much spot on. We came as a family of three ‚Äì two adults and a 14-year-old ‚Äì for a week of sun, to tick another country off the bucket list, experience the culture and relax.

The Wins
Room Sweet Room: 
Big as per what we read, cleaned every day, but with d√©cor that could tell a few stories from the 90s. Still, plenty of space for us and our stuff (big wardrobes ladies, few shelves for the men), so no complaints there.

Staff Gold Stars: Honestly, the staff were lovely ‚Äì friendly, helpful, and the bar crew even remembered our drinks. Makes you feel a bit like royalty‚Ä¶ or at least a regular.

Drinks with a Generous Hand: Local spirits poured like they actually wanted you to taste them (cheers to that). The ros√© from the pool bar was better than in the main restaurant if you like a blush rather than dark and dry; beer quality depended on the pump, but when it was good, it was good.

Food for Days: I‚Äôm gluten-free and survived perfectly well ‚Äì no fancy labelled section, but I found plenty: meats, fish, veg, salads, local dishes, if you know what you CAN eat (which you should do) then you will be fine. 
For breakfasts that ranged from eggs and yoghurt, fruit and VEG (yeah you read that right) to pancakes and continental bits. 
For the rest of the family, meal times consisted of ‚Äì pizza, pasta, chips, and more carbs than you could wave a breadstick at. 

Spa for the Brave: I treated myself to a 2-hour hammam and massage for ¬£25 JET2 recommended. Glorious. Just‚Ä¶ maybe don‚Äôt book if you‚Äôre shy ‚Äì let‚Äôs just say it‚Äôs authentic.

Beach Space: Yes, it was busy, but it‚Äôs big enough to cope, plus there‚Äôs a roped-off section of loungers for hotel guests.

Kid Security: Under-16s can‚Äôt leave the resort without an adult ‚Äì our 14-year-old was politely stopped at the gate when we tested it. Thumbs up for safety.

The ‚ÄúHmm‚Ä¶‚Äù List
Cutlery Roulette: Some of the plates and glasses came straight from the dishwasher but hadn‚Äôt been checked, so food still stuck on there and you‚Äôd occasionally get a whiff from a glass that made you swap it quick.

Not-So-Scenic Surroundings: Out of the gate, the area‚Äôs a mix ‚Äì some clean spots, but also run-down streets, half-built buildings, rubble, and no pavements in places. We walked to the marina most nights, along the seafront which was well kept and pretty (about 50 minutes at a wander) just for something to do. There‚Äôs a Zara, a sports shop, a few restaurants‚Ä¶ and that‚Äôs about it.

Beach Cleanliness: Big enough to find your own patch, but don‚Äôt expect pristine sands ‚Äì cigarette butts and the odd bit of litter around.

Cockroach Cameos: We saw a few. It‚Äôs abroad ‚Äì you deal with it.

Toilet Tales: Main area loos were dated. Constantly cleaned, but still didn‚Äôt feel it.

Bits & Bobs
Local tax was about ¬£20 for the week.

Weather:
Bizarre is the only word for it. Mornings were cloudy, cool, or muggy ‚Äì proper ‚Äúis it even worth putting sun cream on?‚Äù weather ‚Äì right up until about 1pm. Then, like someone flicked a giant switch, the clouds would vanish, the sky would turn postcard-blue, and the heat would crank up to a scorching 35¬∞C. Strange, but we made it work: mornings were for activities and exploring, and by the time we got back to the hotel, the sun was blazing, and we could relax by the pool with our son.

Sunbed Situation:
No gladiator-style ‚Äúsunbed wars‚Äù here, thank goodness. You can claim your lounger whenever you fancy ‚Äì early or late ‚Äì and it won‚Äôt be moved. One tip though: if you grab an umbrella, put it up. Leave it closed and the pool attendants will whisk it away to someone else. And if you arrive later in the day and can‚Äôt find a bed, just ask the attendants ‚Äì they‚Äôll rustle one up for you.

D√©cor overall is dated but tidy.

Went to the market ‚Äì Jet2 rep told us to haggle, but most stallholders weren‚Äôt in the mood.

Taxis are everywhere ‚Äì haggle and you‚Äôll rarely pay over ¬£4 a ride. Hotel taxis cost a little more.

Everything‚Äôs walkable ‚Äì the longest you‚Äôd need to go is about 6km.

Entertainment‚Äôs light in the morning, picks up around 3pm by the pool, and evenings always had something going (theme nights, games, music).

Stray dogs are about (tagged, harmless if you leave them be).

Final Word:
If you need gleaming cutlery, picture-perfect beaches, and endless nightlife, you might be disappointed. But if you want friendly staff, easy food and drink, and a holiday where you can relax without much fuss, this place delivers ‚Äì quirks and all. We had a great week, and most of the reviews I read before coming were bang on.

We just got back from stay at the Iberostar Waves Founty Beach. So first of all everything was smooth riding. We were welcomed in given biscuits and tea and met by the lovely entertainment team, they asked my name and everyone remembered it for the 10 days we were there!  We had a lovely ground floor pool view which was super handy. 
Food - there is plenty of choice a bit repetative but always plenty to choose from. The donuts at 4pm were ok bit stodgy for me but very very popular and the kids didnt miss a day! The deserts were lovely and again plenty to try. 
Beach - the sand is lovely and sea is warm and pleasent. The only problem we found is that the locals leave the beach really messy which ruined it! There is a closed off part for the hotel which is clean though but you are surrounded by locals, its quiter further down!   
Pool - the pool is a bit dated my kids and many others found it fun counting the loose tiles off the bottom of the pool. One pool is much deeper and was much quieter. 
Staff - they were nothing but amazing! Every single one works extremely hard and are so friendly and kind. 
Trips - we did a few, we went quad biking and in my sons words "was the best thing ever" please note children need to be 16 to drive their own but did let my tall 13 year old daughter drive half way through which she was grateful for. We also booked through a website to go horse riding which was ok but it was in a very random place. Still the kids enjoyed it. 
The hotel over all was extremely clean and well looked after. My only concern was on our last morning we were woken by water pouring through the ceiling and the ceiling slow collapsing! 7am and i was running to the front desk. Someone did come quickly but looked and walked away. Thankfully was our final day and it didnt hurt anyone. 

We had a wonderful time and was worth every penny thank you!

review title: Fantastic First time to Agardir and Iberostar
review:
As a family of 5 this was our first time in Agadir and stating at a Iberostar resort.

We had 2 rooms, sea view. When we arrived we were given mint tea and some lovely biscuits while we filled in some forms. The rooms were ready before the checkin time, clean, and more than adequate for us and view of the ocean was fantastic. There is 1 buffet area which has a huge range of foods, from Moroccon dishes, pizzas, pastas, and the kids favourite - chicken and chips - although the chicken nuggets were a bit tough some days.

It's rare to see all members of the staff do their job with such passion. Always with a smile and willingness to help. From the checkin team, bar staff, cleaners, waiters and especially the entertainment - everyone was amazing and friendly.

We had such a great time, booked some excusions to see the city, a jeep tour (recommended) and paradise valley. All the tourist guides were also amazing, engaging and full of information.

Morocco, Agadir and Iberostar have given us wonderful memories as a family. Thank you to everyone there!

stayed DE (11 or 18 / 7) my 2nd time here at this hotel; very big change since the last time "good and and horrible".
the room ''3014'' overlooking the pool is very clean and the maid is always there in time to do it again; enough relax at the pool not like the last time you have to be there at 6:00 to reserve a place 
restaurant varies with an option DE Moroccan restaurant and fish restaurant in the evening 
receptionists welcome the room was handed over to us at 2:30 p.m. 
and there the black point DE the hotel the animators rather say amateurs: DE children who turn to young girls who only scream, self-defeat all day without a manager to control them , no activities for adults without talking of the evening commits giving the presentation to people who speak neither French nor English correctly it is really horrible it was bad in the ear , fortunately my children had a good time especially the gran DE 12 years with a host DE maxi club on the other hand with the little ones he had DE girls I don't know they are there for what if their manager is present we see them work but the day DE are off it is of anything children that runs away , the phones , head in the sky .
really to review the changes that will hurt a lot.

Lovely hotel. Excellent staff. Good location. Wine wasn't good and drinks were weak but the food was  excellent. We stayed for a week. The entertainment staff were great but the nightly dancers got a little boring. It would have been good to see an outside act. We loved the holidays song dances and we all joined in the party vibe. We would love to return and would recommend. Great quality for the price paid. All the Moroccan people we  met on our trip were lovely and it felt safe as a female

Wonderful stay at the Iberostar Founty Beach with KAPPA.Thank you to the entire KAPPA team for your welcome, your kindness, your advice, your friendliness. 

Thank you to the entire Founty Beach management team and all the staff for your welcome and dedication.

We will come back and advise the hotel. Another big THANK YOU to all 

Stayed from 24 to 31 July 2025 hp 1266

review title: Poor 1st impression and definitely not for those with mobility issues.
review: Arrived and although not expecting welcome drinks would have been nice to have been shown a sign or be given information on how to get a cold drink.  Check in wasn't the quickest. Surprised there are no wristbands for guests as this must be s security issue. No information provided about activities or booking the  restaurant.  The rooms in this hotel are located in apartment style blocks spread out some distance away from the main restaurant, bars pool etc. It is a long uphill walk and then two flights of stairs to get to rooms. No lifts. Once there you are greeted by an empty mini bar and no kettle or tea facilities. One bottle of warm water on the table. There is no customer relations manager. Walked into the main restaurant, no meet and greet and no information on how to get drinks. Really regret choosing this hotel.  I would imagine the mobility issue would also be difficult for those with pushchairs.

An amazing family trip.  No wonder voted number 1 by Trip advisor.

Very spacious hotel and despite being full no stress for a sun bed.

It got busy at dinner but there were other dining areas opened, peak season so to be expected.

A wonderful atmosphere and food and staff amazing.  The evening was entertainment was the best I have seen over many years, well done to the entire crew.

We stayed in Block A which is the furthest away from the beach but there is a shuttle golf cart.  We walked every day so we could eat more! :)

Hotel has everything and nothing too much trouble.

We did three trips via our tour operator but we note Robinsons also offer trips.

100% we love the Robinson brand and will look at other destinations.

A great family stay and a message to all please go outside the hotel and enjoy the culture.

Well done Robinsons!

The holiday at Robinson Agadir exceeded my expectations. The rooms, as well as the room service were great, the food was also great. Although the facility is large, ES offers many employment opportunities: Numerous sports facilities, pools and a beautiful beach with sunbeds and hammocks available. My personal highlight was the entertainment staff, especially Rachid. Thanks to employees like him, there was always a good mood and ES never got boring. You can tell that he loves his job and always makes sure that guests feel comfortable.

We came from a lovely hotel in Taghazout and were hoping the last leg of our Agadir trip would be great‚Ä¶it was üòé. Although Robinsons is a big hotel it is spread out and has gorgeous gardens, banana trees, a rose garden , aloe Vera , hibiscus flowers ‚Ä¶..and is right at the end of the stretch of beach flanked by sand dunes which means it is in a quieter end of the busy bustling Agadir bay beach .

We  asked for a room nearer to the beach and this was quickly facilitated by a good reception team The room was super comfortable and I could have easily stayed much longer.

There is a staff training school on the complex which was nice because there were lots of lovely trainees trying hard and doing a great job . We had conversations with several of them who were all charming polite and helpful . We had a lovely waitress called Asmae . The barmen were all engaging and efficient , The  gardeners are doing a phenomenal job.

I had a revitalising peppermint massage in the spa by Norma and it was perfect pressure and prepared me well for my flight home.

I did a good pool aqua aerobics session and next time will try the gym and yoga sessions.

To be honest we had lots of fun just wave jumping ‚Ä¶.who needs a gym‚Ä¶‚Ä¶.

There is a Souk  bazaar actually inside the complex and we bought our souvenirs there as well as in Souk El Had.
The food is absolutely superb at Robinsons and we are BIG foodies ‚Ä¶..the chefs are skilled and we had 5 star food  
consistently from the lovely omelette man to all the lunch and dinner chefs who created deeeeeeluciius meals, many at live cooking stations.

There is a cat project and it was nice to see plump healthy cats wandering around .

Can‚Äôt say enough good things about Robinsons Agadir‚Ä¶LOVED IT . Cannot wait to come back .

review title: Great time as a solo woman
review: I really enjoyed my stay at Robinson despite being more of a German hotel. The room was really spacious, the service and facilities are great. Special high five to Ayoub and Zakaria of the animation team! They brought a special touch to my time spent there, really nice guys and really good at dancing and bringing joy around them. I would recommend even for a solo woman.

We stayed with 2 adults and 4 children (9 - 14 years) for a week at Robinson Agadir. Overall, the stay was very disappointing. On DE arrival ES smelled strongly of urine in the bathroom. The housekeeping perfumed on the third day and by the end of the week the smell was almost gone.

The food was mostly just bad and loveless in our opinion. DA we don't eat meat, the choice at breakfast was limited to two types of cheese, fruit, pancakes, oat slime and waffles. ES always had the same dead-roasted and dry fish at lunchtime. ES also had pasta dishes to choose from, which were sometimes ok if one of the chefs felt called to serve. The gala menu at Rob-Carpet was surprisingly good. As a result, we had severe abdominal cramps and stomach problems for days from the following night. Greetings to the tuna tartare at this point. The problems also had some others, as we were allowed to learn later at the pool. 

ES also had an almost constant shortage of plates, glasses and cups. The staff is overwhelmed with the number of visitors and leaves time for food distribution even in long lines. 

ES there are plenty of towels for the pool area. By the sea, the issue is well located next to the restaurant. By the pool, the only towel dispensary is located in the back corner of the shop. If you let the children exchange towels, they come back every day with new ideas. 

The rooms themselves are fine. Of course, the 17 years are noted in the plant. The freshly changed towels sometimes smelled as if they had been dried over a charcoal grill. 

ES was very mixed up by the guest clientele. ES there were some families with children and guests who were DA to celebrate. For us, two guests represented a week. A 70-year-old lady who, when I went to get drinks, sat down with the 4 children and found ES outrageous that I asked her to let me sit down with the family again. Instead, she started smoking quite enjoyably and smoked the children full. We then changed places for six so that the lady could smoke alone. Another early 30s fell completely drunk into our group and also said to the children "here is all inclusive, you can drink everything". 

Our impression was that all the staff were very welcoming. Really interested in whether you like it, however, no one has. When asked on the last day at the reception how our transport on the day of departure to the airport would be organized, they answered "they can check out until 11 am". That would have been a shame, because our flight left before eleven o'clock.  The "all-round care" from the tour operator was completely missing. You felt like you had arrived by car and stayed in some hotel. 

For comparison, we have Robinsonclub Kyllini Beach. There we were completely enthusiastic last year and until the last day. The Robinson Agadir's performance is in comparison a 2-star Hotel Garni, with very poor value for money.

Stayed in May 2025. Second visit to Agadir. Had a tour around The Robinson hotel on our last holiday when staying somewhere else and were determined to come back and try it for ourselves. Beautiful grounds and very clean throughout. As an older couple the size of the complex could have been a problem for us if it wasn‚Äôt for the very helpful Bellboys. Especially El Mehdi who was always available to take us where we wanted to go in the golf buggies. Nothing was ever too much trouble and he always had a happy smile and time for friendly conversation. Also this would be the main reason for returning so he is definitely a great asset  to the company!

I stayed here with my daughter for one of our  girlie trips 
Initially our rooms were not close to each other but one I asked they moved us immediately the next day 
Even though we are used to a choice of restaurants I can honestly say the  food choice here was really nice. The food was always piping hot and there was almost too much choice 
The staff were always so incredibly friendly and helpful 
The room is large with plenty of storage 
We didn‚Äôt have a supplied mini fridge  or coffee maker which surprised us for a four star hotel , we was always given a bottle of water on request 
The pool and beach areas were always kept incredibly clean , 
The evening entertainment is a little bit hit and miss and the cocktails are not great but on the whole I can‚Äôt wait to return here with my husband as we had a wonderful relaxing week .

The very extensive and varied facility offers fun and games for the whole family. Be it the beautiful Main Pool, the beach or the Sun Downer at the lagoon invite you to relax. 

A very good and large designed indoor and outdoor playground for children is included.
The friendly caregivers will be happy to welcome your children from 3 years of age into the care. 

The entertainment in the theatre and bar is varied. We had a lot of fun. 

The extensive food and beverage offer in the all-inclusive package leaves nothing to be desired. 

The rooms are oriental and modern. We felt super comfortable. 

The staff are very attentive and friendly. 

A little insider tip is the Surf and Turf offer on Fridays in the beach restaurant. For a moderate surcharge, a special high-quality buffet is built for the small group. The sunset with a fantastic view included !

We would definitely go there again. The country is safe and the inhabitants friendly.

We came to Robinson Agadir to celebrate our engagement. My engagement ring went missing the only day we received housekeeping and the way staff handled it was disgraceful.

We were told to come back at 7pm to speak to management. After waiting for hours, we were told they were all at a gala. We had to call the police ourselves. Only when the police arrived did guest relations show up on her phone, laughing, no apology, completely unprofessional. We had to make our own way back from the police station after making a report and after police took photographs of the room, as we did not have much with us because we had to leave in a rush - we even called the hotel to help us get a taxi, they couldn‚Äôt even do this!

After constant pushing and specifically asking, we were finally given an informal letter to explain what had happened, it wrongly stated the ring was ‚Äúmissing‚Äù when it was clearly theft. We were also promised a list of who had entered our room, then told we weren‚Äôt allowed to see it and it would be given to our travel agent, which was not what we were told beforehand.

Staff treated us like an inconvenience from start to finish. No help getting to the police, no updates, no support, no gesture of goodwill, not even basic empathy - apart from one guy at reception I think his name was Robin but we are not sure.

This trip was supposed to be special. Instead, we were ignored and made to feel like we didn‚Äôt matter. Avoid this hotel if you value your belongings or expect even basic decency.

The hotel is quiet and relaxing.
The staff is DE quality and kind.
Meals are delicious.( be it in the morning or evening )
I recommend this hotel

Hotel DE last minute because well rated. But aging hotel. Average breakfast.
Deserved a refreshment. Improve the breakfast.

I am currently in room 318 for 4 nights.Small hotel that met our expectations, the room is correct, clean, nice staff. Except that impossible to sleep!! At 3:30 am I go down to the reception to try to find a quieter room, but no luck the hotel is full and the receptionist tells me to check with the reception the next morning. We had to sleep 2 hours, noise of passers-by, motorcycles, cars, screams, trucks, people chatting at 4:00 in the morning.
This morning, I return to the reception which offers me to change rooms for an EXTRA for a room on the courtyard side so quieter! they admit that my room is noisy. I obviously refuse to pay extra and be taken hostage. If you book in this hotel it is to the luck or then you have to come in low season to be sure to have a room quiet side.
This is the guest experience I had at this hotel: sleeping 2 hours from 4am to 6am. To hear that you had to pay more to sleep better, this is not what we expected from this hotel, especially since there is no different price category depending on the situation of the room.

The rooms are spacious and well soundproofed. There is a free safe, air conditioning and minibar. The only problem is that the cabinet is not large enough and you have to turn the hangers to be able to open the doors. The staff is very friendly and meets our expectations, the hotel has 44 rooms. Breakfast is okay, with natural orange juice, but they could offer seasonal fruits like watermelon and melon. We were half board and dinner was good quality. As we stayed 17 days, the same menus were repeated the second week. On the other hand, the drinks menu is expensive: the first wine costs 27 euros. With regard to the swimming pool, there is very little space to settle on the deckchairs, but the hotel has the advantage of having a space reserved for the beach, located one kilometer away, with deckchairs and umbrellas. Towels are provided on site. There is also a solarium.
In summary: friendly staff, good service and free parking. I'll be back without any problem.

Very good, clean and comfortable with nice staff. Well located in the heart of the city, 10/15 minutes from the beach. Cozy restaurant room, nice terrace with swimming pool. Quiet atmosphere, perfect for holidays! Good value for money.

review title: Lovely relaxed couple of nights break in this chilled boutique hotel
review:
Friendly and helpful reception this applies to all staff.
Room clean with lovely beds and nice bathroom with lovely hot shower.
Cozy patio courtyard garden which was well cared for with pool and handful of sunbeds.
15 min to promenade and beach .
On beach sunbeds of hotel present with security.
Nearby plenty of nice restaurants.

review title: A perfect place to escape for winter sun at exceptional value.
review: Lovely little boutique hotel 10 mins walk to the beach if that, half hour walk to the gorgeous marina. The hotel staff were all amazing very attentive down to the men on the door. Airport pick up was arranged through the hotel. Staff are always happy to help. Lovely roof terrace where we spent the whole of day 1 with drinks being served. Would definitely come back. If your looking for something chilled and relaxed to explore from this is the perfect choice. Topped it off with lovely hot weather.

review title: Winter Sun Break Away From UK
review: This hotel is a real gem, the hotel and rooms are spotless and daily serviced. The staff are friendly and attentive. We enjoyed 7 nights and took advantage of the half board menu, excellent value and the restaurant/hotel (Moroccan in taste and style) has a beautiful view of the pool with the option to enjoy outdoor dining if you prefer. The breakfast is buffet style with a wide range of continental pastries, meats etc including authentic Moroccan options too. The hotel itself is situated about 15 minutes from the beach and 10 minutes from some beautiful parks, we enjoyed both. Agadir is a perfect location for winter sun, great value and the locals were friendly and helpful. On the main beach front, (wide golden sandy beach) there are a variety of restaurants and the marina is a tranquil place to sit and enjoy a coffee. I am sure to return.

Hotel staff were great, attentive, helpful, knowledgeable and good communicators.
Rooms were clean tidy, housekeeping was efficient. The rooms were standard size, but we only sleep in ours, so perfectly adequate. The bar area was great, indoor and outdoor, only inside once, before choosing to go outside! The waiter thought we were mad, it‚Äôs the middle of January!! Still 17‚Äôc at 9pm!! There were other outside seating areas we didn‚Äôt use, with TV‚Äôs and cover. The pool looked pleasant but actually didn‚Äôt see anyone use it! It was in a sheltered courtyard area so didn‚Äôt get much sun in winter. The hotel had its own private cordoned off area on the beach that was awesome.
The only reason for a 4 not a 5 was that the building is starting to look a little tired.

This is a good hotel and the rooms are very nice but the bathroom is rather small. If you have mobility problems this hotel is not for you as there is no lift to the upper floors and even getting into the reception area is difficult.
What we liked best was the pool area where we had our evening meals. The choice of food was very limited (set menu ) but you have the option of "a la carte"
No kettle in the room unfortunately but there is a minibar. There is a shop selling very reasonably priced beer and wine just a 5 minute walk away.

I think I can't find a better hotel for this price (‚Ç¨500/19days). The hotel is dated. Renovation is in progress. Now 60 rooms and next year the other 60. Breakfast is basic but fine for me. Nice pool in a nice area. The staff are friendly. The rooms are tidy. The location is very convenient. Everything within walking distance. Of course they are. There are nicer, more luxurious and more comfortable hotels but then you enter a totally different price range.
I'll be back here. Already in October

We booked one night thinking we‚Äôd enjoy a relaxing escape by the pool. What we got instead felt like an accidental booking at a forgotten roadside inn stuck in the past.

The ‚Äúpoolside room‚Äù was dark and smelled musty. The stove and sink were rusty, as if they hadn‚Äôt been touched since the 80s unless by mold. In the bathroom, we found two random glasses, a 2x1 cm bar of soap that looked more symbolic than useful, and towels with ripped, frayed edges that gave off a strong ‚Äúused to be white‚Äù energy.

Spiders were casually hanging out around the bed, clearly more comfortable than we were. The sun chairs by the pool were dirty and uninviting, and the whole atmosphere felt tired and neglected. The TV? Balanced on a table barely 40 cm high; too small for it and one of the legs was actually hanging off the edge. It looked like one gentle nudge from a toddler would send it crashing down. Practical and safe.
Also beware because those sheets look like bad news (READ THE COMMENTS ABOUT BED BUGS ON GOOGLE )

In short, it was a night to remember,for all the wrong reasons. Wouldn't wish this stay on anyone who values comfort, cleanliness, or functioning Wi-Fi.

Trustworthy and Respectful
A good address to recommend for family and individual travel
Clean hotel and good staff

review title: Health hazard disguised as a hotel ‚Äì completely unacceptable
review:
We booked several nights at Hotel Kamal in Agadir, a month in advance, expecting the double room with pool view shown in the photos on Booking.com.

When we arrived, they gave us a completely different room: 4 single beds, no pool view, and no explanation other than ‚Äúwe‚Äôre fully booked.‚Äù The balcony door didn‚Äôt close, which felt very unsafe on a first floor ‚Äî anyone could easily get in.

The room had only two power outlets, far from the beds, so we had to hang our phones from the wall to charge. There was no light switch near the bed, so we had to get up to turn off the lights.

But the worst part was the bathroom, which was a health hazard:
‚Ä¢ Mold and mildew everywhere
‚Ä¢ Paint falling off the ceiling
‚Ä¢ Rust, dirt, and grime
‚Ä¢ A used toilet paper roll from a previous guest
‚Ä¢ Damp smell and zero ventilation

There was no air conditioning, the room was full of mosquitoes, and the overall cleanliness was unacceptable.

When we asked for a solution, the staff gave us none. They refused to change our room, claiming the hotel was full. They wouldn‚Äôt give us a complaint form, so we had to call the police and take taxis back and forth just to get one. And even after all this, they still charged us for the first night.

This hotel should not be operating. It is a serious public health and safety concern

My husband and I wanted a budget friendly break in the sunshine in Agadir and chose Hotel Kamal based on good reviews, location, price and the fact it had a pool. The hotel is in a great spot in a relatively quiet street, away from the busy seafront, but a short stroll to the beach. There are lots of restaurants and cafes nearby including the lovely Scampi bistro next door, which is licensed. The hotel foyer is really nice with a large, bright lounge area. The rooms are basic, but adequate and very clean. Some have a view of the pool, some of the street. Shower was hot and soap was provided. Beds and towels changed daily. All staff were very mannerly and helpful, particularly Mohammed who manages the pool area. He was just constantly cleaning and very attentive. A wonderful asset to the hotel! Breakfast was again quite basic, but very nice and all we needed (boiled eggs, tomatoes, spreading cheese, selection of croissants, crusty bread and mmsemen, jams, mint tea, coffee and juice). The swimming pool was the highlight of our stay; immaculate, a good depth and size for a swim, surrounded by trees and well maintained plants and with plenty of sunloungers. Mohammed was always on hand with cushions or a beer or coffee from the small pool bar. Other positives about the hotel - checkout wasn‚Äôt until 12pm and we could leave our cases in reception and use the pool until our flight time, reception printed our boarding passes for us, we could charge our phones at the poolside. Not really any negatives, but if I had to improve anything it would be hairdryers and tea/coffee making facilities being available in the rooms and a choice about having a balcony (we didn‚Äôt have one, despite emailing to request one). Overall we had a wonderful stay at the Kamal and would not hesitate to return. We really enjoyed our holiday.

Rooms a bit dated but for the price can‚Äôt complain. Pool area is lovely with plenty sunbeds and Muhammad that looks after the pool area is a treasure and keeps the place spotless. All staff are brilliant ü§© would I go back yes I would . It‚Äôs about 10/15 minutes walk to the beach which is a lovely area

I would recommend this hotel. It‚Äôs clean friendly staff. Good breakfast, clean room‚Äôs comfy beds. Cleaned everyday. Location was good , Wi-Fi excellent, pool area clean. Very quiet rooms/hotel I would come back , shower was very good and hot

review title: Central Comfort at Kamal: A Gem in Agadir‚Äôs Heart
review: "I had a great stay at Hotel Kamal City Centre in Agadir! No complaints at all apart from the check-in receptionist being a bit weird. For the price, it‚Äôs an excellent deal‚Äîgood value with a prime, centrally located spot just a short walk from Agadir Beach and the Amazighe Heritage Museum. The room was clean, a good size, and came with a nice balcony offering views of the bustling city or pool area. The hot shower was a treat after a day out, and the breakfast, at an extra 50MAD, was delicious‚Äîoffering a buffet with continental options. The hotel itself has a lovely outdoor pool, garden, and terrace, perfect for relaxing. The staff were generally friendly. Highly recommend for a comfortable, affordable stay in the heart of Agadir!"

My two sons and I just came back from Agadir. It was a birthday trip for my 13th old son. We stayed in the Hotel Kamal City for 3 nights. We had the most amazing time in Agadir and thanks mainly to the wonderful people in the hotel. From the reception staff, a gentleman called Mohammed (who was so kind to help and book the amazing Camel Sunset Safari and BBQ what we thoroughly enjoyed and would highly recommend) but also everyone else at the reception, the two gentleman at the swimming pool area and the breakfast area. Also a special thank you to the gentleman who was cleaning our apartment and the very friendly doormen:). Everyone was kind, accommodating and nothing was too much for them to help. They went above and beyond. The hotel is conveniently located, a 2 minute walk to the main bus stop Valle D'Ouiseaux. There is a little supermarket, Uniprix, just next to the hotel, you can buy really nice souvenirs, French wines etc. A bureau de change is literally next to the hotel with good exchange rates. If you have children and want to go to Crocpark, you don't need to book expensive shuttle buses, just spend 4 dirhams/person and take the bus number 5 and it drops you off two minutes away from the park (just ask the bus driver to let you know when to get out). Also, there are numerous places to eat on the same street (delicious kebabs, Moroccon food or more posher places next to Uniprix ; fresh fruit juices just opposite the hotel). It is just a 5 minute walk to the sea promenade. We stayed in one of the older apartments that are in need of an upgrade but are specious, very clean etc. So thanks again Kamal City Hotel for an unforgettable time thanks to your hospitality:)

Ground floor room at the pool a little old, lack of maintenance and cleaning, medium soundproofing, very limited but decent breakfast. Nice pool. The welcome is attractive but does not match the room. H√¥tel central. For the price was correct but no more. The hotel is under construction at the level of the rooms but not inconvenient. Perhaps this will improve the aging side of the hotel but also the rate. I recommend the hotel for its good value

review title: The most perfect place to eat in agadir
review: The food was incredible service perfect exceptional from rashid and ibrahim and the front door staff my daughters 17th birthday they all sang to her and arranged a sparkler candle in her dessert the decor was flawless ambience very welcoming and relaxing I cannot fault this place it is a must if you visit agadir thank you so much from the hamnett family from the uk Aug 6th 2025

Location very smart, elegant and so posh.
Staff very kind and a special thank to Mr Riad for attending us for our special dinner of today.
Food delicious, fresh and genuine.
For sure we'll come back.
The Gullotta's Family from Italy

Excellent restaurant everything we ate was delicious, 
Tajine DE monkfish and medallions DE monkfish, crisp DE gambas are succulent. My son loved the Roquefort sauce. 
Have been happy to go back.

From the start you are made to feel so welcome 
Front of house very friendly 
Waiter service  that is second to none could not do enough for you!!

If you are staying at a hotel in Agadia they will collect you and drop you off 

And most importantly the food is some of the best I have ever had üëåüèº

review title: Lovely fusion et EN and top service
review: Some EN lovely people and top service food was really tasty. Was helped by Riyadh what a top guy he helped us so well I came my holiday back 3 x really by DE waiter EN good food from fish to meat!!

We had a very nice evening, in a pleasant atmosphere and with a staff always caring. A special mention to Jacky, who I highly recommend! 

The dishes are hearty and tasty. I come here regularly, and I notice a little improvement in service every time ‚Äî a real attention to detail that makes all the difference. Probably thanks to the professionalism of the manager, Mehdi, who clearly ensures that everything is perfect.

We had a great evening. Very well received, we had booked it is recommended.  A great choice on the map. Delicious dishes. An impeccable service provided in part by Rachid who knew how to be efficient and extremely kind. We will come back in restaurant

We went twice to this restaurant as recommended by our hotel, it is set on Agadir marina. The food and service was amazing both times, we were served by Rachid who was very helpful when ordering.
We tried the fish soup, the goats cheese salad, the crispy prawns and piri piri prawn's. Followed by the salt cooked fish, surf n turf, monkfish and prawn skewer and scallop and prawn tagine. Would highly recommend as delicious.

Simply fantastic, Michelin standard food in my humble opinion and such fantastic value (¬£100 approx for 2 people, 2 courses inc wine). No idea how they do it. Entrees were divine,  flavours were just out of this world. Staff and service were fantastic and def deserved the generous tip given.
