What can I say, the staff were all impeccable, not a single bad word to say about them, all so attentive. The food was just incredible, wouldn‚Äôt be misplaced in a fine dining 5 star establishment.

review title: One of Agadir‚Äôs very first tables
review:
I travel a lot with work, I eat in all kinds of countries at all types of establishments. This restraunt had a fantastic ambiance looking onto the marina in agidar.
The waiters were very attentive and you knew this place worked like clockwork üëç
The food was awesome, grilled prawns in peanut butter were divine üíØ

Kids and wife thoroughly enjoyed their meal, and would happily recommend it. 

Shout out to The Richard the waiter for bringing attention to detail... Love the restaurants story, very busy and popular spot

In the heart of the city and the Marina, it is the best table in the city. Everything is impeccable, the decoration, the courteous and efficient service and above all the excellent cuisine. One without fail.

What an amazing place , 
Friendly staff 
Good food and reasonably priced 
Visited with friends and would go again 
Has main and a pudding each and was around ¬£30 each English

Pure Passion is aptly named: everything is there to have a memorable time. The setting is beautiful, with a neat and elegant decor, worthy of a beautiful Parisian brewery. We are in a refined bistronomic spirit, with a varied, balanced menu, offering quality dishes, both tasty and well presented.
The welcome is warm and the service almost impeccable, combining professionalism and attention. You feel immediately at home, whether for a private dinner or a meal with friends. The atmosphere is friendly, always lively but not very noisy, with a part of the loyal clientele that says a lot about the constant quality of the establishment.
The plates are generous and well stocked, and the whole experience makes you want to come back again. A must-see address in Agadir, to discover!

We visited this restaurant last night the staff were all kind and very helpful food was gorgeous and plentiful I would definitely recommend this restaurant you can also get a free taxi to and from your hotel to the restaurant

review title: Great lamb tagine and lamb shank
Music too loud and fish overcooked
Attentive and respectful treatment of all guests should be a matter of course.
Proper food, a historically long wait and an inability to order desserts
Camels is a must to visit...
review: We've had lunch one day and then returned following day for dinner... WOW what an amazing atmosphere with live singers, that were brilliant, staff friendly and entertaining, food absolutely fantastic, and a beach front view of the mountains to watch an amazing sunset.. Camels is a must visit.. Thank you to all the staff and we'll be back before the end of our holiday...

EN As a Moroccan citizen residing in Europe, I would like to express my deep surprise at the excessive prices charged by CAMEL's restaurant in Agadir. It is unacceptable that a simple dish such as a pizza or a bottle of water DE 75cl costs more than EN in tourist center in Europe. This kind DE tariff policy not only discourages Moroccan residents abroad, but also leaves a bad impression on foreign tourists. I sincerely hope that this message will be taken into consideration by the officials concerned as well as institutions concerned DE their reputation.

Appalling service. I think it‚Äôs because I was solo: three times I asked for a dessert/cocktail menu. Waited ages and asked for my bill. Then the waitress appears with a menu. No thanks. Been here ages
Food excellent though

I'm really surprised by the bad reviews as we go in most lunchtimes and the staff are always friendly and helpful, especially Hassan. We have had many things on the menu over the years and only once had a bad meal. Please ignore the bad reviews.

review title: A disaster!!! restaurant to AVOID now
review:
The menu has been modified to present only uninteresting dishes.
Many people but no service. After 30 minutes of waiting, we did not see the head of a waiter or receive the menus.
When someone deigned to come, it was to deposit us the menu of drinks, left in a word!!
Anyway, there's still a lot to say, but in summary: TO AVOID!!
Great place with amazing view. You have a ocean and beach view. Very plesent wind from the sea. Very friendly stuff and reasonably prices

the restaurant is well located. the atmosphere was quiet because I had lunch around 5pm
very good Sicilian pizza accompanied by a glass of wine

Quite simply the best restaurant food in Agadir. Family of six. We dined here two nights would have been more but only found towards end of holiday. 

The service was amazing. Waiters looked after you constantly.  Food was the best we tried, we were a mixed age group so food went from youngest eating pizza and hamburgers to tagines and camel for the older ones. Nobody had a bad meal and everyone loved the place. 

Price wise very reasonable. Highly recommend this place if you‚Äôre in Agadir.

review title: Avoid Soulless Fric Factory. Deplorable service and cuisine.
review:
Servers who know nothing about catering only in a hurry to accelerate the turn over of customers generating revenue. Music too loud. 
Couscous dry chicken without flavor: a shame for a typical Moroccan dish. 
Avoid especially with a higher quality / price ratio to the same type of restaurant. 
In short, a soulless cash factory for blind tourists.
Many many time's here, a regular customer but tonight service was racist and disgusting, when asked for the manager he was not available.
Many thanks to the waiter for his kindness and professionalism.  Hearty dishes.  Value for money at the top. Facing the beach restaurant deserves you to make a stop to taste its dishes.
Super, lovely restaurant, good Moroccan food, good service and good entertainment both international and Moroccan. Was there three times

It was all happening here on a Friday night - live music, people moving tables, slow orders, wrong orders, laughter, tears and a kids party. All rather loud and chaotic. They‚Äôd sold out of camel tagine but camel skewers were still available. Big portions too. Not the most relaxing meal as there was just too much going on.

Musical atmosphere that breaks your ears, even pierces the eardrums. Manly service, we throw the cards at you.

Continental, Moroccan or Lebanese cuisine.

Food- 
The selection was a good mixture of standard restaurant food and traditional moroccan food.
Great for trying something and/ or sticking to what you know

Drinks-
Great cocktails and good pint selection

review title: Top spot for good food and drink in Agadir!

review: Been twice and food has been fantastic , we had some nice food here and the service is fast and efficient,  can get really busy at night though so be prepared to wait a bit longer
Great food, service and decor. Ate here twice (lunch and dinner) during 5 day holiday. The best restaurant we visited in Agadir, would recommend.
We went here for dinner last night and it had a really lovely atmosphere and lovely staff but the Food is average enough wouldn‚Äôt be rushing back

The customer service was poor especially from a lady who I think was the manager. They brought out the mains before the starters which was very confusing I asked the lady why and she responded with an attitude ‚Äúyou want the starters first?‚Äù Well of course I do that‚Äôs why they‚Äôre called starters. The starters were nice and presented well however the main dishes were not nice they were over powered with strong seasonings the noodle dishes were inedible.

This was our favourite meal when visiting Agadir. 
The food was delicious and the location was beautiful, right by the beach. 
The staff was professional and adhered to our requests even with a slight language barrier. 
I‚Äôve worked in seafood restaurants and can say that it was fresh and of high quality. 
Very well presented and absolutely delicious. 
10/10

review title: Our favourite restaurant on our trip do not skip it
review: I know Asian Fusion as really tasty cuisine, and Pad Thai and Panang Curry from a Thai friend and from several Thailand trips. After a week of vegetarian tajine and couscous, I was really looking forward to visiting this restaurant. But both the dishes of my friendly couple and my Pad Thai were zero authentic and unfortunately only mediocre in taste. If you want something different, especially as a vegetarian, it's okay, but nothing special. The service could not improve the experience either, as it was one of the worst in contrast to our various other restaurant visits here in Morocco.

Excellent restaurant went after reading the reviews 

Top class food 
Lovely setting on the front 
Cosy at night 
Great drink choice and lovely food

review title: Looks Can Be Deceiving ‚Äì Disappointing Experience
review: This used to be our favourite restaurant but in January and May we were really disappointed and wouldn't go back again. The spring rolls have shrunk by 50% and the dipping sauce was tasteless. I had beef noodles, beef was chewy and the noodles were really overcooked. We usually are served by Mohammed who is excellent but got a really miserable waiter this time. Wouldn't return

review title: Very good restaurant on the beach
review:
The restaurant had a great look from the outside, but unfortunately, the experience was a huge disappointment. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend it and definitely won‚Äôt be returning.

When we arrived, several tables were dirty and not properly set. A waiter eventually guided us to a table and cleared it‚Äîbut then wiped it down with a dirty cloth, which didn‚Äôt leave a great impression.

At first, our waiter seemed friendly. He took our order, but then we waited... and waited... and waited. A couple next to us ended up leaving due to the long delay.

We had ordered three drinks‚Äîonly two arrived, and one of them was wrong. When we reminded them about the missing drink, they brought it‚Äîbut again, it was incorrect.

When the starter finally came, we were pleasantly surprised that the food was actually nice, which made it all the more disappointing that the service was so poor. We mentioned the drink error (it even contained alcohol, which we didn‚Äôt order), and the waiter was rude and dismissive, saying it couldn‚Äôt be changed‚Äîdespite it being their mistake.

After that, we decided to cut our losses and asked for the bill. The attitude from the waitstaff was obnoxious, and we just wanted to leave. At the till, we were shocked to find they had added multiple items we never received. After pointing this out, they adjusted the bill, and we paid and left.

Overall, it was a real letdown. A nice-looking place with poor service, rude staff, and billing issues‚Äîdefinitely not worth the visit.

review title: Delicious Food, But Service Needs Improvement
review:
A Chinese , a Japanese on the beach on Agadir is good yes .
Resto on reservation normally but there is always some place left. 
Fine meal very good in the mouth , a pleasure of freshness in sushi, salads .
Very nice soup.
Helpful staff even if a big order error.

The food here was absolutely phenomenal- every dish was full of flavour and beautifully presented. Portions were generous and the pricing was very reasonable for the quality. 

Unfortunately, the service didn‚Äôt match the standard of the food.

We waited quite a long time for our order to arrive, and after asking three different waiters for soy sauce, it still took another 15 minutes to get it. That said, once the food finally came, it was well worth the wait.

If the service improves, this place could easily be a five-star experience.

The scenic view was lovely, we dined outside,
Staff were nice and polite, the food was reasonably priced to you can‚Äôt complain

Food itself was very basic and quite bland but again it didn‚Äôt cost much

I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to recommend.

Really tasty food and really reasonably priced.

We ordered;

A Spicy Majito cocktail and a Bora Bora mocktail

Mango Tango California rolls

Captains TSO chicken & Pad Thai Royale and it only came to 455MAD (¬£37.11)

review title: Nice bit the taste was not authentic Thai
review: The whole staff is wonderful, attentive and the portions are perfect. Lots to choose from, my Ros√© was on point and just a simply great time. If it gets a little cool on the patio, they will light the fire, they will move u if they can. I would certainly go again!

Lovely location on the beachfront with a selection of different cuisines, we had Panang curry, pad Thai, ramen and pho, spring rolls to start and drinks.
We as great service and nice ambience inside but the food was quite bland for a Thai and therefore would only give 4 stars.

The Movenpick in Casablanca was a nice spacious room near the Arab League Park. The staff was very friendly and the pool on the upper level was a nice reprieve from the warm Casablanca sun. We were able to walk to nearby restaurants and it was a great value for the price.

Good 5* hotel, well located in the immediate vicinity of the tram T1.
I appreciated the welcome I received from Amr Kallini, Managing Director and his teams.
The staff is friendly, smiling and professional.
I had the honor of being upgraded EN suite with attention in my room.
The room is comfortable with new bedding, a mattress topper and soft DE pillows allowing to spend a very restful night.
I really liked the restaurant on the 16th floor where I could taste a very good shrimp tagine for dinner and a hearty and fresh Caesar salad for lunch.
The 16th floor has an open-air swimming pool that I couldn‚Äôt enjoy for lack DE time, with a panoramic view of Casablanca.
Breakfast is buffet style, with choice and orange juice pressed on request.
Anyway, I had a great time at the M√∂venpick and I would love DE come back during my next visit to Casablanca.

A big thank you to Hassan the butler of the restaurant ‚Äúle sixteeni√®me‚Äù for its friendliness and efficiency, it feels like home! Not to mention the team which is very friendly too, ‚Äúthe place to be‚Äù if you reside at the Mov√´npick hotel and want to spend a most pleasant time

It is the third year I am visiting the hotel. Perfect location, the rooms are quiet and clean. Friendly people.
The best part of the hotel is the 16th floor Roof top. Amazing view of the city. The restaurant is one of the best I ever have been. Tasty and quality food, the service is amazing the manager is a wonderful person who really cares to make your experience unforgettable. Very polite and professional staff they get and deliver your order fast. A place you must visit to have an unforgettable evening under the stars.

I had a wonderful stay at M√∂venpick Hotel Casablanca. Everything was perfect ‚Äî the comfort, cleanliness, service, and overall atmosphere.

A special thank you to the Guest Relation staff, who was truly exceptional throughout my stay. Always kind, professional, and attentive, with a warm smile that makes you feel at home. You can really tell she loves her job and cares about the guests.

Thank you for your kindness and support ‚Äî you truly make a difference!

I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely come back.

Warning ** Backpackers Hotel **

If you like to be stressed out, then stay here! 

The worst possible stay I have had in 20 years! NO Air conditioning working, I changed my room multiple times and still there was no AC working.  

The engineer came to repair the AC, however all he did was push the temp up and down several times and that was it.  Not exactly technical he never returned and when I asked him later on whats going on, he said it was fixed! Nothing of the sort‚Ä¶ NO AC! 

As a Platinum Accor member, no amnesties were given not even water in the room.  I requested water several times and in the end, went to buy some myself from the shop outside.

The iron was from the 1970‚Äôs with some of the electric cords visible and deep cuts in the earth cable, had I not seen this and plugged it in, I would have had an electric shock.

The bathroom was dismal and no way this hotel can say they are a 5 star! Its really impossible.  You need to use all the towels on the floor to keep it dry because the glass is missing the rubber seal from the bottom, so all the water seeps out, this was present in all the rooms.

The service is absolutely zero, breakfast is a waste of money.  The valet could not find the car for 20 odd minutes only to tell me he parked it in another street and gave me directions to the car. 

I moved hotels to the Marriot Courtyard, absolutely spot on! No issues and they went above and beyond to accommodate me, even I am not a Bonvoy member but for sure shall be!

I am expecting some form of lame excuse from the hotel, as after I checked out they wanted to resolve the issue! A little too late! You lost a customer, not that you care.  For sure I shall take this up with Accor as the hotel falls far beyond the expectations, even the Ibis has better rooms and better service.

review title: Service and people at the front desk are very good
review: We had a great stay at this hotel the extremely professional reception staff warm and always ready to render service
It is a wonderful hotel and especially the service of the reception I recommend it to everyone thanks Movenpike hotel

Very welcome. Caring and friendly staff. Food on top. I recommend.thank you hahar guest relation for your support
Very welcome. Caring and friendly staff. Food on top. I recommend.thank you hahar guest relation for your support

Personal very professional in all their functions, I take the opportunity to leave a special thanks to all the employees, especially the team directed to the roof part where is the pool that made this stay result in a super great and very pleasant experience.

The hotel is in need of a total refurbishment and refresh, it is very old, the check in process was arduous and took 2.5 hrs before we were given a room. We arrived 30 minutes before the check in time at 3 pm.
Once we were finally given our room key the room smelt old and musty, so we asked for another room which was only marginally better.
The breakfast choices were lacking and the breakfast area was impractical for eating comfortably, low profile chairs with lower tables to eat on.
On the first full day at the hotel the pool area was closed for a private event for the entire day, the following day we decided to use the pool area, but it was so crowded (because it was closed the day before) we had nowhere to sit and relax so we simply ordered food by the restaurant and the service was terrible. We waited 35 minutes for them to take our order and they forgot half of the items when it was finally delivered. The Chicken was under cooked, until we asked to speak to the supervisor we were not given an apology. You would be well advised to seek alternate accommodations.
Overall experience very disappointing. Not the standards we expected form the Hyatt chain of hotels.

I have left this way too long but to be honest I thought I had lost the bits of paper on which we had written the names of the very professional and helpful staff with whom we had contact with during our stay. In particular I would like to thank Samira Yassine for how well she kept our room during our stay.  Nissrine Islam was very friendly and helpful in taking our food and drinks orders. Our club experience was wonderful as well and we were well looked after by Oussama Daoudi. I would also like to name Reda, Rania, Islam, Lemia, Hossein, and Sedeek. We were very impressed by the level of pride and professionalism we witnessed by the Hyatt team. Thank you all for a wonderful and memorable stay.

review title: Abdullah jannah a person to remember
review: The experience at the pool side was absolutely amazing thanks to Abdullah jannah who made sure everything was smooth and enjoyable. The bar manager as well very polite and very professional

review title: Service Excellence Thanks to Nisserin Yassa
review: We had an incredible experience, thanks to our amazing waitress, Nisserin Yassa guided us through the menu with thoughtful recommendations of traditional dishes, served tea with the grace of a master, and surprised us with a beautifully assorted dessert selection. Her attention to detail and warm service truly elevated our night. So impressed!

review title: Exceptional Service That Exceeded All Expectations
review:
had a truly wonderful stay at the hotel, made even more memorable thanks to the exceptional service provided by two outstanding team members.

Mr. Oussama, who manages the Executive Lounge, went above and beyond to ensure everything was seamless and personalized throughout my stay. His professionalism, attention to detail, and genuine care truly made a difference.

Miss Asmaa, Head of Reservations, was equally impressive. She handled every request with efficiency, warmth, and remarkable precision. Thanks to her, my entire experience was perfectly tailored and stress-free.

I can‚Äôt thank them enough for their dedication and kindness. It‚Äôs rare to come across such a high level of service, and because of them, I‚Äôll definitely be coming back very soon. Exceptional staff like these make all the difference!

The location is good--walkable distance to the mosque, medina, restaurants, and train station (Casa Port). The hotel felt like an island with foreigners with the proximity to the medina. We appreciated the sweets upon arrival. We could not use the pool due to some repair going on. The room was rather small and dated. There was a night club in the hotel, which led to some noise in the night. On check out, we asked for a taxi to the Casa Voyageurs station and was told the fare would be around 15 dirhams. The taxi driver charged us 100 dirhams and threatened to take us back to the hotel if we did not pay the amount. This, of course, is not Hyatt Regency's fault but wish there was a way to confirm the amount before taking the taxi.

I recently stayed at the Hyatt Regency Casablanca and was impressed by its fantastic location. While the hotel has an old charm, it is exceptionally well maintained, making for a comfortable and enjoyable experience. Highly recommend for anyone visiting Casablanca!

review title: Evenings at the Living Room bar
review: One of the best hotels I have stayed at in recent memory, has everything you need and excellent customer service. The pool and restaurants are  fantastic.

We enjoyed each of our evenings at the Living room bar, the whole menu is amazing, and we want to thank Nisserine Yassa for her excellent service, her pleasant smile and recommendations, and the delicious cocktails made by the talented Yassine Nir. These two people bring a soul to the Bar Living room that make it a warm place!
Very comfortable, very well placed, very smart. Large spaces both in the room and in the hotel. Very attentive staff.

review title: Nice hotel, good price to stay
review:
Myself, and 3 children stayed for a break away.
This holiday was very reasonably priced, for this reason I was worried about how good the hotel was going to be.

Great facilities, pools very good & clean, I see them cleaning every morning, always checking the water out. Always subbed, even in August, no matter what time of day we came
Down we could always get a few beds.

Hotel in general is clean, restaurant, pool, toilets ect. However the cleanliness of the rooms was very average. It was acceptable when we arrived. But the cleaners cleaning the rooms were terrible i couldn‚Äôt tell if they had been or not, towels changed every 3rd day, cleaners every other day. Wasn‚Äôt too bothered as we kept it clean ourself, but didn‚Äôt have a brush to sweep floors other than a tiny brush.

Kids loved the pool game, aqua fit, water sports- shame these aren‚Äôt daily.

Silly rules of no floats in the pool, some
Can go in, seems to change daily, no ball games in pool- Seemed like fun police, all the kids on holiday wanted to play with balls and floats but got told off.

Location- great location. 5 min walk down either hill or steps to front, plenty restaurants, cafes, shops, a shopping centre. Beach‚Äôs all in walking distance.

Gym- this holiday was advertised as having a gym, the gym is next door it costs ‚Ç¨8 per session and have to take a towel or you have to hire one for ‚Ç¨3, happy to pay but it doesn‚Äôt state when booking it‚Äôs not part of the hotel.

Restaurant food reasonably priced and good. Ate a few times but close enough to walk out.

Overall would recommend the hotel.

Everything was very good.
Unfortunately there was no air conditioning in the apartment, only one ceiling fan it the bedroom.
I did see that you could get air conditioning in your room for ‚Ç¨10 a day with ‚Ç¨20 deposit. So was disappointed by that. But the staff were all lovely and very helpful the apartment was clean and very nice. The pool area was lovely. Food was very good. They also had a great variety of entertainment.
I really enjoyed my stay here...lovely area. Had a great time.

Used this place 4 times since December. It has everything you need and any issues are dealt with within hours.

Negative. Rooms facing the sea now have a lot of music noise from the water park that has opened in the hotel opposite.

The new fans in the bedrooms are really good but confusing to use. You do not need air-conditioning. Press the button below on. Press the top button on the bottom left of the handset. Then press the button in the middle on the left, with 3 dots, until the light goes bright. To switch off the light, press the off button in the top right. This turns off the light not the fan.

Excellent base for the many lovely restaurants and shops in town. Room was well stocked with plenty of room and a small balcony. Supermarket nearby with everything we needed. Would return again and hire a car to visit the beaches in the south. Nice pool with enough sunbeds not really for swimming just cooling off unless you‚Äôre early when it‚Äôs empty. Staff all friendly and good service. Everything clean and regular room cleaning. No air con but room stayed cool with just windows open and ceiling fans on. Open air pool complex nearby which is really nice. Quite a few steps to walk up and down to get to town or no steps and can walk on pavement but can get taxis if too hilly. Would certainly recommend. Good value for money.

review title: Great stay. Short distance to town
review:
Great stay. Only getting 4 stars only for barman not interested in serving. So didn't bother with food there either. Rooms were perfect. Everything you need. We had family of 5. Plenty of room. Balcony was adequate. Plenty of kitchen wear.
Also helpful friendly reception and cleaners very good.
Pool a bit small but not overly busy so was perfect. Plenty of sunbeds. Didn't appear to be any sunbed hoggers leaving towels and disappearing. Hotel is up a steep hill one way and steps the other.
Consider this if mobility isn't good. But taxis be cheap anyway.
All in all definitely will visit again.
The phenomenal experience. Highlighting Javier's cocktails, they are super good and always to the taste of each customer. And Juanjo at breakfast is unbeatable.

review title: Great for families with teenagers who need their own bedroom
review: Beautiful hotel with a very Spanish feel. The rooms are very spacious. WiFi is free and fast throughout the hotel. Although there is no air-conditioning, there are big ceiling fans in the bedrooms. There are plenty of sunbeds even at 10.30am. This is definitely a place to come back to.

We were ten days when we arrived we no longer liked that we courtesy give a gel and shampoo for a day does not say anything good, since the one who is housed one day also receives it, dishwasher for two days does not say anything good, since we have been ten days, and what finished the stay was the last day we had to leave the studio at 11:00, and at 10:10 phone call from a receptionist with the loan to offer a parking space, at 10:15, an operator rings the doorbell with the pretest to know if there was in said studio, the famous evacuation box, in short as you can see that you want to leave, if really until 11:00 I do not have to leave the really left, why the bus Titsa passes to the airport line 30 , at 11:10 and we did not want to miss it, in the end we left at 10:30, gentlemen of apartments Casablanca, you are some smart with your pretestos and your desire to leave the studio free, because wing I do not return, and that was the second time we had gone .

We flew into North Tenerife, drove our rental car to Casablanca. Checking was easy and took only a few moments, the parking garage and space to unload was perfect. Most hotels don‚Äôt have that type of space in Tenerife. It‚Äôs also centrally located, so if you did not want to rent a car, you could walk to just about any place you want in Puerto de la Cruz. The food was good, the service was excellent and the place was very clean. They offer tours, live music and dancing on site. Our room was a bit outdated but our bathroom was newly remodeled and beautiful. The Mattresses were comfy too, and the kitchen was nice to have! This vacation was a 10 out of 10!! Can‚Äôt wait to go back.

Few activities and musical performances in the complex.
They should put transport from the Rodeos airport
Apartments located on a very steep slope.

The Casablanca hotel has good clean comfortable rooms. Mini fridge, aircon, room safe all included. Cooked and cold buffet breakfast to a good standard. Short walk to beach, restaurants, bars etc. nice clean pool with plenty of sunbeds.

We had a lovely 12 night stay recently.

It's in the quieter part of Santa Ponsa but still very close to all amenities.

It was very clean in the public areas and the rooms are cleaned to a high standard every day.

The staff were all friendly and there were plenty of sun beds available at the pools.

There is a safe and a small fridge in the rooms, both free.

However the fridge was tiny and not very cold, so we opted to hire a proper fridge at a cost of 50 euros.

It was well worth it in my opinion as it was very cold, just a shame it didn't have a small freezer compartment.

Stayed at Hotel Casablanca for four nights in a junior suite with terrace. Bit disappointed with the view as thought we would be able to see pool and sea as we were on top floor.

We had a massive apartment with separate tv room and a fridge and kettle. (No tea or coffee left so you need to take your own.). Thought there may have been a couple of bottles of water in fridge but none.

The terrace was massive but because of extremely hot weather we didn‚Äôt actually use it as there was no shade.

Small bathroom with shower and toilet. Sink was outside of bathroom bit dated. Nice towels.

Comfortable beds with a tv In bedroom although we did not use this at all as used one in lounge a couple of mornings. There was a dressing table with a large mirror. Loads of wardrobe space and hangers. Bedroom door did not close properly. Aircon was adequate.

Cleaner was really friendly and did a good job. Toiletries were a refillable bottle of shampoo and small bar of soap. Again a bit disappointing for a suite.

We were bed and breakfast and found the restaurant to be average as on three of the mornings going down at different times no coffee in some machines, no scrambled eggs just an empty tray. Waitresses were lovely in restaurant. Decided to eat out for breakfast at local Irish bar and it was really lovely would have done that for rest of holiday if we were there longer. Went to pool one day. Pool bar really nice. Had bar snacks and drinks which were nice. Plenty of sun beds.

review title: Lovely hotel, would come back again.
review: Just back from this hotel it was amazing. It should be more than a 3 star at least a 4. It was immaculate cleaned to a high standard including pool and pool area and garden. The staff were all friendly nothing was too much trouble. Breakfast was lovely, there were plenty of sun beds no rush to get one or put towels out . The stairs to pool weren‚Äôt as bad as they look and sound there‚Äôs hand rails to assist also a lift in the next building. Rooms cleaned and mopped every day and regular clean towels also fridge and safe in rooms . The hotel was 5 mins from beach and shops either left or right out hotel very central but just far enough back to be quiet. can recommend very highly this hotel and will look forward to going again. Thank-you for a lovely holiday Hotel Casablanca!

This hotel is lovely, the location is close to the beach, shops and restaurants. The staff are lovely and the breakfast was great, really pleased with it.

All areas including the pool were very clean. Always sunbeds available and pool well maintained. Daily room clean was good with a change of towels when requested.

The only small downside is the bar prices are a bit more than outside of the hotel but restaurants are so close you can pop out and get lunch much cheaper.
All in all a great hotel, we really enjoyed our break here.

First time at this hotel everything was perfect room food staff location what isn't there to like in a quiet area but near beach approx 5 mins walk & plenty of restaurants/ shops near bus stops to take you to nearby resorts ! The best thing about this hidden gem was the friendliness of every member of staff who made you feel very valued would highly recommend

Absolutely beautiful hotel. More than a three star hotel. Wonderful staff from reception, cleaning staff and restaurant workers. Always a friendly face. So clean and tidy. Hotel at full occupancy but never felt that way.
Breakfast was very good. Plenty of choice of hot and cold food, pastries and fruit.
Guests have been returning here for over ten years so that shows how good this place is.
Two pools for use of guests. Both clean and at any time of day lots of beds available.
Fantastic gardens which are well kept. Loved Mr and Mrs Duck ü¶Ü that came for a swim in the afternoon if it was quiet.
Beach about a ten minute walk. Near all restaurants and bars but not close enough to hear or keep you awake.
Lastly amazing air conditioning much required in the extreme heat. I can recommend this hotel and would happily go again.

Hi, I just got back from 8 days at this hotel and I'm already starting to miss it üò© Beautiful hotel very clean, maids do excellent hard work bravoüëçüèªü´∂üèªüëåüèª
Breakfast service, reception excellent, very tasty breakfasts, dinner paid extra plus drinks but I think it was a good price because I ate with my family in the city and the bills were higher or even much higher ü§îüôÑü´£
If someone is going there this month, you have to know that it is very ü•µ üî• and it is best to spend the afternoon in the pool, I will point out that it is very clean, good job by the gentleman who works hard every morning, and he makes sure that the guests feel good when using it.üëåüèª
Mallorca is not a cheap holiday destination, but in fact, there is probably no other cheap place in Europe ü§îüôÑü´£
The view from the terrace was beautiful, especially in the evenings ü§©ü§©ü§©
The hotel was very quiet and peaceful. I missed some music by the pool. It was in the bar but very discreet. I had to use music from my smartphone.
Overall, we had a fantastic holiday time there, for which we would like to thank the entire staff of this hotel üëåüèªü´∂üèªüëåüèª

Just returned home yesterday from my 3rd visit to this gorgeous hotel. As usual the hotel was spotless and the pool area was immaculate with plenty of sun-beds available even later in the afternoon.
A new thing this year was a small fridge and safe included in the rooms which other years you had to hire them . Staff are so friendly and helpful especially Tracey in the restaurant, always friendly and helpful.
Booking our 4th visit in the next week for 2026.

Arrived at the Casa Blanca for a 5 night stay, check-in was easy and the staff were pleasant.

Room: We booked a standard room, which was exactly that, absolutely fine for what we needed but could be a bit small for a longer stay. Room was clean with a traditional style decor and a/c. It had a wardrobe, dressing table, small TV and small fridge, the beds were comfy with spare pillows in the cupboard. The bathroom was very small, with a shower over bath which was very tight to get into, especially if you are on the larger side. The water flooded the floor every time you showered, which is quite dangerous and very slippy! There was complimentary shower gel on the wall and a hairdryer.

Restaurant: Fantastic outdoor dining on the terrace with lovely views. Basic selection of food, but something for everyone, however kids could struggle to find a filling meal or if you're a fussy eater. Drinks were pricey compared to the local bars, which indirectly forced people to spend elsewhere.

Pool & Pool Bar: Steep steps to the pool however there were plenty of sunbeds, no need to save a bed or do the mad AM rush! Pool and pool bar were very clean with a ping pong table in the shade and light music during the day.

Entertainment: Jet 2 advertised occasional evening entertainment but we didn't see any entertainment for the duration of our stay. If drinks were cheaper and they had entertainment guests would spend more time at the hotel and spend more money.

Location: Great location as a base, only 30 mins transfer from the airport, so even better for a long weekend stay. Restaurant and shop opposite the hotel or a short 10 minute walk down hill to the beach, bars and restaurants. Note, guests with mobility issues could struggle with this hotel.

Complimentary Shower Room: The hotel offers 2x complimentary shower rooms to use for 30 mins on the day of your departure, as checkout is at 11am - Bookable on checkout. It's a great addition to have and it was even better then the bathroom in our room! Secure luggage room available to use if you have a late departure.

Conclusion: Lovely traditional hotel, in a good location, ideal for short breaks or a base if you just need somewhere to stay. Not suitable for those with mobility issues due to steep steps to the pool and hills both ends of the road to access the main resort. Food is as expected for a 3* but could find it hard to find something for fussy eaters or children. Drinks could be cheaper to retain guests to spend more on site.

We visited Casablanca restaurant on 06/08/25.

The food was first class , with good vegetarian options for my wife ..

Our food and drink orders were delivered timeously , and staff were very attentive .

If in Kusadasi we‚Äôd highly recommend visiting this restaurant ..

They also have a hotel pick up/ drop off service which is complimentary ..

What a brilliant experience, we went to watch the women‚Äôs Euro finals and what a great atmosphere. The staff are amazing, the food is delicious and an added bonus is they will also pick you up from your hotel and drop you back off. It is a family run business and you can tell that they put everything into it. Thank you so much for an amazing experience, we will definitely be returning. A special mention goes out to Harry for looking after us, we wish you all the best.

We ate at this restaurant last night as a family of 6, ranging from 7 to 69 years old. Every single one of us thoroughly enjoyed our food and the cocktails were also amazing. They even went above and beyond and created a bespoke cocktail just for me! A special mention to Harry who was very polite and welcoming to our whole family and the fact the restaurant pick you up and drop you back to your hotel free of charge is a massive bonus. Will definitely be returning!!

‚∏ª

Friendly staff and a bonus that they pick you up and take back to your hotel. The staff are so welcoming especially Harry. The menu has good options for both adults and little ones, and the relaxed vibe makes it easy to enjoy a meal with the whole family.
One of the best places I have eaten by far! Great staff very pleasant and helpful! Great with kids! Definitely rate this place 5 stars! Well worth a try when you are in the area

Lovely food and AMAZING customer service. 
Picked us up from hotel, and took us back after some shopping too. 100% recommend

review title: People, food and drinks, atmosphere 10 of 10!! Highly recommended ‚ù§Ô∏è
review: Casablanca Restaurant ‚ù§Ô∏è we was there in juli 2025 - amazing food, friendly and helpful people, good service and great atmosphere with lots of smiles üòÄ we ate mixed kebabs with chicken and beef and food was delicious 10 of 10! Peaple who work there and take care of us make this place ‚Äûlike in home‚Äù. We cone back there 100% next time when we come to Kusadasi :) best regards from Joanna, Lukas and Nikodem from Troms√∏ üòá

Great place to eat EN we enjoyed EN , plates were full and tasteful, kids have eaten lekekr and carbonara was very tasty definitely recommended. Staff very friendly they always have time for a chat. When we are back in Kusadasi we will definitely come and eat there again.
It's a good spot for chefs with excellent palate, entertaining waitstaff with excellent behavior, good talk, good work for your health... üôÇ Recommendations
You will not experience better food and hospitality anywhere! Great food, amazing service! *****. They even pick you up and drop you off FOC!

review title: and yet another visit to my favourite restaurant
review:
I go to this restaurant every time I visit Kusadasi which is probably all i need to say.
The food is and always has been exceptional and the staff are friendly and attentive.
Defo the best I have tried in Kusadasi

It was great night, they are made us day. Magic tricks, good stuff, kitchen... Specially foods are amazing. If you need recommand try the all about the shish kebaps. I will come back again thats why. Thanks for everything guys.
I couldn‚Äôt recommend this restaurant enough. Plenty of choices on the menu and very reasonably priced.  The staff were very friendly and attentive.

When we visited this restaurant we didn‚Äôt know what to expect but to say we where delighted is an understatement the food was delicious portion sizes where big and prices where very reasonable, everything freshly cooked and staff are so friendly. We went back twice again , Harry stole our hearts and we will always remain friends the son we never had‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è , we highly  recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Kusadasi its family run beautiful food and friendly staff that can‚Äôt, the glynn family infinity uncle Paul Jess jayde Amelia Katherine

We are staying at the batihan beech resort and spa, mustafa visited the pool area and offered us free pick up and drop off. (You are also free to go shopping/drinking before or after eating, and return for free lift) the food is amazing, the staff are on the next level making you feel so welcome and the cards and magic tricks make it a special night. We decided to go again a few night later and the night was just as amazing the kids loved it here and we have just booked to return for a 3rd night. They make you feel like part of the family I cannot rate this place high enough, if this restaurant was back home this would definitely be the go to restaurant, go you won't be disappointed.

review title: Thank you San Andres.... wonderful island.
review:
Very good service.  Great restaurants.  Excellent beachfront location with multicolored fish 50m from the hotel.
Air renewal DE lacking EN room 409, as the windows do NO open.  The rest very good.  Thank POR an excellent stay.
Excellent place to vacation, good location, its facilities nothing to say. The options DE varied and rich breakfasts.

Very good location!! Very nice beds. POR the closeness to the sea, nothing dries up! But outside DE that, everything flawless. The pool and the bar very well. It has 3 very good restaurants. Pastas are very rich. EN the beach, which is glued, there are always umbrellas x 50,000 pesos (about 15 dollars)
Nice facilities, good breakfast and friendly staff. The wifi ES the best DE within the rooms but EN common areas it works very well.
Spacious room, very friendly staff, good DE breakfast, best beachfront location and close to everything, great variety in restaurants, recommended
Great the whole experience was unique and highly recommended the facilities are very comfortable and the food very delicious very nice everything

Very comfortable hotel, clean and with good service. The area DE the pool ES very good. Restaurants too, especially DE snack. Great location, on the rambla and facing the beach.
The only thing we were NO happy with was that the room had NO window, but we understand that it was a standard room.

Very comfortable room, excellent service, super good toilet in the room. The service DE the people EN reception and other hotel staff are very friendly and professional. Excellent service.
A very varied firm 10/10.

review title: A memorable experience at Hotel Casablanca ‚Äì San Andr√©s
review:
We stayed DE July 21-27 and unfortunately our experience was very bad from the start. EN reception was poor, with unprofessional staff and, in many cases, poor attitude. They entered our room unannounced, something totally unacceptable.

The room smelled damp, the keys malfunctioned, and overall the hotel is in poor condition, with several sectors under repair and a very old-fashioned style, especially the pool area DE.

The most frustrating thing was that they offer you an ‚Äúocean view room‚Äù, but if you want a balcony, they charge you an extra 50,000 Colombian pesos POR day, something that was NO previous information.

DE addition, you are automatically charged 10% service, although outside the compound it is indicated that ES voluntary. It's NO DEARTH to pay for it, but if care ES bad, you should have NO choice whether or not to include it.

We also received poor recommendations and little guidance on what to do in the area, which made the experience even worse.

EN summary, this hotel is NO match DE promise. Lack of seriousness, cleanliness, transparency and respect for guests. I'd give it a 1 DE 10 and definitely NO recommendation.

We stayed EN the Casablanca Hotel DE from the night of July 20 until mid-afternoon on the 24th. We arrived after midnight and, although EN that first moment the attention generated some concern ‚Äîprobably POR the hour ‚Äî everything improved markedly as our stay progressed.

Upon entering the room, we noticed that the internet connection was not working. They explained that it was DE general problem, which was resolved the next day and NO longer failed during the rest DE our stay.

The hotel is located EN te beachfront, in a truly unbeatable location. Having travelled the island from end to end, we confirm that it is one of the best possible locations to enjoy San Andr√©s, both for the access to the sea and for the proximity to shops and activities.

During the three nights I continued EN dinner in the different restaurants of the hotel. The gastronomic proposal was excellent, both POR the quality DE the dishes and POR the service and atmosphere. We found the value for money very reasonable: a full dinner for two people, with aperitif or beer, is around 80 US dollars, and with Argentine wine, about 90. EN both cases, the price includes the tip. We especially recommend the DE mar sharing grill, grilled salmon, grilled tuna, risotto with pork and mushrooms, and the amazing DE hummus entree with sauteed loin.

Our room was spacious and comfortable, with a king size bed ideal for rest. The bathroom was also very comfortable, with excellent DE water pressure and constant replenishment DE towels and towels ‚Äì EN several occasions even twice a day ‚Äì a DETAIL that speaks of the level of attention to the guest.

The DE breakfast was another high point of the stay: complete, fresh and with options for all tastes. Today, before DE retreat, we shared a late check-out and, as a gesture DE courtesy, we were invited with a bite DE assorted stiffs that closed our experience with a DE gilt.

We would like to draw particular attention to the staff. Both the manager, the chef and the manager DE customer service were always present, attentive and available to ensure that every DEtail of our stay was perfect. You can see a real commitment to the well-being of the passenger.

We definitely recommend ENda Hotel Casablanca and hope to come back in the future. Thanks POR everything!

We stayed here for our wedding night. 
Beautiful quaint hotel with wonderful service. Original hardwood floors!
We checked in and found a beautiful swan towel sculpture on our bed and tons of faux red rose petals. I mentioned in the booking this was our wedding night hotel-and they followed through with this. So pretty!
I forgot a couple things and the front desk was able to quickly provide- lotion and some blank sheets of paper. So generous.  I think the young lady who was so kind at the front desk was Amina. 
We had a room that led out to the pool. Pretty little private patio with a table and chairs. I wrote out my vows here! 
Loved this hotel!

Great boutique hotel. Very clean, great staff, right on Duval so not far from the action but up the southern end so a quiter section. Near Hemingway House and Southern most point. Continental breakfast provided. Small pool but very refreshing after a long day walking in the sun. Bar/restaurant right next door is excellent

review title: Perfect home base in Key West!
review: We loved our stay here. It was centrally located, making it easy to explore old town on foot. Our ground-level king room was spacious and comfortable. We enjoyed the cool, shady courtyard pool. The staff were friendly and we appreciated the light continental breakfast to kick off each day. Would absolutely stay here again!

Construction mainly in wood, white. 2 floors near a restaurant, no noise is heard. Wife and husband kind and helpful. Great location in the center of the main street. Room 9 with private terrace with beautiful deck chairs. Small pool but comfortable. Comfortable bed, bathroom with shower easy to adjust. Very clean. They offered breakfast although not included.

review title: Nice hotel in good location on Duval Street
review: I stayed at the Casablanca for a long weekend in January (Key West 1/2 Marathon).  I chose the Casablanca based on the location and price compared to other hotels nearby.  I was pleasantly surprised with my stay in Room 6.  The room seemed larger than the pictures on the website.  Bed was comfortable, bathroom was clean, and the balcony was a nice area to sit and be outside.  Hotel staff was super friendly and helpful.  The free breakfast was a bonus as well.  Having the Old Town Tavern connected to the hotel was great for lunch and mid-day drink.  Only negatives (minor) are that it got a little noisy one night (but it is Duval Street) and you can hear glass bottles being emptied into the dumpsters.  Overall, thoroughly enjoyed my stay here and recommend the Casablanca!

As a family,  there were 3 of us in the double  queen! We arrived early and were able to check in early. A plus!!
The room was small, however  beds were comfortable! We used the, provided, chests to store our clothing. The bathroom was ample  big enough for all cosmetics.  We love the sample Salt Scrub! 
Breakfast was simple and adequate.   The Tavern next door has excellent food.

This older hotel with a lounge and restaurant on location was a great choice. Central, which we could walk from one end to another of the main street which has mostly everything we came for. A couple of  downsides is the parking and all the rooms in which we saw had stairs. Parking is 7 minutes south. Free but walking after you drop off your luggage.

Great place with a clean light room and quiet back yard. Nice coffee and selection of pastries in the morning was a big plus. Parked my car in the free parking lot as directed by the front desk and enjoyed walking on Duval. Overall enjoyed my stay

review title: I was charged for one night in full for a night I didn't stay.
review: The parking situation and bed n breakfast was absolutely horrible. On top of that they  charged me in full for a night that I didn't stay claiming they couldn't NOT charge me because of the booking.com reservation that booking.com approved. After booking.com said I was eligible for a refund Casablanca refused to refund me the unstayed night. They are absolutely the MOST HORRIBLE I've ever done business with. DON'T STAY HERE!!!!

Outrageously expensive for what it is.The owners clearly spend nothing on maintaining the place.

- Room stank of bleach, which was used to mask the mold growth in the bathroom, behind the bath
- Noisy in the evenings with the Nextdoor restaurant extractor fan running until late
- Single ply loo roll, which says it all
- Supermarket pastries and drip coffee for breakfast

The only positive is that the bed was comfy and the staff hard-working, efficient and kind.

Recommend to avoid if possible as there are better places to be found at more amenable rates.

review title: Convenient, quirky and friendly place to stay in central Casablanca
review: This is a great place to stay in Casablanca. It is traditionally decorated, the staff are friendly, the beds are comfortable and it is within easy walking distance from the Central Market, the medina and the port. There are also 2 tram stations very close by, as well as a supermarket.

Beautiful decoration, perfect Moroccan style, spectacular staff, excellent food, very clean, adore. Thank you for the excellent stay that you provide me, here I felt very well received, I felt "at home" I love the hotel in everything üôèüèªüòç

review title: I highly recommend this hotel for any stay in Casablanca!
review:
Great hotel, beautiful traditional style (exactly as in the pictures) very well placed. The kitchen is delicious. 
But what sets it apart most is the benevolence, adaptability and quality of its teams! Thank you for your stay.

review title: Excellent value. Good location. Traditional feel
review: We stayed for one night before joining a tour as a pair of couples. We booked via booking.com. It was excellent value with friendly staff. I like the traditional feel and Moroccan decoration. It has a central location with atm around the corner. You could walk to the old town and Mosque; we were ‚Äúaccosted‚Äù by a taxi driver who offered us a 2 hour city tour which was excellent. The breakfast and central area was traditional and attractive. At first breakfast was hit and miss but staff were responsive and cooked an omelet. It‚Äôs all a little ramshackle and slightly dated but hey the price paid it was great. 5 star for feel and value.

review title: Overall, our stay was good. We think we got the most spacious room in the hotel which was great.
review:
We stayed two nights at the end of our tour.
We got a very spacious room on the 9th floor thanks to Chafik. The bed was comfortable with a good firm mattress. Air con kept the room comfortable and there were spare blankets. 
Rainfall shower appeared to be new so maybe has been upgrades.
It had a very Moroccan d√©cor . We  have stayed more than once at the sister hotel in Marrakech.
Clean.
Lift rather slow.
Close proximity to major sites like the Central Market, the old medina, Rick's Cafe and the Mosque which can be toured by foreigners. We had a balcony with a view of the port.
Breakfast very good selection: Dates, olives, cheeses ,breads, beans ,cucumber etc.

Cleaning grade 0.
But the real surprise was just the bed bugs. Seen and photographed in the morning. Unfortunately thinking it was just my impression I slept in the haunted bed and a few days later the stings appeared. The manager went up to the room but not having seen them according to him they were not there. 
Bad experience for me anyway. Would not recommend

Picturesque hotel, nice decoration Public parking 100 m away. Staff was not very friendly (too little tipped?). Reasonably spacious room, but with the necessary defects: 2 loose sockets (dangerous!), separate shower head, malfunctioning sink ... Great breakfast.

I stayed 3 nights in this hotel because I was on a group trip and the travel leaders booked this hotel for the entire group. I would have personally made a different choice, but the hotel is completely in line with hotel big and old hotels in North Africa. The room and the bathroom were enormous and furnished in the traditional style, but quite basic and some hanging structures are missing. In general, cleanliness must be improved. It was also impossible to get clean towels: both the staff was reluctant in giving new and additional towels (you are only given 2 towels and there's not shower carpet, so you must use one of the towels) and all the towels had stains. Bath products are really low quality. 
The breakfast is ok.
There's a not detectable but constant smell overall the hotel premises.
The hotel has a convenient location, 5 minutes walking from the Casa Port station and 10 minutes walking from the medina.

Our flight was changed by the airline late in the game, so we booked this hotel as a last minute addition to our trip.. all of the hotels booked were budget range so we are not expecting all the bells and whistles, just a simple room to stay that is free of pests.. and this is what this place was.. the hotel is very large, the elevator indicated 10 floors.. we were given a room on the 7th floor (75) m, which had partial water views from their balcony.. The shower curtain was not as wide or as long as the open side of the shower, so water got everywhere each time we used it.. breakfast was not included with our suite, so we opted to pay to add it, it was 7 euros per person and included a make to order omelette. A couple bread items were stale and some were fresh.. made us question the freshness of the sausage and cheeses, so we just avoided those.. booking.com had a note saying that the note may or may not charge us a ‚Äòcity tax‚Äô.. we were charged this, it was approx $5 USD ( not exactly sure of the exact amount but not too bad) for 2 rooms. I was expecting worse as the pics online make the place look really stuffy and dusty, but it was bright and the beds that we got didn‚Äôt have the crusty looking lace frill. There was a person that was constantly cleaning the lobby, there was an elevator and a very diligent porter.. it was just ok.. I would try and look for somewhere else at the same price point if looking for a budget stay, if possible.. the place just seems impersonal for some reason.. but it‚Äôs still ok to consider as a budget option. After 1 night, we moved to Ryad 91, which we much preferred over this place.

Reception are bastards
they gave me a single room while we were 2 people !!
they counted extra charge for 2nd person
communication is so bad, impolite, stupid all staffs
no hot water, no wifi connexion
they didnt want to cancel my stay and told me to pay 7 days if I want to go so I CALLED THE POLICE;
The hotel insulted me and behaved in really bad manner. No good manner, really pitiful, I was with an old person and made us wait for a long time. They didnt change the bedroom, they didnt fix de wifi, they didnt want to give me back my passport !!

BE CARREFUL, THEY ARE VERY DANGEROUS. when the police went, they kept saying bad words.

Also, the person who pick the luggage is bad person, he said to us many bad things about the owner but when he saw us leaving just after 1 day, he didnt help for the luggage.

They saw 2 women and they wanted to control us. DONT RECOMMAND HERE AT ALL, this hotel should be reported as dangerous
Stayed only for one night and it was the most miserable stay

review title: wifi doesnt work, water doesn't work, water go out, broken chairs windows, no ac!
review: horrible hotel!! the place needs lots of repairs, water goes out, things are broken, the owners son is a rude person. i dont recommend at all.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Casablanca!  The location was great, far enough away from the noise of the main beach, but close enough to walk or a short golf cart ride away.  The staff were super friendly and attentive.  They were always available to answer questions, and went above and beyond to help us if we needed something during our stay.  We loved the pool and the atmosphere of the hotel, very tropical, with lots of wildlife and beautiful vegetation.  There were beach chairs out every day to enjoy.  The parking area had plenty of charging stations for renting a golf cart and was gated in the evening.  Nelson was helpful in the evening with letting us in and helping to get the cart plugged in.  He was super friendly to the kids and made arriving back at night more fun.  

The room was amazing as well.  We loved the small kitchen area with all of the amenities needed to have a meal at the hotel.  The bedroom was cozy, and clean.  The bathroom was spacious as was the shower.  We had two little balconies and a nice view of the ocean from our room!  We will definitely be back in the future!

review title: A great hotel on the beach away from crowds but close enough to walk to everything!
review: We stumbled upon Casablanca and were so excited to be staying there!  It is a gorgeous property, friendly staff, and great location!  Large rooms with kitchenette and living area, 2 balconies, right on the beach, away from the crowds, but walkable to everything!  We will be coming back for sure!  Thank you for a great stay!

We loved this hotel! We stayed in the penthouse and enjoyed the gorgeous space and the friendly staff! They offered daily housekeeping and nightly security! Our room and view were stunning! Our stay was definitely authentic to Sayulita and we will be coming back to stay again!

Recently stayed at the Casablanca and had a lovely time. Our group made the mistake of looking at the recent reviews on here and completely panicked days before our trip to Sayulita. We were so pleasantly surprised by everything the hotel had to offer. We had two different room types, one in building A (furthest from the beach) a few floors up, and the other in a building closer to the beach on the ground floor. Both rooms were great. True, the ground floor rooms are a bit darker because of the lush plants on the property, but they're still great rooms. We actually reread some of the terrible reviews while relaxing poolside and found them to be kind of crazy and hilarious. If I had to guess, the people who wrote them have never been to Mexico. We did not have a sewer smell from our bathroom, but the times I have had that in Mexico, it was when I was flushing toilet paper - so it makes me wonder if that was the culprit for folks who have complained about that. We left food out on the counter and did see some tiny tiny little ants the next morning, but they disappeared when we put the food in the fridge. The rooms are bright white, and I loved it, it feels very clean. The sheets and towels were fine, but the beds are quite firm (we never had problems getting to sleep, but they are firmer than I'd like). The pool was clean and the beach is a quick stumble away from even the furthest room. We really enjoyed this hotel and will absolutely stay here again! In our experience, after staying in several hotels and airbnbs in town, this location in Sayulita is the best! The only things I would change are the beds, and I would love if they had some sort of fridge behind reception where you could buy canned cocktails, drinks and snacks!

We did not have a pleasant stay at the Casablanca Hotel.  In a nutshell, the bed was a board, sheets scratchy, had almost no remaining bottled water and the towels were ripped, stained and threadbare.  The toilet paper is in the same holder and of the same quality as a gas station.  No dish towels and a tv with no remote.  Everything I looked for, was not there.  At every turn, I felt like the owners were saying ‚Äúwe want to spend as little on you for your stay as possible.‚Äù  The shame is that it would not take a lot of money to make the rooms quite comfortable; new beds, linens, some decent tissue and ensuring the room is well stocked.  I will say the front desk is helpful and the grounds are absolutely stunning but we won‚Äôt be staying again.

Hard pass‚Ä¶. We went for the new year.  Left 2 days early.  Place was all painted white so everything showed.  Reasonably priced but expected it to be nicer with all the good reviews.  The only place I would stay is the main house where you have access to the pool on the beach.

Majority of the staffs were friendly and tried to be helpful, the room equipped with the cookware, flatware, mini fridge and a 5 gallon purified water dispenser. I booked a room for 7 days for 4 people. It was not a 5-or 3-stars hotel so I didn‚Äôt set too much expectation. Staffs at front desk ( daytime) knows English but the rest of staffs don‚Äôt. My standard for hotel is to have a clean room - that's it. Other reviews mentioned the place is dated; it's fine with me. The staffs are trying their best to keep it up, however:

The staircases were not safe for young children, there were trails but the gaps were very big; kids could climb out or fall off from there, so be aware. 

Wifi was slow, as the rest of Sayulita. Do not expect to come here to work remotely if your work requires good bandwidth.

The A/C (heat pump unit) in my room was not working at the night of day 3.  It dripped water for like 30 mins then making noises for another 30 mins - alternating between water dripping and noise making for the rest of the time from 2 am until the next day. I reached (8ish am) out the front desk for help. After a staff fixed it, the A/C was not able to be turned on with the universal remote control on the evening, probably it was reset, not sure.  I was desperate because it was like 38C even at night time, tried to ask the front desk but no one was there except the security guard. He was not able to help because he didn‚Äôt speak English. Thus, I returned back to room and tried to figure out what was going on. Then, I realized that the remote control was out of sync/reset. There was no English instruction manual found online for that brand - only Spanish. Good thing was the remote worked the same  way as most of the other universal remote control. Checking some YouTube videos for the setup helped and also figured the ‚Äúchannel‚Äù code of the A/C brand from the Spanish instruction manual (mirage brand - code 027 or 028) to sync it back then it worked properly.

Starting on day 4, the room was not provided enough bath towels :( - some reviews mentioned that too. I had 4 people but only 2 towels provided. I went to ask the front desk (around 8ish pm) but there was no one except the security guard again. So I tried to talk with him using google translate. After he understood my intention, he was so nice that he went out to another staff‚Äôs house for asking help. That staff, who was mainly responsible for maintenance/repair, was already done for his day and I believe he lives close by the hotel since they both came back within 5 mins) He was able to give me extra towels I needed . Sadly, I still didn‚Äôt get enough towels again for day 5. I didn‚Äôt want to bother asking for help again. Every time that I found out the missing towels was already in the evening and the poor security guard couldn‚Äôt help much besides asking another staff for help. Also it wasn‚Äôt his fault. I think it is some thing that the cleaning staffs should be aware of - attention to the detail. 

The pool itself doesn‚Äôt look that clean, there were debris (like plants, bugs, etc.).  I saw the staffs sprinkled chlorine powder in the pool once. The water was not so clear which could be told by the water color. It feels like the pool needs a few maintenance - water refresh , fixing the missing or cracked tiles on the pool. In certain part of the pool, you may be able to smell strong paint smell, which I believe (just my assumption) that the room‚Äôs floor may be painted every time a guest is checked out from a room since the floor of my room had 0 scratches  on day 1 but as long as someone opened the patio door, the door will definitely scratch easily the floor.

Some reviews mentioned that the bathroom smelled like sewage. It was unpleasant, I tried to avoid it propagating out of the bathroom by closing the toilet lid and close the shower door accordingly. 

Hot water in shower will run out after 2 people took shower in a row ( max 10 mins) but it will come back after waiting like 10-15 mins, so plan the time accordingly. Good thing is in the middle of the summer so i didn‚Äôt mind to take cold shower. 

I would like to give a good review, among all the points I brought up above I could handle them, not a big deal‚Ä¶ However, the only one thing that was unbearable was bug. The room itself has a lot of tiny bugs (grain of sand sized, looks like ant but not sure) crawling everywhere ( on the kitchen counter, floor, behind the couch, closet, coffee table etc.) l completely understood  that the weather was hot and having bugs was unavoidable, but the amount I saw in the room made me very uncomfortable. The patio doors and the unit door had no seal. Basically there were gaps on the top and bottom of the door could let any bugs come in. There were also a gecko and a beetle visiting the room once. I didn‚Äôt dare to touch anything or leave anything on anywhere because of those tiny little bugs. Also I prohibited anyone ate in the unit to attract more bugs to come. When I left an item on the table I had to shake violently it a lot to make sure no more bugs. When I packed my luggages, I had to empty them all and make sure I didn‚Äôt bring any bug around.

After 5 nights of stay, I decided to leave the hotel, I did not want to make a fuss. The place was cheap but I rather paid a bit more to stay in another hotel so that I could end well my vacation for the last 2 nights. I didn‚Äôt ask for a refund for the rest of 2 nights. I understand life is hard, especially after COVID happened and everyone should show sympathy. I just don‚Äôt want to make a big deal out of it because it was not the staffs‚Äô fault. However, I would like others know what they are signing up for. Everyone has different tolerance on different things, this hotel may work for some but not others.

Casablanca was a wonderful out of the way hotel right on the beach. It is not a resort. The hotel is an older, traditional style building(s) with a pool in the center of the two buildings. The suites have plenty of room for two with all the amenities to be comfortable for your stay. It is quite a walk to the main plaza but there are several restaurants close by as well as markets for groceries. The beach is right in front. Never felt crowed and all we came across were gracious and friendly. If there was any negative, the WIFI is not ‚Äúhigh speed‚Äù but didn‚Äôt impact anything we needed. The transportation company that works with the hotel has top notch drivers. Loved it!

I stayed here for 8 nights with my extended family, we had 4 rooms including the penthouse.
This place is magical, we all loved it here. 
Communication was great before we arrive with Octavio and when we arrived. The woman at the front desk was very welcoming, 
 my husband and kids went fishing with her husband , a great experience , later we had dinner at the penthouse with the fish that a woman who works at the hotel prepared, all was delicious.
Would definitely return, loved it here. 
I slept so great here with the sounds of the ocean

We visited Casablanca restaurant on 06/08/25.

The food was first class , with good vegetarian options for my wife ..

Our food and drink orders were delivered timeously , and staff were very attentive .

If in Kusadasi we‚Äôd highly recommend visiting this restaurant ..

They also have a hotel pick up/ drop off service which is complimentary ..

What a brilliant experience, we went to watch the women‚Äôs Euro finals and what a great atmosphere. The staff are amazing, the food is delicious and an added bonus is they will also pick you up from your hotel and drop you back off. It is a family run business and you can tell that they put everything into it. Thank you so much for an amazing experience, we will definitely be returning. A special mention goes out to Harry for looking after us, we wish you all the best.

We ate at this restaurant last night as a family of 6, ranging from 7 to 69 years old. Every single one of us thoroughly enjoyed our food and the cocktails were also amazing. They even went above and beyond and created a bespoke cocktail just for me! A special mention to Harry who was very polite and welcoming to our whole family and the fact the restaurant pick you up and drop you back to your hotel free of charge is a massive bonus. Will definitely be returning!!

‚∏ª

Friendly staff and a bonus that they pick you up and take back to your hotel. The staff are so welcoming especially Harry. The menu has good options for both adults and little ones, and the relaxed vibe makes it easy to enjoy a meal with the whole family.
One of the best places I have eaten by far! Great staff very pleasant and helpful! Great with kids! Definitely rate this place 5 stars! Well worth a try when you are in the area

Lovely food and AMAZING customer service. 
Picked us up from hotel, and took us back after some shopping too. 100% recommend

review title: People, food and drinks, atmosphere 10 of 10!! Highly recommended ‚ù§Ô∏è
review: Casablanca Restaurant ‚ù§Ô∏è we was there in juli 2025 - amazing food, friendly and helpful people, good service and great atmosphere with lots of smiles üòÄ we ate mixed kebabs with chicken and beef and food was delicious 10 of 10! Peaple who work there and take care of us make this place ‚Äûlike in home‚Äù. We cone back there 100% next time when we come to Kusadasi :) best regards from Joanna, Lukas and Nikodem from Troms√∏ üòá

Great place to eat EN we enjoyed EN , plates were full and tasteful, kids have eaten lekekr and carbonara was very tasty definitely recommended. Staff very friendly they always have time for a chat. When we are back in Kusadasi we will definitely come and eat there again.
It's a good spot for chefs with excellent palate, entertaining waitstaff with excellent behavior, good talk, good work for your health... üôÇ Recommendations
You will not experience better food and hospitality anywhere! Great food, amazing service! *****. They even pick you up and drop you off FOC!

review title: and yet another visit to my favourite restaurant
review:
I go to this restaurant every time I visit Kusadasi which is probably all i need to say.
The food is and always has been exceptional and the staff are friendly and attentive.
Defo the best I have tried in Kusadasi

It was great night, they are made us day. Magic tricks, good stuff, kitchen... Specially foods are amazing. If you need recommand try the all about the shish kebaps. I will come back again thats why. Thanks for everything guys.
I couldn‚Äôt recommend this restaurant enough. Plenty of choices on the menu and very reasonably priced.  The staff were very friendly and attentive.

When we visited this restaurant we didn‚Äôt know what to expect but to say we where delighted is an understatement the food was delicious portion sizes where big and prices where very reasonable, everything freshly cooked and staff are so friendly. We went back twice again , Harry stole our hearts and we will always remain friends the son we never had‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è , we highly  recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Kusadasi its family run beautiful food and friendly staff that can‚Äôt, the glynn family infinity uncle Paul Jess jayde Amelia Katherine

We are staying at the batihan beech resort and spa, mustafa visited the pool area and offered us free pick up and drop off. (You are also free to go shopping/drinking before or after eating, and return for free lift) the food is amazing, the staff are on the next level making you feel so welcome and the cards and magic tricks make it a special night. We decided to go again a few night later and the night was just as amazing the kids loved it here and we have just booked to return for a 3rd night. They make you feel like part of the family I cannot rate this place high enough, if this restaurant was back home this would definitely be the go to restaurant, go you won't be disappointed.

The Movenpick in Casablanca was a nice spacious room near the Arab League Park. The staff was very friendly and the pool on the upper level was a nice reprieve from the warm Casablanca sun. We were able to walk to nearby restaurants and it was a great value for the price.

Good 5* hotel, well located in the immediate vicinity of the tram T1.
I appreciated the welcome I received from Amr Kallini, Managing Director and his teams.
The staff is friendly, smiling and professional.
I had the honor of being upgraded EN suite with attention in my room.
The room is comfortable with new bedding, a mattress topper and soft DE pillows allowing to spend a very restful night.
I really liked the restaurant on the 16th floor where I could taste a very good shrimp tagine for dinner and a hearty and fresh Caesar salad for lunch.
The 16th floor has an open-air swimming pool that I couldn‚Äôt enjoy for lack DE time, with a panoramic view of Casablanca.
Breakfast is buffet style, with choice and orange juice pressed on request.
Anyway, I had a great time at the M√∂venpick and I would love DE come back during my next visit to Casablanca.

A big thank you to Hassan the butler of the restaurant ‚Äúle sixteeni√®me‚Äù for its friendliness and efficiency, it feels like home! Not to mention the team which is very friendly too, ‚Äúthe place to be‚Äù if you reside at the Mov√´npick hotel and want to spend a most pleasant time

It is the third year I am visiting the hotel. Perfect location, the rooms are quiet and clean. Friendly people.
The best part of the hotel is the 16th floor Roof top. Amazing view of the city. The restaurant is one of the best I ever have been. Tasty and quality food, the service is amazing the manager is a wonderful person who really cares to make your experience unforgettable. Very polite and professional staff they get and deliver your order fast. A place you must visit to have an unforgettable evening under the stars.

I had a wonderful stay at M√∂venpick Hotel Casablanca. Everything was perfect ‚Äî the comfort, cleanliness, service, and overall atmosphere.

A special thank you to the Guest Relation staff, who was truly exceptional throughout my stay. Always kind, professional, and attentive, with a warm smile that makes you feel at home. You can really tell she loves her job and cares about the guests.

Thank you for your kindness and support ‚Äî you truly make a difference!

I highly recommend this hotel and will definitely come back.

Warning ** Backpackers Hotel **

If you like to be stressed out, then stay here! 

The worst possible stay I have had in 20 years! NO Air conditioning working, I changed my room multiple times and still there was no AC working.  

The engineer came to repair the AC, however all he did was push the temp up and down several times and that was it.  Not exactly technical he never returned and when I asked him later on whats going on, he said it was fixed! Nothing of the sort‚Ä¶ NO AC! 

As a Platinum Accor member, no amnesties were given not even water in the room.  I requested water several times and in the end, went to buy some myself from the shop outside.
