The iron was from the 1970‚Äôs with some of the electric cords visible and deep cuts in the earth cable, had I not seen this and plugged it in, I would have had an electric shock.

The bathroom was dismal and no way this hotel can say they are a 5 star! Its really impossible.  You need to use all the towels on the floor to keep it dry because the glass is missing the rubber seal from the bottom, so all the water seeps out, this was present in all the rooms.

The service is absolutely zero, breakfast is a waste of money.  The valet could not find the car for 20 odd minutes only to tell me he parked it in another street and gave me directions to the car. 

I moved hotels to the Marriot Courtyard, absolutely spot on! No issues and they went above and beyond to accommodate me, even I am not a Bonvoy member but for sure shall be!

I am expecting some form of lame excuse from the hotel, as after I checked out they wanted to resolve the issue! A little too late! You lost a customer, not that you care.  For sure I shall take this up with Accor as the hotel falls far beyond the expectations, even the Ibis has better rooms and better service.

review title: Service and people at the front desk are very good
review: We had a great stay at this hotel the extremely professional reception staff warm and always ready to render service
It is a wonderful hotel and especially the service of the reception I recommend it to everyone thanks Movenpike hotel

Very welcome. Caring and friendly staff. Food on top. I recommend.thank you hahar guest relation for your support
Very welcome. Caring and friendly staff. Food on top. I recommend.thank you hahar guest relation for your support

Personal very professional in all their functions, I take the opportunity to leave a special thanks to all the employees, especially the team directed to the roof part where is the pool that made this stay result in a super great and very pleasant experience.

I actually went here for dinner and then breakfast.

Nice ambience and setting indoors. Aircon was quiet and the right temperature.

Waitresses were attentive and confident in their tasks.

There was a specials blackboard and i selected the Tomahawk pork chop. Presented well but being quite thin it was overcooked and dry. 

For breakfast I had the English breakfast. Hmmmnnnn strange looking and stringy mushrooms that were yuk. Serioulsy a hungarian sausage on an English breakfast. 

The wine cellar boasts a big selection of European wines. Despite a chalk board sign saying Sauvingon Blanc there wasn't a drop in the hose. Now European wine doesn't cut it for me. The beer was nowhere cold enough as it's from a refrigerator. It's opened constantly and the beer should be on ice.

Now the owner is Austrian so that may explain the wine choice and Eurpean sausage for breakfast. But really it's not rocket science to make a plain sausage. 

I'm afraid the foundation of the business being foood and beverage is letting this place down.

It‚Äòs worth a try when you are in Dumaguete! We ordered the Daily Special Menu and the famous Schnitzel. The special menu was Sweet Potato Soup, Tofu Salad an Spinach Spaetzle with breaded Onions. Everything tasted very delicious and the price was also great!! Again, worth a try!
We have been here several times, and have never, ever been disappointed. The food, the service, and even the ambiance is first rate.

Had the tenderloin steak medium rare and was the best steak I've ever had here in the philippines. Wife had pork ribs and fish menu for relatives from the philippines in Dauin. Was a delightful and delicious meal without a doubt. Cabernet sauvignon wine was nice and smooth. Very happy with the food and service. Didn't take long to serve our meals either. Would definitely recommend Casablanca for a great dining experience!

Ambiance was very pleasing from walking in. Waitresses were  smiling and greeted us with a warm welcome. They answered questions as if knowing already what our was going to be. Fresh bread with butter and jelly. Food was delivered in a timely fashion, done to perfection.

review title: Good or bad depending on whose working
review:
The good news is the selection and quality of the food is generally top-notch. It's one of the few restaurants where you can get a real U.S. ribeye steak.
The bad news the quality of service is hit or miss. It depends on who's working the tables on that particular day. There's no consistency in service. One day it's outstanding the next day you basically have to chase down the staff to get anything done. Staff is present but they seem to be there just for a paycheck, too busy talking to the security guard or they are glued to their cell phone.
To add insult to injury the restaurant charges a minimum of 20 pesos for each leftover bag/container you want to bring with you. Talking about ‚Äúnickel diming‚Äù and squeezing every paso they can out of a customer. Believe me, there are much better restaurants within walking distance where the quality of service is better and consistent. Plus you don't feel squeezed for every Paso in your pocket.

I spend time at the restaurant between my flight and ferry. I had the seared tuna starter with pepper and sesame which was AMAZING. Super fresh fish and very generous portion for a starter. Was almost tempted to go back the next day when I was stuck in town because of the weather.

This was a really good place until it was sold to a Filipino owner. As is standard in the PH the new owners have not followed the original owners excellence. Food is a Filipino version and is sub standard. My favourite dishes are gone replaced the the usual unhealthy crap that is the norm here. It‚Äôs tasteless and clearly using substandard ingredients. Don‚Äôt waste your time. Not for taste decerning foreigners with realistic standards of health and food quality

This is one of the few places in dumaguete where you can get some good food. 
Unfortunately my experience was a bit mixed. I waited 20 mins for a coffee although there was just another table busy. I had to get up and walk in to get things moving. Another time one of the waitress was rude and clearly doesn‚Äôt enjoy working there. 
Shame because the food was fine and the other staff would smile at times. 
Sans Rival next door as it‚Äôs name would suggest it is way better and not more expensive so far.

Casablanca is one of my favs in Dumaguete. I was last here in 2019 and returned several times this year.

Always consistently good food and service. Food is always really good, staff friendly and attentive, you can‚Äôt go wrong coming here and should be on your list of places to try.
been here a few times. friendly staff. great ahi tuna ap. food generally very good,probably best on the boulevard in Dumaguete

Tuna steak is fire.   It's a nice little place with inside and ou seating.     Best place I've ate here so far.  Prices are reasonable.  Ac works really well might I add.  It was 103 today when I got here

Great location right on the Boulevard. Excellent menu - recommend tuna steak, cooked to perfection. Fabulous service and nice atmosphere. Great range of very good wine and bottled German beers. Tap beers fine.
We have and will return...
good group platter for family, very  good , good portion,  good value,   service was frendly and fast
Good Restaurant good hole day breakfast friendly staff. Best place and location to relax and drink a Heiniken draft Beer and watch the boulevard seen !
Nice place with really morrocan vibes. The drinks were good and the show that the girls made was amazing. I recommend you to check it out.

review title: I love too much atmosphere and service and thank you for Abdellah wazin Beautiful welcome üëçüèªüôèüèª
review: I love too much and to remake InchaAllah and thank you for waiter Abdellah wazin for his kindness and welcome to the next time InchaAllah

10/10 in terms of food and experience ! Very friendly staff (our server Marwan was very attentive and accommodating!), the singer and dancers were incredible. Would recommend asking for a table on the upper level for larger families (especially with kids), the view and atmosphere is great. Overall it is clearly maintained by a very detailed-oriented staff, from the ushers that greet you from the street in traditional dress to the entertainers and attentive waitstaff.  Must see spot in Casablanca!

Beautiful restaurant ü©∑ü©∑
We had a great mom ENt with family in an exceptional setting!... The dishes were delicious, well served and very fragrant. The tagine was tender and full DE flavors, and the couscous really successful. The staff is very welcoming and smiling! A huge THANK YOU to Abderrahim and ayoub Lotfi!
The setting is very nice and typical. You feel like everything is done with care. I recommend this restaurant very much!!!
Thanks again...
A happy family

review title: 4. Dar Dada: an authentic experience not to be missed
review:
An exceptional culinary experience in the heart DE Dar Dada! Each dish was a real delight, refined and tasty, with a careful presentation that reflects the authenticity and know-how DE Moroccan cuisine.
A big thank you to the waiter Abdellah Elouazani, of remarkable kindness and professionalism. He knew how to make our meal even more pleasant by his attention and smile.
I highly recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for an unforgettable dining experience in Casablanca. Congratulations to the whole team!
The food is very good, the atmosphere is very warm and the service, Ab DEllah Ouazzani member of the team is very caring and very attentive.
Delicious food! Younis was very attentive. Good ambience too. We tried three different tagines. All were very tasty!!
Great experience, I loved it. The people are very nice, the service is impeccable. Beautiful decor. I love it! I'll be right back.

Their service was top-notch, the food was delicious, especially the chicken porridge. Just suggested adding the mushrooms of Mony
I would love to try again
Amazing meal and wonderful service. A big thank you to Marouan! We had mixed salads, and the mezze, both were fantastic. Tajine and cous cous also great.

review title: Bad experience - I do not recommend ps at all
review: We were not able to eat there because despite an advance reservation you are obliged DE order a starter a main course and a dessert each even if you are not as hungry. Otherwise you are kindly requested DE leave the establishment! I am not talking DE the external environment. HORRIBLE I do not recommend at all.
I like the morrocan tea guy he‚Äôs very friendly and talented. I can feel the moroccan vibes in this place. I felt like iy‚Äôs a lot for me
Served by Younes, perfect service, nice and with lots of attention. Thank you very much, and especially to Younes for an awesome evening!

review title: Thanks to all the teams you are at the top
review:
A real nugget! Warm atmosphere, top service and simply delicious cuisine. Each dish is a journey for the taste buds. I will return without hesitation! üëå
Sorry, I forgot the server names, but I would like my comment to be dedicated to the entire server team. Thank you for your hospitality and professionalism.

The place is great and thanks to Koather and the gentle Abed for their service and help with the food test 
Atmosphere, homes, spirit, furniture and everything 
Will visit again

"We stayed at the Novotel Casablanca for a business trip and were really impressed by the quality of service and the comfort of the rooms. The room was clean, well decorated and equipped DE everything we needed. The staff was very welcoming and professional, always ready to help us. Breakfast was delicious and varied. We highly recommend

I enjoyed the cleanliness of the rooms
The hotel is well located in the city center next door 
DE la Gare casa port and various stations DE transport.the neighborhood is clean and secure, the staff is attentive.
I recommend

Clean hotel, my room was well arranged every morning, and clean.
When I arrive, in the evening nothing is missing, clean towels, the room fragrant.
The staff is attentive.
I recommend for cleanliness and proximity

review title: "Perfect stay at Novotel Casa City Center
review: "Excellent stay at Novotel Casa City Center. The room was clean, comfortable and well equipped. The service was professional and the staff always friendly and attentive. Very well located in the heart of Casablanca, ideal for both business trips and for tourism. I highly recommend.

The room facilities old and dirty, small and uncomfortable space, Staff at reception demonstrated poor service. Towels worn out, toilet 1√ó1 m, no bidet or Shattaf to self wash in the toilet, parking is not easily available and not convenient

Hotel very well located in the center of casablanca. The rooms are comfortable and clean especially the d3l new floor which offers an amazing view.The staff is very friendly and attentive if all the boys in reception and the room maids.

review title: Thanks again to the whole team.
review:
The rooms were clean comfortable and well equipped. the staff was always available and ready to help us.
We highly recommend this hotel.

I had a great stay at the Novotel 
Casablanca, the location is perfect, close to shops and transport. 
The staff is very friendly, always available.The room was spacious, clean and impeccable for optimal comfort.

Hotel in renovation work restaurant, but as usual guest I can change hotels thanks to the proximity and impeccable service 
My room on the 14th floor was clean.the maid is attentive to any additional request.
The breakfast always up to standard.

We had a great stay at this hotel! The staff was very welcoming and helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable.
Thank you for your kindness.

Great choice in Casablanca, Chile!
In addition to having a very good food, the Macerado had the kindness to wait for us to serve our lunch, in full Sunday at 17:15. We ate a delicious meat, prepared in a wine-based sauce, with edible flowers and rustic potatoes. The wine was good, the service was very good and the place is welcoming, as it seems that we are eating at the house of family or friends. 
I recommend

I thought the place was good but it was a bad experience, they made many mistakes. The entrance was a machas a la parmesan were very cold and without much flavor. The juice was normal to bad. The soup was cold even though I mentioned that I wanted it very hot. The bottom dish the worst, hard meat, the dish was also cold they reheated it and yet it was not in a good temperature, the dish was not good it had no taste of anything, I could not eat it. They gave no explanation. The only good thing was the waitress's attention. This place has a lot to improve.
A warm welcome on a rather cold day. The octopus as a starter, excellent. Natural apple juice‚Ä¶ Lady and Jaime are super friendly!!
Excellent blend of flavors, flexibility to add options that didn't appear on the list and rich atmosphere, we will definitely come back!, a 10

I'd been there years ago and I didn't like it. I went again and again I didn't like it.

Entrance to the restaurant without car or wheelchair access. Then, we asked if they could heat some noodles for my girls (somewhat tricky) and the answer was no, they only did it with the strains...

Regarding meals I stand out in the negative: 

- Mix of oysters and clams to the Pacific, came cold seafood, cheese idem and commenting on the problem we respond that it was normal because they were frozen...
Chardonnay sour without flavor, more like a lemonade, even requesting correction.
Unflavored grilled steak, with only a cherry tomato.

The rest of the dishes ordered were good: Rabbit, pea cream, tasty but cold tomahawk.

Nice and cozy place. Well presented dishes.

I hope you will improve the points regarding criticism as they have potential for improvement.
Anyway, I'm not going a third time.

review title: Very good place to eat in a very pleasant atmosphere
review: Very rich the place, the atmosphere for lunch is perfect, the food exquisite, the meat ready and very well prepared and the attention of Renata excellent...a place highly recommended!

review title: Visit Macerado, you will not regret it.
review: Macerado presents a rich menu in well-designed flavors. His experience is gourmet from the entrance to the end. I highly recommend Brownie's dessert. Attention is essential in the experience as all the people who attend are experts in making your visit unique. Let's hear it for Javier as a waiter, another level. If you are in Casablanca, do not hesitate to visit Macerado.

Beautiful place, elegantly decorated house of fundo. We ate 4-stroke menu, exquisite includes wine for each tasting time.
Excellent attention Miss. LADY very attentive and helpful. Good service and tasty food are appreciated.
Beautiful place to come to eat with family. A wonderful, four-stroke lunch with some exquisite wines. Excellent service!

Wonderful place, fabulous food and 5 stars attention, accommodated to our tastes with small changes that are always grateful.

Thank you very much to everyone for the amazing attention.

Excellent place, great food, pleasant service. In a very nice setting. Country house.  I found it great that a rooster was walking among the tables, without seeming to disturb the presence of the diners of the restaurant.

The garden is an excellent place to share. Very quiet atmosphere and a menu with first class food.  
I recommend the pinot sour!! üòã

Good choice for lunch on the way to vineyards, dishes at their right point, attention from the first people, make you feel comfortable and pleasant, always attentive.
I recommend it 1000%!!
Thank you for the lovely experience
I'll be right back!!...

Mary bad experience, the food was cold, apparently from the refrigerator they put it on the plate, and upon requesting the solution, they gave her minutes from the microwave and ready. They did not provide a solution that would deliver the letter's request. The poor entrance. The net carp had no meat just ornaments. Total disappointment 
Low paid 79k for two people didn't even cast a ballot

review title: A great option to get out of the routine.
review: It is place itself is beautiful, beautiful garden, the restaurant decorated country...very pleasant. The attention is attentive and worried that you feel at ease. And what to say about their exquisite food, all the dishes we tasted very well prepared and fresh and at good temperature. It's better to book. I highly recommend it!

We had trip on July 21 to 28 7 day
The service was so good and room was so clean we love RIU party we will go again

review title: Been here 8 times since 2009 and will return again. Two week stay this time and could have stayed longer
review:
View from this resort is spectacular. The view of the mountains that make this lands end are quite a site from the beach area. This resort is within walking distance (for most) of Cabo San Lucas marina which has numerous restaurants and shops for all budgets. The boats in the Marina are a sight in themselves, Nice to see how the other half live and boy are they living. Cabo Wabo is a great evening spot for those they like the night life - very enthusiastic vibe here, music is great and dancing is good exercise.

I have stayed at the Riu Sante Fe numerous times and have never been disappointed. Cleanliness is a definite 10 out of 10. Staff were all very pleasant - I have to mention Conny from the beachside restaurant - she made our morning breakfast such a pleasure each day. She eventually learned my friends name was Gaz.

We requested a room in building 7 and they were able to accommodate us during check in. As I get older I appreciate the elevator in building 7 more and more. We had a beautiful view of the peninsula. Room was clean, bed was amazingly comfortable - everything about the room was perfect. Water and drinks refreshed every day. Room is modern and fresh looking.

There are vendors on the beach selling various wares but they are not aggressive nor in your space, and their negotiated prices are fair.

The food in the buffet was all very good but for the first time I found it a bit limited in choice - I may be getting fussier as I age. Always found something to eat and always enjoyed our meals. Line ups at some of the stations for breakfast require a bit of patience - have your coffee first and relax - you're on vacation time.

This resort is geared towards a part atmosphere and it attracts a large number of late teen, early 20's. I am over 70 and I still love the vibe of the Riu Sante Fe. The kids were all respectful and there was no issue at all with noise for us. The younger crowd helps one feel more alive so don't be scared off when they say it is a party resort. Live a little, you won't be disappointed.

In 2024 I stayed at the Riu Sante Fe in March which is whale watching season. I have done that tour twice and seeing the whales is an amazing experience. I included a couple of pictures of the whales as well

Probably missed some stuff but everything about this trip was a positive so anything I missed would just be more incentive to come to the Sante Fe.

Nice place to stay, very clean, fun atmosphere, location is great. Staff was very nice, our housekeeper was great. Food was decent, didn't care for the specialty restaurants reservation process but we managed and were able to manage. We had a car so we ventured off resort a few nights for some food and entertainment. Entertainment was cool..thinking of returning as a group

This is my fifth or six time. At this hotel. I have always enjoyed it. I was there before the remodel. Now. The new remodel is even better. I enjoy this hotel a lot to staff. Everyone is very amazing from the bartenders. The waitresses, the housekeeping, the front desk, I would return again. If I could this year this year. They were SEVENTEEN of us last year. I had Eighteen of us in our group, and everyone has enjoy their stay here.
Great choice DE food and drinks, good internet service, quality staff, nice events, all excellent
This is a wonder place to vacation staff is very helpful, room was always clean and food was delish!!

review title: When you Riu Make sure you Santa Fe!!!!!!!!!!!!
review: When you Riu Make sure you Santa Fe!!!!!!!!!!!! The resort is absolutely gorgeous. It‚Äôs in the prime spot of Cabo just minutes from downtown. There‚Äôs a bit of walking, depending on what part of the property you are staying on the food is good not fine Dining but it‚Äôs good services is Great. It‚Äôs a plus if you know Spanish, but the employees do their best to help you with whatever you need. Excellent pool the tiki taco near the beach is awesome. The folks that usually work there are awesome and they are there to make you smile.

This was our first time staying at a Riu, and we chose the Riu Santa Fe in Cabo. We were beyond impressed! The all-inclusive experience is absolutely the way to go‚Äîgreat food, excellent service, and plenty of fun activities. The Riu parties were a blast, and the atmosphere was lively and welcoming. You definitely get your money‚Äôs worth here. We‚Äôre already planning to come back next year!

review title: Props to Fernando G at the front desk.
review: I just wanted to give a shout out to Fernando G. at the front registration desk. My wife got sick and needed some medicine that she just received a prescription for. Fernando helped us out, called the pharmacy, and had the meds delivered to the front desk. He spoke perfect English as well as we found out he grew up in SoCal. His customer service was exceptional. He went way beyond to help us out and saved us a trip from leaving the resort and getting lost. Thanks Fernando!!!

So, how to start the hotel itself correct. The rooms are ok good the cleaning is done but not spraining your wrist either, the smell in the rooms smells the enclosed moisture with heat..
level restaurant the correct buffet also drinks are degeu on the other hand juices in the morning not good at all soft either
Now the staff, friendly question must teach them I think they don't give a shit we call them they pretend not to hear, to ask to clean a table they dodge to order a coffee they take 30 minutes to bring back, not smiling not kind. Staff training needs to be completely reviewed. Not a single person DE gentile it‚Äôs sad they face the face when they serve we ask them one thing it looks like it makes them yech clearly.
No animation it‚Äôs sad for such a big hotel we get Ch**
No music at the pool..
the hotel is not crazy what better to do and improve and fast!

Anyway, we're not coming back.

review title: Basic rooms in a drab resort but convenient for parks
review: The rooms are basic and dated, there are shower gel and paper cups in the room but not much else. They are clean and contain a (very dated) security safe. We had a bath and shower. The window barely opens and there is a ceiling fan, which was adequate enough to cool the room but we expected AC for the price paid. The breakfast was basic (cheap sausages, bread, juices etc), long queues if you go from about 08:00 onwards. There are no coffee/tea facilities in the room but you can get one cup per day from a vending machine located in a couple of the blocks (not great quality). There is a small gift shop and starbucks at the hotel. It took us about 20 mins to walk to the park, we never used the shuttle bus. The hotel just feels drab and no real Disney magic here, such a shame it's not been updated. If you see it as it is (a reasonable distance from the parks and a comfy bed) then it'll do!
Great trip to Disney with the family. Conveniently located and clean and comfortable rooms despite being a bit dated.

2 nights , 2 adults , 2 children

Contrary to some reviews, we found our room very clean.

The bedding is super comfortable,

Simplistic but sufficient decoration.

I agree with the comments on the heat in the room almost untenable (yet 22/23 degrees outside).
The window only opens a few centimetres DE, which doesn't let air through.
The ceiling fan is not enough to refresh.

Apart from the warmth, our stay at this hotel was pleasant as well as the staff we have with.
Very nice staff and very clean room, small bed for 2 people, spacious bathroom DE
Thank you to the entire Disney team for making this stay so magical. Thank you also for all the attention paid to the birthdays DE my women during this unforgettable stay for them!!! ‚ú®

review title: 4 floor without elevator, outdoor stairs in the rain
review: Lovely place but 4 floor no elevator with outdoor stairs DA do in the rain with suitcases.

Very basic room, no tea and coffee facilities. No clear signage and long walk and stairs to room. Went as a grandma, daughter and two teenage children. Were given a room with just two double beds and no option to change to singles/double with two singles. No decent snack food or takeaway nearby, luckily McDonalds deliver to the hotel so we ordered in. Window only opens 2 inches and room reels very claustrophobic.

We had asked during our reservation that our 2 rooms be close to each other; when we arrived at the reception when I mentioned our request, I was told: "yes it's not a problem" but when we had our SMS with our room numbers it was not the case, we were not even on the same floor... The next day DE morning, my spouse who was sleeping on the DE floor was awakened by an alarm (type of alarm beep but incessant) from a technical room: it was horrible, it beeped VERY long... Finally, when we DEparted, we inspected DE's rooms to be sure we had not forgotten anything and what was our surprise to see under the children's bunk beds: 2 empty bottles of water that did not belong to us! It's not normal, at the price of the stay, we expect the cleaning to be done properly, it disgusted us... we will never come back to their hotel. As long as the extra hour in the park DE 8:30 to 9:30 for people staying in a hotel disney is DE scam because many attractions were closed: haunted mansion, train DE mine, pirate ships, pinocchio...so a queue DE 40mn for Peter pan since there was nothing open... You were actually trampling an hour DE more in the park looking for an open attraction... Huge disappointment and really the feeling of being ripped off...

We had 2 nights in Santa Fe, we knew what to expect as had stayed before.
Online check in & picking up tickets at the 'Express Luggage' allowed us to do all day at the parks before heading to hotel. At reception magic pass was authorised immediately no queues.

Room in block 47, top floor quiet as requested near the river. Room clean & tidy, yes it requires an upgrade if you look hard for fault. Bedding all good, window did open & fan was sufficient for the outside temperature. Bathroom toiletries required to be filled & bath could have been cleaned better.

We ate at La Cantina which was excellent both breakfast & dinner.

We walked to the parks every day 15/20 mins.

All in all another good trip & Santa Fe is a good low cost option for Disney

Great trip, pleasant stay.
Hotel themed DE very clean coaches and room and very friendly staff

review title: The hotel is no longer lovely little hotel - will not be returning
review: We stayed here over 10 times the last 6 years, we were loyal through COVID and remodels. No longer. This used to be a sweet, quality hotel when it ran as the independent Old Santa Fe Inn. Delish breakfast, well trained staff, all of the rooms were working. Avoid this at all costs, the price of the rooms doubled since La Fonda purchased it, which is strange as the quality of the amenities was downgraded, the staff hardly acknowledge you any more, the front desk cannot help solve small problems, and the quant 'little bistro' they added closes when they want (i.e. earlier than advertised).

Good location, parking on site, decent free breakfast, nice clean room, friendly and helpful staff. Internet is not reliable, however. That is the only minus and can be pretty annoying as it goes in and out.

This is a prime downtown location. The complimentary Breakfast was very satisfying with many options available. I enjoyed the happy hour specials on my first day. The property does not have a gym or pool on site, so I enjoyed walking for my daily exercise. The staff were very helpful and provide a map explaining how to walk around to various areas of interest. I felt safe walking in the area as the location was waking distance of many downtown areas of interests, including the Loretta chapel, the Rail Yard, and Canyon Road. After reading many reviews, I rented an suv to get around but only used it for other attractions not located in the downtown area. My room had a microwave and mini refrigerator that I put to use. I never used the tv. My only slight drawback was the sound that carried from other rooms. I could hear conversations in my bathroom and front door from nearby guest rooms. (My room was in the first floor in the corner.) It didn‚Äôt prevent me from sleeping but was a bit annoying. I‚Äôm glad no one had extended nocturnal activities. üòâ Overall I would recommend staying at this location, but I would choose another that has a pool and gym onsite for convenience. If this were not an important factor for me, I would return.

The location was within walking distance of everything. The rooms and grounds and breakfast areas are spotless. The homemade chile and fresh fruit made the breakfast . We got a room with a living room and bedroom. The comfort was with the extra.

review title: Good experience except for the resort fee
review:
Our 4th visit. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. Location is great. Good free parking.
Will probably always choose Pinon Court as our first choice on future visits.
The room #41 was wonderful, beds were comfortable, room was very clean. The gas fireplace was a nice addition to the room.

review title: Lacks Customer Care; Beautiful Hotel, great location!
review: There is something seriously wrong with the reservation side of this hotel. I made a reservation a week or two ago, and then couldn't find any confirmation so thought I must have been mistaken. So I made another reservation. After not receiving any confirmation after waiting an hour or two, I called the hotel. That's when I learned that I now had two identical reservations, so I asked them to cancel the most expensive one and send me a confirmation for the existing one. The confirmation consisted of a one paragraph statement of the dates with no mention of the rate. So I decided to cancel my reservation since by now I had Zero trust in the management. The website had an option to manage my reservation online so I tried to do that, but was foiled by the confirmation number that they sent me for the second reservation not being recognized by the system! So I called yet again to cancel and asked for a confirmation of my cancellation. They gave me number over the phone, but again never received a written confirmation. I will NEVER consider this hotel again and caution other possible clients to be very careful about proof of their reservations or cancellations.

Beautiful, clean, comfortable and great location!! Everything is within walking distance. I would stay here again but I'd be prepared in knowing that this is a "do it yourself" experience. I wanted to give it 5 stars BUT, the lack of customer service at the front desk brought the stars down! We needed help in getting walking directions and getting the lay of the land but each time we went to the front desk, the young lady was always on the phone. Even when the toilet was overflowing in the front lobby, I finally had to interrupt her on her call, to let her know, there was an issue. There was no "thank you for letting her know" or acknowledgment that I even existed. She totally lacked any interest in being helpful or friendly. Same with the night time person; didn't offer getting someone to help us, as we climbed deep stairs with heavy bags to our rooms. We had to point to brochures on the front desk and ask "are these maps?" with one word replies "yes" Again lovely place to stay just be prepared to not bother the staff. LOL.
Wonderful hotel - calm pleasant vibe. Low key but helpful, friendly and professional staff. Historic but nicely updated. Ideal location for exploring downtown and the Railyard. Great parking.

A quaint feeling and very comfortable hotel with great location providing easy walks to downtown and rail yard areas. Super friendly and helpful staff. Heard it was recently remodeled and they did a nice job capturing the essence of Santa Fe, old and new.

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review title: Worse Four Seasons I‚Äôve ever been to!
review: The worst experience ever! The front desk are clueless on what they are doing. One of them Carlos even hung up on me. They double billed me and overcharged me and the useless manager Andres couldn‚Äôt help me with an issue, completely useless. Argued with me for 30 min, the worst customer service skills. I spent over $3.5k for 2 night stay. Would never come back and don‚Äôt recommend this property!!

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review: We went for two nights on a girls trip and booked on Amex, over 3 k for two nights. The room is nice but the hotel is nothing special.  The worst part was the service. The hotel told us we have $100 credit and $70 per breakfast which we used. When we left the hotel told us that the credit did not apply as we didn't put incidentals on Amex and gave them a visa instead. They charged us an extra $270. When we called and said that we were never told that we need to give Amex for incidental (which we happly would have) the manager hung up on us! This is the worst experience at 4 seasons we ever had and that manager needs to get dismissed! He wouldn't give us the contact of his manager! We expect someone from 4 seasons to contact us right away as this is absolutely unacceptable.  We will not be staying at 4 seasons ever again.

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review: This is a beautiful property. Our room (casita???) was beautiful and elegant. The staff at the resort were all friendly and helpful. The food at the on-site Terra restaurant was excellent. I highly recommend the Dulce de Leche Warm Cake for dessert, but know that it's big enough for two people, so bring a friend! It was one of the best dessert experiences I have had anywhere.

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review: Everything about the place is beautiful, thoughtfully designed, etc, BUT the dinner I had last night was maybe worst dining experience.  Here's a brief summary:  It took 45 minutes to get 2 glasses of rose and two expensive reds to arrive.  Our waiter disappears.  We ordered 4 med-rare hamburgers with onion rings.  It took another hours to get our food (and we couldn't find a waiter to order more wine).  The bergers were tepid and VERY WELL DONE.  The buns were soggy on the bottom, dry non the top.  The onion rings were tepid and greasy.  The waiter apologized when delivering the food, and offered to comp the wine.  The bill, still $100, took another 30  minutes as the waiter had now disappeared.  We finally went to the reception desk to pay.  As I said, and awesomely beautiful lace to visit/stay, but PLEASE AVOID TERRA!

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review title: First experience was great at Four Seasons
review: Just incredible service from start to finish, beginning with the booking all the way through checkout. Resort is quiet, with excellent views to the Jemez Mountains, 30 miles away. Rooms were excellent--no notes. The resort is wonderfully secluded with great hiking trails behind it up into the foothills of the mountains behind it.

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review title: Terra at Four Seasons Rancho Encantado
review:
First experience at Four seasons rancho encantado was exceptionally wonderful. Local and had never been to this establishment but was invited by some neighbors  and thier family. Walking in to a friendly hello and welcome in by Mynor. We decided to have a quick lunch in the Terra restaurant. Hostess was personable (didn't get her name) We were waited on by Kevin who was always on top of our needs and had some great menu recommendations. Restaurant was fairly empty (surprised) since food and prices were fair. Had the Terra Burger and it was absolutely great! We preceded to walk the resort after lunch and walked to the Spa, very tranquil and relaxing as soon as you walk in. 
I can go on and on but I can say I will definitely be going back with friends to enjoy especially when the weather is warmer and can enjoy the patio.

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review title: Sophisticated and serene luxury retreat - with such great staff!
review: Dined at Terra restaurant with a friend. We were not guests at the resort but referred by a local friend. Went in for breakfast and sat in Terra bar, although small and quiet,  still welcoming. Restaurant staff were attentive and and accommodating ( gentleman and young lady server I did not get names but both sweet) We were welcomed with complimentary banana bread as we waited for our breakfast.  Breakfast dishes as expected and pricing not out of range. Will definitely be back on my next visit to Santa Fe to try lunch or dinner.

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review title: There is currently a large scale construction project going on.
review:
I stayed at the Four Seasons Santa Fe for an early Christmas trip with my partner and his parents, and we had an absolutely lovely time. This property definitely lives up to the Four Seasons name, and was a really relaxing and beautiful place to unwind for a few days in the high desert of New Mexico. The sunsets from the bar's terrace are breathtaking. The resort is a short drive (about 15-20 minutes) to downtown Santa Fe, and its about a 45 minute drive to Bandelier National Monument which was surprisingly cool as a self-guided day trip.

My partner and I stayed in a Rancho Suite, which was AMAZING, and my parents-in-law stayed in a Vista Casita. All of the rooms are recently renovated, and feel fresh, and have a modern, chic, and sophisticated style with a distinctly New Mexican touch. The Rancho Suite was incredibly spacious - huge, really - with a large living room, large bedroom, gigantic full bathroom / dressing area, and a separate powder room. And the signature Four Seasons mattress and bedding - honestly its my favorite part of staying at a Four Seasons! The Suite also had a large outdoor patio, and two fireplaces, one indoor and outdoor. I would highly recommend upgrading to the Suite, if possible to feel like you're really treating yourself. The Vista Casita, which my parents-in-law stayed in, was also incredibly tasteful and thoughtful in its interior design and furnishings - but I was just blown away by the suite! The difference between the Rancho Suite and Encantado Suite is apparently the view, with the Encantado Suite having one, and the Rancho Suite not. The view from the Rancho Suite was terrestrial, not too bad, with desert landscaping and such. It is worth calling and speaking to someone at the resort after booking if you are particular about your view - I was surprised to see the resort's layout after arriving, which isn't easy to understand from the online photos - some of the casitas look like they have views more directly onto the parking area, or are nearer to other casitas - while other casitas look like they are naturally positioned to be facing a more private direction. 

Two other great, and complementary, amenities of the resort are - you can reserve a private hot tub area via the spa - which we took advantage of each day - this might be harder to reserve when the resort is busy. And, there is a really scenic hiking trail that starts right from the resort, and has great views of the surrounding landscape, local plants, and wasn't too challenging for a novice (it had some steep bits, so at times a workout!) But, it was nice to do a hike without having to drive to a trailhead.

The service was superb, with all of the team being friendly, and making us feel welcome. Each night we had the "fire butler" come and light our fireplaces. The hotel also provides complementary s'more kits / marshmallow roasting kits, which was a really cute touch. The staff in the main lobby area were always kind and friendly, asking if we needed anything to help with our stay. The bar and restaurant staff were amazing, and were so friendly, remembering us day-to-day during our stay, etc. When we were greeted at arrival, one of the guest services managers met us personally, offered us sparkling wine, and after speaking with my mother-in-law about her interest in stargazing, offered to arrange a stargazing session with a local professor (which she did, and my mother-in-law loved it, but I have to note, we weren't told a price when reserving, and we didn't find it listed in the activity guide, and on our bill I saw that we were billed nearly $300. So, that was a bit of a surprise!). One thing we found hit or miss was the housekeeping service, especially in comparison with other Four Seasons hotels and resorts we've stayed at - during our four nights, a couple of the days the room cleaning and servicing was fine; but a couple days it felt lackluster or perhaps rushed - blankets not refolded and put away, outdoor furniture left a mess, living room furniture not resituated - just nothing "special" like at other Four Seasons' housekeeping where you get back to your room and think "oh how lovely!" or "what a lovely touch" or "I can't believe they even tidied my charging cables!". This is a small complaint and of course, the rooms were always clean, beds made, etc - you just expect a little bit "extra" touch with daily housekeeping or turndown when you're in this level of luxury hotel.

And last, a note on the restaurant and bar - the food and beverage is truly delicious at both - but it's worth noting, the prices, especially at the restaurant are sky high, which did make me question the price/value proposition of the restaurant and bar. For example, my father-in-law ordered a martini at dinner, and it cost $38. It wasn't uncommon for cocktails to be priced over $30 on the menu. Breakfast for two each morning easily cost my partner and me $100. That felt exorbitant - this isn't London or Paris, it's New Mexico... The food and beverage is priced higher than the Four Seasons Lanai in Hawaii for crying out loud lol! And unlike other Four Seasons, this resort didn't a offer more "casual" grab-and-go or cafe-style option that's more reasonably priced when you're not looking for fine dining. Even the bar menu was really pricey for what it was. That being said, there is a "happy hour" with a few "affordable" items to snack and drink on as you're watching the sunset, but just - well, be prepared to spend a lot on food and drink if you stay on property! And, you'll want to stay on property because it's so lovely!

Overall, we really enjoyed our time staying at Rancho Encantado - and would highly recommend it to someone looking for a luxury stay in the Santa Fe area. Despite a few small quibbles, it surpassed my expectations in almost every way!

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review title: Luxury in the Land of Enchantment
review: Be advised. There is currently a large scale expansion project going on.  The noise and pounding is unbearable and permeates throughout the entire building.  If you are looking for peace and quiet, this is NOT the place. Also the service level is about the same as the Holiday Inn, in other words, it is terrible. It takes 10 requests to get some ice sent to your room. This is the absolute WORST Four Seasons I have ever stayed at. Maybe the last.

place name: Four Seasons Resort Rancho Encantado Santa Fe
review: We stayed for a glorious four nights last month, loved it and can't wait to return. The casitas are lovely, comfortable and spacious, and the whole property feels like it fits in perfectly in the desert setting, as Four Seasons often do. We had breakfast at Terra every morning and food and service were always excellent, with a special mention for Estrella for providing wonderful and warm service to start our day. The food was also fantastic, and I am still dreaming of those blue corn pancakes. We had a wonderful and quiet dinner there one evening as well, where food wine and service again were exceptional. We used the hotel shuttle just about every day to drive us into town near the plaza or Canyon Road, and enjoyed chatting with Elijah and the rest of the drivers. We visited the spa every afternoon and loved the private courtyard sauna and hot tub, it was a great way to wind down before dinner; to sit in the courtyard under the sun and listen to the birds chirping. Overall, we can't say enough good things about it and look forward to coming back.

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review:
This used to be a nice hotel. No more.

I‚Äôll start by saying that I live in Santa Fe (30+ years). I was also in the hotel business for many years here. I understand historic old buildings and know they can be charming & challenging. But this hotel is an embarrassment.

I had to book a room last minute. I had to appear for a legal matter on a Zoom call and my Internet and phone both went out just hours before I was due to appear. My attorney called to make a reservation for me & explained I only needed the room for a few hours and really only needed a phone and internet. He was told to book online. He called back to let them know I was coming. I checked in at 1:45 for my 2:00 meeting. When I questioned the rate, I was told by the front desk manager that I should have booked the day rate. We would have if they would have taken our reservation when we first called. The front desk manager was rather unpleasant and refused to change the rate. Ok-I get it. But I expected the room to at least be adequate for a four diamond hotel.

The room was awful. Dark and drab, no adequate lighting. The hallway to my room was filthy with leaves and debris on the floor. The carpet in the halls and in my room were filthy. The bathroom wall was streaked with something disgusting next to the toilet. The furnishings were dated, dreary. The room was so smoky that I had to open all the windows to get decent air. The screen fell off. Both the sink and the tub were dripping water (we are very water conscious in the high desert). The light in the bathroom was broken. The windows were dirty. The air conditioner was so loud that needed to turn it off for my call but the room was so dark, I couldn‚Äôt find the thermostat.

I checked out after my zoom call at about 7:00pm. I asked the valet to please pull my car up to the front since I am disabled. I tipped him well to bring my car. Although there were no other cars there at the time, he left my car parked at the bottom of the hill with the keys on the visor. I asked the front desk to please check me out. They said it was ‚Äúall taken care of.‚Äù I asked for a copy of my charges. The girl went into the back and I waited and waited. When no one came back, I left. No one asked me about my stay or let me know what was happening. There was no one in the lobby or at the front desk. My clothes and hair reeked of smoke.

So about five hours of bad service and a really dirty dark smoke filled room for the low low price of $556.00.

As a Santa Fean who lives less than 2 miles from La Posada, I take great pride in my community. There are many lovely hotels in downtown Santa Fe but this hotel is truly awful. I hope management will take notice and realize that this hotel is in desperate need of renovation and proper maintenance and the staff needs training to represent what you claim to be a luxury property. Only the location gives this hotel anything noteworthy.

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review: The grounds are beautiful in the summer. The air conditioner worked well. It was very nice they upgraded our room to a suite.

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review:
Got in just after midday. Room was ready. That was a good sign, but the last one. Room had a fireplace and reeked of smoke. Somewhere outside/above the room there was a beeping noise about every minute, 24/7. The topper was a dirty rag hanging on the shower curtain rod. Went to the front desk. They said they would take care of all three. They replaced air filter in room. A little better with the smoke smell, but still not great. Maintenance came and somehow could not figure out how to stop the beeping. They had no solution for the noise, not even a new room available. I hardly slept all week. The dirty rag? I waited three days to see if they would take care of it. It stayed there until I knocked it on the floor (with a hangar), then it disappeared.

The pool was dirty, and we would not go in.

All in all a complete dud.

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review title: Quiet & Peaceful Elegance in the "Santa Fe" Style
review: Elegant but beautiful low-key campus-style resort with rambling pathways leading to guest rooms, pool, full-service spa, fountains and many "easter egg" vignettes and mini-plazas to enjoy and relax in. Pleasantly-rustic but functional room furnishings, exceptionally comfortable beds and pillows. Excellent food. Not cheap, but you get what you pay for.

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review title: Great La Posada Experience - a Go-To Place
review: Great experience. Glad to see that La Posada is still providing quality experiences. Walking distance to the Santa Fe plaza. Our go-to place when visiting the city. Our room was not ready when we arrived, so we just drove around to reorient ourselves with the areas around the plaza. Received a call when our room was ready and we returned to the hotel to unload our luggage and check in. Valet parking was great, employees great, but perhaps a few more are needed. When I called for my car, the phone was only answered on one day, resulting in a lengthier time to have our car brought around for our use. Room 212 was large and excellent. Our only challenge were the sky lights (2) which poured light into the room at sunrise. In the future, we will ask for a room without skylights. We ate breakfast at the hotel restaurant daily. Axel on the staff was excellent. He was attentive, professional, and helpful. Front desk staff was great. We also participated in the evening tastings in the lounge, which were excellent and informative. The bar staff were friendly as well. The colorful landscaping helps create a great, serene atmosphere. Overall, a great experience.

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review title: Nice atmosphere but needs an update!
review: The location is perfect, within walking distance of the downtown area and restaurants. The original home turned into lobby is beautiful and the bar and restaurant areas are quaint. Our room was upgraded to a fireplace room, which unfortunately smelled like a campfire. The floor was not level so the head of our bed was actually lower than the foot of the bed. We weren‚Äôt offended by this because the hotel appeared old and historic so this just added to it. However, the bathroom had no room to store much and it was in need of a very good overall cleaning. The sink, toilet, and shower were surface-clean, but the dust around the floors around sink and throughout as well as the marred paint made you question cleanliness in general. The worst was that our ‚Äúupgraded‚Äù room made all of our clothes smell like a campfire. When we unpacked clothing at our next hotel, our clothes wreaked. The rooms of this hotel really need an upgrade. We‚Äôve stayed in other hotels with fireplaces and have never experienced this before. Our room also ran very warm even with a/c cranked down. We used points for this room. We would have been extremely disappointed if we paid the going rate. It‚Äôs still tough as a Platinum member to experience this and have used our hard-earned points for a subpar experience.

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review title: Outside awesome, room not so much
review:
A really cool but old house serves as the lobby, bar and some of the restaurant. The grounds are really pretty and well taken care of. All positive points on the outside. Oh, and the location is perfect and within walking distance to everything downtown.

Our room (and assuming the others) are in desperate need of updating; something I seem to be saying a lot lately in my reviews. We had an adobe fireplace in our room, and while it was cool to see, it smelled like an old campfire. The furniture is really old, the carpet and bench stained, old tub/curtain setup for the shower like a low level motel. And it was not cleaned very well at all. The only positive about the room itself is the bed was comfortable as most Marriott beds are.

We used our points to book this hotel and I'm betting there are better Marriott or hilton properties near by. La Posada is a historical place, but the rooms need some TLC.

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review: The location and the patio restaurant are the highlights of this hotel. The location is excellent - two or three blocks from the plaza, as well as about three blocks from the beginning of Canyon Road and its art galleries. While there are some hotels closer to the plaza, they would be a longer walk from Canyon Road. I‚Äôm in my late 60s, and easily walked from the hotel to the main stretch of the Canyon Road galleries (and back). The outdoor patio was a delightful setting for both dinner and breakfast. Marriott elites should be aware that the free breakfast for Bonvoy platinum and above offers only a limited choice of 4 or 5 items, and does not include the tip. I passed on that, and ordered the fruit plate for breakfast, which was very nice and quite large - one of the best fruit plates I‚Äôve had. I booked a Sage room (over the spa) to be sure I would have access to an elevator, since other rooms are either ground floor (where people walk past your windows) or require climbing steps. My room had a small balcony that overlooked a rooftop- other rooms on this level had larger balconies with apparently nicer views. There is a nice open air sitting area one floor above this level, which apparently few people notice. The hotel grounds are pretty and atmospheric, and help make up for rooms that could definitely use a refresh. My room was a decent size, but rather dark, and the furnishings needed updating. The hotel offers an on-demand shuttle service to Museum Hill or certain other areas (I think they said within 2 miles) but I did not use it.

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review title: Great bar area and super location with wood burning fireplaces in a townhouse type setting.
review: Great place that gives you a western feel! The staff will get your room heated up in winter by lighting a fire for you in the fireplace of each unit. The main lobby is really designed as a western homage and I believe was used in scenes of Better Call Saul!

place name: La Posada de Santa Fe, a Tribute Portfolio Resort & Spa
review title: Much better places to stay in Santa Fe
review:
Was not happy with this hotel:

1. I have bonvoy status and yet I was given a terrible room.
2. The room was not as advertised. The room was a shoebox and we had zero room for our bags. Also it was not decorated in the same way as shown on the website.
3. Heard my neighbors when they talked, sneezed, coughed, etc.
4. Room was dark. Couldn‚Äôt keep the window shade open since people walked by and could look in.
5. Staff not friendly.
6. Pool area was gross. People left their plates, drinks, towels and it was not cleaned up timely by the staff.
7. Our unit had one shared outdoor table for 3 rooms. Other rooms had much more ample outdoor seating.
8. No water in the room. Hotels usually leave 2 bottles of water in the room.
9. TV was not on a bracket that rotated. So we couldn‚Äôt watch it in bed.
10. Bathtub was slippery.
11. No full length mirror.

The only positive was that it was a decent location, the gym was decent and the premises were nice.

We were very well received. The staff is friendly and attentive. They prepared a map and video to help their client navigate the streets. Very much appreciated! They serve tea and cookies at will!  Thank you for this stay

Splendid Riad and very well located in the medina. The hotel is very comfortable and beautiful, the rooms are spacious and bright and there is a superb terrace overlooking the city to enjoy a hot mint tea. I highly recommend!

Beautiful, small hotel with even more beautiful people.  Mohammed, Mohammed and Yassmina were all kind, welcoming and helpful.  Food was delicious and plentiful.  Arranged wonderful city tour with Rashid.  Strong, hot shower much appreciated after some days in the desert!

A superb riad( room, decoration....an feels like home( superb team
..., good location near a door( taxi......) very good homemade breakfast. We'll gladly go back. They speak good French, English

We had a wonderful stay at Dar Fes Medina. We were extremely well received by the staff who were very caring and very friendly. The riad is splendid. Breakfast is hearty. And best of all, the rooms are full of charm, comfortable and well decorated! The riad is also easy to find, as it is close to a medina gate. I can only recommend coming to spend his stay at the dar fes medina. It is a faultless and excellent value for money. Thank you to the whole team!

Nice welcome. Very charming Riad, typical Moroccan decoration. Amazing breakfast with good homemade Moroccan products. The large blue door to access the medina is not even a 15 minute walk away. Ideal location. I recommend.

top top top ....
Thank you to the whole team for your welcome and kindness
Reservation, welcome, services, taxi ..
here we always come without constraint, with confidence
exchanges are very simple and pleasant by email or whatsapp

We came to the accommodation around 21:00 and someone from the riad came to the main street to help us with the luggage and also to show us the way - thank you again for this <3
The room was super clean, big and beautiful. The riad itself is very beautiful, it looks like a museum to me. The breakfast was great, but what stood out to me the most was the hospitality. Thank you again for everything. It would be a pleasure to visit you again.

The place is in a very convenient location, inside the Medina but very serene and very close to the main road for taxis. The staff was always helpful and considerate, really very, very courteous! We felt at home:) 
Great and rich breakfast, regarding dinner, was undoubtedly the best of our trip! (And we toured many places). 
Cleanliness impeccable, the room was spotless! 
Thank you!

review title: Just book it. You won‚Äôt be disappointed!
review:
This guest house is such a gem! The owner and all of the staff here have been absolutely amazing to us.. I can honestly say I‚Äôve never felt so welcome as I have here. They really go above and beyond to serve you and provide you with the best experience. Tea and cookies are available any time you want them, breakfast is made to order when you get up and is delicious and filling. It‚Äôs an easy to find location, fells safe everywhere around here, the rooms are spacious and beautiful, everything is clean. This is our favorite place we‚Äôve stayed in all of Morocco! 

They helped us with tours, with arranging airport transfer, printing boarding passes, just all around a really incredible experience. I am thankful to have found this location!

Everything you‚Äôve heard about this Santa Fe institution is true.  Delicious, authentic, flavorful food with a lovely ambience (especially the gorgeous geraniums on every wi due) and warm service that feels like home!

Service was excellent and it was a full house , but overall the food was bland. Special
Appetizers of stuffed squash blossoms had no punch/ kick. And the stacked chicken enchiladas were also bland. The one saving entree was the pork shoulder which was good as a result of strong salt flavor.

This place was wonderful. It was busy, but as a single I was seated quickly. The entire staff greeted me, asked if I needed anything, and followed through on my requests. The food and coffee were excellent, at reasonable prices, and large servings. There is no doubt I will rerun to this restaurant whenever I go back to Santa Fe. All readers have my highest recommendation.

Went here with my brother and his wife for lunch. Packed. Waited about 1/2 hour. Worth it. I had a salad. Wife had pork Adovado. Brother had eggs ranchero. Best he had ever had he said. Great food and service. My wife and I have been going here for many years. Love the place.

Cute little spot on the corner with an obvious line of people waiting around on the sidewalk. We made our way to the desk and were told it would be 15-20 minutes. The cool thing is you don't have to wait around because they will both call and text you when the table is ready. We shopped a bit and they were true to their word in terms of timing. 

We were able to sit in a booth and noticed that a large round table in the middle of the room is a communal table, so be prepared to sit with strangers if you're a small party. It's very packed and staff are busy, busy, busy.

The person who took our drink orders and got us settled also told us what the special of the day was. They were friendly and engaging, answering a few questions we already had.

The person who took our order wasn't the easiest to understand nor were we easy for them to understand so it took some work to figure it all out. When the food arrived, it looked good and ended up being just okay. Two of the people in our group said they wouldn't order the breakfast burrito again because it was just "meh." My dish (think breakfast nachos) was too heavy on the onions and not enough of other items. It wasn't as special as I wanted it to be.

Anyway, for three of us the bill was just over $100 with tip, so that should give you an idea on cost. Cafe Pasqual's was recommended to us and we're glad we gave it a try but probably won't return.

Very simple breakfast menu but with excellent choices.   Food is all organic.  The burrito was amazing.  

The atmosphere is quaint but comfortable.  Very clean.

They don't take reservations for breakast and worried about the wait.  We arrived at 8:30am and were seated right way.  The service was fast and when we left half-hour later there was a short line out the door.  Service everywhere is super fast; not even enough time to drink your coffee.  I had avocado toast -- it even came with bacon.  It was very good and a nice change from traditional Mexican breakfast.

We've eaten in restaurants around the world, including Michelin-starred extravaganzas.  The truth is, however, that this smallish family-run restaurant is at least as good as any of them.  The food is always freshly made.  I had the bison burger today.  I asked for it medium, and it was spot on when delivered.  The menu description tells you that it is topped with green chiles.  In virtually every restaurant I have been in, this means that they are chopped from a can.  Here, they were whole chiles that had been cooked to perfection.  The gruyere topper was superb, as were the lightly grilled red onion (cooked enough to remove the snap, but not drooping).  I had it with the salad side and with the real-deal blue cheese dressing.  When I come away from here, my wife and I always comment that it is just a better meal than anywhere else in town.
Wonderful food and good service.  We had a late lunch both times we were there.  This minimized the wait time.  The staff was very friendly and attentive.

It's not a true visit to Santa Fe without having breakfast/brunch at Pasquale's -- and it's just as delicious as it was when I ate here, at my mom's insistence, 15 years ago. My friends and I enjoyed browsing the nearby shops while we waited for the text telling us our table was ready. Once seated at the community table, I enjoyed the best mimosa with fresh-squeezed orange juice and split a yummy breakfast burrito stuffed with chorizo and hash browns. And the green chilies had quite the kick I was looking for -- go Hatch, lol. Breakfast was hot, plentiful --  and good for splitting or leftovers later. The staff was really friendly and attentive. We thoroughly enjoyed everything -- the food, the wall murals, the atmosphere!

I'm sorry to break the 5-star reviews. How can you pay $128.00 for four breakfasts consisting of tortillas, eggs, beans, and bacon? The food is overpriced, the place is very small, and there's no room at the tables. One of the servers was very rude and unprofessional. We were lucky to find a New Yorker named Julie, and she sorted things out for us. We were visiting from New Jersey and are planning another trip next year to Santa Fe. This cafe will definitely not be on our list of places to eat. My advice to the owner: Please train your employees and teach them some human relations.
Absolutely the best!  Everything we‚Äôve tried here is excellent - especially the chili rellenos and huevos rancheros.   This is our ‚Äúgo to‚Äù restaurant in Santa Fe!

A wonderful cozy bistro with great care taken in both their cuisine and their wine offerings. With awesome personal service and their great food and atmosphere, it is our first choice for dinner in Santa Fe.

After reading the reviews we decided to go to Cafe Pasqual's for lunch. And we were lucky to wait just a little bit for our own table. The atmosphere is unique. We liked the bright whimsical decor. They provide an excellent variety of foods. Our dishes and drinks were wonderful and well-presented. The service was fantastic. Highly recommend.

review title: A must-do meal in an iconic restaurant. Get reservations!
review: Each of the three of us thoroughly enjoyed our meal, capped by a shared dessert. A reservation is essential to eat at this iconic Santa Fe restaurant. On a nondescript street corner, it opens into a high-ceilinged room filled with art, much of it by the founder (now deceased). Our waiter was a longtime resident of the area, and efficient and very nice. Try to eat at Pasqual's for an authentic Santa Fe dining experience.

This was absolutely the best dining experience we‚Äôve ever had!The atmosphere was high end but relaxed.The server knowledge of drinks and foods was excellent. Presentation and flavor suburb!
I had Elk,my husband had the shrimp and rice cakes . We each had signature cocktails,fresh ingredients. The hostess came over and gave me shopping tips . Definitely recommend! It is fine dining, worth every penny!

Excellent, though pricey, food.  My main dish was based upon kale, to which I was unfamiliar. It tasted terrible, to the point where I now avoid kale whenever possible. My husband's meal was fine, but won't return. Too many other good places in town.

This review is long overdue and still won‚Äôt fully capture the magic that is Geronimo. It‚Äôs a true gem‚Äîone of the best restaurants in the country, tucked into the heart of Santa Fe. I‚Äôve been lucky enough to dine here dozens of times over the years, and every single experience has been outstanding.

From the warm welcome at the door to the attentive (but never overbearing) service, Geronimo nails the details. The atmosphere is elegant yet relaxed, full but never crowded, and perfect for a memorable evening.

On my most recent visit, we started with a special tomato and burrata appetizer‚Äîfresh, vibrant, and delicious‚Äîand the best beef tartare I‚Äôve ever had. For entr√©es, our table ordered the signature elk (a must-try), the sweet and spicy prawns, and the short ribs, which were tender and rich. We ended with the apple dessert (almost too beautiful to eat) and the crepe, which was the table favorite. Even the coffee service impressed, arriving with warm scones that were the perfect finishing touch.

Geronimo was the highlight of our girls' weekend and never fails to deliver. If you‚Äôre in Santa Fe, this spot should be at the top of your list.

review title: Best Meal We Had in Santa Fe
review: We had dinner here for Mother's Day and it was fabulous. Very high touch from the moment we gave our car to the valet. We were greeted warmly and shown to a lovely table. My husband enjoyed one of their specialty cocktails and I had a glass of wine. My husband had the lobster bisque and said it was amazing! I had the Alaskan halibut for my main course and my husband had the rack of lamb which arrived at the table with a presentation that could not be ignored.  I had a flourless chocolate cake for dessert and my husband had an assortment of sorbets with a cappuccino. This was the best meal we had while in Santa Fe and created an unforgettable dining experience.

After reading such high reviews we were really looking forward to dining here, but it was such a disappointment.  The seating was cramped, the service mediocre, and food just ok.  I ordered their elk signature dish, which was tasty but cold and hard to cut.  The side of saut√©ed spinach was floating in water.  My husband ordered their  special, beef Wellington, which was way undercooked and tasteless.  For the high price, we expected much more.

review title: A must restaurant when in Santa Fe
review: The Wagyu Carpaccio and the Ahi Tuna Sashimi and Tartare appetizers were excellent. They were so superior that I wished I'd ordered one or the other as my entree. Dienke, our server, was most informative and friendly. The Toasted Coffee Tiramisu was exceptional.

This restaurant rates as 1 of the finest Dining experiences that I have had the pleasure to dine in, The menu‚Äôs the choice of drinks, the service, everything 1 could want for a special evening out. Our waitress Christine was charming, knowledgeable & above all attentive. Our party from Michigan & the U.K all agreed Geronimo! 1 of the best!

Exceptional food and service. Fine dining at its best! The atmosphere was elegant, warm and inviting. We also appreciated that the tables were spaced far enough apart for privacy and the restaurant was quiet. Not only did Mitzi, our server, provide excellent service, the servers removing dishes or bringing more water or bread were also friendly and professional. We‚Äôll be back!

review title: Excellent dining experience at Geronimo in Santa Fe!
review: Geronimo is a wonderful restaurant, and has been a top-rated place in Santa Fe for decades now.  My wife and I dined here every year for several years in a row but hadn't been back in 17 years, since our kids arrived on the scene, and we missed it.  The restaurant was even better than we'd remembered.  It's a great place for a celebratory dinner or a special night out, but not stuffy -- our 14-year-old and 17-year-old both greatly enjoyed our dinner.  My son and I both enjoyed the elk, which was exceptional, and I'd also recommend the Wasabi Caesar Salad.  Geronimo also features an excellent, and carefully curated, wine list, so you're sure to find something to pair with your dinner.  Definitely reserve a table (and an evening) to enjoy Geronimo during your next visit to Santa Fe!

As on our previous occasion, service was very good. Had pear salad and the Caesar salad. Both were very good. Request for anchovies was met, making the Caesar even better for me. Wine (bottle) was a very good Barbera d‚ÄôAlba albeit a little pricey. I chose the elk steak (waitress said it was their #1 entree); it was a little tough and I would not order again as the bacon in the gravy overwhelmed the elk flavor. Spouse had the filet. Sauce was good, but the steak, while tender, offered a non-descriptive flavor. We were seated at a table in the bar; would not do again, as we got a non-stop listen in on the bartender‚Äôs non-stop interaction and stories with a couple seated at the bar. This made the table a noisy choice. Given the above, and a pricey $300+ tab ($110 for the wine), we did not find this visit as enjoyable as last years visit. Not sure we‚Äôd go this route again, although, obviously, this is a very high end Santa Fe restaurant.

Four of us girlfriends went to Geronimo last weekend and it was fantastic.   The ambiance and the food were outstanding, and Nancy, our server was excellent.   One of our friends has a food allergy and they were so attentive to this concern.  I would highly recommend.
Excellent service. Delicious food. I highly recommend it if you‚Äôre up for a splurge when in Santa Fe. (Business casual is recommended).

Wonderful food and service. My wife had the elk tenderloin and I had the sea bass. Both cooked perfectly. Terrific sauces and side dishes. Good choices of wine by the glass. Our waiter, Slade, was professional and personable. He invested a good amount of time in explaining the dishes we were most interested in. Good energy level. The restaurant itself has a nice, relaxed vibe. Our table was in the bar area which worked out well. Music enhanced the atmosphere without being overpowering. Easy to carry on a conversation. Geronimo would stack up well with our favorite restaurants at home here in Chicago.

Very nice place, I sat at the bar.  Food was good, but the service was a bit lacking.  The couple next to me were offered a garnish for their water and pepper for the salad, and I was offered neither.  It's a little thing, for sure, but honestly this kind of thing from staff is a real turnoff.  Disappointing.
The best restaurant in Santa Fe by reputation and does not disappoint.  Wonderful decor and top notch staff.  Good wine list is a nice touch.

review title: One of our favorite restaurants for great traditional New Mexican food.
Amazing authentic local food. My spouse had never had sopapillas and I thought she had died and gone to heaven.
Waited 41 Years to Eat Here Again and I was Rewarded It Was Great !
Friendly service and authentic Northern New Mexico cuisine
Food ok, place felt like a chain restaurant

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review title: Excellent location and top notch services in Tangier Morocco
review: 2 minutes walk to the beach. Could see lightings in Spain from my room. Zero noise and very central.  3 minutes walk to the train station and with a shopping mall. You will miss nothing here. Excellent location and good food. The staff are excellent, you get services as quick as you want it. My family love it.

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review:
My stay at the Hilton Hotel Garden Inn Tangier was truly outstanding, an experience enhanced greatly by the efforts of Rajaa El yassem, the Food & Beverage Director, and her dedicated team. From the moment I arrived, I was welcomed by a staff that was professional, courteous, and focused on ensuring my stay was second to none.

The location of the hotel in Tangier offers breathtaking views, and it's conveniently located for exploring the city. My room was spotless, modern, and comfortable, providing all the amenities one could wish for.

A major highlight of my visit was the dining experience. Under the guidance of Rajaa El yassem, the on-site restaurant provided a culinary journey that was both exquisite and memorable. Every meal was a masterpiece, showcasing a perfect blend of local and international flavors. The attention to detail, the presentation of the dishes, and the attentiveness of the staff were truly exceptional. Rajaa and her team took the time to understand my preferences, making personalized recommendations that never failed to impress.

Thank you.

Manfred

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review: I had a lovely long weekend with with my mother. The hotel staff could not have done more to make our stay wonderful. We had an excellent service from Inaas and Iliyas at reception (but all were very good). The room was spotlessly clean and the cleaner whose name I did not jot down was excellent. The staff at breakfast were truly amazing especially Malika and Sanae. Sanae in particular went out of her way to make sure us and others were well catered  for. Breakfast was plentiful and very relaxed. I would highly recommend this hotel for, service, value for money and standard of accommodation. It's a stone's throw away from the shops and the sea and the medina is about 40 minutes walk away.

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review: I am currently at the Hilton Garden Inn in Tangier, and I would already like to express my satisfaction. The property is clean, well located, and offers excellent service. I would particularly like to highlight the professionalism DE Madame Samra, the hotel manager DE the hotel. She is very courteous, always listening DE her customers, and shows remarkable dedication to ensuring their satisfaction. Its involvement and management clearly contribute to the quality and reputation DE this establishment. Many thanks to the whole team, and congratulations to Ms. Samra for her exemplary work.

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review:
I had a wonderful stay at this hotel! The staff were incredibly welcoming, helpful, and professional throughout my visit.
