I especially want to thank Wafae, Rajae et hanane who truly went above and beyond to make sure I felt comfortable and cared for. Her kindness, attention to detail, and warm smile made my experience unforgettable.

Thank you to the whole team, I‚Äôll definitely be back!

Majida B

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review title: Stays at Hilton garden inn Tangier
review:
After six stays at Hilton Garden Inn Tangier, we want to express our sincere appreciation to the entire front desk team for their outstanding service. Each visit, we were welcomed with warmth, professionalism, and genuine care. A special thank you to Taha and Inass, who consistently went above and beyond to make our stays smooth and enjoyable. Taha is always efficient and courteous, while Inass stands out for her thoughtfulness and attentiveness. 
Thanks to all of you, every stay truly felt like coming home. We are grateful for your dedication and look forward to returning!

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review:
I warmly thank the generous and professional staff of Hilton garden who made us our great experience in Tangier either in terms of accommodation or catering....
A nice crush on the lovely maid Loubna.
Good luck and see you soon
Sara

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review title: Not worth the price you have to pay
review:
Very disappointed with my stay at the Hilton garden hinn hotel in Tangier. One day, on returning after a long day, the room was still not ready until 7pm. ‚Äî an unacceptable situation for a hotel in this category.

Moreover, the floor of the room was never cleaned once because my daughter had dropped coca all week. For an establishment with such high rates, a minimum of rigour and comfort is expected, which clearly has not been the case.

The only positive: the staff, really nice and professional. But despite their kindness, this is not enough to compensate for the lack of overall quality of service. the hotel is clearly not worth its price. I strongly believe that there is a lack of training at staff level.
The bartender is clear as well as the girl who made omelets are great at the top

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review:
We would like to express our gratitude for the outstanding service provided by Ilias, the front office receptionist at Hilton Garden Inn. He was incredibly polite, helpful, and professional throughout multiple times during our stays. Ilias made us feel welcome from the moment we arrived, always ready to assist with a smile. His friendly and attentive approach truly stood out, making our experience at the hotel even more enjoyable. Thank you, Ilias, for your excellent service  it made all the difference!

Greetings,

Reda & Shaimae

place name: Hilton Garden Inn Tanger City Center
review: I am always using this hotel for business and trips, the cleaning lady hajar was very helpful and nice, the smell of the rooms and corridors are always amazing. Reception team professional and nice and the concierge team as well. Location near to the beach and everything (food, caffes, mall, train station‚Ä¶) totally recommend.

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review: The rooms deteriorated. Not dice coffee maker in the room the balconies are dirty... the staff is not up DE valet

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review: The furnishings DE the rooms very deteriorate, no coffee maker, the balconies are rooms , no valet parking, the pool is orrible , the breakfast catastrophic and poorly organized does not deserve to be a hotel 5*

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review: Fatima and Aziz made our stay very comfortable and offered excellent hospitality. Everybody here was very friendly, declines good, and clean room- 10 star from us. üòäüòä

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review title: Great hotel but don‚Äôt use spa
review:
**Fantastic stay at the Royal Tulip!**  

The hotel experience was excellent‚Äîthe hospitality was spot on, and the staff were exceptional, especially **Fathine** and her colleague at reception (whose name I unfortunately can‚Äôt recall). They went out of their way to arrange a late check-out for me, making my stay even more comfortable.  

However, the **Royal Spa**, which is linked to the hotel, was a disappointment. While it may not be directly managed or owned bythe hotel, the owner's daughter of the spa personally promised us a one-hour massage**, yet we received **only 45 minutes**‚Äîdespite the high price. The service and overall experience at the spa were poor. The ladies working there were professional and hardworking, but it was evident they were treated unfairly‚Äîexpected to work long hours without proper compensation.  

**I strongly advise against using the Royal Spa.** We raised our concerns with the hotel, though it‚Äôs clear this issue is beyond their control.  Definitely will visit hotel again but never the spa . Thank you hotel

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review:
Very modern hotel, large and very clean rooms and friendly staff.
Buffet for both breakfast and dinner very varied and good.
Located in the new town close to hotels, shopping malls and restaurants.
Small inconvenience with a dinner on the second day of stay already paid for that was not recognized by the room manager. Later they recognized the mistake by apologizing and offering us a cocktail at the bar (very good and highly recommended especially given the location in an Islamic country).

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review:
SPA fechado, sem aviso pr√©vio; pequeno-almo√ßo pobre, quartos a precisar de manuten√ß√£o nas casas de banho. Hotel grande, vazio, parecia que tinha sa√≠do do apocalipse zombie. 
Ponto positivo: simpatia do staff. 
--//--
SPA closed without warning; poor breakfast, rooms in need of bathroom maintenance. Large, empty hotel, like something out of the zombie apocalypse. 
Positive point: friendliness of the staff.

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review:
The positives: friendly staff
The negative:
- lacks maintenance: black bathroom gaskets, jammed drains, did not close the bathroom or terrace doors, pillow with a hole, dirty carpet, etc.
On New Year's Eve there was an orchestra downstairs that could be heard in the room like they were singing in your ear.
When we checked we said that the last day we had to leave very early. They told us they'd make us breakfast to go, but they didn't.

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review title: Nice enough but not a tourist hotel
review: Unfortunately although the Royal Tulip has an impressive rating, it is important to know that some of the services here are less than  great. The room was lovely and had a bath, though shower blew hot and cold. The hotel seemed to cater more for business travellers, and during our stay a conference there made the breakfast area completely over subscribed. 4 sunbeds around the pool and not a very welcoming area as had been shut up for winter including the pool bar. The spa and indoor pool were cost extras, including the equivalent of 20 euros per hour to use the indoor pool. Without this spa I'm not sure how the hotel earns it's star rating. I'm sure in summer months this would feel v different but beware if you are a UK traveller looking for half term sun.

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review:
Upon arrival in the room, our first welocoming sight was:
- some greasy/luquidy stuff on the wall next to the door.
- unclean utensils.
- some yellow sticky debris on the toilet seat.
- greasy stains on the carpet.

And when we asked for help, it took some time before got help.

The breakfast was very delicious and served one of the freshest orange juice ever. The breakfast personnel were really helpful to help you bringing the breakfast to the room when we were too sick to get down ourselves.

place name: Hotel Royal Tulip City Center Tanger
review:
We stayed there 7 nights. The Pension is well located in the centre. The staff is friendly and very professional and the room quite large and bright, the bed very comfortable and very clean.
The breakfast is very good and hearty, there are many choices. 
The swimming pool is not too big and the wind that engulfs it cools it down too bad but we do not go there for that. The gym is a real room with everything you need. 
For parking spaces there are enough with the one on the side. 
In the end this Pension is very good I highly recommend.

review title: RUN AWAY, WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE EVER
review: Worst experience with a barcelo hotel, does not deserve the barcelo brand from the way they treat their frequent customers. Booked and paid a stay via mybarcelo benifits account, and of course my account got debited the same day on the 18/07/2025 but no booking was shown in mybarcelo account. Tried contacting the hotel and the barcelo group, all what they came up with is to initiate a refund which will take up to 8 days which i did not ask for. I wanted to keep my reservation as it is their systems problem which they recognized by email it was a bug from their end. Their solution was to invite me to book again with a 50 euros a night higher rate: 150 euros intead of 92euros. And the irony i that after they initiated the refund they kept hiding not answring me emails asking to keep my booking at the initial price as i am not supposed to assume their system bug. Advice RUN AWAY from occidental tanger as you won't get any support once they get your money you have to keep chasing them for a solution. WORST EXPERIENCE AS A FREQUENT CUSTOMER

I absolutely loved my stay at Occidental Tanger. From the moment I arrived, the staff made me feel so welcome ‚Äî always smiling, helpful, and genuinely kind. Their professionalism and warmth really made a difference throughout my stay.

The hotel itself is beautiful, clean, and very well maintained. The ambiance is calm and relaxing, perfect for unwinding. I especially appreciated the attention to detail in the design and comfort of the rooms.

Overall, a fantastic experience ‚Äî I‚Äôll definitely be coming back. Huge thanks to the whole team for making it such a memorable

I had a great time with my little family.
Everything was perfect.
A big thank you to Mademoiselle Sara who was up to it as always, very professional and very helpful.

I‚Äôm not sure how this hotel was rated so highly. We arrived in our room only to find that there were no bath towels, only hand towels. We called down but there was no answer at reception (it was late, around 10:00 pm) and no number for housekeeping. In the morning, we stopped by reception on our way to breakfast and requested the towels. When we went back to our room that evening, still no towels. We stopped the housekeeping attendant and she brought us the towels.
The breakfast buffet, the were people using their hands to grab the food because there weren‚Äôt enough serving utensils for each platter.
All in all, I would say this is really no more than a 3 star hotel. It is fine for that rating and about what you would expect. The bed was comfortable and the room was clean. We didn‚Äôt try the pool since we were only there 2 nights and had a lot to see. It‚Äôs not in the city proper so it‚Äôs a taxi ride in and back each day. It‚Äôs 2 blocks from a small beach and a beautiful park.
A magnificent place to explore while you explore the city, an oasis of tranquility with unbeatable services.

Ideal place for meeting and not only...
The hotel and location that surprises!!!
Food and services TOP!!
Close but isolated enough to be able to enjoy the city with peace and quality!!!
Repeating...
I'll repeat for sure. Great hotel chain and better managed. We got very easy s the beach and downtown.
Great stay! Clean and comfortable room, welcoming staff and great location. I highly recommend this hotel for a pleasant stay.

Very well maintained hotel, with a modern and beautiful decor. The staff is attentive and always willing to help. The bed is comfortable and the common areas are clean and well maintained. Very good value for money. I'll definitely be back!

I loved my stay at the Occidental Tangier. The welcome was warm as soon as I arrived. The room was spacious, well maintained and had a nice view. The staff is always smiling and attentive.
I also enjoyed the quality of the buffet and the cleanliness of the place. A hotel I recommend with my eyes closed for a pleasant stay in Tangier.

We loved the peaceful charming road w/such personalized service. Noura called prior to our arrival to arrange transportation and help finding the riad once taxi dropped us just outside Medina wall. 
We were able to have a hamman ( scrub) and masssge at the riad. Breakfast was tasty and plentiful. They arranged a guide for us to tour the Medina, etc. overall wonderful and would stay here again.

This is a modern hotel designed in a riad style within the old medina. The staff is very very helpful and friendly and they can provide any sort of service you might need. The decoration in the common areas is beautiful, moroccan and modern. It is located in the residential area of the medina and within walking distance to the main attractions. The rooms have everything you need and are comfortable, but in my opinion they are a bit 'suffocated' since they do not have windows towards the outside, only towards the inside patio and that could make you feel a bit exposed. Also, there is no lift, so you have to use the stairs but it is only 4 stories tall. Please note that Tangier's medina is hilly, so you have to go up and down all the time and this applies to your way towards the hotel.

Dar Chams is beautifully located in the medina . It‚Äôs charmingly appointed with many restful areas including a pretty roof terrace . Noura and her team work hard to make sure their guests‚Äô needs are well met

review title: Lovely hotel in the heart of the old medina.
review: We stayed 3 days at Dar Chams Tanja.  The hotel is lovely and in the heart of the old city.  Our room was clean, spacious with a nice bathroom.  The breakfast was good.  The best part of Dar Chams is Nora and her staff!  They are all so kind and helpful.  For first time visit to Tangier, they made us feel so welcome.  If you want to stay in the old Medina, stay here.

review title: A fantastic stay in a beautiful place with excellent staff.
review: My husband and I and another couple stayed 4 nights in Dar Chams Tanja. It was beautiful, clean and spacious with many nice amenities. Both the breakfasts and dinners were delicious and beautifully presented and served by quiet and attentive staff.  Eating on the rooftop terrace with a wonderful view was an added bonus.  All of the staff was friendly and attentive to our needs but Noura, the manager was outstanding.  She had many communications with me before our arrival and made herself available at all times during our stay.  She was very professional and helpful, arranging for transportation on arrival and departure, recommending restaurants and authentic shopping as well as arranging guided tours of Tangier and Asilah.  The tour guide she booked for us, Hamza was very knowledgeable and friendly and accommodated our schedule and all requests including assisting us with providing food for some of the homeless animals in the city and arranging for a camel ride on the beach. In addition, Noura acted as our liason with a tour company we had reserved before arriving.  Her assistance was invaluable. We all loved our stay in Dar Chams Tanja and would highly recommend it.   If we go back to Tangier we most definitely will stay there again.

review title: Charming and Elegant Hotel near the Medina
review: My husband, teenage daughter and I LOVED the Dar Chams. Our rooms were  beautiful with wonderful authentic Moroccan touches. My daughter and I splurged on the hammam located right at the hotel and followed it with a massage. WOW!! It was a great experience. The breakfasts on the rooftop were wonderful as was the dinner there - we were even able to get a bottle of wine. Nora was always helpful and a wonderful hostess. We highly recommend the Dar Chams. It was a terrific beginning to our Moroccan adventure. Thank you Dar Chams for your wonderful hospitality.

review title: The absolute best in so many ways...
review: When you are looking for AMAZING staff, breathtaking views, unbelievable breakfast and ultra clean lines, rooms, etc Dar Chams is a place my family and i highly recommend. Nora was so helpful coordinating tours, answering questions and being such a delight to speak with! Please give them a try - you wont be disappointed - especially the top floor suite - enjoy!

Stayed at Dar Chams Tanja with my family (two children ages 7 & 9).  The room was beautiful, spacious and fantastic breakfast on the rooftop.  Best part was the welcome by Laura each morning - great ideas for tourism, finding the best guides, taxis and the warmest welcome.  Fantastic service, without hesitation, I would return again to this hotel - we loved our stay.

A stay at the Dar Chams Tanja is a portal to the past. It opens first hand the rich cultural history of one of Western Civilzations defining cities.
  There are other hotels in and around the Madina and the Kasba; however Noura, the Dar Chams Tanga's manager, catalyses all the components of five star travel into a rich and unforgettable experience that is unrivaled.

Nora, the team and the facility were all terrific. The rooftop views were only beaten by the quality of the food and service. Nora was a gracious host and was there to help answer all of our questions. Highly recommend!!

Residence in formula Aparthotel. We had taken a 2 bedroom apartment on the 2nd floor. The accommodation also has a well-equipped kitchen, a single bathroom and a terrace with sea views and a small living room with leather armchairs and a dining table and TV. The whole accommodation is air conditioned. Cleaning is done and well done. No elevator. No parking problem. the residence is 20 minutes from the center of Tangier. The residence has two swimming pools not large but pleasant. No dining on site but you have cafe restaurants nearby quite a bit. No shop either but there are some nearby. Very special mention for the staff, welcoming and helpful.

review title: Great park in a great area with great people!
review:
Beautiful surroundings with sea views. The apartments are spacious, fully furnished and very clean. Every morning the rooms are cleaned up and provided with clean bed linen and bath towels.
The staff is very friendly and professional. This applies to the reception, the porters, the interior team and the manager. All great people who are always there for their guests!

Very comfortable beds and plenty of space. Price was also good, for a family it is a perfect location to come by car. They also have a large swimming pool if you want to swim and is only 20 min from the center easily accessible by car.

I recommend Pension Mnar Castle in Tangier 100%.
The ladies of the Fatima and Donia reception are very friendly, professional, and pleasant (always with a smile).
The guards are also very nice and smiling.
The apartments are very clean and spacious.
I'll come back next year inchallah but with my parents.
Thanking you.
See you later.

review title: Spacious apartment with all amenities. Noise carries from adjacent apartment. 15+ miute drive to medina.
review:
This is like an apartment complex with rather large apartments. The "room" I got was an apartment with a kitchen, two large bedrooms, a living/family and dining room and a balcony with comfortable seating. The kitchen has everything, including a cooking range and a fridge.

There is a small Bosch clothes washer as well. When you run it, it is loud, and sounds like a helicopter taking off. Although no dryer to dry the clothes. The service was awesome. The staff, mostly ladies, took my wet clothes and dried them in their large industrial drier in the morning.

Sound carries. I could hear the guests in the apartment above me, talking and moving about late in the night.

It is actually not the ideal location for a sightseeing trip to the Tangier medina since that is about 15-20 minutes away from the apartment complex.

I has a bunch of smaller quibbles but nothing to dissuade someone else from staying at these apartments. While waiting for my clothes to dry in the morning, I was able to update a very receptive lady host what all of these little quibbles were. She was very grateful and eager to address the issues I brought up.

The reasons for the 4-star rating versus a 5-star were the location being far from the medina, the noise, and the minor quibbles.

review title: WARNING: Do NOT stay at this hotel. Once you were checked and they will try to blackmail you for more money. Horrifying
review: I am extending a FIRM WARNING, especially to Americans traveling to Tangier. When you book they will take your money up front and right before you leave blackmail you for more money and threaten to leave bad reviews which they will do making up embarrassing accusations to try to strong arm you into giving them cash under the table. They even tried to keep us from our room the last night making us go in this office where they told us if we paid them more money they would give us access to our items. It is horrifying the practices here and I would advise that anyone considering staying here as beautiful as it is do NOT as they will try to scam you. I‚Äôve traveled the world for years and I‚Äôve never ever experienced anything like this. It is horrifying. What I expect as a result of this review is they will write some crazy story and then contact me via WhatsApp asking me to pay them extra money to take it down. I had to pay them to be able to get my suitcases. Please know you should definitely not get in the situation of staying with them. This experience was unreal and I can‚Äôt believe they get away with this stuff.

review title: Nice if you like to stay in the middle of nowhere
review:
I stayed at the Mnar Castle for 6 weeks last October to November 2019. I thought it was lovely at first but after such a lengthy stay I observed some issues which would discourage me from staying there again.
First, the hotel is in the middle of nowhere. There is one single restaurant across a busy road and a dining room in the hotel. neither one serves alcohol. There IS a shuttle, but there are limitations to where it will take you, only to a couple of places and getting them to pick you up is a challenge, you must phone the hotel to make arrangements and often they are not very organized.

Secondly, the Hotel is crawling with young families. If you have three or four children yourself I guess you might appreciate that, but if you are a sophisticated couple or single you could be irritated by all the noisy families everywhere. The breakfast room, which serves a large buffet, (no sneeze glass, just buffet tables) is very nice but the young children touch all the food. Inevitably there will be screaming babies in there and some even ride scooters around the room, or race around the tables or lots of crying and shouting. If you are looking for a good nights sleep, be aware that a screaming baby might keep you up to the wee small hours.
Thirdly, No soundproofing in any of the rooms. I knew whenever any of my neighbors was using the toilet at 4 am and I knew precisely what they were doing. Yikes!
Fourthly, Do not ask the women at the front desk for suggestions on where to go in Tangier because they only know what is on the property. Horse riding, dune buggy riding and the odd bus tour. If you ask them about anything authentic they will send you to overpriced tourist spots. That's because they don't explore Tangier properly themselves. I had an episode with another Canadian couple on a trip to Chefchouen, the blue city. The girl at the desk booked us on a private car which was several times more expensive than the one we understood her to be booking us on. I paid the difference, but the other couple didn't pay and checked out early. The trip was a little spoiled for them. If you want info on what to see in Tangier, use the Internet and then ask the locals.

Fifthly. Do not under any circumstances bring valuables with you to this hotel. There are no room safes and not even a main safe where you can store passports, cash, camera equipment, jewelry or watches. I had a pair of Chanel earrings stolen by someone entering my suite, possible a chambermaid? when I was out. I did tell one of the front desk girls about it and she was horrified promising me if I could remember the day it happened, the maid would be promptly fired. But I didn't want anybody to be fired so I didn't say.

Sixthly. Although the main shuttle driver, who by the way spoke not a word of English or French, just Arabic was a pleasant and accommodating sort, the driver that filled in on his day off came on to me several times which I found disrespectful. I didn't say anything at the time because he had a wife and family to support but if you are a woman travelling alone, stay to the middle or back of the bus when he is driving.

On a more positive note, I found the young gentleman who looked after the horse riding program incredibly helpful when I had a problem with a Microsoft word program on my laptop. I cannot say anything else but thanks a million you saved the day for me.

The hotel is clean, beds are comfortable, maid service is thorough, grounds are pretty, but I believe it's better to stay near the center of the city where the action is and where you have choices. The lack of good English spoken at Mnar Castle also makes things a challenge.

review title: Best option for families in Tanger
review: Super welcoming staff that will do beyond what is expected to please their clients. They offered traditional Moroccan sweets upon arrival, Guzlan was calling daily to check that everything was alright, and further more they gave us a new year stylish silver plated souvenir plate! Though simple furniture, with single no shower bathroom, but the apartment was very clean, with amazing view so we cant complain. Daily house keeping service. Breakfast is more than a brunch, and almost as heavy as dinner with many traditional options, freshly squeezed juices, and hot drinks upon request. The room has no safe box, but they provided us with one immediately when we asked. We reported at the end of our stay that we didnt like the pillows as they were hard, and they responded saying they would have been happy to replace them, if we have reported that! We stayed 4 nights, and we re booked with them one more night at the end of our trip as we could be happier.

Mnar Castle represents good value for anyone traveling to Tangier who is not wedded to staying in the inner city. The hotel has a fantastic breakfast buffet, large and comfortable apartments, a large swimming pool (which we did not use) and it has a reliable shuttle that runs frequently into various locations in the city including all the areas that a tourist might want to visit. When we were there there were families from other parts of Morocco as well as China and parts of Europe staying there, and with the large apartments and great buffet it is a great value for families in particular. Recommended.

This 5 hotel suite room is a new hotel , very clean and 15 minutes drive from city center,bed is comfortable and room consists of a leaving room and a bed room with kitchen ,breakfast have a good choice of international food and staff are so friendly and polite, there is a transport every hour free of charge to city center .

This house is a real gem!! Everything is thought out, organized for the pleasure of the eyes and the table. The decoration is very refined, not a fault of taste, the opulent breakfasts, never the same, are served in different porcelain every day, great art, small embroidered towels in the colors of Fez, the evening meals cooked by Nadia refer to the great chefs of gastronomy, what a treat, we do not know how to thank so much delicacy. This house is generous, elegant, discreet, the charming staff is like the dear owners Ma√Øt√© and Jean Pierre. Let‚Äôs hope that we are still the joy of staying there.
Many thanks for sharing and long life.
Very affectionately,
Annick and Jerome Sauni√®re

review title: A real gem of a hotel
review:
The hotel is within a quiet area of the Medina. It is charming and full of character. The room was comfortable and we slept well.
The staff were very friendly and happy to help with any advice and recommendations. The breakfast was amazing and delicious.
I would highly recommend staying here and we hope to return.

review title: A beautiful riad in the heart of Tangier's Old Town
review: A wonderfully authentic and lovingly run riad in the heart of the Old Town. The entire team around the gracious owner Monsieur Jean-Pierre is incredibly friendly and accommodating. We have deliberately chosen the "highest" room. A wonderful experience, even if the ascent is laborious and the room rather small. But one is compensated with a private terrace and a breathtaking view over Tangier. The dinner was super delicious, as was the breakfast. A very pleasant place with very nice people.

From the moment we arrived Dar Sultan treated us as family . the breakfast was fantastic filled with fresh juices, fruits, pastries , eggs and coffee. We had a mishap , needed extra care during our stay. Mustafa stepped in to help us . Stocked fresh water, delivered goods and greeted us every day / night to check in. Thank you

Simply gorgeous riad in the medina. Beautifully decorated in antique Moroccan style. The room was smallish but quirky and very well appointed, with comfortable bed. We weren't offered the chance of dining in the riad but tea was always available.

Dar Sultan is a beautiful place to stay in the heart of the Kasbah in Tangier. It is easy to find and convenient for sight seeing and restaurants. I would not stay anywhere else ! The rooms are comfortable and lovely and there are fantastic views from the roof terrace. The Moroccan breakfasts are amazing as was a traditional dinner we had one night all cooked to order. Absolutely delicious and served with a good bottle of red Moroccan wine. All the staff are friendly and helpful and can't do enough for you. Nothing is too much trouble. I would highly recommend Dar Sultan for an authentic and enjoyable stay.

review title: . ‚ÄúIf you don‚Äôt know where you‚Äôre going, any path will take you there.‚Äù ‚Äì Lewis Carroll
review: Past the door of this warm and beautifully decorated place, everything is sweet and voluptuous. Exceptional guests, Ma√Øt√© and Jean pierre, who have the art of telling you about Tangier and making you love it, a staff that never stops anticipating your needs, breakfasts worthy of the most starred hotels, dinners cooked by Nadia that enchant your palate. Everything is just an invitation to make you happy and come back to it very quickly.

Dar Sultan is a magical place. The decoration takes you around the countries visited by the owners of the places Ma√Øt√© and Jean-Pierre, preserving the history of this beautiful place. The staff is very attentive, and they pamper you throughout your stay. Breakfasts are majestic worthy of kings and queens. The rooms are held by masters where everything is changed daily with surprises on a daily basis.
It is located in the heart of the Khasba and the view from the terraces is beautiful. A place to choose with your eyes closed.
Thank you all for making our stay a very good memory.
Dominique and Vincenzo

review title: an exceptional stay as at home
review:
A small onion travel organization for a group of 10 thanks to the owners of the place
We were very well received by Mr. Durand as well as Nadia, Ayoub and other staff members.
We felt like home, we had great times, we highly recommend the Dar Sultant, for a peaceful and pleasant holiday in the heart of the Kasbah.
The meal was exceptional whether it was the dishes or the service quite perfect we spent a wonderful evening, breakfast also.
They have adapted perfectly to our sometimes constraining schedule
We also enjoyed the moments of exchange with the staff.

Beautiful Riad located just two minutes walk from Bab Kasbah (where the taxi drops you). Lovely room with all that I needed (clean towels, toiletries, space, comfy bed). The breakfast is incredible - bread, croissant, jams, honey, butter, delicious yoghurt, fruit, apple compote, egg prepared according to choice. Access to a stunning terrace with comfy patio furniture and a jungle of beautiful plants. For me, the highlight were the staff at the hotel who were always available for a chat, always offer tea/coffee, always smile and give their tips about exploring Tangier. Especially Ayyoub, the night receptionist, was always available for a chat and tea when I got back to the riad after a day out.

review title: A good Moroccan dinner in Tangier
review:
Friendly staff, the best couscous I have eaten in Morocco.
Hearty and well-kept dishes
Advice for those who have dinner or lunch in Tangier

review title: Unique experience as if you had dinner at someone's house!
review:
A gem in DE kasbah-medinah of Tangier üíï!
Super cozy diner with super good food. 
We have been received very warmly, every employee made us feel at home!
Definitely recommended

review title: A true Moroccan culinary journey at Kebdani!
review:
we had the chance DE dine at Restaurant Kebdani, and it was an unforgettable experience. This restaurant is a real haven DE peace, with an authentic setting, a beautiful decoration DE and a warm atmosphere.

The welcome is simply exceptional: the staff is attentive, smiling and always ready to share anecdotes about local dishes and traditions.
This is a great place.  Nice traditional food, great and friendly service. Central location for us. Good prices.  Thanks Bilal for your service.

We spent a few days in Tanger and found this little place walking around town with delicious food, good service, and cosy atmosfear. It really felt like you were invited home to one of the locals. 
We have the lamb and chicken tajin with some sides and salads, and I can say it was one of the best tajin dishes I've had. 
We finished the meal with some traditional maroccan tea, which is my absolute favourite. 
Would definitely come back here for my next visit to Tanger.
It was a wonderful experience, the food was delicious, the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Bilal. Congratulations to the entire Kebdani team.
Very good cuisine flavored with Moroccan flavors. Very good value for money. Very friendly and attentive welcome
Really really nice atmosphere and good food! Really enjoyed the experience. We got a lot of free food, including pastries, appetizers & tea. The food is excelent and very traditional.

Just ate Couscous at Kedbani restaurant. The experience was great and unexpected. The place is inside the old town and you have to walk to get to it but once you sit you get a great service. The appetizers were tasty. And the Couscous was a good surprise because everywhere we went we were told that Couscous is only available on Fridays. Today is Sunday and this place doesn‚Äôt abide by that rule. It was a good and large meal especially the beef one. Ended the course with Moroccan tea and pastries. Paid 200 dirhams for a dinner for two including tip and it was worth it. This is less than US $25. Note that they don‚Äôt accept credit cards. Highly recommended.

review title: We loved the food and service
review:
Bilal has been an excellent waiter!
The plates are generous and delicious.
An entire experience in the beautiful city of Tangier.

We ate very well, the attention and care were excellent, the food was very good. Special mention to Bilal, very attentive and kind!
Recommended site!
The best place in Tangier to eat couscous, a pleasant and cozy place, 100% recommended. Bilal has treated us wonderfully.
I have eaten very well and Bilal has treated us very well and of the minors I have seen, I highly recommend him, you will find the best and very good.
Bilal gave us VIP treatment, attentive, professional and friendly. Furthermore, the food was yummy and the atmosphere was great. Absolutely worth visiting!
The waiters were very welcoming and the food was very good. Thank you for sharing your experience.

review title: Typical lounges or terrace, all atmospheres
A very great moment of pleasure.
Great experience, lovely restaurant and impeccable service.
To avoid if you are looking for Moroccan food
A lovely way to spend an evening
Had the potential but failed at the finish line
A pleasant surprise on our last night in Tangier
Thumbs up for a brilliant restaurant
Very typical new moroccan classist style‚Ä¶

review:
Me and my wife had a delicious meal at Sarayya  food last night.
The welcome we got from Yazan and hes lovely mother was exceptional.
If ever you are in Tanger and you like your traditional Indian food rather than Moroccan like me then this is the 
Place.
Thank you very much for a lovely meal.
Rashid atcha 
19 may 2025
Superb food. Fast, friendly service - and very reasonable prices. We will be back for sure. ‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶‚Ä¶..

Just had a lovely meal at the Sarayah.  Very welcoming and clean restaurant Fantastic food and very generous portions. Super friendly and helpful staff.  Highly recommend the chicken entree and loved that you could make the food as spicy as you like.

The best Indian meal ever !!! All homemade with fantastic spices. We had the buttered chicken and chicken tikka masala with biryani spicy rice and garlic naan. It was amazingly tasty. The hot chocolate pudding with hot chocolate sauce and ice cream was delicious too. Yummy üòã Lovely friendly waiter called Mustafa who was Moroccan but only eats Indian food now. That says it all. üíØ

I haven‚Äôt eaten much Indian food in my life but what I ate there was delicious. Impeccable service and we brought the rest to get out.
They cook all the food on the spot. They are seen cooking from the dining room.

On our last night in Tanger, we decided to go for Indian food rather than something more traditional. Sarayah was near our hotel and was highly rated. It‚Äôs small - maybe 8 tables - but not cramped. We had the butter chicken and the lamb Jalfrezi, and my son wanted to lick his plate. Yazan was so helpful navigating the menu, and the restaurant seemed to be filled with a nice mix of locals and visitors. We‚Äôre craving it already.

Indian restaurant run by Moroccans with Indian cooks I ate a moment I had a great Tandoori Chicken and Butter Chicken 
Recommended

review title: Loved it- my favorite Indian restaurant in Tangier
review:
Loved the service & the food
The staff were super nice and helpful 
Tried chicken tikka and butter chicken both were tasty

review title: Unforgettable Indian cuisine: The best I‚Äôve ever tasted
review: I‚Äôve had the privilege of enjoying Indian cuisine in many countries, including the UAE, USA, Belgium, Spain, and the Netherlands. But nowhere have I experienced such an exceptional culinary delight as I did here. The food was honestly the best Indian food I‚Äôve ever had. Every dish was rich in flavor, perfectly spiced, and clearly prepared with great care. This restaurant surpasses everything I‚Äôve tried elsewhere. An absolute must-visit for anyone looking to experience authentic Indian flavors at their finest!

We had dinner two consecutive days and each time we tried different dishes. I‚Äôm so surprised that this place serves authentic Indian in Morocco of all places! Top service by Yazan and Mustafa on both occasions. I can certainly assure one would have a great dining experience if they visit this place. Next time we‚Äôre in Morocco we‚Äôll come town to Tangiers only to dine in Sarayah Food. Keep up the great work guys!
Mustafa and the chefs at this restaurant are fantastic.  Authentic Indian food in a great setting.  Highly recommend if you are in Tangier.
Restaurant relatively small and very very clean. Thanks to Mustapha for the welcome, his smile and his availability. Tasty dishes, really nothing to criticize. Quick service. Thanks again.
Delicious food, very good service. Indian making the food so its authentic. Food was really good and freshly made. Will definetly come back

review title: A festival of flavor and great service
review: We had to go to another Indian restaurant first but it was exceptionally closed. It is like the one we discovered the restaurant Sarayah and we were not disappointed. We were in a relationship with our 3-year-old daughter. We were served very quickly, the restaurant has a semi-open kitchen that allows to see the preparation of dishes and chapatis. All our dishes were excellent, we feasted üòä again thank you to the whole team for their service at the top.
The staff was very nice and helpful the atmosphere was lively and family friendly and rhe food was excellent I enjoyed every minute of my time there

review title: Excellent food. Excellent service. Beautiful location.
review: The food was delicious.  The soup.  Oh my goodness.  I could go on about the soup forever.  The service was top notch.  I would eat here again.

We had a wonderful time here! Our host was very friendly and gracious and gave us a real taste of Morocco in more ways than one! The food was a huge banquet and we enjoyed the ambiance and the great variety of food!  Thoroughly recommend this restaurant to those wanting to experience the real Morocco!

WOW! I cannot say enough nice things about this wonderful restaurant!! The proprietor was VERY helpful with food suggestions and was spot on with every recommendation! EVERYTHING was exquisite and the portions were quite large. The entire staff was friendly, polite and most accommodating. Be sure to eat here as you will not regret it!!

We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Restaurant Valdalucia. Everyone was so welcoming and friendly. We ate until we couldn‚Äôt eat anymore. Several people in our group tried new foods and enjoyed everything! One of the highlights of our day!

What a delight!  The food was amazing and the owner just wonderful. You felt like family the minute you walked in.  He easily accommodated my daughter, who is gluten free.  There was so much she could eat and he was so very knowledgeable about it.  We watched him speak to so many tables in so many languages and made everyone feel special.  Easy to see why so many tour guides bring their clients here for lunch.  Easily the best part of our tour of Tangier.
Very good and quick service, people were very helpful and food was very good. Would definitely recommend. We had an amazing time.

review title: Amazing story behind this family ask them to tell
review: Excellent food and service. Part of a package tour, but pleasantly surprised by quality and quantity of food. Drinks were free flowing too. Highly recommended!

Tourist trap! Had lunch with my family at this restaurant. We ordered different dishes √† la carte and were disappointed when we got the food. Really small portions that do not satisfy even children for hysterically much money! In addition, the fruit looked the day after tomorrow and the bread had food stains on which suggests it was served earlier. Not worth the money!

Fine good resturant  with the best food we had a good experience  the pastila and the tangier food was great  .................................................................................................................
They were so kind and the food was amazing! The owner came and talked to us and gave us recommendations and was very accommodating! Great place for family and it was decorated very nicley!
Fabulous. Best food we've had in Tangiers. Can't recommend highly enough. Staff were so friendly and drinks were limitless. Excellent all round

Our guide, Nabeel of Nabeel Tours Tangi brought us to this restaurant for lunch. We ate on the second floor and it was beautifully appointed with fabulous tiles and colors. The Wait staff was super friendly. We loved our meals. I would return!
We've been there and it's been great. People are nice and the atmosphere very chill. We got ourselves an all-in price from owner. Food üíØ % service üíØ % interaction üíØ %
very good food and very friendly people, we will definitely be back with my family, we loved the place and the people. üëèüèºüëèüèºüëèüèº

A tour guide brought me here.  The food was very good, but I never received a menu nor an itemized bill.  My bill was $425 MAD, local currency, and I believe was around $26, American dollars.  I think part of the bill was for my tour guide, which I offered.  
They kept bringing me more food than I wanted, but did give me a box to bring home.
Very nice location on the beach. We were lucky to benefit from a table while the reservations were full. A caring and discreet team. We enjoyed our dishes.

I went there often, unfortunately the terrace became covered.
The ambience is nice, the food is good, the location is in front of a beach that makes miles.  Funny thing is, there's a goose who pretends to attack people who go back to restaurants.
a beautiful atmosphere by the sea with very good food, very fast service, the fish was delicious, the chicken with a specific taste
Restaurant very friendly service and well-tasting location central fine parking conditions and good atmosphere

You can‚Äôt beat the location. The ocean is incredible here, and the views from the restaurant are incredible. 

All the seafood and fish is great, particularly the oysters. I will come back.

review title: A great experience, the day after Christmas Eve
review: A very nice place and setting on the edge of the Atlantic halfway between the caves of Hercules and the airport of Tangier. Very good miller soles perfectly cooked and very fresh. The staff is very welcoming.

Excellent lunch by the Atlantic Ocean around Tangier.
We had lunch in a beautiful setting, served by very welcoming and efficient staff.
We tasted an excellent mix of fish.
Restaurant not to be missed!

review title: Suffering, typical restaurant in q the owner is French and is not present
review:
Nice space, poor service, expensive.
Food nothing special.
Typical restaurant for tourist.
I waited half an hour for the drinks, they didn't come up I went to get a Coca-Cola, I ate a fish soup, the water hasn't come yet.
We get up, we pay and we leave

Very nice restaurant, by the sea, with a large terrace.
Super nice staff, we ate very well there. I recommend the plancha squid, just excellent.
I recommend.

A place with splendid ocean views ....bright through the veranda. 
A meal at the top ... homemade fresh fish.

review title: Delicious lunch after a visit to Cape Spartel.
review: A beautiful place on the beach of Sidi Kacem. The view is beautiful, the restaurant very clean and very well maintained. We made a very good breakfast in the sun based on fish and seafood (delicious and very fresh). I will keep an excellent memory of the swordfish carpaccio and the plancha squid. A Trip Tip: don't forget to book because it's very popular!

The resturant decor is outdated. Priceses are extremely high for morroco.  The food is too plane and I felt that I am in hospital . The resturant targets foreign alcohol lovers.  The food experts would give this place zero if available
Very good fish restaurant by the sea. The view is perfect. On the other hand, in the middle of the season you have to book lunch on the terrace. Closed at night.
Excellent address. It's always a pleasure to come back to this restaurant. The food is of very good quality. The fish is always fresh and very well prepared.

We came here by chance, and we were very happy. We highly recommend booking, otherwise you will not have a table in the outdoor terrace which is really nice and you will probably sit inside, as happened to us. The service is very slow, so if it bothers you avoid it, if you are more patient it can be the restaurant for you, they are still very courteous. We ordered gazpacho and tuna and octopus carpaccio. All very good. To continue as a main course we took the sole mugnania, really good and tasty, and the fillet of pageot royal, good. Both dishes were accompanied by pasta with pesto (I know, as Italians it is a bit strange) and cooked vegetables. Perhaps the thing a little less good were just the side dishes. In addition, in this restaurant you will also find wine, beer... which is always difficult in Morocco. The price is certainly higher than the Moroccan average, but still lower than Italian prices.

review title: Wasn't impressed. I had high expectations after reading some good reviews.
review: Very polite softly spoken staff, but took us an hour to get served and no, restaurant was not that busy. We did request gluten free options so I understand perhaps thats why other got served before us, but when the food did come... The quality of the traditional food besides the chips ( which were obviously freshly made in clean oil) was very poor. I ordered a seafood grill and seafood tagine. Fish was not fresh and tagine tasted off...I was too tired to complain and so we just paid and left.
I highly recommend it is delicious and the staff is helpful ‚ù§Ô∏èüá≤üá¶üá≤üá¶üá≤üá¶ I invite you to eat at Restaurant Ahlan Tangier it is a delight mmmm

Typical Moroccan restaurant. Very clean and friendly and helpful staff. 
Wide selection of meat and fish prepared in typical Moroccan recipes or grilled. 
We order:
grilled mixed fish dish with the addition of fried squid. 
Fish tajine 
Grilled sardines 
All very good and tasty. 
In the meantime they bring you warm bread, olives and cheese. 
At the end of the post typical mint tea and biscuits offered. 
So satisfied we went back several times during the holiday. 
Absolutely honest price.

Not understandable why this restaurant is so highly rated and recommended in several forums. Due to the food and service maximum average for Tangier. Our tanjins were served cold. We haven't seen this in any other restaurant in Tangier. Unmotivated staff.

We really enjoyed our dinner. Super fresh and delicious food and fast service. 
The service was top; We receive some apetizers, tea and cookies besides our order.

review title: Great place to start sightseeing in Tanger
review: Variety, quality, detail, central and all at a good price.  Do not hesitate, if you are going to Tanger at least the first lunch or dinner that is in this place and then if you want to change try other things but to start this one will leave the list very high. Friendly treatment.

Restaurant very traditional, simple, but serves an amazing food. We have stayed for 2 weeks in Marrocos and this was the best food we had for sure. Couscous agneau is a certain choice, with all the flavors.

I travel to Tangier 4 or 5 times a year, and during my stay, I always go to lunch or dinner at this restaurant. The dishes are very well prepared, the presentation and the plating is very good, and the service of the waiters is unbeatable. If it is true that there are also other very good restaurants in Tangier, because there the food is very good, but Ahlen restaurant, is one of the best in terms of food Tangier

Great restaurant, top team. Tea offered with a Moroccan cake.
You can go without hesitation
Two meals during our stay in TANGER
Typical decor

review title: To flee false advertising and false reviews
review:
Comments are false!! Restaurant to flee!! We have followed the opinions that are simply wrong. Considering the quality it's not possible to get reviews like this.
Do not go there
The food was excellent. What we liked the most was the lamb couscous and the meat lozenge. The deal was wonderful

Excellent Moroccan restaurant in the old town (Medina). Simple menu, decent portions and quick service. 

It‚Äôs close to the main ‚Äòstrip‚Äô of the Medina, so plenty to wander around and see before or after.

We ate with the family , the small olives and cheese as an aperitif were offered to us, we ate couscous and skewers everything was excellent and we ended with tea and cupcakes that were also offered to us. 
I recommend we had 4 for 275 dirhams
Lovely food and excellent Moroccan tea. We had a mixture of lentils, beans, cous cous, French fries.  Great service very clean. Was recommended by another traveller.

A small restaurant positioned in the medina in Tangier.  It is only small and gets very busy.  We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table.  The tagine and couscous dishes were lovely, very filling and reasonably priced.  There was complimentary bread, cheese and olives before the main course and Moroccan tea and biscuit at the end of the meal.  It was good value for money with great service.

Everything and everyone was brilliant!
Delicious breakfast, comfortable bed, lovely staff!
Thank you for having us!

We traveled me and my sister and we just loved. The mega comfortable room was all we needed after ten days traveling quickly. We were able to rest and enjoy the city at a different pace. The room is beautiful, well decorated, you can see that everything was thought out with great care. The terrace, which is huge, is perfect for enjoying the climate of Essaouira. The team made us feel at home, we want to go back.

review title: The best place to stay in Essouira - Book directly for the best price!
review: We had the most amazing stay here and couldn‚Äôt ask for a better welcome to Essaouira. Felix was so sweet and made us feel at home, he recommended few nice restaurants, cafes and a unique rooftop bar. The room was nice and comfortable with a lovely indoor courtyard view. There is a jacuzzi available for an hour for each guest, you just need to reserve your time slot. Breakfast was so delicious and fresh, and it was served on the terrace. It was nice to have a lovely view. Make sure you meet Simba üêà Thank you for having u,s and hope to come back soon!

This was my second stay here (I have a third booked later in the year too!). Everything about Riad Baladin is so lovely - the vibe is really relaxed, the decor is beautiful, and the rooms are comfortable and clean. Breakfast is on the rooftop terrace, which has stunning views all around.  They have a lady on site who does massage (her name escapes me, apologies!), which was very relaxing and highly recommended.  Felix and his entire team are exceptional - from the front of house welcome, to all the ladies who do breakfast, to the nightguard who looks after the place.  I've recommended here to everyone, whether they're planning a trip to Morocco or not! :)

The riad's authentic Moroccan style is impeccable, the jacuzzi made it luxurious and cosy. The staff's well maintenance is reflected by the cleanliness and amazing breakfast.
Such a magical blend of hospitality and luxury, I advise you to pack up and not rethink

The Riad is really charming, the breakfasts are delicious and the staff is very kind. 
Felix (the owner) is super friendly, he gives good addresses to eat and he explains everything to see in Essaouira. 
I highly recommend this Riad!

review title: Experience not to be missed in Essaouira...
review: Third solo stay at the Riad.  Very warm welcome.  The hotel manager, Felix, has a kind word for everyone.  He puts all his soul and heart into this riad.  The open fireplace welcomes guests to breakfast.  It feels like home.  Besides, the riad is close to the sea, and we are lulled by the sound of waves.  Possibility of massage.  Not to be missed...

A beautiful calm retreat with lovely staff and excellent service. Our room was very comfortable and just the right amount of traditional Moroccan touches. Breakfast was delicious and Felix the manager made sure we had all the information we needed and gave us some great tips! Highly recommended.

Riad cozy and warm. Very nice discovery, no complaints about the rooms, very welcoming and professional staff, very nice panoramic roof top. Well located, everything is easily accessible. We will come back to that very soon.

review title: Jewel in the Medina of Essaouira
review: Lovingly furnished riad, in the middle of the medina and yet very quiet. Excellent breakfast and very friendly team. Great roof terrace to relax!!, which have already given many tips from the arrival pro actively. Thank you so much!

I found it really embarrassing to stay in a so-called "Riad de Charme" which, unfortunately, charming has absolutely nothing and the photos you see on the site then live are other. From the reception to the structure, to the level of decor, everything was disappointing. 

The common room was devoid of a real fountain ‚Äî the one present was mural and not working. The cleanliness left much to be desired: stained sofas and chairs, the bed in the room with blood-stained pillowcases, sheets with hair and visibly dirty, as well as pierced and frayed towels. 

On the rooftop, the tub was CLOSED, covered with a filthy tarp, accompanied only by two deckchairs thrown there to make a scene. The breakfast was monotonous, without any variant, and the coffee really bad. The humidity was oppressive everywhere, especially in the room, where the situation was even worse. But the icing on the cake? Cockroaches in the room and even on this occasion apologizing was superfluous 

Despite all the inconveniences and errors found, no one has ever apologized to us.

After reading the previous reviews, I wonder: maybe the other guests saw this place with pink glasses... or simply, compared to where they usually live, this seemed like paradise to them?

This lovely little hotel is well worth a stay in an equally lovely town. You reach the riad if you walk the 500m from Bad Marrakech and then straight forward. Cars can't reach anywhere near here. Good breakfast and fast service. There is a jacuzzi on the roof top that you can ask to use (it's included). The room was spacious with a few quirks, like a fully tiles shower/bathtub to which you will have to step into through a small stair or the glass doors into the room (curtains seals off the view). The living room they show on the pictures are a common room on the top floor where you will find books and a place to sit down and relax.

review title: A modern oasis in a beautiful town
review: This is a modern riad, tucked away just off the market.  It has been tastefully redone with modern amenities, lots of space in the rooms,  and very comfortable beds.  They have done a masterful job at maintaining  the friendly, relaxed vibe of Essaouria with modern comforts

Nice riad, well decorated and welcoming, good location. 
Breakfast was varied and very well on the terrace.  Always with fresh orange juice.
Youssef very helpful and pleasant. 
Our stay was great
We recommend it to you.

review title: A few days in Essaouira, Morocco
review: Riad Dar Maya, in beautiful, welcoming Essaouira, Morocco, was a real find.  With only five rooms, its is a wonderful place for those of us who like smaller, more intimate properties.  Our room and the public spaces had a soothing, minimalist design, which was quite appealing.  Everyone on the staff was very professional.  The location, deep in the old medina and very close to everything we wanted to see, including the old Portuguese battlements, was ideal.

A five room boutique riad, managed by Youssef who is charming, going above and beyond to help with whatever queries you may have 
The breakfasts are good:  eggs however you want them, delicious bread.  Fresh orange juice, fresh fruit salad with yogurt, sweet pancakes/a sugary bun (difficult to describe but delicious) and good coffee (or teas of your choice ).  However, for dinner I suggest you eat out.  The roof terrace is lovely but the sea views are not as spectacular as hoped for.  The decor is sophisticated- lots of marble .  The bedroom floor is very cold so do take slippers as they are not provided.  Dar Maya is ideally placed within the walls and within easy walking of interesting sights, especially the Port.   Also excellent restaurants five or ten minutes away.

The hardware, the interior design was better than the photographs. Muted colors, ambient candle lights in the evening, alcoves, deep marble bath, and restrained decor were so soothing, welcoming quiet time to rest, read and write. We felt 'at home'. There is no view to the ocean, but I felt it is better so. It is a sanctuary from whatever is happening outside. 

The software, I felt, needs maintenance and repair. The staff English language, the fixtures like a broken lamp, the pipes which don't drain well, and stained pillow covers... Lacking quality control, manager or owner's presence and ownership when something deviates from the normal operations.   

The hardware is so good, I am letting it go...

review title: An elegant setting in the medina
review: Fantastic experience in the heart of the medina. A beautiful discovery, an elegant, quiet and spacious hotel with a team with little care to make the stay even more pleasant. Special signing for Youssef who responds to all organizational requests with a smile:)

Lovely place with lovely hosts/manager‚Ä¶

Rooms were decent sized and clean the and toilet was also clean. Hot shower during cold December really helps

Very conveniently located to get to the old city walls but pretty much the main area of Essaouira is within walking distance regardless.

Really glad we chose this place.

Had a 2 night stay here & cannot fault the service offered by Youssef & the team. They make you feel so at home. Our room was amazing, spotlessly clean & spacious. Breakfast was very good, All the staff were so friendly. Highly recommend this Riad if travelling to Essaouira. Keep up the amazing work, we will be recommending this Riad to all our friends

Essaouira is a windy location, on golf course or on sea wind can be bring you in amazing situation. Nice hotel, food is correct. New and Very clean. Free parking. Quiet location. Members are helpfull. wifi in reception onl

review title: A nice hotel we will come back to
review: We spend 3 nights, me, my daughter and fiance. Nice rooms, normal "ibis" breakfast. Good service, and nice beds.This hotel was a Ibis but somehow changed the name to Moussafir. The pool was ok, and we had really great time there all three.I put a four "very good" because the time i was there was special for me, but if i will be objective about the hotel, it is a "Ibis" class with a little extra. Very nice people who work there.

The outside of the building is stunning.  Very Essaouira. And the pool area is beautiful (although the pool is rather small for the size of hotel). The inside is rather sterile and standard and the corridor to the rooms is very long. My room was lovely though it didn't feel like I was in Africa at all. Shower was great although my sink drained very slowly. The food for the set evening meal was interesting. I think it tried to be refined and posh but feel short in its randomness. Whole fish with cold rice. Hard spaghetti with cheese. Drinks were pricey too.

Essaouira is a windy location, on golf course or on sea wind can be bring you in amazing situation. Nice hotel, food is correct.
New and Very clean. Free parking. Quiet location. Members are helpfull.  wifi in reception only

good location, small but clean room, a shower that works, a good bed with clean bedding.  didn't try breakfast because prefer going out and helping somebody in the community but it looked ok.  good value for money.  stay here if you can.

I confirm it's beautiful than expected for a 3*. Nice than several 4*. New and Very clean. Free parking. Quiet location. Members are helpfull. You can benefit free wifi at rooms 100-103. For good swiming pool view ask rooms 110-112-114...

Basic typical Ibis on the road to the old city.
Rooms are ok, same about service.
Breakfast was very basic as well, not more than that.
If you do not expect to much, so it's a very good option.
It's a realy good for value option.

We stay in ibis three nights, the room is clean, well heated and the reception so helpfull. Good price and plenty breakfast, 15 minute by foot to the center by the seaway. Good compromise for visit Essaouira and find a place not expensive

helpfull staff,good standard of housekeepng,nice quiet hotel away from the centre yet close enough to walk or 10 dirhamby taxi,breakfast was disapionting let hotel down,all mod cons.have stayed at this hotel 18 months ago is a good uk 3 star rating,complimentary iron provided but no ironing board which is disapionting,most staff have good understanding of english .

mohammed from uk.

after being fed up dark dodgy medina riads we went to the ibis for the pool and quiet! we were pleased however was over priced for the room...small, carpets dirty, cheap looking. Pool area nice. food ok, expensive, long walk to the centre, get a taxi, essaouria is nice, take a jumer!

A charming boutique-style dar (house) in the medina, stylishly restored. Amina was welcoming and helpful, providing a delicious breakfast.
Our open-plan bedroom was spacious and comfortable (the toilet incorporated into the bedroom/bathroom) but lacked a window with view or somewhere to unpack clothes (a small rail is provided). It's worth mentioning the beautiful polished floors are hazardous when walking on the floor rugs - extremely slippery!.

review title: Felt like part of the family
review:
We stayed for 5 nights in Essaouira
And treated like part of the family . This is a small riad with 5 rooms and each one has its own charm. Very clean and the Manager is an absolute gem . For the life of me I don‚Äôt remember her name . But she was so attentive , Cooks up a storm and is a master at baking making the most wonderful cakes and pancakes . We had dinner and she even turned the fireplace on for us . You really couldn‚Äôt ask for anything more .

The dar is charming and clean, the location was very good, and the house manager Amina made a very good breakfast. She doesn't speak english at all, so communicating with her to stop using her scent candles proved to be not possible, which was a problem for me as I am very allergic to whatever scent that was. Our bathroom did not look like the picture, but it was a nice bathroom. The bed was good, and the perfumed candle smell did not go into the room.

review title: A cozy, hospitable B+B in the medina
review: Hotel Dar Les Sir√®nes is a cozy B+B in the Medina of Essaouira. The rooms are basic and comfortable, and come with a bath or a shower. They are clean and functional and supplied with adequate linens. Breakfast is fruit, pastries, orange juice, bread, scrambled eggs and coffee or tea. At the price we paid (about 800 dihrams/night) it was a good deal. The best aspect of our visit was our the welcome from our hostess, Amina, who seems to do everything (front desk, cooking, cleaning). Amina was very kind and sweet, and immediately responded to any of our questions or wishes. It shows how just one staff person's hospitality can make a visit enjoyable and worth returning to the hotel.

A very sweet little riad. Francoise was exceptional and really made our stay at Dar Les Sirenes so welcoming and easy from start to finish. Francoise went above and beyond to help with recommendations and restaurant bookings and we enjoyed our stay so much because of her. The riad itself is small, but has everything you need and good breakfast cooked by Amina. The bed was very comfortable but I would say the pillows need changing as they were a bit old and clumpy. Overall, Dar Les Sirenes is excellent value for money and the lovely ladies who work here are very accommodating.

The place is super clean, quiet, and gorgeous. Great location, beautiful architecture, really pleasant and friendly atmosphere. On top of all that the people who work there are incredibly helpful and generous with food, drinks, fruits, their time, and advice. They made my stay in Morocco super pleasant! I will always stay there.

Me and my wife stayed at Dar Les Sirenes for a total of 7 nights. We had a wonderful time. Initially, we planned to stay 3 nights, but the comfortable rooms, sunny terrace, and above all else, the dedicated and lovely staff inspired us to stay much longer.

The place is clean and beautifully decorated with local art and furniture. The rooftop terrace offers a nice opportunity to sun bathe, with a fair amount of cover from the ever strong winds.

Our trip was made especially lovely by the ever smiling and supporting staff. I got food poisoning by eating at the fish market, upon which the cook made us a soup for dinner twice in a row and the staff brought up medicine and a thermometer to our room.

Overall, it really was a home away from home. Highly recommend.

We have stayed at three other riads in Essaouira over the past two years. We rated this riad the best for the following reasons: 1) The morning breakfast was exceptional. 2) The staff were friendly, and helpful. They went out of their way to accommodate when we asked anything of them. We asked for Berber Eggs one morning and they made them for the following day. Another day asked for some dry cleaning to be done, which was quickly procured. Great people as well! 3) The rooftop terrace was large and inviting 4) The room was clean, and large and had a small balcony. We realize that we probably had one of the largest rooms, but all the rooms we saw were unique and nice. I would have to say that you will not be disappointed in choosing this riad.

The bed was very comfortable and the linen good. The architect who designed it must not have thought how awkward to actually stay and use the place. Polished grey concrete bathroom with a bow balanced on a stand, not bathroom shelf. The bedroom, a cell, one tiny window up against the city wall so no view and not much light, the other window onto the landing so curtain had to be closed . Breakfast, whilst served and prepared by a lovely young lady, was chaotic,she obviously had no training. No, do not recommend The rooftop terrace had paint and plaster falling off the walls, the 2red ‚Äúsunloungers‚Äù were fit for the scrap heap and the other seating was tired.Dying plants wonky parasols. In need of some upgrading

We would have liked to stay at Riad Chbanate but it was fully booked so we stayed at Dar Les Sirenes. We were still welcome to spend time and have delicious meals at Chbanate. All the staff at both riads are wonderful. Special thanks to Gregy, Hicham and Said who all went out of their way to make us feel at home. Gregy was especially kind with us and with our 2 year old daughter. She still says his name after one month back home! Thank you! Both riads are tastefully decorated but Chbanate is trully special. We would definitely recommend.

An unforgettable stay in Essaouira!
We had a wonderful stay at this hotel. The atmosphere is charming and the location is perfect. A special thank you to Layla who was exceptionally kind and professional. His smile and good humor made our meals even more enjoyable. We would also like to pay tribute to Amir, the receptionist, for his valuable help. He provided us with all the necessary information about Essaouira with great availability and in-depth knowledge of the city.
We highly recommend this property and hope to return very soon!

We were given a free upgraded room which was not expected but appreciated. The hotel is in need of some TLC, the door to the balcony rubs against the floor, the door for the bathroom was covered with dust, the toilet did not flush properly and the shower head wouldn‚Äôt sit right. For breakfast in the morning only half the tables were set up properly (cutlery, napkins etc). Breakfast wasn‚Äôt very good and service was off, we received our jams after all the food was served so it was quite pointless and the coffee cups were dirty.

The Hotel has everything you Need. Big bathroom, comfortable bed, nice breakfast, clean swimming pool. The staff is really nice and polite too. You are really close to the old city of essaouria- about 5 min walking. If your holidays are about surfing it‚Äôs a real long walk to all the surfing schools and the good surfing spot - around 25 minutes.
You can really here the cars from the room because there is the Main Street. So If you are a light sleeper you should book the room which is NOT facing the sea, because there is also the main road.
In general it‚Äôs a real cute little hotel :)

The hotel is nice bud old.

The doors from the balkony don't close properly as some others also.
The furniture is very old and not in a good condition.
The dishes are not cleaned very well.
The breakfast is too sweet, not really healthy.

For now it's not worth the price.

But, the staff is very very friendly, the garden is soo beautiful and the pool is nice.
The hotel is just in front of the Medina, the location is perfect.

If the management would improve the kitchen staffs training and do some smaller maintenance it would be a really great hotel.

If the management would improve some things and trained the stuff well it could be a superb hotel.

Loved our stay here. Noureddine and the other staff were wonderful and did everything they possibly could to male our stay comfortable.
If you are looking for a generic 4* hotel then this isn‚Äôt for you. It feels more like a big Riad and more homely.
The rooms could do with a little updating. The wooden bed frames creaked VERY loudly and it took some investigation to work out that a kink in the shower hose was causing low water pressure.
But for the price this was great and I would definitely stay again.
Location perfect and pool/reception area lovely and relaxing. Breakfast simple and delicious.
Pete Crouch

The building has a lot of potentiall but for us it seems like the management and the sense for proper service has left the building. For this price we expected a lot more. The towels and sheets are old and have permanent stains. At breakfast, the plates were chipped and not washed properly, and the tablecloths were dirty. The location is also very noisy and the windows doesn‚Äôt shut properly. However, the staff were kind enough to let us change rooms to one with a bit less noise.

Very very friendly pleasing staff.
Hotel is ‚Äútired‚Äù
Would be simply beautiful if it was done up.
Towelling robes and towels are old as are pool lounger covers.

Faulty towers element:- blew fuses in room on day one and shower head fixture fell off! All fixed that day.

Water plentiful and hot so had lovely bath.
Rooms with sea view are super others a bit dank!!

Good breakfast.

You pay for bottled water after small bottle in room has gone.

No lifts and rooms over 3 floors.

However close to beach and medina Lots of choice to eat.

Poolside enclosure is nice and pool warm. It was VERY windy at times

Lovely staff but hotel is very run down and not very clean. Towels & sheets are ancient and stained. Pool is clean but sun beds & covers grotty. Garden unkempt. I suggest staying at their sister hotel which is a Riad within the M√©dina

review title: Totally overpriced and very run down!
review:
This was an incredible disappointing hotel! After paying a premium price for the stay we had an expectation to receive a certain standard of quality.

The building is incredibly run down. Towels are badly stained and frayed on the edges. There was a blood stain one of the pillows. Water does not drain from the sink in the bathroom. Bathroom window can't be opened without it dropping completely on the toilet. Windows and door t balcony didn't lock. Overall the room smelt of mould and it was very dusty. Hotel food was also terrible! Breakfast as well as lunch/dinner offering.

We moved to Le M√©dina Essaouira a block away for the same price. It was an exceptional improvement!

This was by far the nicest staff, very very helpful, always smiling very attentive and polite and trustworthy of all the hotels and riad I have been to on my trip to Morocco this was the best place I've stayed in I highly recommend it !

This restaurant is a true gem. Every detail from the lovely ambiance to the delicious food is meticulously thought out. The warm hues in the woven leather chairs, the natural unique stone floors , the expansive windows with glowing light shining inside onto tables with tall carved wood candles. The food is creative, flavorful, perfectly balanced in texture and taste and exquisitely presented. The price point is reasonable and the service impeccable. Truly, a must try.
A warm welcome in a bewitching setting. Everything was perfect: exquisite food - we composed a meal with different tapas-, fresh and tasty gray wine, warm atmosphere.

Brand new restaurant , fine decoration half-Eastern , half-Western. The meal was delicious from A to Z! Boss and staff very friendly. More western-oriented cuisine with exotic touches. Price also close to France ( a little cheaper ). We strongly recommend tasting these delicate dishes and flavors! We'll be back.

review title: A wonderfully comfortable intercultural dining experience.
review: We had a wonderful experience at Umia, so good we ate there one night and chose to eat there the next night as well. The restaurant is lightly modern in style and the host/owner is gracious and welcoming. The owner is, we believe, Moroccan, married as he told us to an Italian and the restaurant reflects that cultural mix. The food was superb, a mix of offerings that were Moroccan and continental, with a nice mix of offerings including some superb beef and fish carpaccios.  The six of us just had a lovely time and, having been in Morocco for almost three weeks found the mix of dishes refreshing.  The service was excellent and friendly, making you feel most welcome in Englis, Frech and, although we did not speak it, obviously Arabic. The wine list was good and reasonable. So too were the prices, certainly not inexpensive but also not over the top. The noise level was moderate, certainly not intrusive. We just had an excellent experience an would highly recommend Umia.

Very welcome. Frame decoration arranged with taste. Cocktail very ok. Tuna steak on top. The fishing port is not far so quality products. Very good to cook knives but cooking and seasoning to improve according to our taste, and in relation to the price, hence the 4* instead of 5* which is close.
Love this restaurant! Wonderful food, great ambiance and super nice staff. Hard to find a very good restaurant in Essaouira but here it is!!!  I will be backüëç

Unfortunately from the moment we arrived we felt completely rushed as they fit in two services. The male owner was so rude when we turned up two people short of our 10 person booking. Made us feel extremely uncomfortable from start to finish and all of our food was tepid so clearly pre prepared. However our waiter, Abdul was lovely. As frequent visitors to Essaouira, we would never return

One of the best restaurants we've ever eaten in. Friendly service, great ambience, good location.
Great value for money.
Would definitely come back.
Thank you.

review title: Don't go (Madada restaurant is much better!)
review: Too expensive, man in charge of room / restaurant is mainly interested to, once order placed, get you out as soon as possible so that table is again free for next guests (this not only we had to experience, and other couple we knew had exactly the same experience), he is also very 'made' friendly, but not really friendly!

I cannot tell you, how wonderful this place is! This was our second visit. The beautiful lady and handsome man who run the place are invested, heart and soul.
