The queue pays testament to the incredible food and really exceptional service. Then there is the food. Just WOW. My husband is a chef and he says the attention to detail and the ingredients are exceptional. Lovely Ros√©, stunning plates of food and a beautiful setting. When you pay well for food, you do expect a lot. This is a gem that absolutely delivers. 10 out of 10. Absolutely!!!

Wonderful experience not only at the culinary level but also in relation to the incomparable service. Beautiful discovery, to do again!! 
A must in Essaouira.
Excellent cuisine in a beautiful setting! A delight of flavors and beautiful creativity! Address to discover in Essaouira

review title: Great food in a beautiful ambience!
review:
We were back here after 5 years and just as enthusiastic again.
Very friendly welcome , very good, perfectly prepared food (octopus carpaccio, then filet Wellington. ) 
An excellent Moroccan red wine.
That's not quite cheap , but it's absolutely worth the money.
We will definitely come back!

The cocktails were amazing! It was delicious. What a good recommendation. 
The food and the drinks were amazing. 
The bar tender is really nice!

review title: An address to note and especially book before
review: Umia rhymes with culinary excellence. An inventive menu, refined flavors and attentive service make this place a must-see. Here, each dish is a nice surprise, in a warm setting where you like to come back.

Beautiful local cuisine offered by this restaurant near the ramparts of Essaouira.
Here you can enjoy fresh and deliciously prepared products, in a slightly offbeat atmosphere (candlelight evening, music and 70s rock decor. We spend a very pleasant time, while enjoying a hearty and delicious meal.

Cost inside, quick service and tasty food, service not so friendly.didnt appreciate the cats jumping on us mid-meal and wandering in and out of the kitchen but I saw that other customers liked the cats

Food was delicious however, our male waiter was unfriendly and inattentive.  He would walked past us while one of us tried to wave him down.  I thought he was having a bad day until a young lady came in and his mood changed from night to day.  Atmosphere was lively.  I would have given a 5 star review had he been a little attentive to our needs.
a beautiful discovery in Essaouira. A "cozy", warm atmosphere and a very vegetable, very fresh and creative cuisine, full of flavors and aromatics. Highly recommended!

What a find! The interior is incredible and the food was to die for. And what was so good was every day they offer 2 vegetarian starters and 2 mains. The owner was very personable and played a great playlist (if you‚Äôre 50+ LOL). I will definitely be returning when I am in Essaouira next.
Welcome and very warm place, pleasant atmosphere by candlelight, the dishes are of a very good quality! No alcohol, but it‚Äôs not a problem, because everything is organic!
Excellent I recommend address fresh quality products, cozy atmosphere do not hesitate to go there. I would love to go back

review title: Romance in the morning or evening
review:
This is a beautiful little restaurant tucked away in a quiet street of the medina. They were playing an awesome playlist (my fav). Each seating is unique. If you are planning something special with your love, choose the little elevated table in the nook. 

The food is delicious. Short menu, small portions, but definitely filling. This is a ‚ÄúDo Not Miss‚Äù restaurant.
Very nice place, a bit outside the hustle and bustle of the old town. Very cozy atmosphere, refined decor, the menu is limited to a few dishes that are carefully prepared and presented.

review title: Belly full heart happy taste buds satisfied
review:
A delicious time!
The taste buds feast
The cuisine is Moroccan and fine!
Starter for dessert we have for our heart!

Go ahead with your eyes closed

Yeah. 
It is better to book as we passed twice and the service was full so we booked for the next day.  
The setting is nice. All in stone and original decoration 
The dishes are just as good and perfectly seasoned  
 A very good table

My friend had walked past Triskala and liked the look of it. We read the reviews online and, even though the menu looked limited with just three starters and three mains, it looked interesting. A small menu is generally a good sign, as it usually indicates that food is freshly prepared although, on the other hand, it can be a struggle if the choices don‚Äôt appeal.

We made a reservation but, unfortunately, on the day we visited, I wasn‚Äôt keen on the mains so I ended up ordering two starters. The sweet potato and fennel soup was quite nice, although there was not much taste of fennel, and the portion size was extremely small. The accompanying homemade olive bread was delicious and my other starter of sardine croquettes was very tasty. We both had kombucha to drink and shared a dessert of panna cotta, both of which were nice.

I didn‚Äôt find the staff to be friendly, starting with our early arrival for our 6.30.p.m booking when we were refused entry until exactly 6.30.p.m, even though the doors were wide open and there didn‚Äôt seem to be anything happening inside. Being made to wait outside for no obvious reason (thankfully it wasn‚Äôt raining!) seemed petty and I would say that the staff in this restaurant were the least friendly and welcoming of anywhere we visited in Essaouira. Once inside, and seated (the seating is not very comfortable either!), the other tables filled up quickly and there was a nice relaxed atmosphere, with a bit of a bohemian vibe to the place which seemed to be very much in keeping with the mainly young-looking clientele.

Prior to eating, we‚Äôd become aware that the food is sustainably sourced from the restaurant‚Äôs own permaculture farm where you can also go to eat. Although the farm is roughly a half hour drive from Essaouira, we actually said we‚Äôd have visited for a meal on another day, had our meal at Triskala not been a very average dining experience. Whilst the restaurant‚Äôs green ethos, which includes not using plastic and only serving filtered water or water in glass bottles, is commendable, my food in particular was just average and failed to live up to expectations.

review title: A serene lunch in the heart of the Essaouria medina
review:
A calm restaurant lit by candles,  and welcoming staff.  Happy to serve us a light lunch .  My zucchini- wrapped sardine croquettes were  delicious as was a gently seasoned octopus salad.  My highlight was Karkade - a drink with all manner of juices and spices - a real pick-me-up from the grotty cold I was suffering.

The cat was very friendly- sleeping on my lap throughout the meal.  A lunch time from heaven

review title: A Unique Plant-Based Experience in a cave- like atmosphere
review: This restaurant has a unique and beautiful cave-inspired decor, offering a truly special experience. The atmosphere is warm and cozy, and all the dishes are plant-based, crafted with natural and delicious flavors. A great choice for adventure lovers and healthy food enthusiasts

Had a beautiful meal at Triskal this evening. Had the leek with goats cheese for starter and then fish with vegetables, before finishing off with their amazing cake.  All beautiful flavours, fish cooked  to perfection, all in a relaxed setting with good music and interior. My favourite place whilst staying in Essauoira.  Can't wait to return.

Super trendy deco restaurant modern cuisine mixed with the original Moroccan traditional cuisine of flavor especially the giant nems cut into pieces raised balzamic cream and sesame pearl a delight all well explained by the waiter very considerate and pleasant very good French will return 10/10 thank you Youcef for advising us üòénassera
Quiet and cozy place, the staff was kind to the little care, we ate well.a culinary experience to do again.                                  Price quality f&b correct

review title: Excellent, the best restaurant we have made, from starter to dessert everything is perfect, plus the waiters live the
review: Perfect, to do absolutely, excellent cuisine, good friendliness, our favorite for this restaurant, hats off to the waiters
Place in the heart of the medina with a map that is presented to us in detail by the master of the place who is a passionate!!! We feasted and enjoyed this magical setting!!

We had a great time at the Keystone. The atmosphere is cozy, the staff smiling and attentive, and the dishes... a real treat! It is a fine cuisine, full of flavors, with a beautiful presentation.

You can feel a lot of passion in what is on offer, both on the plate and in the service. An address where you feel good and recommend without hesitation.

Thank you for this beautiful gourmet break!

Value for money very average. I agree with Mohamed. The game was not worth it!
Strong products in taste and very little finesse. Even so, the waiter was fine.

Disappointed , after reviewing the reviews. 
I expected something else.
Disappointed value for money.
Beautiful in pictures but in taste we are not there.

review title: Nice place where you get (quickly) sick
review:
Very nice place. Nice service. Cosy. Recipes sought. Ah I forgot: out of 3 people 1 was sick before leaving the restaurant - another table had a similar problem with this damn octopus (poorly thawed?) and me 3 hours after evening because of the little octopus I had the temerity to swallow a piece despite the first impression evening the salad avocado gambas ...

Brief restaurant to visit but where to avoid for your health consume...

Only problem with my stay in this beautiful city.

review title: How to ruin your mood and appetite
review: We visited a restaurant with friends. The waiter was not attentive and did not write down our entire order. We waited for the order for an hour, during which time the order was already delivered to everyone who came later than us. When it turned out that the waiter had not recorded our order, he did not apologize and began to prove that we had not ordered these dishes. They left in a bad mood. The prices for the dishes are too high. With such an attitude towards visitors, you cannot call yourself a restaurant.

High prices compared to small portions and a wait of about an hour. 
Limited choice of dishes. 
Tagliatelle with prawns drowned in cream. 
High-end target but in fact poor reception in content.

My friend and I came here two years ago, and were determined to visit again. The food was so good! 
We have not been disappointed! We all tried starters we wouldn‚Äôt necessarily have tried at home; the roasted cauliflower, pigeon pastilla and the monkfish spring roll. Each one of us was  convinced that we had had the best! 
Surely the starters couldn‚Äôt be bettered? But the mains were comparable! We can highly recommend the Monkfish with Saffron sauce, the lamb shank ‚Äòto die for!‚Äô and the handmade crab ravioli (which I‚Äôd had 5 pieces now (it was so delicious). Ambient and relaxing. Friendly and informative staff. 
Thanks once again!
Some place. Very friendly staff. Some of the best food we have had in our entire stay. Crab ravioli and lamb with, quite simply, the best rice ever (caramelised banana and raisins)

Cozy warm environment. Limited map but of everything. Delicious fish, fate, eaten. More like a small portion but enough for us. Host discreet but nice explanation about preparation tagine with fish. Really do!

Discovered by chance. It was a very good memory. Succulent. 
Original dishes with a touch of Morocco on the plates. 
A crush on tiramisu.  
And them. Crab rapes 
A very good memory 
Part of the best restaurants in essaouira
Innovative and tasty cuisine, a cozy setting, very friendly service: Moroccan cuisine revisited and full of flavors

We had dinner at this chosen place thanks to reviews from tripadvisor.  The dishes were delicious, the presentation captivating and colorful, the fish fresh and tasty. The staff was extremely friendly and the cost really honest! I highly recommend it!

review title: The heart is also on the plate
review:
Small restaurant, nice decoration and super well eaten. Thanks for the welcome.
The heart is also on the plate.
Just a suggestion, good home fries with lamb chops, it will be fabulous, finally the rice and vegetables were good too.

review title: Fantastic choice to eat fresh fish
review: Fantastic Moroccan restaurant to eat fresh fish. We loved both the food and the atmosphere and the service. We will repeat if we return to Essaouira.
Great food, fresh produce and extra attention to the layout of the plate. Cozy little restaurant, with super friendly service

Best dishes we both had in Essaouira.  Friendly service, great selection of fish and veggie dishes, the goats cheese and fig tagine was seasoned to perfection, exceptional.  Small and intimate, my favourite out of all the restaurants we visited in Essaouira.

review title: Doubts about excellent reviews and freshness
review:
Big doubt about the excellent reviews of this restaurant, it was not bad, but far from excellent.
We had lunch this lunch in a restaurant that offered the same dishes at the same price and the quality was really different.
Very good quality and care also in the presentation of the dishes. Best meal so far in Morocco. Very small place but very hospitable.

Small restaurant well located in the medina. We have chosen seafood products listed on a slate. The avocado with prawns very tasteful, the st pierre with a fair cooking, the delicious squid with vegetables and rice well cooked and a saffron cr√®me br√ªl√©e and what we have not yet had in the 10 days that we are in Morocco is an elegant presentation of each dish. Congratulations to the chef for the freshness and cooking of the dishes we chose, all for a very reasonable price. Go ahead without hesitation.
Small restaurant not to be missed during your stay in Essaouira. Nice service and delicious cuisine. in a small alley as there are many here, the place is charming and welcoming.
Small and cozy restaurant, a very well-kept cuisine and excellent dishes, we ate excellent fresh fish at very honest prices. Highly recommended.

review title: Excellent small, cozy high quality restaurant
review: This is an excellent small, cozy place. The food was of very high quality, fresh fish, goat cheese and roasted eggplant appetizer, Saffron creme brule- all fantastic.  The staff were also superüéâüòä

We went to the Restaurant du Coeur for dinner and left delighted. The product is good, the presentation careful and the service very attentive. We tried several dishes and highlighted the tartares (the tuna with avocado and the prawn with mango) and the grilled squid, which came with vegetables, rice and roast potato, all in point.

Prices are very good: starters for 5-6 ‚Ç¨ and main ones for 12-15 ‚Ç¨. The only catch was the dessert menu, fairly fair, but overall the experience was very worth it. It's a small place, so it's best to go soon. Highly recommended if you are in Essaouira.

Great experience. 
The staff are very kind.
The food, is just excellent. A hidden place, but so rich. 

Best restaurant we tried in Marrocos. 

#freshfish

The food was high quality with refined tastes. We got two and
Delicious appetizers (octopus and avocado salad with shrimp), a squid tajin and two excellent desserts.

Restaurant from the few covered by sublime cuisine. We ordered two fish starters (avocodo and tuna/octopus salad) and two first courses (tajine with squid and pasta with seafood) that delighted our palate. In order not to miss anything, we added a creme caramel! 
20‚Ç¨ each spent very well! Recommendedoooi

review title: The food is good, especially pizzas, but otherwise the service was poor and we were very poorly set up. Cher po
review: The waiters were not pleasant at all, the table was very badly installed, one bench far too far from the table, the other sitting between two benches. Waiters had to pass over us to serve the next table. It was not a good condition to enjoy a good pizza otherwise. What a shame! When the price is twice as expensive as a good Moroccan restaurant!

Excellent lunch, we all had different dishes and we all loved it. Moreover very friendly waiter without overdoing.
To renew without hesitation. only small downside, the map is in Italian and English. we would have liked French too. See you soon, we will return very quickly.

review title: Beautiful Italian restaurant in the Medina
review: Wonderful Italian restaurant in the middle of the medina. Very nicely designed and with very friendly staff. The pizzas are very good, although a little too long in the oven. The wine is a nice way to experience European flair in Morocco. After three weeks Morocco a nice experience.

We were skeptical for fear of taking a catch but it turned out to be anything but. We wanted to disconnect from spicy food by returning to GOOD ITALIAN CUISINE. Great! Pasta with tomato top cooking perfect and pizza margherita very good. 3 plates pasta two daisies two waters one coke and two Italian coffees 55‚Ç¨.
A very good address!!! Tagliatelle, lasagna and pizza like an Italy!!! every time you arrive in Essaouira la Taverna it is a fixed appointment, and always very good!!!

A real Italian restaurant! The pizza is really good, Neapolitan style, with quality ingredients and, if you wish, Italian charcuterie... the pasta is sublime: carbonara and amatriciana as in Rome, and the specialties Bolognese (lasagne, tortellini, balanzoni, tagliatelle, etc.) are the best of the cuisine... to try!

I had the pleasure of tasting the risotto alla milanese at La Taverna Bolognese di Maurizio, and it was simply exceptional. The arborio rice was cooked to perfection, neither too firm nor too soft, coated with a beautiful creamy cream. We could clearly feel the presence of saffron, with its delicate and slightly earthy aromas, which give the dish this golden yellow color so typical. The meat broth had a nice depth, and the freshly grated Parmesan added a touch of character without masking the other flavors.

The setting of the restaurant is simple, warm, with a sincere atmosphere that immediately puts at ease. It feels like being welcomed at home, but with the refinement of real Italian cuisine.

Chef Zahira is doing an outstanding job. His sense of taste, precision and generosity in the kitchen are felt in every bite. A real moment of happiness.
Very disappointed. Pizzas aren't very good. Spaghetti carbonara too salty and on the bacon there was only the skin. We're not going back there
Want a pizza? This is where you should go without forgetting to book. Even with prosciuto and bacon in the carbs! And a Martini as an aperitif..

4 different types of pasta, delicious flavor and cooking. Eggplant and mozzarella top.  Maurizio was not there. But Zaira as well as nice and with a nice smile cooked like a real Italian chef. Good! Among other things, good Moroccan wine. And cheer me up better than my mother-in-law!

review title: Pizza and tagliatelle with meat sauce in Morocco!
review:
Who would have thought that in Essaouira I would find such a good Italian pizza? This pizzeria was a real surprise: light dough, well leavened and with that authentic flavor that only a real Italian pizza can have. The ingredients were fresh, from stringy mozzarella to tasty tomato, and cooking in a wood oven made a real difference.

The atmosphere was simple but welcoming, with a Mediterranean touch that makes you feel at home. Friendly and helpful staff, and prompt service without hurry. An excellent alternative if you want to change a little from local dishes and enjoy a moment of ‚Äúmade in Italy‚Äù taste.

Highly recommended if you are looking for a corner of Italy in the heart of Morocco!

PS: I RECOMMEND YOU TO BOOK

I need to stress up front that the food here was fantastic and the staff were very friendly. We shared a Burrata as a starter and had fresh, hand rolled pasta as a main each (I had the bolognaise and my partner had a vegetarian option). We also ordered sparkling water and wine. The starters arrived with no sign of any drinks, which I had to chase for twice. The starter was very good indeed, but we had not finished it when our mains arrived. At this point our unfinished starter was whisked away from us to make room on the table, leaving us to dive straight into our mains. The mains were both excellent and the pasta truly was handmade and of excellent quality. At the end of the 2 courses, we were left with a considerable amount of wine to consume and so decised to take a punt on dessert. The dessert menu duly arrived, but after 20 minutes or so nobody had taken our order so we decided to call it a day. The food was amazing and the staff were all very nice and friendly, but I can't help but feel that they could do with a bit more training and coordination to male this place a truly great experience. I found the price to be very reasonable for the quality of the food, but reflective of the service.
It was so good! We had pizzas, pasta and the pizza sandwich and it was all incredibly good. Super recommended. We'll be back.

Beautiful discovery in the heart of Essaouira.
A place to feel at home and be able to eat good Italian food.
We were there for lunch and we took a platter of cold cuts and pizza, all of excellent quality.
Attentive and kind service, beautiful location.
After a month in Morocco it was a really nice discovery!
We will definitely return

review title: A pearl in heart of the Medina
review: A pearl in the heart of the Medina! This Italian restaurant is a real asset for Essaouira! It really feels like being in Bologna, with fresh egg pasta, Lasagne, Tortellini.. the best Risotto of my life‚Ä¶and even the meat main courses are of excellent quality. And a Pizza like this can only be eaten in Italy. Highly recommended!!!

review title: An unforgettable culinary experience in the heart of Essaouira
Good on the plate and as soon as the restaurant is open
Small, chic, delicious, informal,& cool music
Dinner in the alleys of the Essaouira medina

review:
What a disappointment üòû 
From the welcome to the bill we were disappointed, unfortunately I advise against food lovers.
Dry cheeses, menu far too expensive for the quality proposed.
Never again!!

We had high expectations for this restaurant based on its glowing reviews, but unfortunately, our experience fell short. The setting itself is beautiful‚Äîsecluded, with an oasis-like atmosphere and authentic decor that should make for a truly memorable visit. The promise of cheese and wine to round off the meal was especially enticing.

However, the reality didn‚Äôt quite match up. When we arrived, the restaurant was completely empty. While this might be due to visiting during the off-season, it did make us wonder about its usual appeal. The menu structure was another letdown‚Äîyou couldn‚Äôt simply choose a dish but had to commit to a full four-course menu. Unfortunately, the food was bland and uninspiring, making the wait for the cheese feel longer than it should have. And even when we finally got to the much-anticipated cheese, it turned out to be a selection of the same type at different aging stages, and found both a hair and a fly squashed into the pieces‚Äînot quite what we had hoped for.

Another disappointment was the lack of drink options. With only water available and no wine or even soda to accompany the meal, the experience felt incomplete.

This restaurant has everything it needs to be an incredible dining destination‚Äîthe ambiance, the concept, and the potential for a great culinary experience. But based on our visit, it fell flat. Hopefully, with some adjustments, it can live up to its potential.

We stopped there to buy cheese only. So no review about the restaurant but we didn't really like the place... an Impression of little maintained from the parking lot, not many people to welcome visitors, closed and uninvolving pool, statues of women who are almost scary... but probably we understand nothing about "art" and their little panties... 
The displayed menu proposals seem correct although simple and of a rather high Award. But we would have to test to know the value for Award and we did not want it at all, too bad.
FYI still good goat cheese but disappointed by the cow.

review title: Disappointing. Surprised this is recommended so highly!
review: Having read such positive reviews on trip advisor we decided to visit here for lunch. We were the only people there, which is slightly off putting, but thought we‚Äôd give it a go. Menu is quite  limited. We all chose the vegetarian option. Mise bouche was good but then  I was served a cheese croquette that was solid so I couldn‚Äôt eat it. Then a bowl of basic salad leaves with some goats cheese crumbled on top. Then a plate of tasteless cheese to finish. We tried to eat some but it just wasn‚Äôt enjoyable so we left it, paid and departed. Surprised this is rated so highly! We can‚Äôt recommend it.

We spent 2 nights in this guest house and are delighted with our stay. The setting is relaxing, the rooms are spacious (we were shown 3 rooms and we could choose the one we liked the most) , the welcome whether by the girl or the owner was perfect (a fruit basket offered on arrival) , the divine breakfast .. in summary, a perfect stay

Awesome!!!
Abderrrhazak as endearing as ever! 
He has an incredible culture!!!
And this place is timeless, pleasantly serene and what's more, the food is very good..

review title: big disappointment, no respect for the customer
review: the place is simply without maintenance, abandoned swimming pool, non-existent parking, very unpleasant sculptures, certainly to my taste.... the meal nothing more, basket of tough bread, limited service, but severe addition! moreover payment exclusively in cash but no change to give us...total disappointment, the tourist is not just a cash cow, no hard bread, but fatty grass! no offer to buy cheese, nothing, like the welcome, and the place, everything from another age!

review title: Mediocre in terms of the setting and the quality of the food. Day-old bread. No cleanliness and above all poor decoration
review: The cheese factory without being able to buy a cheese! Stale bread. No welcome and an entrance worthy of a bad film with works of art ill-suited to the place. A non-existent sales space. The cleanliness of the place leaves something to be desired and the parking lot is obsolete.

review title: A very good address I recommend..
review:
Removed from the road, via a stony road suitable for vehicles, we discover a cheese factory that we do not suspect the owner of.. a very nice person.. pleasant with welcoming staff both in terms of cheese and goats as well as the potter.. cheese level my regret in Morocco eating quality...well my desire was fulfilled here with very good cheeses all in a very pleasant setting tables d'h√¥tes arranged with taste...we are campervans and fell under the spell
Thank you all very much for your welcome
Excellent to advise. Pleasant place perfect services relaxing atmosphere music matching everything

review title: Scam or sham or both... Deplorable in any case
review: A scam both in terms of the price and the contents of the plate... A place which seems to be at the end of its life... It must have been nice, there was an effort at decoration but there was no has more than that in memory. The quality of the food is deplorable, a piece of stale barbecue and above all a lot of cheese that almost makes you vomit... For a price bordering on the indecency of a European capital. And above all, don't take the vegetarian one, you will have cheese for the rest of your life if you empty your wallet... the quantity is insufficient and the service is not provided or to be provided... Really move on, please.. You will be doing business a favor.

Don't go there!!
Very bad experience!
Nothing crazy, very high price for the service...personally I strongly advise against it....
We were eight of us. What a gem. The service was awesome. We had a m√©choui plenty of it. the chesse out of this world .

A Wonderful place with a great food!I went with a group of friends for lunch, the food it was delicious, especially if you re into chesse very nice vibe and great decoration, I really recommend this restaurant. Oh,m√©choui was actually the best thing!.

Beautiful place with amazing food, good service and good company. 
The manu is pre-set and you get openings, salad and main of your choice (it can be cheese plate, fish or other more serious food). The cheese was really special and the cheese maker was a great person. Highly recommend!

review title: A marvelous stay at Lina Ryad in Chefchaouen
review: Wonderful stay. The staff, foo and location are beyond compare. Beautiful riad but it‚Äôs the staff that makes it so very special. Food is to die for. Every night we sat on the upstairs deck enjoying the beautiful prayers coming from the miniarets. So lovely. Again, I can‚Äôt say enough about the women working at the riad. They should come to the u.s. and give lessons on kindness and grace. Truly amazing!

review title: A lovely Riad with wonderful service
review: What an amazing Riad and spa in the heart of beautiful Chefchaouen.  We stayed at a suite on the top floor with access to the terrace and a wonderful view of the blue city.  Easy walk to all around the city and the main square.  Staff were very hospitable.  Great place to stay.

This is a lovely riad with wonderful service. Everyone we encountered were so pleasant and accommodating (from reception, to staff serving meals and housekeeping).  We were on the 4th floor (had lots of steps to get there) but the view from our terrace was worth it !  They even brought our dinner to our room one night !  The room was quite comfortable, a bit on the small side, but we felt right at home. 
 Our stay was the first stop in a 2 week trip in Morocco, so it was a great way to start with wonderful hospitality and comfort. I would highly recommend staying here.

Beautiful Ryad with expansive views of the city. I had an incredible massage. Exceptional. The food was good and the staff were kind and professional. It was a lovely experience and a wonderful place to decompress and relax after days of traveling.

review title: Boutique hotel in the blue city
review: Overall a nice hotel in the middle of Chefchaouen. Quite a walk up from where the cars can drop you. Room was comfortable and we had a nice view over the city which is a very popular tourist attraction. The staff were very nice and helpful especially the lady who served us at breakfast. Lots of stairs getting to the rooms and there is a nice roof terrace. If you want to drink alcohol you have to bring your own but overall we enjoyed our stay in the city with the majority of the streets painted in a vibrant blue!

Beautiful Boutique hotel in Chefchaouen. One of the most beautiful buildings in the town. Great breakfast and perfect service. Beautiful panoramic terrace. Perhaps the restaurant is improvable but the stay was extremely pleasant.

I lately visited the spa & had a really good Moroccon bath experience by Eman, a very professional polite lady. With her techniques, she took off all the dead skin without any rash happening to the skin . Should consider reservations before going. I highly recommend the spa.

Beautiful ryad with easy access to everything and great hosts. The spa is fantastic too. The breakfast was delicious and included with the stay, and we were able to book the pool to use in private for half an hour. Roof top access and views were impeccable.

review title: As close to perfection as possible
review:
This is a really comfortable Riad that gave us such a warm welcome! The Riad sent men to come down to the edge of the Medina to meet us and collect our bags. They also carried our suitcases up to our room on the top and back down to the car park when we left.
It‚Äôs in a great spot where you can walk around and lose yourself but get back with google maps! Breakfast was delicious with a selection of breads, savoury and sweet, yogurt, fresh fruit, and eggs served however you like them.
We also had dinner at their restaurant and I had a delicious baby goat tagine. We had a couple Hammam too which was our first time - I‚Äôve never felt so clean and my skin was so soft 
Excellent staff 
Highly recommend

This place was amazing.  The service was remarkable from start to finish.  Examples:  
 - We asked for someone to meet us at the CTM bus terminal, and the Manager herself met us as we walked off the bus, she arranged the taxi, rode with us to the Medina Gate where we were met by a porter who took our three heavy bags and led us right to the place.  
 - Lunch was prepared for us from scratch and was delicious.
 - We had the room on the 4th (top) floor (room #5) which was absolutely spotless and beautiful.
 - But the Rooftop Terrace was the unexpected surprise - the view was absolutely amazing, and was accessible from our living room doors.  
 - In the evening we went to the lobby to relax and immediately mint tea and cookies appeared, at no charge and without asking.
 - The breakfast was freshly prepared for us and delicious.
 - We had the same service when we left - the porter carried our bags again, walked us out to the gate and got us a taxi.  

This was five star all the way.  I highly recommend this to anyone staying in Chefchaouen.  We almost extended our stay we liked it so much.

No one works on site during reception hours. System for checking in is excruciating... we also communicated several times with the manager by phone and text messages, but no answers to enlighten us. The manager also tried to scam us by raising the price of $100 and then blamed the ‚Äúerror‚Äù on his receptionist which he confirmed we did not have later. The manager also said that he did not receive our payment afterwards. We were asked to leave the money on the desk in the entrance in plain sight and with many passers-by who had access... The person in charge is aggressive and stupid. When we tried to talk to him face to face twice, he left saying he would be back in 1 minute and never came back even 1h30 after. Constantly lacks toilet paper. Lunch between 9am and 10.30am, but on our two days of visit there was none despite being included. Fortunately the view from the rooftop was beautiful, but the inconvenience caused by the service is unfortunately not worth it.

DO NOT STAY HERE! I‚Äôve stayed at many hostels, some being worse rated advertised than this but this is the worst by far! So much misadvertisement. From the start the host wasn‚Äôt there when we arrived and gave us no check in instructions. We had to figure it out for ourselves. Finally we found the ‚Äúowner who doesn‚Äôt work there just lives there‚Äù who got angry at us as we were impeding on his only free time at 4pm. We were given incorrect rooms to what we booked and paid for and were told to deal with it. He then got angry for not giving him the money we owed as he wasn‚Äôt there on arrival to give it to. We got the cash and gave it to him and he told us he would give the change later which we never received. He was rarely on site and was rude and ignorant with small things such as asking for toilet paper he said he‚Äôd get around to it later and never do it. He also has a brother or friend who lives or stays there. We had a confrontation with the owner over an incident which we aimed to handle peacefully but we were met with swearing and yelling and the brother got involved getting in our faces and getting hands on even picking up glass and threatening us. The breakfast is a plate of croissants and cake nothing else so no buffet or variety. He was also seems sleeping on the floor of the rooftop one night. Most unpleasant workers and hosts ever and most unpleasant experience. Don‚Äôt get fooled by the pictures and description because the host runs it so poorly

Very clean hostel, decorated really well. The beds were really comfortable with delicious breakfast included with our room. Joe was a great host and really friendly, keeps the place in top condition and had some great chats with him. Would recommend this place to anyone going to chefchaouen!

Great hostel with a beautiful rooftop, and super friendly social environment. Oumima is one of the best hostel staff I‚Äôve encountered anywhere and has fantastic recommendations for food, etc. She deserves a raise!

Baraka was one of my favourite riads in Morocco. Not only because it was clean and has such good atmosphere but the owners Joe and Trevor went out of their way to make us feel welcome. They had a lot of tips on where to visit, eat and go and even recommend a lovely local hamam for a non touristy hamam experience. After exploring the city and surroundings during the day, watching the sunset from the rooftop terraces was the perfect relaxing ending of every day. Thank you so much Joe, Trevor and team Baraka, we will most definitely be back!

The riad is beautifully decorated, clean and has an amazing rooftop where you can see the sunset. The breakfast served is one of the best! Shout out to the amazing owners for treating us like Moroccan Princesses. Will be back again and would highly recommend!

Trevor and Joe have set such a wonderful atmosphere with Baraka. The place is fantasticly put together with an amazing menu. We especially liked the avocado breakfast! The entire stay felt welcoming and both gentleman both had amazing suggestions on not to miss destinations and restaurants.

Go here if you go to Chefchaouen.

review title: Amazing place with great hosts and fun company
review: Amazing hostel in the perfect location. My boyfriend and I stayed here for three nights and could have happily stayed many more. Everything about this hostel was perfect - we especially enjoyed the roof terrace with a beautiful view over the city. Joe was an amazing host, we will be recommending this place to anyone who visits Chefchaouen.

My boyfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights. On arrival Joe (the main host) was attentive, gave us a tour, filled us in on the details and showed us our room. He was a really nice and friendly guy and made us feel comfortable from the beginning! We stayed in a private room with a fan which was very nice. The whole place was decorated beautifully, especially the terrace where everything was blue (to match the blue city). The location was perfect; inside the medina but close to a gate. There were plenty of places to eat, shop, and chill and Joe would direct us or even take us himself when we wanted to go somewhere. Mohammed also worked there, he was super friendly, attentive and helpful too. We managed to make friends with the other people staying - people usually hang on the terrace but it's nothing crazy- very chilled and nice vibes. I would definitely recommend especially if travelling alone and wanting to meet people :))) thank you Joe and Mohammed!

From Charlie and Tom xx

This is a nice looking hostel. That's the only good thing I can say about it. The manager and owner are rude and abusive to the guests. There's no security here. No lockers, no locks on the bedroom doors. No kitchen, no doors on the bathrooms, which is weird. Stay somewhere else. I don't expect to be shouted / swore at and generally treated like a nuisance. Just not good

We just returned from a trip to Morocco staying in 7 different hotels in 7 cities. Dar Jasmine was the best of the lot. Yes, you do have to climb (158) steps to reach the hotel. The luggage is brought up or down by porters of the hotel. Once you reach the hotel, the breathtaking view, the excellent service, the pool - compensates for all the calories you spent. Dinner and breakfast on the terrace, overlooking the city and the valley is priceless. The service by the staff was equally welcoming. This is definitely the hotel to stay in if you are visiting the Blue city.

What a great hotel! Everything is right! 
Yes, you have to climb some stairs to get there, but how else do you think of such a beautiful view:)! 

Really everything is right in this hotel, the decoration, the floors, the colors. Reception very friendly, extra compliment to Fatima. Delicious drink on arrival and the hotel staff will also help you lift your suitcase. 

Pool is lovely and also has a nice view of the town. Lovely sunbeds and fine towels. 

Room is fully equipped, housemade cookies on arrival and here also a great view of the town. 

Food is delicious, both dinner and breakfast well catered for, great to watch the sunset on the terrace. 

The hotel is definitely not cheap, but definitely worth the money!

Beautiful location on the side of a mountain.  Many steps to the top, but also many benches along the way.  Our room was lovely with arrival mint tea and cookies.  There are also cookies in the room. We ate at the restaurant and the food was delicious, the views from the dining room and the many terraces were soectacular.

Stunning property with the best views of Chefchaouen. We booked the Bali suite which was spacious, clean and well appointed. It‚Äôs spacious and great for multiple people as it can easily sleep 4 and has 2 bathrooms. The staff were lovely and their food is amazing. Highly recommend.

Best hotel stay of our trip in Morocco. The hotel/rooms/staff/food/views and city were 10/10 üíô 

We had breakfast and dinner at the hotel, on the terrace and were lucky to have stayed on a Friday, for Friday Couscous. The staff went above and beyond to make our stay memorable and special. 

We learned late at night that our ferry the following day was cancelled and we had to leave early in the morning to catch a different ferry. The staff helped us rearrange our transfer and made us a to-go breakfast. They met us outside our room, helped with our bags and gave a friendly and warm send off. We were so touched and our stay at Dar Jasmine was the perfect ending our such an incredible trip in Morocco.

review title: Perfect for a stay in the blue city
review: Gorgeous property perched high on the mountain above the blue city. Rooms are spacious and comfortable. The onsite restaurant offers food throughout the day or dinner, with prearrangement. Breakfast is choice of Moroccan, healthy, or continental. Stay here for peace and relaxation. The staff are very gracious.  Try the spa, reasonable prices. The stairs and steps up and down to the property/city are worth it.

Dar Jasmine is stunning and worth the climb up 163 steps! Hands down the best place to stay in Chefchaouen. 

We had dinner at the restaurant and it was quite good (but be aware that they don't serve alcohol but will serve it to you if you bring your own). Give yourself some time to enjoy the lovely made-to-order breakfast. The rooms were comfortable and we had a gorgeous view of the Blue City. We didn't even have to go to the Spanish Mosque at sunset - we just went out on our terrace to watch it.

Dar Jasmine in a lovely hotel in the quaint town of Chefchaouen, away from the main part of the blue city. The hotel has porters to bring up your luggage from the road -- be sure to tip them. We stayed in the Jasmine room, which had a great view and a patio but the decor is tired and the room had an overwhelming smell of jasmine from a plant spring that was left in the room (we tossed those out ASAP). The bed was uncomfortable and the hotel did not have mattress toppers. The pillows were also not great. We had dinner at the hotel, which was just ok (you must bring your own alcohol) but leisurely and the view is lovely. There are not many hotels to stay in Chaouen and this is the better one.

Charming hilltop riad in the beautiful Blue City.  This mecca for tourists is so attractive, you'll never put your camera away.  Two young porters met us at the gate and ran up the many stairs with our luggage!  How did they do that?  Yes, it's a climb ... but so worth it.  Our room with its fantastic views was one of my favorites.  We had dinner at the restaurant and loved the lute player who entertained us.  Food was good (not great).  The gardens, ground, and pool were exceptional.

review title: Wonderful stay in this pleasant hotel
review:
Wonderful stay in this charming hotel with swimming pool , elegant rooms with views of Chefchouan, excellent welcome,. The only problem lies in the climb of stairs that gives access to the hotel. Some people of an age may have difficulty mounting them... 
This is certainly the best hotel in this pretty town

Puerta Azul is a beautiful hotel. Its rooms have gorgeous paint patterns and designs. It is a clean hotel with very friendly and attentive staff. I appreciate that breakfast was served; you only need to sit down and they will bring you breakfast and coffee. I found the washroom to be a small, tight space that was a little difficult to move around in. Be sure to ask about keeping your keys secure when you leave them with the front desk.

review title: Puerta Azul: the hotel of Chefchaouen
review:
For the second time we stopped at the Puerta Azul Hotel in Chefchaouen with a group of 20 people in October 2024
For the 2nd time we have nothing but praise for this hotel with its typical and refined decoration. Aziz and Mouaad were very careful to make our stay in these places successful and we say a big thank you to them.
Whether it is the spacious rooms, all with a different decoration, whether it is the tasty and hearty meals, whether it is the location, close to the superb medina, whether it is the kindness and professionalism of the staff, everything is done to ensure that we have a dream stay in this establishment
Many thanks to the whole team

A travellers hotel set in a suburb outside town. Used to accommodating tour groups. The room was pleasant, clean and comfortable and staff very helpful.
It‚Äôs modern feel made up for central location as too far to easily reach the Medina. The staff were helpful but breakfast overwhelmed the size limits for catering.

review title: I got help from a friendly staff.
review:
It was a lovely hotel.
Above all, they have been very friendly in their personal consultations and I am very grateful to the staff. I met the warm hotel staff who were the most thrilled to come to Morocco.
We left the hotel early in the morning, so it was a very short stay, but we are happy to be here.

We loved it. A family-owned business. The decor is Moroccan and very beautiful. It has thoughtful details. Wifi was smooth. Clear. Breakfast is served by the employees. Less varied yet delicious. You can sample local produce. It''s got basic toiletries. While we were away from the dazzling tourist center, this was not a problem for us. About 20-30 minutes walk. We will stay if we go again.

Beautiful hotel just outside the walls of the wonderful Medina of Chefchaouen. Aziz the manager could not be more helpful even taking us to a pottery market outside of the city in his own car and would not even take a tip. Then took us tour restaurant rather than put us in a cab. Beyond the call. His team were friendly and helpful and the local breakfast was fantastic! We will be recommending this hotel to all our friends and family. The Medina is stunning and a wonderful place to get lost in!

review title: Very satisfied with the hotel puerta azul
review: Very satisfying, everything was perfect. The hotel was very clean, very clean and very welcoming. Very good stay . very nice staff and very nice room .I recommend without hesitation

review title: A wonderful stay at this hotel
review: My stay at this hotel was amazing.The room is clean , the view to the ceiling terrace is sublime which is beneficial for a yoga session .. the breakfast is delicious . We had a warm welcome from the manager. Nothing to say üëå

review title: You Will Fall in Love Too! Puerta Azul is near the bus terminal, restaurants and All You MUST SEE during your trip!
review: Puerta Azul was like my second home with new family. The staff at this property are amazing! Breakfast is yummy, plentiful and healthy. This property is a cultural immersion experience has been one of the best to experience in my lifetime!!

review title: Place full of colours, harmony and cleanliness
review: Located near the center but not in the central area. Nothing special from the outside but the interior and the rooms are gorgeous, colourful, furniture colored with the typical colors of Morocco. Abundant and good breakfast. Excellent service and availability. Clean, tidy and well maintained.

A favorite address in Chefchaouen. The location is exceptional, the rooms very nice and very comfortable (in addition to being very clean!), the terrace offers exceptional views and... Rafik is a love! He accompanied me in the evening to go to the on-call pharmacy (my teen was sick!), he was in care for us. And on top of that, the breakfast is excellent! A huge thank you for the welcome

We were a group of friends, we stayed 1 night and the welcome and attention received from Rafik was great, he helped us with the suitcases upon arrival and departure, we wanted breakfast on the terrace and he prepared it for us there, he offered us guide to visit the town and everything with a smile, without a doubt highly recommended

The best thing about the stay is Rafif's attention. From here we want to thank you for your attention, all the time attentive and looking out for us with a smile. The perfect breakfast. He picked us up and helped us with our bags on the way there and back. It made our stay familiar and welcoming. A hug from Spain

What I want to highlight here was the service. Thank you very much for that warm welcome. We felt very comfortable during our stay at the riad. The host was super helpful, and the room was beautiful, with its air conditioning and everything. It also has books on the landing if you want to read for a while. The truth is, it was the best during my stay in Morocco.

Very warm welcome, charming and cozy place, very well looked after.
The bedding is top notch.
Thanks to Mohamed for his kindness and sense of hospitality.
I highly recommend it to have a good, quiet time.

Our stay at Casa La Palma was great. The hotel is really excellent, especially considering the price. It‚Äôs just a few rooms with a small staff of two, but is taken care of well with a great breakfast included on the rooftop terrace. Clean and everything needed is provided. The staff doesn‚Äôt speak much English but is still very helpful and everything needed gets done. Also worth nothing that it‚Äôs located at nearly the top of the hill of Chefchaouen‚Äî not good if you don‚Äôt want to walk up and down stairs a lot. Would highly recommend.

Rafik treated us like good friends and we were sad to leave. The beautiful terrace where we had our breakfast each day will always be remembered. From the very central Casa La Palma you can explore this elegant medieval city with ease. The rooms are thoughtfully decorated. At night you can survey the entire scene from your high perch within the Medina walls.

review title: Some of the Best Service Anywhere
review: This place was charming and very tranquil ‚Äî done up in a traditional Moroccan style in a lovely part of the old city. The breakfast was very good and can be eaten on the roof with a fantastic view of pretty much the entirety of Chefchaouen and the surrounding valleys. The staff at this hotel is quite possibly the nicest I've had anywhere. Apart from carrying my heavy bags from the city gate (which, fair warning, is a bit of a walk up and down several stairs - as is everything in this city) to the hotel (then back when I checked out), the desk clerk arranged for a car to take me about an hour and a half away to see the shrine of Sidi Abdesselam. Beyond that, he took me personally downtown to a tailor shop so I could get some pants tailored ‚Äî something above and beyond anything that could conceivably be in his job description. And he did everything with a smile on his face and without ever making me feel like I was inconveniencing him. The only thing to be aware of is that Chefchaouen is built along a giant hill, and this hotel is pretty close to the top of it - so be ready to do a bit of walking going to and from the main parts of the city which are mostly down the hill. On the plus side, the location is really much more in an authentically old neighborhood of town rather than an area where you're likely to mostly run into tourists (or people trying to sell you things...) -it feels alive and real, which is nice. This hotel is an excellent choice!

This week we held a small event in the private room at Casa La Palma. The staff was so helpful, warm, and made everyone feel welcome and special. Huge shout out to James the bartender who made the best cocktails! And also Karen the Events manager who took care of our every need. Thank you! And then there‚Äôs the space! My goodness- it‚Äôs beautiful and chic all the way! Thanks again for helping us host such a classy event!

We were warmly greeted by the owner and his helper up at the car park, which was so helpful as we had lots of luggage that would have been challenging to carry. It was only a 5 minute all-downhill walk from the parking area.

The B&B is very nice. All 3 rooms that we reserved for our 2 night stay were spotless and clean. Nice en suite bathrooms. The beds were very comfortable. We enjoyed the rooftop sitting area. Breakfast was quite nice as well. The owner helped us reserve a table at Cafe Sophia, which we liked very much. We also appreciated his early morning assistance with our baggage on departure day. Only minor issue was his credit card machine didn‚Äôt work that morning, but we were lucky to have enough cash on hand to cover.

I was on the terrasse on the roof and the view was spectacular.  I ate the best beef and prunes tajine in a delicious broth.  My husband had a chicken and olives tajine.  Very generous with good olives.  Both plates were served in pottery and it continues to bubble as it was in the oven just before serving.
House offered us salad, bread, olives and harissa sauce.

Restaurant located in one of the alleys of the village with several rooms and many seats.
Delicious couscous with goat meat.
Low prices and friendly staff.

Warm welcome, very good traditional Moroccan cuisine, hearty dishes 
Very good value for money and simple but pleasant setting

Yemekler harika, mekanƒ±n lokasyonu √ßok iyi. Kuzu tajin erikli ve bademli yedim, harikaydƒ± ki ben kƒ±rmƒ±zƒ± et pek sevmem, tavsiye √ºzerine yedim bende tavsiye ederim. Falafel lezzetliydi fakat porsiyonu az. ≈ûaf≈üavana bir daha gitsem hi√ß d√º≈ü√ºnmem yine bu mekana giderim.

The food is amazing, and the location of the place is excellent. I had the lamb tagine with prunes and almonds ‚Äî it was wonderful, even though I don‚Äôt usually like red meat. I tried it based on a recommendation, and now I recommend it too. The falafel was tasty, but the portion was small. If I ever go to Chefchaouen again, I wouldn‚Äôt think twice ‚Äî I‚Äôd definitely come back to this place
Super good! Beautiful terrace, welcoming staff. We ate 3 starters, 2 tagines, 3 desserts and all under 200 dirhams

review title: Excellent food and trim Moroccan great service
review: I was recommended by my hotel manager was not disappointed a very Moroccan flavour to the Restaurant food was amazing. I had the chicken olive tagine the Moroccan salad the eggplant and the tomato and peppers just wonderful flavours. The chicken was so tender excellent service very friendly. I recommend this place.

Comfy seating, warm hospitality and memorably delectable Tangin chicken !

Must-visit when you are in Chefchaouen !

Let the restaurant and serve you their best dish !

As an Indian, I loved their mix of spices

review title: A peasant meal and evening at Bab Ssour
review:
While exploring the distinctive blue streets of Chefchaouen, finding Bab Ssour was a pleasant discovery. From the moment we entered, the atmosphere felt warm and inviting. The staff were notably friendly. Their welcome felt sincere, contributing to a comfortable sense of hospitality that set a positive tone for the meal. Simple things like the menu in multiple languages added to the experience.

Choosing from the menu was made easier by the helpful staff at Bab Ssour. When I mentioned I was unsure what to order, they took the time to discuss the options and offered good recommendations based on my preferences. It was clear they knew their menu well and aimed to ensure guests had a rich experience.

The food itself was very good. Following their suggestions, we enjoyed Moroccan flavours. The dishes tasted fresh and seemed carefully prepared. We thoroughly enjoyed Baisara, Lentil soup and the Moroccan mint tea. The goat tagine was tender and well-spiced. We capped the meal with their delicious yoghurt as dessert (caveat: it was very sweet, but we decided are on a holiday).

For those seeking good, authentic Moroccan food served by welcoming staff who make you feel comfortable, Bab Ssour is a solid choice. It's certainly a great choice if you're in the area.

Very qualified and friendly staff. 
Couscous served only on Friday lunch that was the best of my gourmet life!!!

Best eggplant ever i ordered two dishes. Amazing restaurant food taste is off the meter good. 
I had the lamb and its the best lamb i have ever had.
I will be returning fir more great food on this trip. 
Do yourself a favor go look for this place eat here and you will know best food in the city

The guys were very nice and helpful. Affordable prices and generous portions, great food.
The view then, special!
Bravo, I will definitely be back if I come back to town

I've visited various parts of Morocco quite a few times, and have always sought out local food. This is the best meal I have ever eaten in morocco, and the price is incredible. The man who was serving us was perfect - funny, articulate and a clear passion to explain anything on the menu which we might not be familiar with. The food was perfection - we had bread, olives, 5 Moroccan salads, 2 Harira soup, oxtail tagine and goat tagine and two homemade lemonades.and it came to less than ¬£18 for the pair of us. Helpfully a man noticed we were looking a little lost on the main road and guided us up. Worth noting the restaurant is closed on a Monday, but their sister restaurant chourafa is open - and will serve traditional dishes alongside the fish on the menu.
Just amazing address!!! The value for money just incomparable. The food is really excellent: traditional and made with love!! A family restaurant and authentic it was great!!

Bab Sour is a wonderful spot for a traditional meal with a great terrace offering a lovely view‚Äîa perfect place to sit and enjoy the atmosphere. The Mrozia was excellent, rich in flavor and perfectly cooked, while the lamb tajine was tender and delicious. The combination of good food and a relaxing setting makes this a great choice for a meal in Chefchaouen. Definitely worth a visit!

We came here on the recommendation of our tour guide. It was one of the best restaurants we‚Äôve been to in all of Morocco. I had the oxtail with raisins (Mrozia), truly in the top 10 best meals in my entire life. We also got the pumpkin starter, which was excellent. The servers were really good, courteous, kind, fast and friendly. I wish I could give this place 10 stars, I t‚Äôs really amazing.

The food was delightful. Traditional, almost home-cooked Moroccan food, served with a smile 
My wife had a generous helping of a kefta tagine (meatballs cooked in herby tomato sauce, with a poached egg in the middle) and I had the couscous "nouria' (veal, chicken and vegetables on a bed of couscous).
We would recommend the Cafe Restaurant Sofia to anyone visiting Chefchaouen.

review title: Avoid, not a nice restaurant experience!!
review: Restaurant is very grubby. Not a nice area and food only ok. Our table was surrounded by 5 cats who kept trying to climb on table while we ate. Couldn‚Äôt wait to leave. Not sure why this restaurant is getting a high rating. Would not recommend!!!

Sofia‚Äôs was recommended in our Morocco travel book and it did not disappoint. It is a small, outdoor eatery near the Plaza Uta el Hamman. It is near the end of the road up a couple of steps from the main walkway. My husband had the meatball tagine and I had the chicken, lemon, and olive tagine and both were the best tagines that we had in Morocco. The service was great and we were very impressed with the variety of languages that could be accommodated when ordering.
Excellent Moroccan cuisine. Utmost kindness. If you want to immerse yourself in the real culinary Morocco, this is the place

It is not obvious DE nt find the Sofia restaurant which is in a small street next DE the main square of the medina. But we eventually found and we were not disappointed. It is a small restaurant that does not pay DE mine but with top service and a very nice owner. The kitchen is excellent. I recommend!
Corner away from the bustle and quiet, not passing through. Exquisite food. Perfect attention. One of the owners speaks perfect Spanish. To repeat.
Small restaurant in a quiet and excellent area! We were surprised by all this mix of flavors in the place specialty.  It was just perfect!  Thank you for that service.

review title: I recommend to eat this place
review:
Very quiet and cozy place. 
Super correct service and service. 
The delicious food. 
Great price.
Recommended 100%

Very friendly staff , superb service! 
everything was made by woman chefs and all dishes were very delicious we really enjoyed our dinner.
certainly  try the chicken rolls and the meat in bread.

A little hidden above a small plot, nice little unpretentious restaurant run by women.
The welcome is nice. It may be crowded, but it's fast.
Harira soup, good with lots of flavors. Zucchini stuffed with meat and rice, without too much fragrance but very good, good beef couscous and chicken. 
Nice little address not to ruin 
Good value for money 
Jean-Pierre

review title: Great option for celiacs in Chauen
review: Exquisite everything. A haven of tranquility within Chauen. Much of the menu is gluten-free and they are aware of how to take care of cross-contamination. A very good choice for celiacs in Chauen
Today we ate at Sofia restaurant with the whole family, we loved it. The food is especially good and the service very friendly. It is run by women of the same family.

Disastrous welcome. Not at all child friendly. The manager saw us arrive with our group of children and welcomed us very cold. The discomfort was so great that we had to leave. 
It's a shame to experience this during the holidays.

During your visit to Chefchaouen I recommend this restaurant. We tasted a Kefta tagine accompanied by their homemade bread and a succulent chicken-beef couscous.  Do not hesitate the price is very sweet.

We ate at three places in Chefchaouen and this is very overrated, the food is decent but it is very touristy.
Every restaurant in Morocco offers small samples before the meal, here nothing, the menu is more expensive than the other restaurants on the square and the location is very shabby.
Don't get plucked.

We ate here on our second day of a group tour in Chefchaouen, and the food was absolutely delicious! My friend and I both had the chicken pastel, which was seasoned chicken inside a pastry filling with cinnamon and sugar on top‚Äî sounds intriguing but trust me, you should 100% order this! Would definitely recommend this spot!

We had an unusual time on the rooftops of chefchaouen. A neat decoration with a view of the entire medina. 
The waiter, Amine accompanied us with all the politeness and hospitality that make the reputation of Moroccans! 
The meal was very good, local cuisine and homemade served with bread and olives and the price is very decent.
Thank you to the whole team and especially to Amine for her kindness and joie de vivre, we were very happy to meet you! 
If we have the opportunity to return to Chefchaouen, we will not fail to eat in Tissemlal!
The typical Moroccan place, with good value for money in terms of food. We have eaten in better places the truth, the cake somewhat small and dry, very dry. You cannot pay by card.
A basic dinner in a basic restaurant but everything was tasty, wholesome, and nutritious. Service was prompt and efficient.
This is a fairly basic restaurant with a fairly basic menu but we really enjoyed our meals here, the food was good and the service very friendly and attentive.

review title: Ordinary cuisine in an exceptional setting ...
review:
With each visit to Chefchaouen, I have become accustomed to stopping at Casa Hassan‚Äôs restaurant for the pleasure of seeing its evolution ‚Äì and it is always interesting to see the regular reinvestments in the decoration of the places, which improve year after year. This treatment for aesthetics makes the place really nice and invites to relax.

In terms of health and freshness, this is a sure thing: we feel that quality and food safety are at the heart of their priorities, which is reassuring. However, at the culinary level, the experience unfortunately remains ordinary. With such an exceptional setting, it is a little disappointing not to find local specialties that would showcase the talent of the Chaouenie cooks. Portions, especially for some tagines, are sometimes ridiculously small, which can leave a taste of unfinished.

In short, Casa Hassan‚Äôs restaurant is a charming and safe place for a meal, but could gain authenticity by integrating more local flavors. A suggestion for future visits: bet on a touch of locality, it would add a nice added value to the experience!
The welcome is friendly in a traditional setting. The dishes are well prepared and very good value for money. The small ambient music is also very pleasant.
The food was delicious, and the staff was friendly.  It was a quiet and relaxing atmosphere.  The cous cous chicken was superb!

review title: Amazing restaurant , Best place in town
review: Really good food at a fair price, not a tourist trap. If you go there , eat on the terrace , it h√°s an amazing view and vibe. Love it !

review title: One of the best in the city
review: Restaurant that we have frequented for 20 years. Succulent dishes based on fresh products and excellent attentive and professional team. We haven‚Äôt found anything better in Chefchaouen yet.
Best food we have had in Morocco so far, amazing flavours, plentiful & delicious with fantastic service.    We tried the meat targine (exceptional) , salads, vegetable targine, meatball targine.

We went there on a recommendation from Hamza of Casa Sabila. The location is inside the medina and we were seated in a nice cosy dining room with a great huge fireplace. The food was nice. I enjoyed the Moroccan salads and a chicken pastilla. Nice, decent dinner.

Restaurant recommended by our Riad and if didn‚Äôt disappoint. We had a very tasty lentil soup, kebob and delicious fruit juice and hot tea.
This hotel was easy to find, had a nice ambience and the staff was friendly.
This was recommended by our tour manager and everyone was pleased. Food was good and the service was also good. Great atmosphere.

A very nice place and excellent service. I went twice and was not disappointed.
Ideal for families or couples.

review title: Totalm ENte recommended, lots of variety on the menu
review: Very varied menu, perfect if you go with children, EN our case we have gone several days and everything we ate was rich. The treatment DE the staff has been 10!

Very good tagines, friendly staff, present but not "sticky", fast and efficient service, on a shaded terrace overlooking a must-see and lively square (Outa el Hammam) of the Blue City, in front of the casbah.
A very pleasant moment.
Restaurant what is in top location on the large square. The food is good and and priced ok. The staff friendly.

Retant Ali Baba in Chefchaouen offers a fantastic variety of traditional dishes. The lamb tagine and chicken kebabs are perfectly cooked, bursting with flavor. Great atmosphere and friendly service‚Äîhighly recommend!

review title: Nice food, wonderful terraces with great views Fun staff
review: We visited the top- top terrace. Wonderful opportunity to watch the sunset.  We had the flat menu which included Moroccan salad ( tomatoes and cucumbers), veggie couscous and orange salad for desert. I had delicious pomegranate mojito ( non alcoholic), and coffee. All was delicious. The couscous was perfectly seasoned and al dente same the vegetables. The price was reasonable. The view is majestic.
lmad was very welcoming and kind! We had the mixed salad, kefta tagine, chicken pastella and Zaazaa juice. Everything was delicious. Fatima is an amazing chef! Nice atmosphere. Highly recommend üòä.

We planned to go to Cafe Bilmos.  

Next door Ali Baba restaurant  poaches Bilmos customers.  Usher said ‚ÄúYes, this is Bilmos‚Äù and seated us.  We got the menu saying Ali Baba, so we enquired again, they said it is the same owner (Not!).  We finally left and went over to Bilmos who said Ali Baba has a history of misrepresenting themselves.

review title: Quick meal and the end of the day!
review: We needed a quick meal at the end of our day of travels. We had delicious tacos and chicken skewers. We sat on the patio and enjoyed the ambiance of the square.
The place is super friendly.  Good hearty and cheap breakfast. welcoming and smiling staff and clean.

review title: A pleasant Moroccan evening in Chefchaouen
review: This is a lovely addition to the main square. The selection of food is well priced and very well prepared.  The staff  speak many languages and English is spoken fluently. We like this little place the best.
Good restaurant, we ate there with my husband tagines that were excellent, in addition to that the restaurant is on the spot so nice setting.

Actually this restaurant is was amazing we had a lunch her whit my family and we ordered chicken tagien is was so good and olso to chicken pastilla are so delicious and to stuff are so nice and olwys smiling üòä
This spot is beautiful, the village is beautiful, the staff catered us very well. Good portion sizes and good tasting. I would defiantly recommend if you visit chef chaoun.
The food was authentic and great. The staff were very friendly and helpful. Would definitely recommend to anyone visiting.
Correct but has no place in the top 10; it‚Äôs just a snack on a square but the dishes are nothing exceptional and the service remains approximate.

review title: Who needs alcohol is right here
Not the only alcohol in town
Local Bar, fine for a drink.
Tr√®s mauvais accueil et nourriture lamentable
Good place with friendly service and the smaller version of the holy grail

review: Excellent. Jn friendly and personalized service. The beautiful facilities. The delicious food. Air in the room. Beautiful pool. Everything you can have after a night in the desert. A spectacular couples trip...

An exceptional stay, a welcome worthy of Moroccan hospitality, very good service. Good looking, attentive and proactive staff.
Beautiful architecture, fusion between modernity and tradition without forgetting the property that was impeccable. Thank you. 
On reviendra inchalah

The hotel is very nice and well run. The rooms are large and well equipped. The restaurant offers only one menu this is tastefully good and priced well designed. Breakfast leaves nothing to be desired. The pool and garden are great and a dip in the pool is wonderful. The location is outside the city center and quiet. For transit very good.
In our room, the air conditioning was only running on one level and very noisy (room 104).

Hotel 3* away from the center, quiet... Clean and quiet rooms. The pool area with hammocks and sofa area very well!!! Perfect for drinking a few beers or wines at very cheap prices. Dinner and breakfast included with the perfect accommodation. The cheapest drinks (alcohol) in Morocco.

Located in the middle of no where! There is not much to see in the surrounding area. The Hotel was nice and the rooms were comfortable. Dinner was a set menu but there is table service. The servers were accommodating and attentive. The pool area was great and the charm of the hotel was a pleasant surprise.

Maravilloso. Returning from living one night in the desert, Ali welcomed us in an oasis of peace. A lovely Riad, ideal to unwind and relax before continuing the journey... dinner and breakfast very good! The staff very attentive. We'll be back for sure!

Very good hotel, modern and with pool.
Modern and large rooms with excellent staff.
They have like two hotels across from each other.
We were in the front (the other one is the one with the pool and the dining room, but you cross the street 30seconds and you can enter that area).
Very good hotel.

I have to reiterate what other reviewers have said ... location, location, location.  What a shame this lovely little take on a kasbah is located so far from everything interesting.  The neighborhood appeared too sketchy for us to be comfortable roaming about at night, so we didn't, which resulted in a lackluster evening.  Our room on the top floor was lovely, with a great view, and its own private terrace.  The pool area is neat as a pin, but much too cold to take advantage of it.

This is a lovely road in the heart of the Sahara. They do a great job sourcing comfort despite being in an area where access seems to be limited to many things. Clean, comfortable, lovely breakfast and dinner and outstanding hospitality! Cannot go wrong staying here if you are staying overnight in the desert!

This hotel is simply fantastic... already entering you perceive the 'welcome and attention to every detail. The rooms then brand new spacious and with everything you need. Also noteworthy is the restaurant and all the prepared and friendly staff

Very nice hotel with only a few rooms and great personal service. 

Our room was very spacious, the bed a bit hard for my taste.

Delicious breakfast with personalized service.

We stayed one night at this hotel and would consider it again

review title: Maybe better places to stay in Ouarzazate?
review: Not the best place we stayed on our trip.  Obviously owned by someone who had involvement with the Moroccan film industry and location as the city is the "Hollywood" of Morocco. People were very nice but rooms and bathrooms were not great and in dire need of modernisation. Location is very quiet Dinner and breakfast were OK but we only stayed one night.

review title: Wonderful character, clean and full of charm
review: Wonderful hotel, fabulous service, full of charm and character, very clean, super comfortable, delicious food.  Had a great one night stay here and everything from checkin to the wonderfully spacious and decorated rooms, top notch service and tasty meals made this a highlight and most memorable hotel in Morocco.  Omar was an incredible host and took wonderful care of every detail.  Seems like a passion project with all the details thoughtfully put in place.  I saw some reviews where people commented on the person watching over and I saw him too, but reminded me of a director watching over a set in caring way.  I will say I did not get the TV to work but didn't ask so suspect it was something I did wrong.  Was some noise from the street with people walking by.

review title: Elegance and beauty...and a "one man show"
review: This hotel was well located...and had everything we needed.  The room was generous in size...and the service and food was great!  When we arrived in the very early morning, we were greeted by the friendliest staff/manager you could possibly imagine.  He was a complete one man show...as he greeted us...showed us to our room...and even was there in the morning to serve us breakfast.  The only small issue we encountered was that even though it was over 100 degrees every day...for some reason the outdoor pool was too cold to get into.  But, come on...this guy can't be responsible for maintaining the pool temperature in addition to all of his other many duties...lol.  Wouldn't stay anywhere else!!

Where to start:
A warm welcome in a magnificent and quiet setting
the caring, attentive hosts.
The Cleopatra room is beautiful and spacious with its balcony.
The copious breakfast served in our room at our convenience and everything is made with fresh produce (orange juice, fruit salad, etc....)
The cleanliness is impeccable.
The dinner is excellent with local products.
The exterior with its swimming pool is a relaxing place accompanied by the song of birds.
It very close to the airport and the city center.
A big thank you to Aziz and Omar for their welcome and their availability, they will advise you on your visits, reservations, taxi and guide.
This guest house and well-being, we feel at home.
We will keep great memories of our stay because we were truly spoiled but we will say no more...
We recommend it to you
We do not understand the criticisms of certain travelers regarding your establishment.
Madame Cleopatra and Monsieur Caesar.

review title: Hotel was disappointing, unfortunately does not keep what the website promises
review: Very spacious rooms, the bathroom was huge. At first glance everything looks luxurious, but unfortunately everything is a bit dated. The staff is friendly and helpful. The restaurant is overpriced, the food not particularly good.

Hotel was very luxurious! Staff was very friendly and accommodating! We had a slight issue with our room that was resolved right away. Food at the hotel was amazing (we had dinner and breakfast here). Each room has a different theme based on movies filmed in Ouarzazate which is a nice touch! Would stay here again!
Our hosts offered us excellent service, from the moment we arrived! Very nice hotel. Tranquility assured. Located near the airport. Excellent meal in an intimate atmosphere. Don't hesitate to book!
Very Bad experience, Disrespectful Staff and their Service is super poor. You are bad !! Bad relationship with customers! The establishment is not clean at all. Value for money non-existent etc etc

review title: Looks the goods but does not deliver
review:
Staff courteous.
Bathroom below par- no shower curtain, old fittings, water took 10 mins to heat up
Restaurant average- all pre cooked and served by the staff at the front
This is a place big on style but poor on substance and delivery.
Poor neighbourhood. 
Not worth the money

Great hotel!!!
Great location
Great building
Great people
Great food
Great service
Great value for money
Parking easy

Would stay again and highly recommend a good stop off on the way to the desert.

Like stepping back in time staying at this hotel in this ancient landscape

review title: Warm, friendly staff lovely hotel with authentic Moroccan features and details. Good food.
review:
The team were very welcoming even though we were a bit late arriving due to long queues at passport control. We enjoyed a lovely 3 course dinner and Rashid was very friendly.
The room was comfortable and nicely decorated with traditional Moroccan details.
Breakfast was served in the roof terrace by Mohammed who was so friendly and chatty. He helped us with our bags to our car as well. We would have liked to have stayed longer but we‚Äôre heading to the desert tomorrow.
Highly recommend

review title: A favorite riad! Very special art and decor
review: This was one of our favorite riads in Morocco! The building is so unique and beautifully decorated with art and photos from around the world. There are so many cozy spots to enjoy in the lobby, on the roof top, in the restaurant. I wish we had more than one night to enjoy this riad.
