The dinner was excellent and the service was so friendly and chatty. And the riad is walking distance from a small artisan market on the corner of the road with independent vendors.

review title: Dar Kamar : best place in Ouarzazate!
review:
Situated in the old city, Dar Kamar offers nice decorated rooms, a much appreciated hammam and delicious moroccain plates in his restaurant, situated near the large panoramic terrace.
It's a perfect place if you plan to visit Ouarzazate for few days or you just plan a stop over to other destinations in the region. Staff always available and very professional.

In the old kahsba court, the building has been completely renovated. Very elegant decoration, many high quality objects. Warm and friendly atmosphere, very professional welcome and good advice. Everything is done for a perfect stay. Terrace overlooking the old town where calm and relaxation reign. To know absolutely, perfect breakfast and evening meal of very good staying power.a
To advise absolutely. This hotel deserves the highest rating.

review title: Amazing, beautiful and welcoming. Like at home
review:
A beautiful and welcoming place, where we were welcomed with incredible hospitality. From the start, they made us feel at home and their help exceeded all our expectations. It is not easy to find words to express how grateful we are for everything lived in this place.
Thank you heartily to Said, Mohamed and the whole team. Thanks to you, Dar Kamar will always have a special place in our hearts.

Having recently stayed 2 nights in the Dar, we can only describe the place as exceptional. Mohammed and Sahid were fantastic hosts, friendly, helpful and extremely knowledgeable, dealing with many enquiries ahead of our stay too. Although we didn't have contact with the other staff, they all do a brilliant job in making sure that your stay is a high quality experience. We ate dinner both nights in the Dar and the food was an extremely high standard and delicious. Good to see that Moroccan wines are served, the red wine was definitely more drinkable than the rose!! We had a look at all of the rooms and each have their own uniqueness. I can't imagine that there is a better place to stay in Ouarzazate for location, service and experience. We don't usually return to the same place twice, but have vowed to return ahead of our next trip into this region of Morocco and the desert.

review title: A nice but hidden place to stay
review: Just like other places I stayed, getting to the hotel was hard. Our group traveled on a bus, so we were not able to get close as there were narrow alleyways to the hotel. It was a short hike going to or away from the hotel. The interior had a charming look. The restaurant had both indoor and outdoor seating but it was located on the top floor. You had to climb the stairs as there were no elevators.

review title: Gorgeous riad with super honest price
review: Truly tastefully renovated. Beautiful terrace on the Kasbah. Better to book directly at the hotel to get a room upgrade. Tastefully furnished 60m2 suite. Excellent breakfast on the terrace. Two dinner menus at 14 and 18 euros.

review title: Dar Kamar is a great place to stay!
review:
This is a really interesting place to stay-it is located in a 17th century courthouse! It is nicely located, next to the Kasbah and within walking distance to an arts center. Our room was really spacious and beautifully decorated. Breakfast was delicious.
Our only disappointment was in one of the employees-he actually cheated us out of some money! We paid for some laundry but did not have exact change, so this man said that he would get change and bring it to our room. He never did and when we went to look for him, he was gone and even the next day when we looked for him-they said he wouldn't be in till later. We had to leave, so that was that. It was not much money, but it is the principle of the thing! So beware of the man who works there and wears a short brimmed fedora!

We stayed just for one night. Too short! But the staff is very friendly and our room was very big! We had a parking spot in front of the Hotel and the breakfast was varied. We would recommend this place and would love to come back :)

review title: Old, lack of maintenance and very bad smell
review:
The hotel is kept in a very bad condition, no maintenance in the rooms, lack of painting, old furniture, very bad smell.
The attention of the staff was poor, unfriendly and not professional, I do not recommend at all the hotel.
Also the pool is kept in a bad condition, furniture is old, wrecked and uncomfortable

We stayed 1 night there. Cleanliness is not good. Rooms are large with old furniture. Internet is only in lobby area. Breakfast and dinner was with average quality, not yummy, not various.
Hotel is acceptable for short stay on budget price.

I don't get some of the reviews - the hotel was really nice, a bit old but very clean. Staff were friendly and smiling. Our room was spacious with nice bathroom and even with fridge. The pool is amazing and very clean! Breakfast was one of the best we had - huge variety of savoury/sweet. And a big plus was a bar opened till midnight which served beer (25 dirhams for Flag).

review title: Unable to check-in and lied to us
review: We made a room reservation for 9 people 4 double rooms and 1 single by Booking.com for the hotel and when we tried to do the check-in the receptionist told us he was not finding the booking, though we showed him the booking confirmation with the code number and all that. Facing this situation, instead of being honest with us (overbooking, problems with Booking.com, whatever he could have said..) he asked us to see the price that we were paying, and then told us we were in the wrong place, and that we should go instead to the Le Zat hotel because they belonged to the same company and the conditions were the same. Upon our arrival to the new place, they were indeed waiting for us, but then they explained us that they have nothing do to with Ouarzazate Le Riad company and they accepted us because this same hotel asked them. Ultimately, we paid the price to stay in Ouarzazate Le Riad with interior and exterior pool, sauna, and in the end we ended up in a totally different hotel without having a clue of the reason.

Sometimes I can't understand some people's reviews. You go to a hotel for 15‚Ç¨ each per night and you expect it to be the Palace or the Ritz? There is a five stars hotel near by for 180‚Ç¨ per night. If you want quality, pay the price. Beautiful hotel with not high maintenance and so so breakfast, but huge rooms with comfy beds, huge swimming pool and located in a near by area. Lovely staff. Sometimes people are so demanding and they don't want to pay much. If you bring your baby to Morocco for a desert trip, you have a problem, demanding person.

This hotel had the name Riad Salam on entrance gate. Hotel with some of swimming pools we used for one night. Very nice situated hotel in begining of Sahara desert. Brakfast with traditional moroccian choice of meals and drinks. After long way from Marrakech through High Atlas and very hot air around we welcome stay in swimming pool.

review title: OK, but old, bad service and no good Food
review:
Rooms are a bit old which wouldn‚Äôt have been a problem. But our bathroom was not clean, the water was leaking all over the toilet. And the room was very noisy at night. We don‚Äôt give a worse review because the bed was clean and comfortable.
The service was really bad - made promises, they didn‚Äôt approve and were really unfriendly.
And regarding breakfast: It just was not very tasty, but OK.
Our conclusion: There is definitely better value for your money in Ouarzazate!

Poor and old hotel. Hotel service really bad. No amenities in the bathroom, and if you ask, they give a small mini bag of soap, like in the worst motel. About the breakfast. Poor and really bad quality.
Dont come.

review title: Only good to use for sleeping!
review:
The hotel and room we were in are presented well and kept clean. However the amenities are sparse with no facilities to make tea/coffee in the rooms - something I missed a lot the week we were staying there.

The food at breakfast was sparse. With not a lot of options, you weren't able to make breakfast interesting.

Asking the staff for anything extra (like hot water for tea) was a pain, as they didn't like to provide it all the time. During the day and after dinner service there were no staff around to ask for help apart from the reception. There was no way to get food or drinks without going into town unless it was breakfast or you paid for dinner.

Overall, as a base of operations to go to other places it is fine. The beds are comfortable and rooms clean, with the staff being agreeable to most requests.

+ Nice traditional Riad and great location. The terrace offers superb views of Ouarzazate and the surrounding area. The bedding is of good quality. Very spacious junior suite.
The bathroom is aging. The holed towel? Any breakfast

Great, lovely, the rooms very nice, clean very nice, super friendly, we went by car without problems to park, the ideal breakfast on the terrace with very nice views... totally recommended.  Tania thank you very much.  We were delighted.. recommended 100x100

Three great days and an interesting and rewarding sharing in a riad as we would like to find
 
Liked ¬∑ a super friendly welcome with drinks , a large and very clean room, explanations about the city and customs and full of Tips for Things to Do, a hearty breakfast and served at the time we chose (we are late bunks and late risers, bottle of fresh water offered several times, efficient air conditioning (fortunately it was over 40¬∞), impeccable bedding nothing to blame

Did not like ¬∑ shutters or blackout blinds but good not be too demanding!!!

review title: Very nice stay in historical riad
review:
First of all - you need to have a lot of cash (Euros or MADs), you never know when you gotta spend it at riad - taxi both ways from/to the airport, city tax (because WiFi at the receptionist's computer & terminal didn't work, by in our phones did so we needed to go to town centre late evening extremely tired after three days excursions because we were only 10 euros short and not able to pay via card and we were back to our country the next morning...) - hence one star less - not sure about this "lie" about not working WiFi?

Otherwise, it was an awesome riad. It was clean, quiet, and friendly, and it had a good breakfast, comfortable beds, and a working toilet and shower. There was nothing not to be happy about. It is in very safe surroundings, so we were not likely to be lost around as we first thought. I would definitely recommend it. Thanks!

Having stayed in Kasbah Taourirt previously (but in a different hotel), I was somewhat familiar with its maze of alleyways.  But my taxi dropped me off near the rear of the kasbah, and the driver asked what we thought was a random stranger who just happened to be standing there how to get to La Rose Noire.  Coincidentally, that "random stranger" turned out to be the manager, so I had no issues finding the place!  Even so, it really is not as difficult to find as some people have made out in the comments.  The alleyways are well lit, and there are signs pointing the way.  But don't expect perfectly-paved streets, it is an ancient kasbah, after all.  Just enjoy the authenticity!  

Some reviewers have mentioned that they were disturbed by the call to prayer from the neighbouring mosque, although I can't say that I even noticed it!  But maybe I've just come to expect it in Morocco over quite a number of visits, and have learned to tune it out.  But use that "neighbouring mosque" as a waypoint when finding your way to the hotel - it's the only one there is in the kasbah, you can't miss the minaret.  There are two ways in to the small square in front of the mosque - the exit on the opposite side not only has a sign pointing the way to La Rose Noire, but leads to a dead end, where you will find the hotel on the left.

I'm a fan of staying in traditional places when in Morocco, so I always try and stay in places that have Berber and Moroccan artefacts and rugs as decoration, and a history, so I was not disappointed.  I will admit that the place is quite dark, but that is often the case in traditional places as it helps to keep out the scorching summer heat.  I did have to use the torch on my phone to complete the arrival form though!

My room was large and comfortable - it even came with its own 'throne', which was nice to relax in!  The bathroom seemed to be fairly new, and the shower was hot and powerful.  Breakfast was the standard Moroccan fare, lots of breads of various types,  jams, spreads, tea, coffee, juice and eggs (in my case, soft boiled).  

The only negative point I will mention is that one of my windows didn't fully close properly, and on my second night there, it got very windy.  Consequently the window was blown wide open several times during the night!  Fortunately, the aircon unit kept the room nicely warm.

They will even sell you a rug or piece of Berber jewellery if you're that way inclined.  Just keep an eye on the prices!

review title: Unique special atmosphere, a leap in time
review: We stayed for one night but would have liked to have stayed at least another day. Nice, welcoming, characteristic, stylishly furnished environment. Absolutely worth seeing. Spacious comfortable rooms, as well as private bathroom. Professional and discreet service attentive to every need. Excellent breakfast served on the terrace also furnished with a magnificent view of the Ksar and Kasbah. I highly recommend.

review title: Journey of the Thousand and One Berber Nights
review:
Despite the events linked to the earthquake, we did not cancel our reservation. We do not regret it, quite the contrary. The French media focused on the destroyed buildings as if the entire region were a post-apocalyptic setting.
This is absolutely not the case, although the suffering of the victims should not be minimized.
Coming back to the Black Rose, the setting is sumptuous offering a warm welcome and exceptionally tasty traditional cuisine.
On the security side, the building is reassuring since it did not suffer any damage during the earthquake.

The atmosphere of this place is unique, the rooms are spacious and carefully furnished, very comfortable bed, super breakfast on the terrace. You can see that all the staff work with love and care. The riad is in a small, very picturesque neighborhood close to the kasbah. I highly recommend it!

Our stay at Rose Noire was one of the most enjoyable in Morocco. We stayed for 2 nights in total (at the beginning and end of our trip). Jmiaa, her family and staff were extremely welcoming and warm hosts. We loved the terrace with amazing views over the Kasbah and Ouarzazate. The hotel is in an excellent location, 10 minutes walk from the centre. This is a restored Riad, with great , characterful interiors which offers an authentic stay with amazing views.  Breakfast was excellent, with the best pancakes!  Highly recommended and if we ever visit Ouarzazate we will be staying at Rose Noire.

My husband and I wanted to stay at the Fint Oasis because we heard it was hard to find parking and that way we could get on the road early. 

The family running Maison d'H√¥te La Roche Noire is so incredibly hospitable.  They genuinely want to get to know their guests and ensure that you're enjoying their experience.  We were greeted with mint tea (of course).  We enjoyed a lovely, authentic dinner in the communal dinning room (all guest groups have their own tables).  Halfway through dinner the family began to dance and play drums, inviting us to join.  

Rooms are simple, but they're clean and the bathrooms were modern.  Would recommend.

We spent 3 wonderful days at the Petit Riad Guesthouse in Ouarzazate.
Riad is still with a lot of tastes both inside and outside. Everything is clean and well thought out. The rooms all decorated differently are beautiful and extremely clean. The hearty and varied cuisine is delicious.  All the dishes are nicely present. The staff is very attentive. Meals (June) were served around the pool among flowers and beautiful bougainvillea.  Everything was quiet and relaxing.  In particular we thank Mr Mohamed and Mr Aimad for their professionalism and kindness.  Discreet, they were always present to answer our questions.  Thank you Mr Mohamed for always serving us our meals with a smile and kind words.
And of course, thanks to Fatima, the owner who came every morning to make sure everything was in harmony. 
This was not the first time we stayed at this riad and it will not be the last.
We wish you a very good continuation and see you soon.

Elisabeth and Charles, Florida

This riad is perfection. The friendly, friendly staff who take the time to discuss. The interior is beautiful. The kitchen is delicious. It's a very nice address. Thanks to Maguy of breed Direct for this booking +++

We were visiting Ouarzazate and slept in this charming hotel very well decorated. Located outside the city center next to the airport which has very little traffic so no embarrassment. We ate a very good meal on site.
I recommend this address

Very nice Riad, well maintained and beautiful decoration.  Loved the room, spacious and very well decorated. Everything is well thought out, clean and impeccable service. The location is great too 
The breakfast was very delicious too.

review title: A pearl at the gate of the desert
review:
This "Little Riad" is a guest house full of charm, of recent construst certainly, but where the atmosphere recreated by its owner is authentic. 
The rooms are spacious with excellent bedding and tasteful decoration. Dinner and breakfast, typically Moroccan, varied and generous, regaled us.
Many thanks to Aimad, as well as to all those who help him make this riad a must. Good job!

We stayed two nights, going to and from the desert. It is a very nice little Riad, very comfortable rooms with large beds. We ate very well and the staff is very friendly. The pool and terrace are lovely. We recommend the place warmly.

Riad full of charm, spacious and beautifully decorated rooms. A beautiful pool and terrace that must be very pleasant in the summer. Tasty meal with Berber specialities and excellent, varied and hearty breakfast. Finally a great welcome!

review title: Exceptional welcome and quality of service!
review:
We ate in this Riad the day before we returned to France. 
Everything was perfect: service, food, price... and what a sense of hospitality! What a professionalism! 
The establishment is beautiful.
A pearl. This is rare these days. 
We'll be back as soon as possible.

review title: Exquisite riad on the outskirts of Ouazazarte
review: Exquisite riad on the outskirts of Ouazazarte.  The place was super-relaxing, with a very inviting outdoor space, complete with pool and dining tables and also a beautiful garden.  The inside courtyard was tastefully appointed, with photo-worthy mosaic work.  Bedroom was spacious and comfortable, with comfortable bed.  And all the food was terrific.

review title: Top notch stay at le petit riad
review: A gem of a place oozing rustic authenticity and warmth.  Top notch service, fabulous food and lovely chilled vibe.  Comfortable rooms, good outside areas and the staff were truly excellent. Only downside was road noise when on the upstairs terrace but for a 3* rating you would be hard placed to find a better bolt hole for a night or two.

Hotel built in typical Moroccan terracotta friendly place where cats are welcome to plan to share the deckchair with the four-legged companions large swimming pool very large courtyard typically oriental very affordable room price drink of your choice with or without alcohol for me I always started a dish with meat to share with our friends long hair pleasant table company

The hotel has a good location, very close to the fortress and the medina. The staff are polite and helpful. Modest but decent breakfast. However, the hotel is very old, not clean enough, the air conditioning did not work in my room and it was very stuffy. Bad wi-fi.

Booked one night here, ended up staying three nights. Nice hotel at the edge of town, restaurants and attractions on walking distance. The name of the hotel was a little confusing; google maps has the exact location, but the sign above the gate says ‚ÄúRiad salam‚Äù, staff couldn‚Äôt explain why. The hotel has everything you need, very friendly staff, swimming pools, a bar (they serve alcohol), restaurant, laundry service and so on. The place is a bit dated and the rooms are noisy, but it‚Äôs clean. I think it‚Äôs the best you can get in this price range.

review title: Lovely room, terrible food (worst eaten in Morocco)
review:
We arrived not sure what to expect but we were given a lovely room with lots of space for us and the children. Unfortunately the food was terrible (think 1960s bad English buffet with tepid food and weird mixtures). No Moroccan food at all. Worst still, standards of hygiene must have been low as within 1.5 hours of eating I got a tummy bug, my 11 year old son was really ill the next day. We both ended up with terrible diarrhoea as we continued our journey. Only just recovering from it now back home. Such a shame as we ate in street markets and small cafes with no problems until here.
Lovely venue, yes its faded glory but the room we had was lovely,  just do not have anything to eat here. 
Feel sorry for the tour groups we saw.

review title: Nice rooms, good service, poor pool area - faded grandeur
review:
This is a well located tourist hotel, only 10 minutes walk from the Kasbah and town centre.  And very reasonably priced. 
The service on the whole was excellent (apart from the grumpy lady cooking the breakfast pancakes!). Our room in the older part of the hotel beyond the pool, set above a courtyard, was really lovely. Spacious, cool and loved the stain glass windows. Very clean with a fridge for our water.
We joined in with the buffet dinner which was termendous value, and the salads were delicious. Felt slightly overwhelmed by 2 huge groups staying at the hotel the same night but we were allowed to sit in a separate part of the dining room from them which was good. However, they took over the whole pool area after dinner and there was not one seat to be had outside anywhere.
Sadly this hotel is really let down by the pool area. Every cushion on every sun lounger and chair was split, faded or ripped - all in a really poor state of repair. Some of the sunbeds were broken too. The step ladder going into the pool was wobbly and felt like it was going to come off, and at 4pm in the afternoon the pool looked dirty and was the coldest pool of our whole trip. It's a shame as it looks nothing like the photos, but wouldn't take too much to upgrade it all a bit.
Overall - this is okay for a quick stop over, the service was good, but the pool area was a let down.

It's a nice hotel, friendly people and clean pool. We had a good time until the checkout; we suddenly had to pay ‚Ç¨36 for one bag of laundry. Also every beer was ‚Ç¨4. Be carefull for what you do because the prices are overrated!!

review title: Great location and good facilities at a bargain price.
review:
This is a huge hotel and one suspects it is past its heyday.  There is a main block (Hotel Tichka) and also many rooms arranged in two storey blocks around courtyards.  (Riad Salam).  Between them is a large pool deck with bar, sun-loungers, fountains, etc.  We stayed in one of the courtyard rooms, overlooking the pool.

Room was very spacious, with two queen-sized beds.  All the amenities worked, with a particularly gushy shower and plenty of hot water.  However the bathroom was well overdue an update.

The hotel is a few minutes' walk from the centre of Ouarzazate and the CTM bus station, and also very handy for the Kasbah and the cinema museum.  We paid ‚Ç¨30 including breakfast for two, so the faded decor and dodgy bathroom were more than outweighed by the low price.  One suspects in its heyday it would have been much busier and would have commanded much higher prices.

I quite liked staying in this almost deserted monument to another time.  Like being in a J G Ballard novel!  But the main thing for us was the practicality of the location before departing the following morning on the bus back to Marrakech.

The hotel is very well positioned as it takes a 5 min walk to reach the main square in Ouarzazate.

My room was minimal with old style forniture and a not perfectly working toilet and shower.

However the outside garden and the swimming pools are nice to have, especially in summer.

we booked two rooms and i  both of them: no hot water (impossible to shower), no conditioning (freezing room), no discount on the price when we complained. also not particularly clean. avoid it if you can.

Although the hotel name advertised here (Le Tichka Ouarzazate) can be found on GPS, it pointed to a different location. Quite frustrated at first but luckily a local policeman showed us the correct direction. When we got there, we were surprised to see the hotel name was not as advertised but instead Riad Salam. Had to confirm with the reception that we were at the right place.

There's no elevator available but we got a room on the ground floor. We had to walk quite a distance to get to our room located on the block at the back of the main building and the pool. Wifi signal was not strong here. Parking available for free. Breakfast was pretty basic but the best of all hotels we stayed during our trip in Morocco.

review title: Small little gastronomy of the city without noise
One of the best family outings
Great place to dine!!! Excellent food, fabulous service!
Go ahead with your eyes closed
Little evening in the wrong place

review:
First, my experience with Ouarzazate was wonderful. The place is very beautiful, clean and organized, not to mention the service, which was sensational. I went with my family on vacation and everyone enjoyed the night we spent there. The food, for me, was the best part, it is very delicious and beautiful. In reality, it was a set of things that made me want to return to
Ouarzazate and who knows, I might be lucky enough to return! I recommend
Oo... i and my wife sit herethat day... i got our lunch and... your friendly customer services... love this places one and one more ‚ù§ üíò

Best experience ever at Ouarzazate. The foods are delicious and the service is excellent. Went alone. It is a great place to spent lovely ecological moments ( food+ the view +people + construction ). i do really like the experience .and I would recommend it.

Last night we drove 25 mins through rough roads from Ouarzazate, full of expectations and appetite to dine at this place. At the beginning we were excited to see people dressed in traditional costumes serving as we expected real moroccan dishes that we like so much... Only 4 or 5 dishes were available. We chose grilled beef, chicken tajine and aubergine tajine. The bread came with some sad olives (I produce olives and olive oil in Italy). The bread tasted and felt like old, cold chewing gum. The olives were tasteless olives (except the spicy ones that were impossible to eat). Then the main dishes came: the bbq meats were small pieces, dry, overcooked and just warm. The aubergine tajine was a disgrace: three slices of aubergine on top of some tomatoes with cheese. The chicken had been dropped in the tajine with the same green olives that had been offered as entr√©e. The flavours of the two ingredients had not been amalgamated by properly cooking together... it was like the olives were dropped on top of the chicken just before taking it to the table, resulting in a tasteless chicken without character, let alone moroccan taste...
At that point we stood up, we paid and we drove back 25 mins to town
If the whole experience had not been a really unpleasant situation were we got scammed, I wouldn't be losing my time to write a negative review to warn fellow tourists... Our strong advice is to stay far away from this place. We ended up having a pizza at a local 5 stars hotel. Horrible experience...
A plenty of plates and delicious food that i test, i like the way they use to cook, i mean its much deep love whene they cook, makes me love the food

review title: Still the best food in Ouarzazate
review:
After almost 3 years of our last visit, they got better in every sense possible. 

The found a Master Cheff, capable to create delicious meals and present them in a very special way. This time, we enjoyed mostly vegan & vegetarian meals (as this is one of the few restaurants in Ouarzazate with this options). 

The service was also very very good. Super recommended.

I was really surprised by the quality of this restaurant. Super good, super food! Organic vegetables and the best local products makes the experience special. 

I would definitely recommend this restaurant to anyone who is passing by Ouarzazate, even thought if they are not staying at the Ecolodge.
The ecolodge serves you a delicious meals including the stay the food is amazing at this property I recommend you to stay here and enjoy the meals.

nice idea to have spent lovely ecological moments  ( food+ the view +people + construction ).
i do really like the experience .and I would recommend it.

We eat our tagin Meat With vegitarian wich caming from the field from of the restaurant 
Very delcious organic food in my life With Nice and splendid panoramic of th√© lac atlas mountains With stars watching all night
Romantic place 
And the boss he is  Very popular in ouarzazate 
They have rooms too

Me and my familly been to ouarzazate last week,we were wondering where to have a tipycal dinner in this aerea ,after searching in tripadvisor we found L'ile de ouarzazate ,we emailed them to make a reservation ,youssef the boss of this loveley location answered our email and questions very quickly and took our reservation,when we arrived to the restaurant the staff welcomes us with a meant tea and hade dinner wich was deleciouse,afterward they made a local music for all the costumers , was an unforguetable stay i really recomand highly this location

I think this is one of my most loved places to eat they have some delicious tajins and couscous , I hope I can visit this restaurant again and over again because it has what i'm looking for , nice job guys üëçüëè

This is the restaurant for the ecolodge. All the food here is natural and is delicious. Service is good, limited local wine list which offers good value. Much better than going all the way into town to eat

One of the best Tagine's available in Ouarzazate. If you are at the area don't miss this place. In cold days, the Harira is also very good. It's very easy to find, they are the only place near the barrage.

For the location, the quality and the service, soon we will see this restaurant at the first place in Trip Advisor. 

The owner is a very nice person, who is able to speak 7 different languages and will provide the best hospitality and food in Ouarzazate.

In a superb location, with delicious berber traditional food made with some ingredients from their veggie bio garden, this restaurant is a must for every traveler passing by Ouarzazate.

If you are looking for exclusivity and high quality service, go to see this place.

One of the best restaurant in warzazat if you look for a good place its so recommend 
 The service is amazing

Actually it is a special design and the suites all have a roof terrace. But it seemed unloved by the owner. No nice decorations in the room, in generell a bit neglected and dirty. Sorry. Could be very nice if it would be in good shape. The food was OK.

review title: Best and funniest waiter and man in Morocco!
review:
We were the only guests on this evening, we were served like kings. Kamal our waiter was entertaining, funny and a great human being! Our food was delicious and i was able to try some liquors. We tried to contact Kamal afterwards, to thank him again for this very special dinner experience, but i believe my SMS/WA-Message did not arrive :( 
Kamal if you read this, thank you very much! We' ll see us again :) Thomas & Verena

We were looking for a restaurant for dinner. The Cote Sud already invited for dinner from the outside. Because the restaurant is a bit off the main road, we were the only guests. In retrospect, it was the best evening of our Morocco trip. Our server was very accommodating, very nice and above all interested in fulfilling every wish. The food was delicious and plentiful. The price level is based on German prices. Value for money so top!
Thanks for the great evening, we will come back!

The food is simple but brilliant. Made with love and care. You can get both the traditional Moroccan dishes but also french and Spanish. The onion soup was brilliant for example and so was the sambas al pil pil.
An oasis for hungry travelers! We had a very nice time in this wonderful restaurant. We sat by the pond in the yard. Both the food and the atmosphere were great!

CoteSud has great architectural grandeur and is beautifully situated, away from the urban hustle and bustle, but with a open view, over the green banks of the river. The sunrise over the old kasbah of Q. was phenomenal. The rooms are attractive, convenienttly equipped and furnished, with a nice terrace on top. The breakfast is OK with an admirable service. Diner was rather good with an excellent wine list. CoteSud is a must.

review title: Warm welcome in a stunning environment.
review: A truly magnificent building with beautiful pieces of art in unexpected corners. High quality food and excellent service. It was no problem to use the rooms a few hours longer and all of us were given a bottle of water for the return journey to Marrakesh. Had a very nice conversation with the friendly owner, who travels to Ceuta once a month in order to offer fine Spanish delicacies. The place is very peaceful and the view from the roof terrace impressive. We loved it here !

review title: INDISPENSABLE PLACE IF YOU VISIT OUARZAZATE
review:
It is a very nice restaurant with a beautiful place for the swimming-pool. The food is delicious, specially the typical spanish "paella" and the "croquetas".
An indispensable restaurant and hotel for relaxing, having a good lunch or dinner if you visit Ouarzazate.
The waiters are very friendly and attentive too.

Very nice restaurant..to repeat. Nice place and relaxing and calm atmosphere...
Very good paella....

The food is delicious and the swimming pool is fantastic! The place is clean and well prepared, you feel just like home. The staff members are so friendly and kind, as well as the owner Enrique. 
I would fully recommend it because it's definitely the best place in Ouarzazate!

We spent 2 days in Cote Sud. Once you enter the property you keep on stunning until the moment you leave. Beautiful architecture, amazing colors, very welcoming and charming Enrique and the staff will make you feel like a queen/king during every minute of your stay. You are always free to choose your favorite spot for breakfast/lunch/aperitif/dinner - in the restaurant, by the basins, on the rooftopS (big enough to play tennis) overlooking mountains or on your private rooftop terrace. It's a perfect place to spend a weekend at with you favorite friends (there are 4 double - very nice - rooms) and do nothing but eat, relax, reflect over life and sunbath. The menu is very nice and so is the selection of wines/cavas.
Thank you for a wonderful stay!
The place is somewhat difficult to access but Enrique kindly picked us up from Ouarzazate.

... but actually also offers limited accommodation.   From the outset, let me say how stylish this place is.   The dream of one man, which deserves better patronage than it enjoys - I suppose one has to know it's there.   It's a bit off the beaten track and a tad contemporary/fundamental in style, which is probably why it's not particularly noticeable from outside and afar.   The inside continues the contemporary theme and is the essence of tranquility - the use of indigenous antique artifacts (doors especially) is inspired.   The owner and staff were warm, hospitable and properly attentive; the meals (dinner and breakfast) both beautiful and first rate.   We loved it and would visit again; if you get the opportunity, try it yourself, you won't be disappointed.

What a pleasant surprise.  We began with fresh rolls, crispy on the outside soft and tender on the inside.  Then a fish spread on points of toast.  Finally meat balls in an understated tomato sauce with potatoes, last was light refreshing  yogurt desert. Heaven.  The menu is fixed.

CoteSud Nice place to eat.

I styed with friends to have lunch and it was cool place pig pool .

food is tasty .

Booked for a long weekend, plan DE cash. 3 debits to my bank account, for 2 Cokes: 15‚Ç¨
I was only reimbursed one after more than a month DE recovery.

The hotel is old, not worthy DE the IBIS brand

we stayed 5 nights in Ouarzazate. an excellent base to shine in the area. a very nice hotel with a large pool. the rooms are spacious and clean, well air conditioned and well soundproofed.
only downside: although the rooms are non-smoking , some guests do not mind to smoke there anyway!!!
the breakfast is really great. we only had lunch once at the restaurant and it was perfect.
Finally, one last word: the staff is very friendly and very professional.

.

review title: Definitely worth a stay if in Quartazat
review:
Great hotel. Cheap but clean and has the basic amenities. Pool is actually lovely and big and very quiet. Hotel staff are all friendly and really helpful. Would recommend if you want to explore Quartazate.
Breakfast is continental with fruit and cereal. Coffee is ok. It‚Äôs a great hotel for the price

Hotel well located between the historic kasbah and the city center.rooms are well equipped and very clean.the breakfast buffet is served with happiness, very generous with everything you need.the staff at the reception and restaurant are very friendly.I recommend

Hotel located in the city center , spacious and clean rooms.
Breakfast varied, welcoming staff, helpful and attentive.
A beautiful experience and good place for relaxation especially in this time, you enjoy the sun.
I highly recommend it.

Coming a little late in the evening and was greeted by a smiling portier. Driving mc who needed a wash and he arranged with someone for it, gianteviceüëç. Nice hotel and nice patio by the pool. Breakfast as in other hotels. Nice service. Locked parking is a plus for us at mc

Excellent hotel, quiet, very welcoming and pleasant staff, good location, catering to the height, correct and clean room, staff always listening and watch over your requests, do not miss this opportunity to relax

always available welcoming and smiling staff
I highly recommend this hotel. a good breakfast .a pool and terrace to enjoy especially in full sun .not far from the city and the kasbah taourirt .and 10 min from the city center.

Friendly and comfortable hotel,my room was very clean and very well maintained.I liked the restaurant;the dishes are really delicious and the breakfast hearty with a nice presentation,the staff is welcoming, warm and with little care.
I highly recommend this hotel

Clean rooms very good services ,very good reception very good quality of people beautiful and kind be precise and factual be objective and impartial be, constructive and respectful be clear and consistent be honest and sincere
The restaurant is run by Moroccans, who offer their know-how, with ready-made dishes and flavors that we love!. I recommend Ouarzazate couscou, not to mention oriental pastries and mint tea.

review title: Lunch decided at the last moment successfully.
review:
Friendly and warm welcome,
Tasty and abundant cuisine,
Fast service,
Thank you.
We will surely return
Too bad the welcome was cold enough, because this restaurant is worth a visit especially for Tajin, much less for couscous.

review title: A very friendly restaurant and a kitchen that wakes the taste buds!!
review: Very good restaurant, I was received by a very nice and very nice gentleman. The chorba and the royal couscous with sheep that I took were very good, very well made and very well presented. I highly recommend this restaurant, do not hesitate to go there.

couscous very good , quantity right , served very hot , broth well seasoned , boulouane very fresh , service fairly fast , desserts decent , the place where we eat a good couscous √† pau , thinking of retaining the restaurant is not very great

Cocktail Marrakech divine, Couscous Ouarzazate excellentisime , plate of sweet little sweets of the bled succulent and B tea mint as in a ryad in the country.
We all feasted!!

Very good Moroccan restaurant, dishes made with good raw materials (merguez them from couscous in particular), lots of taste.
And an excellent Lebanese red wine to accompany the meal.
We will return as soon as possible
A warm restaurant with tasty cuisine. Recommend unreservedly both for these delicious tagines and for its generous couscous
The tagine was excellent, so was the service (thanks for the khobz). It felt like a shithole, thanks for this delicious time

review title: Starter, tagine, Moroccan red wine and mint tea to finish. Price/quality fine.
review: First time ever tried Moroccan cuisine.  Was great, we're gonna do it. A little too fast operation is only downside. Nice atmosphere.

Very nice home. Beautiful decor. Relaxed atmosphere.
Casa beer +
Excellent couscous+ Good red wine.
Impeccable service
not much to detail, just to point out that if you want good couscous in a pleasant decor, this is the address in Pau for you. Simple and good.

We came two years ago and we liked the atmosphere of this establishment.
We came back for Valentine's Day and were very satisfied with the service and delicious dishes offered.
A tagine was a hit for me and a very good couscous for Madame.
I recommend this little setting a stone's throw from Bosquet.

Very good restaurant. I had a divine tomato kofta. The tea is also excellent.
My colleague had a lamb and pear tagine which he also really enjoyed!

Excellent welcome from the staff. Fast service.
Perfect dishes (Tajines Couscous etc.) wine list
Restaurant to know

Very small room, overlooking a busy main street night and day, no soundproofing, my wife made me look at me because I'm a heavy sleeper and she spent a sleepless night
Mattress very hard, I like
Shower column old but does the trick
Towels very rough, will have to think about renewing
Thank you.

Cheap and cheerful, on the main road, next to all amenities, supermarkets, coach station, restaurants, cafe. Hotel staff Mohammed, Ayoub, Simo very very pleasant, well spoken English, local knowledge great. Hotel a bit dark, poor lighting, rooms can be a bit cleaner. But you get what you pay for.

I spent four nights at this hotel in Ouarzazate in November of last year 2023.The room was large and clean and,eventhough it faced the street at the front,sleep quality was excellent.The staff were  friendly and made me feel very welcome.....This hotel is in a good location,a short walk to the centre of town as well as being on a major bus route,with the bus stop just in front.....The building itself has lots of character and is definitely worth a return visit....I am happy to give the hotel 9 out of 10.

Friendly staff
Nice location. Clean. Good food. Comfortable. Over all one of our best stays in Morocco
I would recommend staying here. 
It is close to carrefour where you can buy alcohol and there is a very good and cheaper pizza restaurant called Positano near by

We had a big room for 3 people, hotel staff Mohammed, Walid and Fatima were all so friendly and helpful! Very nice people and Lovely place to stay. The breakfast next door was also very nice. Definitely recommend.

Traditional Moroccan style Hotel in a great location. We was greeted with mint tea on arrival and a friendly team. Mohammed and the 2 lovely ladies at reception helped with all our needs. 
Fantastic value for money. Would stay again.

review title: Beautiful hotel and great and good location
review:
A wonderful hotel and a good location. We were under the care of houdda and others, and we shared them for good treatment. The hotel is on its way to the best and is being improved, and we will visit again... thanks !!!! 
Also the boss whas nice personne the give us time  wher are enjoy in this hotel

THEY GAVE US WRONG ROOMS, ONE OF US HAD TO SLEEP ON A SOFA AND THEY WERE VERY RUDE! 

We had booked a room for 4 and a single room (we were 5). They gave us two double rooms and left some bed sheets on a super uncomfortable sofa. Not a sofa bed, just a normal sofa. Didnt even put the sheets on and didnt give us blankets. We spoke to the manager on the phone and basically told us to fck off. Didnt even apologise or offer an alternative.

The worst place we've been on Morocco and the most expensive

review title: Great value hotel in a good location
review: Convenient location on main road not far from bus stations, a carrefour supermarket and various cafes and restaurants nearby. Good value . Nice room with a big bed and large separate bathroom. The room also had a fridge, balcony and aircon and also provided a kettle and tea bags. Wifi okay. Cafe/ restaurant attached to hotel provided a good value breakfast and snack meals.

the hotel is located on the main road leading to the centre of the town, there is a supermarket nearby and the souq is only 10 minutes away on foot. The rooms are okey size, though a bit dark, reception staff is friendly and helpful.

Exceptional welcome in this atypical hotel, received with mint tea. Patio with trees, nice swimming pool with views of Erg Chebbi, as well as for our camper van. Restaurant very suitable. We were offered a 4x4 outing with a very pleasant guide for a visit of the surroundings, and sunset on the desert dunes with a night and catering at camp les Roches. The next day sunrise on the same dunes, meet with nomads then camel tour üê™ in the late morning.
Stay from 12 to 14 May 
We highly recommend this property, thank you to the staff 
Corinne and Olivier

review title: Superior Jeep Tour and Great Wiad Tour
review: Great accommodation, very clean and with pool. Toilet in quadruple room wobbles, however. But the best were the tours, which the boss organized for us very spontaneously: Jeep tour with a guide and only 3 quads (you should pay attention to a small group, otherwise it is not fun). And the next day a jeep tour with guide Asis. He was great! Could be very good English and has given us lots of exciting info. There was breakfast at the tourist camp and a visit to the real nomad camp and the abandoned coal mines. Fully recommended! Asis is great!

review title: Small charming hotel with beautiful swimming pool at the foot of the dunes.
review: Small charming hotel with clean rooms and comfortable beds overlooking a beautiful interior patio with fountain. The pool with views of the dunes is superb. At the foot of the dunes, ideal to walk there at any time.  The owner is welcoming and professional. I'd definitely go back!

We have spent two very nice days in the stay, it is very well located, close to the dunes and close to the center.

The host, Hassan, has made us feel at home. Typical Moroccan food with very good elaboration and spacious rooms with private bathroom very comfortable.

We would definitely return, highly recommended.

review title: A great place next to the dunes
review: The hotel is lovely, next to the dunes. We stayed at a reasonably priced lovely suite with a room with a bed and another one with a sofa and a table. Everything was beautifully and cosy. The hotel has a swimming pool, a great rooftop, and a nice courtyard with a fountain where you will take your breakfast in the morning  - delicious! The owner was nice, during Ramadan served harira to all guests - the best we have had so far in Morocco - and organised for us a trip to a lake, a gnawa music place and the dunes with sunset and dinner. We didn't have dinner in the hotel, though, as we found the prices quite high for Morocco.

review title: Magical Desert Experience with Camel Ride & Amazing Hospitality!
review: We enjoyed a camel ride into the desert camp. Everything was magical, especially the sunset and sunrise experience. Before that, we enjoyed the pool, and the staff gave us a room to change our things. We headed to the camp, where the staff welcomed us with a cup of mint tea. We enjoyed dinner and breakfast. Highly recommend this place :)

We had a wonderful stay at the Auberge des Roches 
As a family with a perfect welcome and very warm 
We made a trip to the lake and dinner under the tent and very hearty and delicious meal with tea up the dune and after the meal wood fire with Tam Tam
Unforgettable memory

A must stay in Merzouga! We walked into a few different places (that looked much different than their pictures showed). This place is well kept, from the rooms to the pool and rooftop, it's just beautiful, you can tell the owner cares about his place.
The staff is so wonderful and the breakfast delicious, best we had so far in Morocco! It also helps that it's literally right beside the dunes and a short walk to town for food. Wouldn't stay anywhere else,  if your looking for a hotel or camping!

review title: An Unforgettable Stay at the Hotel Les Roches
review: We stayed here for one night. It was really very nice. It is close to the dunes and has a wonderful pool. They had a charming roof, and the staff welcomed us with mint tea. Dinner and breakfast were very delicious. Thank you guys! We will return to the hotel Les Roches, and we will certainly send our friends.

review title: 3 nights in the heart of the Sahara desert
review:
Such a wonderful experience from where I can start I'm gonna start from the staff wow they're so cute, helpful and friendly Many thanks to Hassan and his team the place was incredible it's located near the dunes . The food was so tasty it was cooked by Chef Ahmed and Zahra and the hotel they offered us to spend an overnight in the desert it was amazing I'm gonna rate this hotel üíØ 
Thanks auberge Les Roche we are coming back soon

review title: A little piece of paradise at the gates of desert
review:
We stayed one night at Ksar Bicha before taking the road to the desert. At the reception we will remember Soukaina, who is a very nice and smiling person. The room for 5 was beautiful, and the place paradise, with a beautiful swimming pool very relaxing. 
Beautiful hotel organization for expedition to the Merzouga desert. Everything was in line with our expectations. We had chosen one night in fixed bivouac and one in wild bivouac, and we greatly enjoyed the organization, meals, and our very friendly camel Omar. The evening and night under the stars under the camel blankets were a moment of enchantment. On our return early in the morning we enjoyed the breakfast and the room left at our disposal for a shower. Not to mention the possibility to finish our stay by the pool to stuff before going back on the road.

One of the best hotels I've ever been, service of 10, total friendliness.
Giant bedrooms, immense beds, total neatness.
Great food.
I have stayed two nights since three remaining ones have been spent in the middle of the desert, visiting the black desert of Kem Kem, doing three trecks and camping in the middle of the Great Dune.
On my return I visited the German sculptures on my own.

Friendly hotel, team with little care. View of the dunes. Cleanliness nikel. The best is to do 2 nights at the hotel then 2 nights at the ksar bichar bivouac. Change of scenery. For lovers of driving on the dunes. Coach Ali is the best. Hate dy revenir

The ksar is a hotel at the gateway to the desert dunes. We have opted for the tented camp in the desert. With a Toyota our guide Mohammed accompanied us to the camp crossing the dunes of erg kebby to the camp we took possession of our comfortable and spacious warm tent with bath and shower. The staff of the dispobilisdimo camp offered us a tour in the dunes on a 4x4 x see the sunset after a couple of hours of unforgettable tour we returned to the camp immersed in the dunes x the Berber dinner (excellent) among the stars.  In the morning don't miss the camel ride of a couple of hours on the great dune to see the sunrise , return to the camp abundant breakfast and departure for merzouga ... 
Unforgettable experience and suggestive location particular friendly staff.

We had a good reception at this Ksar although we weren't sure which language the attendant spoke because she spoke very softly. She was very nice and made arrangements for our hammam and massage at the last minute.
We had dinner on the premises, and it was delicious, but it took a long time be served.
Strangely we were not offered tea when they served dessert and we had to order it separately.
We were leaving very early the next day, and we requested an early breakfast but were told it was too early, however they prepared us sandwiches, fruit, yogurt, to keep in the room refrigerator.
The entire place was dark at 6 am there was no one in sight and it was difficult to find the light switches near the reception desk. 
It is beautiful Ksar and it's so close to the desert you feel you are right in it. The pool is very beautiful!

review title: Quad and night in the desert
review:
Quad adventure in the desert and night under the stars in the tented camp, with these premises my review can only be excellent!
We had a great time, all the staff are kind and, in front of the small bonfire that is set up after dinner, there is a way to exchange cultural curiosities that in some way inevitably link us to this place.
There is no hot water in the tents, but we are in the desert, this is more than normal.

review title: The beauty of the desert with all the comforts
review: A wonderful corner in the Moroccan desert. All the staff go out of their way to make your stay perfect and special and they succeed. We were in the upper camp and... a tremendous storm hit us with lightning and thunder! Well, all the staff went out of their way to compensate for what was an unforeseen natural phenomenon and ensure that we had a perfect stay, and that was the case. A wonderful memory of everything, the tents, the food, the staff. Thanks for everything! We will return without hesitation.
Very good, super friendly staff, great breakfast, great room, top facilities. super pleasant atmosphere, excellent hotel decor, traditional dinner with great quality, I highly recommend it.

We had a very nice stay here for several days with the family, three generations. We appreciated the large pool area, where we were often almost alone. The staff was very nice, the food was good and our wishes were taken into account. The breakfast buffet was extensive. The rooms are different, the sanitary facilities are showing their age, but that didn't bother us.

We spent two nights at Ksar Bicha. One night in the hotel, and the second night camping in the ‚Äòsuperior‚Äô tents. The hotel property is lovely and the staff were excellent. The pool is so refreshing. We spent the afternoon by the pool after a really cool 4x4 excursion where we learned about the origins of mascara and met a Berber nomadic family.
 Our ‚Äògolden hour‚Äô camel ride to the desert was truly memorable. The desert camp exceeded my expectations. Our tent had a western toilet, a sink and a shower with hot water, which was appreciated after the 2.5hr camel ride to the camp. 
The food at Ksar Bicha and the camp was truly excellent. We really enjoyed our stay!

very well the hotel, the lovely workers, always attentive to what the client needed, the delicious food, the splendid rooms, the pool was in perfect condition, also had some comfortable hammocks to be able to sunbathe, 0 complaints, repeat 1 and thousand times

I liked everything, from the hotel, the scenery, the attention, the hospitality, a highly recommended trip .both with friends and family ............. we will repeat for sure. 
A great experience.
Wishing you could live the experience again, both at the NasserPalace Palace hotel and at night in the desert of the imperial glory lodges 
A luxury!

I had the opportunity to stay at the Nasser Palace during my trip to the Merzouga desert, and it was, without a doubt, an unforgettable experience. This charming hotel perfectly combines traditional Moroccan style with all modern amenities, offering a warm, authentic and welcoming stay.

My partner and I decided to take a trip to Morocco, the truth is that it has been a long time since minute one, and all thanks to Brahim, a lovely person full of many values.
Exceptional treatment, wonderful hotel, both its facilities for comfort to its food that has been fabulous
If you are thinking of making a trip to Morocco and visiting the desert you can not leave without visiting this hotel and without knowing brahim who will help you with everything you need and will fill you with adrenaline and wellness
Really how amazing
We will definitely repeat ü•≥‚ò∫Ô∏èüôè

Beautiful hotel on foot of dunes. The staff very friendly and always watching that you do not miss anything. 
We contacted Brahim for our trip and he was in charge of organizing our Morocco tour and our excursions. In Merzouga and the surrounding area there are many things to siesta and experiences to live for that reason I recommend more than one night. Visit the village of the blacks, the nomads, quad bike tour through the dunes, camel tour through the desert, visit the market...

Fantastic hotel on the desert gates in Merzouga. The room very small but we were very good. Brahim a perfect host always pending that we were well and very close to deal. He offered us to make a private 4x4 outing through the desert and meet a nomadic settlement and other places.. The driver was very friendly and friendly. Thank you to all the hotel staff... youssef,said,yassine,hanane.
A fantastic dinner by the pool and a wonderful breakfast. We'll be back!!! Thank you all.

review title: I was many times in Merzouga, but this time is different.
review:
I appreciated this structure completely integrated into the Sahara environment. 
Very friendly staff like all people of the south.
Very delicious, rich, and filling breakfast and diner.
I wish l can come back after a while when all the programs of investment are completed. 
It's already so impressive and we can enjoy a lot of pictures and selfies.
The room with aircon and my bed was very comfortable.
The background music is authentic. 
It's a pity, because l stayed only one night, like it's a pity l came alone but l found good company in the GUESTS & staff.
I enjoyed sharing my breakfast very much with the birds, and l liked their different chirping.
It's so pleasant and relaxing here.
The activities are so diverse, like camel riding, the sun rising, and the sunset is fabulous. The quads and the buggies are available for your fun.
The Sahara drive with the comfortable and new 4√ó4 was fantastic.

Me, my mum and my auntie julia stayed in this hotel after a night in the Sahara camp, it was so so nice! Yussef was so lovely and accommodating. The pool was perfect and the room had air con! The breakfast was delicious. I would definitely return

review title: For a couple or family with children, it is the best choice
review: Hotel with super charm, family treatment, great food, and in an incomparable corner, both Nasser and Brahim will make sure that your stay is as comfortable as possible, and because this has been my sixth time and I hope to be able to repeat many more.

review title: Magic and relaxation and at the gates of the desert
review:
We have stayed 3 nights and we have felt at home.
The hotel has all the amenities to make you feel comfortable during your stay. The interior area has a pool and some tables where you can relax and have tea.
Every corner of the Nasser has a special charm...from the terrace where you can see the dunes and the sunrise and sunset, to the dining room or any of the sofas they have throughout the hotel to relax and unwind.
Both breakfast, lunch and dinner are very tasty and abundant, at lunch and dinner each day they serve different dishes, each one more delicious. Breakfast is also varied.
The staff and their managers make the experience even more welcoming and familiar because they make you feel at home from the first moment you set foot there.
We took several excursions, one on a camel to see the sunset in the dunes, which is something you have to experience once in your life and the other was a buggy route through the dunes as well, 100% recommended.
Without a doubt a place to return to again and again.!!

review title: Extraordinary site but comfort/welcome to review
review:
The establishment EN is divided into two: the hotel (hostel) and its spectacular (but not very clean) swimming pool and the ‚Äúbivouac‚Äù located 200 meters away. We are 10 km DE Merzouga, in the extreme north DE the erg, just on the edge DE the dune zone. The place is sumptuous and very photogenic: it is its main (unique?) asset.
As for the hotel, the welcome is minimalist (no smile, no tea or anything attentive), the rooms deserve a serious blow DE renovation, the air conditioning are pushy and noisy, the interior equipment limited to the towel. We didn‚Äôt get DE pool towels... As everywhere in the south at the end of July, DE la douche water is never chilled DE: ours was definitely hot (plumbing problem). Very average service and caters a little bit (but hearty). No breakfast. Attention to emphasize: we were lent a room in the afternoon between our stay at the hostel and our night at the bivouac: very appreciable!
We're going to the bivouac on a camel DE. Big clich√© for tourists but we get caught up in the game. Nothing to see on the welcome side: smile and tea/juice DE welcome. Don‚Äôt wait DE traditional tents: they are semi-solid structures, air-conditioned (!!) and very decorated in a thousand and one night. Restaurant copy/paste with hostel but okay. Breakfast just as average. Price very above the Moroccan standard (little folly but the place deserves it).
We then take you back to the hotel: perfect logistics organization.
You can skip the hostel (without interest) and spend only one night at the bivouac. Arriving at the end of the afternoon, you will enjoy DE hotel‚Äôs swimming pool (you can easily change on site) without missing either sunset (rarely visible because frequent clouds in the evening) or sunrise DE.

Bad service.
There is a modern and dismissive attitude toward the driver, while in fact, he should be treated well because he plays a major and important role in the tourism sector.
Meanwhile, the spotlight is put on the guide, with accommodation provided for him, while the driver is neglected.
From my point of view, my rating for this hotel is 0.

When you come with customers, you as a driver, you are not fair. There is a kind of discrimination. If you are a tour guide, they will give you accommodation, but if you are a driver, they do not give you accommodation. Expensive needs are sold to customers there. Unfortunately, there is a kind of racism towards the driver, and I do not agree with this policy.

review title: A dream but with some flaws
review:
The rooms as well as the place are wonderful, a real paradise. directly next to the dunes, really a dream.
I remove a star because I think it is one of the worst dinners made in Morocco (buffet, bad) and also the pool, to be honest, should be fixed. I don't know if it was a filter theme or anything, but we came out with green costumes

Our time here was very limited but enjoyable. The tent was comfortable and in the Dunes. Camel ride was very short but the sunset and sunrise over the Sahara was breathtaking. The buffet breakfast was limited but the dinner had more options. Both were average. They also provided live performers around the campfire which we enjoyed

Wonderful dunes front place in Merzouga.
Attention to every detail. 

Cleanliness impeccable, and a big THANK YOU to the staff always helpful and courteous.
breakfast and dinner buffet, both excellent and varied.

Thank you for your experience <3

review title: Very very very rude staff at reception
review: I don‚Äôt often comment on the rudeness of staff but the hierarchy who run this place need to know how rude the reception staff are. The other staff are polite and helpful. Also there is only WiFi at reception which is a real inconvenience. I would never go back here

Located at the foot of the dunes, it is an undeniable attraction. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The pool is beautiful.  Small downside for the proposed restoration that is far from the standard of an establishment like this.
The place is ideal for sunrises and sunsets.

Hotel in the dunes of Erg Chebbi scenario to take the folego of so much beauty by itself.
The facilities and hospitality of the Auberbe du Sud staff make this place even more spectacular and magical.
I was two days on a motorcycle trip for the ADV Moto Tour de Portugal, but I intend to come back more often.

review title: Big Riad - Bed and Water were a problem
review: We had the Riad to our self.  It was spacious and cozy.  The sheets were very scratchy and the water in the sink did not work.  The shower did not have a place to hold the shower wand.  The dinner was awesome! The sunset and sunrise views were spectacular from our Riad.  Unfortunately the roof top was covered in bird poop.

review title: View of a picturesque village from a comfortable hotel
review:
In front of the Chebbi erg in Mezguda 5 minutes walk from its dunes stands this very impressive building
As soon as you arrive you immediately notice the attention to detail from the scent of the rooms to the objects scattered carefully in the lobby. Idir welcomed us and, with a very good Italian,
He showed us the services of the hotel and described the planning of the stay (having taken a night in the desert with the dromedaries). The spacious and clean rooms with bathroom and shower very large and comfortable. Courteous and professional staff and attentive to meet all our needs.
In the hotel there is also a swimming pool much appreciated by all of us to relax and recover your strength.
Great dinner and breakfast 
Really a nice place, you can't ask for more

Beautiful isolated hotel. Pool was inviting and very refreshing. Bring your own water and wine. They did have beer, but you have to ask. It was a set dinner with camel as the main entree so be careful when you tell them you eat everything. Salad was excellent. Room was comfortable and large. Staff were very kind and helpful.

Staying at Dar Morocco is an enchanting experience. New, clean, fragrant and with a breathtaking view of the dunes.
The pool like the other common areas are very large and very beautiful!
Mobarak welcomes and entertains guests with kindness and professionalism. At Dar Morocco you feel at home. You are surrounded by people who try to satisfy your every request.
Thank you all for the way you are, never change!
Great guys!!!
See you soon. 
Cristina and Luca - Aosta Valley - Italy

magical place facing the golden dunes of merzouga. welcome and exceptional service ..I recommend. 
very comfortable and spacious room.

one plus the pool. 

activity around dunes, quad, camels ..

accessible to everyone..

I'm happy to be back.

review title: We arrived at this beautiful hotel with swimming pool. Staff attentive and kind. Clean and cozy room
review: Very nice charming hotel in the desert with a beautiful pool. Very welcoming staff attentive to our needs and gentile.Camera very welcoming and clean. Great breakfast and dinner. I highly recommend it to those who want to take a holiday in the Moroccan desert

As soon as you enter the hotel you are enveloped by the smell of the place, it is very pleasant and makes you feel at home. You are greeted with a glass of tea and pastries from the area while you are ckeck-in. Once you have finished tea they show you your room and enjoy the hotel and its spectacular views from the pool where you can see from there the desert dunes. I recommend a photo from the pool with the background of the dunes. It's spectacular.

review title: An enchanting corner in the heart of the Sahara
review:
We stayed at this riad in Merzouga and it was a truly unforgettable experience. The place is lovely, attention to detail and offers all the amenities you would expect from a top Western hotel. The pool is huge and overlooks the dunes of the Sahara, offering moments of pure relaxation and breathtaking views.

The common areas are spacious and welcoming, perfect for relaxing after a day of hiking. Although the structure is newly built, the architecture and materials chosen authentically recall the traditional Moroccan style: you can breathe the real Morocco, with a touch of elegance.

The food is exceptional, very typical and rich in flavors that we have not found in other areas of the country: a real culinary discovery.
Cleanliness is impeccable, certainly superior to many Western hotels we have stayed in.

Special praise goes to the staff, always attentive, helpful and ready to meet every need. They speak multiple languages fluently, which made our experience even easier and more enjoyable.

review title: An Enchanted Refuge at the Gates of the Desert
review: A small oasis of peace and tranquility, perfect for regenerating at the gates of the desert. The staff is extremely welcoming, friendly and always helpful, making you feel at home from the first moment. The rooms are spacious, clean and equipped with all amenities for a relaxing stay. The pool, overlooking the dunes, offers unforgettable moments with a breathtaking view.

review title: Great atmosphere, but more attention to detail would be needed
review: Good hotel with exceptional location. Too bad for the sheets and the synthetic duvet, but especially in the morning there was no running water. Even considering the location at the gateway to the desert, it remains an inconceivable fact for a 4-star hotel

Wonderful location, very friendly and helpful staff, we were only one night passing from the camp in the desert but we will be back safe for a few days of relaxation, good food. Clean and cared for, very good .greetings from Italians together with Ali

review title: Excellent time at Merzouga restaurant in Midelt
Great food, pleasant environment, attentive service and friendly owner and low prices... What more do you want?
Warmly, cozy and authentic Moroccan meal
Not so bad as a family
Great lunch and escape from summer heat
Great respite from the heat with true AC; nice food and great friendly service
Ideal spot for a quick meal when in the Desert
good lunch in a nice and quiet place

review: We were in a group of 17 people and occupied the entire hotel. We had an unparalleled opportunity to make all meals at the hotel and it was very good.

review title: We recommend the Berber palace restaurant
review:
It was a pleasant experience to have lunch and dinner here, we are a family and we had 2 children, we arrived at Merzouga around 13am and we need a place to eat, good, we stopped at the restaurant of the hotel Berber Palace
we ordered berbere pizza, and the kids find fruits and peppers, it was a good choice, and we came back to dinner here because the kids are happy with the food and we too
good family business, local food , bio 
we recommend the place

We stayed in the hotel opposite and went here for lunch. The host received us outside with a bottle of water. Once inside we were given a cup of tea and he told us about the history of his family, the village and the desert. The lunch (especially the kefta) was delicious!

Thank you Mohamed and his team for the big hospitality 
Really a very enjoyable dinners we had in the hotel.  Nice and delicious dishes ( couscous , tagines with vegetables and lamp meat , grilled camel meat .... nice berber kitchen,  we love it 
 Thank you for the memorable experience with you .
we will back soon as we promised you 
Donna Merry

Good place for dinner or lunch or breakfast, we stayed here for one night and enjoyed the Berber food, the couscous was great, the restaurant clean, the service is excellent
recommended

We are lucky to be in berber palace hotel and to try berber food  , we really like the food , tagine , couscous, berbere pizza , all our food we get them in hotel because it's delicious food , and local food , and its the right place to enjoy moroccan food
recommended restaurant in Merzouga
Thank you berber palace team

We were travelling in Morocco starting in Casablanca, Rabat, Chef Chauen, Fes. The lunch we had was the best tasting food so far. We had Moroccan salad, lamb tagine, Berber omelette and fruit.  Mum‚Äôs cooking was outstanding. Highly recommend stopping by on your way to Todra Gorge. The family hosts were very warm and welcoming

review title: Memorable place and even more memorable people
review:
This restaurant will stand out in our memories as more than just delicious food and a beautiful view. The owner and staff were incredible. My husband got ill after a day‚Äôs journey and we stopped here for lunch. These wonderful people were the ultimate hosts and professionals. They tended to my husband, calmed me and my children, and were the perfect example of Moroccan hospitality. Just amazing. For an American family who travels abroad  often, we‚Äôve never encountered such kindness. 

The food and view are outstanding as well. Delicious tangines and skewers. But you will return for the people- as will we.

Unfresh food (ranging from bread to fruit). Were a company of 10 people- three types of dishes were ordered. 
At first, the traditional bread was brought- I'm afraid it's been in the kitchen for days.
Salad is tacky.
The second courses require a separate story:
Since this region of Morocco is famous for goat meat, they decided to try goat tajin, others ordered beef tajin. In the end, everyone got a piece of bone with a scrap of meat floating in a huge amount of fat and nasty soft onions.
Nasty!
As a result, after visiting the facility, 70% had an upset stomach caused by the bacteria.
No wonder, because in this restaurant no one cares about sanitation.
This restaurant was a very good surprise. The host was extremely kind and the food was delicious. We had lunch on the terrace, and it was an additional pleasure.
Great food, great view, great service. Big recommend. I had the goat tajine and it fell right off the bone. üëå came with salad and olives.

review title: The views, the staff and the food excellent!
review:
Very good and local food. I would recommend it 100%. 
The views are stunning to the gorges and the staff very attentive. 
We ordered two tannins of meat and chicken, excellent both.

review title: Oasis of good food and peaceful quiet
review: Easy stop after visiting the gorge, the terrace over an oasis is quiet and cool. Service was friendly and very helpful. Really tasty food, my son rates the beef skewers as some of the best beef he‚Äôs ever eaten. Very fresh, good portions, reasonably priced

review title: Excellent value for money facing the palm grove.
review: A large selection of menu, very tasty cuisine, a warm welcome. Smiles and very very decent prices facing the palm grove.

The place is cute and seem to attract nice customers. The staff is very efficient and fluent in French and English. 
The food was good meeting all expectations. 
The view in the back room and the patio is great without equal.

Bad food and very bad service.. We felt treated like dollars .When we decided not to eat whole menu but only a dish, we were changed to another table wth no views, being the only customers in the restaurant. Not coming back.

Wanted to visit the gorge but came in late. After trying multiple places that said no we landed at la petite gorge and what a gift. Wonderful food and a beautiful place. We had the pleasure to dine and talk to the owner about the area. Can recommend it to anybody who passes through.
Very tasty food, with homemade taste and fresh! Balcony of the best we found in Morocco! I highly recommend
Our driver recommended this restaurant. Great home cooking. Nice view. Friendly waiters. Nice experience.

Great typical food. We greatly appreciated the helpfulness and sympathy of the managers and El Hussein 

Special mention for olives, excellent

At this place ate the best tagine of the whole trip. The tagine with goat and chicken were delicious, we went straight back for lunch the next day, and the tagine with kefta was delicious again. The host and his son are moreover super nice and friendly. Recommended!
Excellent üëå ‚≠êÔ∏è üëå ‚≠êÔ∏è üëå ‚≠êÔ∏è üëå ‚≠êÔ∏è üëå ‚≠êÔ∏è Service and Menu, Great Staff üëç Highly Recommended  for Breakfast, Lunch and Dinner or Anytime
This spot is very good for lunch. We had a men√º, salad, tajin, berber pizza and fruits. A place has a nice view. They can serv lot of persons at one time

review title: Nice stop after the dunes trip
review: Very nice stop for lunch after the dunes trip. Our driver recommended and the food was very nice. Ask for the table outside

We went to this restaurant as part of an organized tour. So certainly it was fast, the restaurant is clean, air conditioned and attentive waiters but we had a bit of a factory feel. Our meal was frankly not very good and we were disappointed. We're not going back.
I visited the restaurant Chez Ibrahim, it is a great and quiet place, the food is very good, I hope to go back

The food was super good and staff friendly!
Eggplant was delicious and the pizza was also super good!!!
I really recomend it.

Bad service 
Terrible exp√©rience ,we sitting 20 min no one comme to ask us what we want . 
Not recommended place bad service

As many reviewers had pointed out: spacious hall, courteous staff, delicious food, clean toilet. We had been traveling in Morocco for a week and had our share of harira, tagine, tangia, couscous, kefta, bstilla, merguez, mechoui, zaalouk, msemen, baghrir and were ready to try madfouna aka "Berber pizza" (Amazigh stuffed flatbread). We finally had one here and it was very satisfying. Their portions are huge and prices reasonable.

We had lunch here today as part of our camping tour, and it was a delightful experience. The meal included a salad, followed by Berber pizza, and concluded with fresh fruit. Both the salad and pizza were delicious‚Äîlight and not oily. In comparison to other restaurants, including Nora where we had lunch yesterday, the quality and taste here were significantly better.

The restaurant itself was also impressive: very clean, well-air-conditioned, and free of cats. Overall, it was a very enjoyable experience!

Great, we were there on an excursion.
Hearty and good meal in a nice setting.
The staff is very friendly.
Good Value Award I recommend.

Our tour guide recommended this restaurant and took us there. The food was excellent and very plentiful. Despite being hungry we were unable to finish all , the food provided. The service was good and friendly and the price was very reasonable so if you are in the area give it a try.
Before receiving the bill I asked all our group to guess the price and everyone was way above the final total.
At the beginning of the desert: delicious, spicy, friendly. What more do I have to say. Food is delicious and authentic. Go there. Great music too
