Best lunch we had this week in Morocco. Friendly, clean, good English. And best local style pizza. Highly recommend this restaurant.
Fantastic cuisine, simple dishes with excellent raw materials. The Berbera pizza is very good and recommended. 10 and praise !

This is a modern restaurant close to the Dar Gnaoua (Gnawa), catering to tourists. Their specialty is the Berber Pizza, which is like a calzone. It was delicious and a nice break from Tajine and Couscous. The seating was spacious and the toilet was clean.

Terrible experience. The food was not just bad‚Äîit was practically inedible. Everything tasted stale or overcooked, like it had been sitting out for hours. On top of that, the prices are ridiculously high for what you get. And to make things worse, they actually overcharged us‚Äîcharged more than what we ordered. It felt like a scam. Staff seemed uninterested and unhelpful when we pointed it out. Save your time and money‚Äîgo literally anywhere else

Run away!!!
More than an hour waiting, the dishes arrive cold, do not match what we ordered and icing on the cake, the tables next door are not cleared and the cats fight (literally) for leftovers. 
The setting was advertised as charming and attractive but really, run away!

We ordered the stake and it was not even close to the pictures in the menu. Taste terrible. Came with a side of tasteless rice and fried potatoes. Everything was cold. Also, we waited more than an hour for the food to arrive. Expensive and low quality  food. Would not recommend.
I had couscous which made us both sick! We waited a long time and the sauce was a little acidic in the end, even though there was no meat, the dish made us sick!

Food tasteless, cold, very long waiting times, but expensive.
This was our winner for the worst food during the two-month tour

To flee! Unless you like cockroaches
An average welcome, mediocre food and a high price for a sad tagine and undrinkable tea
This restaurant, the best restaurant in the region, has all kinds of delicious food, and the service is very great and fast. The location of the cafe is very beautiful , thank you.
Great restaurant, city center location, very delicious food, and good service also ,thank you so much .

Stopped for lunch and had a good chicken and rice. The guys were super friendly and it was great value. Lovely olives, bread and salad too. Food was great, sitting terrace was authentic and the staff was nice.Toilets spotless.
See you again soon!

review title: They put love in the food
review:
Food was rally excellent! We ordered Berber Pizza and Chickens Tagin. They we‚Äôre tasty and plenty in portion. Also we took some juices while waiting, they were amazing. And the staff was very friendly too!
Thank you so much for your warm hospitality and the delicous Berber salad!

review title: This was the best restaurant we tried in Merzouga
review:
Highly recommended for the very tasty Berber pizza, flat bread stuffed with chicken and spices, amazing They gave us free spiced coffee and the hospitality of the owner was very special.
Nicely decorated, Staff are very friendly, restaurant was clean.I denifetly would come back in my next trip to Merzouga.
Thank You for evertthing!
...very slow service, never mind, had enough time so it was worth the wait..there is a barbecue here which i didn‚Äôt try, looked quite good though

Hello !! honestly , I can say it's the special restaurant in Moroccan south-estern , also I would like to suggest that place as the favourite and best restaurant in Merzouga ,instead of its meals ,drinks , overall view on the desert and more stuff which let you chose Hotel Cafe Restaurant Trans Sahara as your direction here in Merzouga .

review title: The best food i ever had in Morocco!!
review:
My family and I travelling all over the country, I had the chance to Visit Merzouga and spend two days in the Sahara Desert, we visited the nomads and Khamlia village.

the best highlight of the day is getting to the main Street of the town where we had lunch in Cafe Taymat,the food was so delicious with good price.

honestly this is my best Tagin i had in Morocco 

Highly recommend!!!
I invite everyone to discover what this restaurant offers, everything is delecious, we spent 'My family anf I' a pleasant moment! w'll do it again next holiday! Thank you Omar!
Moments were very beautiful I spent with you. Thank you for your treatment and hospitalit√©. Thank u so much

review title: Delicious meals in Merzouga at Cafe Restaurant Taymat
review: My girlfriend and I enjoyed an amazing adventure trip around Erg Chebbi Sand dunes. After we come back to Merzouga village we had a delicious Tagine for lunch cooked by Omar and his team of expert at Cafe Restaurant Taymat. We recommend it to everyone who want to taste Moroccan food.

I have been there for a drink and really enjoyed it, friendly staff. Very Clean and very nice. 

Thank you.

We had a fantastic stay in Merzouga thanks to the wonderful hotel and staff who made everything so easy and memorable. They organized an unforgettable ATV ride and camel trek through the dunes ‚Äî truly a once-in-a-lifetime experience!

The hospitality was warm and genuine, the food was great, and the desert camp was peaceful and comfortable. Huge thanks to the whole team for such an incredible adventure!

Thanks to Said and all his staff!

Amazing Riad Highly recommended üíØ staff are friendly thank you so much we brought our food and they serve us thank you so much everyone I  really appreciate that everything was clean and breakfast was very delicious and we had different things in our breakfast

Beautiful experience in a land full of colors. Excellent choice of Riad Merzouga Dunes , very kind staff that welcomes you and is always at your disposal, pleasant stay with swimming pool and spacious rooms. Said a great host. Thank you.

I had an unforgettable stay at this amazing hotel in the heart of the Sahara Desert, Merzouga. The hotel is absolutely beautiful spotlessly clean, comfortable, and designed with authentic charm. The food was delicious every single day, offering a true taste of Moroccan hospitality. The location is perfect, just a short walk from the breathtaking sand dunes, making it ideal for sunrise and sunset views. I want to give a special thank you to Hassan and Mohamed for their outstanding service. They went above and beyond to make my stay exceptional. Highly recommended!

My stay here has been one of the best holidays of my life Mohammed and all three Hassans cannot do enough for you. The Riad itself is  beautifully decorated and spotlessly clean with a lovely garden area and a stunning pool. The meals are tasty, fresh and healthy. Trips can easily be arranged the two highlights were the humbling experience of meeting the nomad people and two nights in the desert camp. Lying on the dunes watching the stars  with Mohammed's guidance was a dream come true. I was here the last week of March and the weather was perfect but be warned it is very cold in the desert at night when you will need a warm jacket.

review title: An unforgettable stay in a beautiful Riad
review: I had the pleasure of staying in this beautiful riad with my sister and cousin, and we absolutely loved it! Upon arrival, we were greeted with warmth and hospitality. The food was fantastic ‚Äî not only delicious, but also abundant and of the highest quality. Every meal was a real treat. The comfort of the riad was also exceptional. The rooms were cozy and beautifully decorated, creating a perfect atmosphere for a relaxing stay. We really felt at home. In short, it was an unforgettable experience, and I highly recommend this riad to anyone looking for a perfect blend of comfort, quality and Moroccan charm.

An unforgettable stay at this Riad!! Very friendly and welcoming hosts!‚ô•Ô∏è. Fresh traditional food full of flavour, for breakfast and dinner. And from the roof of the Riad A breath-taking panoramic view, perfect for watch the sun rise. The place has close by activities to fill your days in the desert such as camel, quadbike or buggy tours, sandboarding, 4x4 offroading and more..

Very peaceful riad. Attention to detail and great hospitality. The breakfast and dinner were spectacular and tasty. They keep you busy with a lot of amazing activities like ; sand boarding , camel rides , 4x4 off roading and sand dune exploration.

Time runs fast turning memories into other realities, but find Said who comes
specially in Fes to hug you, says everything about this "NOMAD" (civilized
as He says ) who has earned and deserved with tenacity and much work his new LIFE. Berber hospitality is enhanced by the beauty and comfort of its
Riad Merzouga Dunes. In the beautiful Berber tented camp you will be able to admire the magic of starry nights, take tours with dromedaries....!!!!!   Knowing
SAID OUATTOU since 2008 we can only confirm its great
experience and professionalism in organizing off-road excursions 4x4, quad bikes,
always in an atmosphere not without comfort and security. Trusting Him and His
staff we wish a wonderful stay to those who want to know him.

                                                                                                             D&M

We stayed in this magical place and I was enchanted!
Not only is the Riad of high quality, despite the price being low, but the offering that the staff offers is of great value.
We took a tour in the desert, at sunset, riding a dromedary to get to the tent where we stopped to sleep (p.s. stop on the dunes to try sandboarding!). 
Dinner and live music, before plunging into the absolute silence of the desert!
The tent with amenities was the icing on the cake.
At dawn I return by dromedary to Merzouga before leaving for Fes.
My compliments to the brothers Said, Mohamed and Hassan who manage all these activities and are able to deal with all requests (even personalized ones) for excursions and overnight stays in any location in Morocco!
I recommend contacting them for any need or suggestion, as they are very helpful people.
Furthermore, with Said we traveled from Marrakech to Merzouga and during the two-day journey we learned a lot about the traditions, culture and religion of Morocco and the Berber people.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review:
After three stays at the Sofitel Jardin des Roses in Rabat, I can only recommend this hotel. At every visit, the welcome has always been exceptional, and the quality of service impeccable. Special thanks to Mrs Hasna, Customer Relations Manager, for her kindness and professionalism which made our stay even more enjoyable.

I would also like to thank Mrs. Nadia of Club Mill√©sime for her exceptional service and constant attention, creating a privileged experience. This hotel remains for us the perfect place whenever we visit Rabat.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review: I love the Sofitel Rabat, particularly the Club Millesmeme. The manager, Nadia is especially kind, welcoming and helpful!

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review:
I am a loyal customer of Sofitel DE Rabat, where I regularly stay during my many business trips to Morocco ‚Äî no less DE seven times last year!
But this time, I want to highlight not the hotel as a whole, but the Club Mill√©sime, one DE the major assets of this prestigious establishment.

I would particularly like to salute Madame Nadia, manager of the Club, the true soul DE this elegant place with stunning views of the neighborhood. His kindness, professionalism, attention to detail and dedication DE perfection make every visit to the Club an unforgettable moment, forever remembered as a happy memory.

I would also like to congratulate Mr Youssef DEbagh, Director of Operations and recently appointed Deputy DE Mr Mohammed MBarki, General Manager of the hotel, whom I also greet with respect.
I still do not know Mr Debagh very well, but as supervisor of the Club Mill√©sime, I can only have a very high regard for him. During DE DE last stay, I had the pleasure of meeting him, and I was touched by his kindness and proximity to the guests. I strongly encourage him to continue along this promising path.

Finally, a word for the pastry chef and chef DE cuisine, all DE them named Ebrahim, whom I have not yet had the chance to meet, but whose talent is felt every bite. The exceptional quality DE the cuisine and pastries alone is enough to justify a visit to the Club.

A big congratulations to the whole team, and a thousand apologies to those I have not mentioned but who, through their know-how and dedication, contribute to making Club Mill√©sime a true haven DE relaxation and DE refinement.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review: and Club Exceptional vintage. Many thanks to Mrs Nadia, warm and very professional , always smiling and her service DE high quality

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review title: Club Millesime Excellent experience with Mrs. Nadia Actually this is not the first time
review: Personalized service at the club , I thank Mrs. Nadia the manager DE her service and her sympathy and kindness, very nice welcome DE her

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review: The lounge of the Sofitel Jardin des Roses in Rabat. A peaceful place with a beautiful view of the tranquility DE the capital. Madame Nadia manages this place with friendliness, elegance and professionalism. We feel at home at the Sofitel lounge.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review: Excellent service at the Sofitel lounge. Madame Nadia was, as usual, in the care. A peaceful place managed with elegance, know-how and professionalism.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review:
Lovely club with a warm atmosphere, Great service and perfect spot to unwind after a long day 
Special thank to nadia
I highly recommend.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review title: Very good experience at the vintage club
review:
The vintage club is very nice. The view is superb, the buffet is varied and the manager Mrs. Nadia is very careful.
I recommend

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review title: Pleasant passage to the vintage club
review: A good stay. Nice welcome. At the vintage club we found Mrs. Nadia who warmly welcomed us with a professional service.

We dined at this riad (we stayed at the sister riad ‚Äî Kalaa 2). The food and service were excellent, prices were reasonable, and ‚Äî for those who wish ‚Äî they have wine (Moroccan) and spirits. The salmon with saffron-lemon sauce was perfectly cooked. The selection of b‚Äôstillas was also very enjoyable.

Quirky hotel. Excellent staff. We were in a 2 bedroom apartment across the street. Accommodation was quaint but good. The people of Rabat are very polite, no sense of danger here like some European cities. The food is excellent. I'd strongly recommend both Riad Kalaa and Rabat in general

review title: At the heart of the Medina but in a quiet area
review: At the heart of the Medina but in a quiet, welcoming and elegant area, it offers spacious rooms for 2 or 4. The ones that overlook the inner courtyard are beautiful but risk being a bit noisy. However great value for money, recommended!

We stayed in Riad Kalaa on our first night in Morocco and it was brilliant. Our room was beautiful, every detail was perfect. Lovely bedding and huge fluffy towels. They arranged a taxi from the airport for us and he walked us to the Riad which was great. The staff were friendly and helpful and gave us advice on where to walk to get the best out of the medina.
Breakfast was lovely, fruit, yoghurt, cheese, bread, cake and eggs cooked to order.

review title: Lovely place to stay in Rabat
review: Wonderful hotel with great staff (especially Idahmed Ayoub) and a very comfortable bed and a great breakfast. Really well located in the old section of Rabat within walking distance of the Kasbah and several excellent, well reviewed restaurants.

We arrived with an expectation of a lovely, comfortable place.  We were placed in the sister facility, #2, there was no sign or other indication that a riad was there.  The courtyard is open to the sky, lovely during warmer months.  In December it was cold.  A covering was pulled over, so no sun and no heaters.  Breakfast was in your coat.  Our room was 3 flights up, again not was expected.  Most room descriptions talk about ground level. The furniture was old and extremely firm, no, it was hard.  The room was cold and the only source of heat was at the end of the long room.  It was noisy as it cycled on and off all night.  It takes hours to warm up the room.  I did not take a shower the first night because I was cold, the second night the hot water heater was broken.  Internet in our room was very poor, it is better in the courtyard, but again, chilly.  The room had few, very small windows, so it was dark.  The entire room ran along the alley, so you heard every motorbike, person and cart in the alley.  It did quiet down around midnight. Not sure about the value for the price since it was booked for us by Kensington Travel as part of a package.  Don‚Äôt book based on photos. All the photos and descriptions are of their primary riad, not #2.

I have been to Riad Kalaa many times for dinner as the food is great and the atmosphere, beautiful. But on this visit to Rabat my usual place couldn‚Äôt take us so I decided to stay at Kalaa. What a fabulous place it is. Beautiful rooms and really comfortable beds. A fabulous dinner and an even better breakfast. A special shout out to Zakaria & Hamza. Exceptional young guys who took tremendous care of us. I don‚Äôt think I‚Äôll ever return to my usual riad now I‚Äôve stayed at Kalaa. I stayed in Kalaa 2 in October as Kalaa 1 couldn‚Äôt take us and that is just as good although slightly further into the medina. Highly recommend both.

review title: Riad moved luggage without our permission
review: Terrible review because the Dar Dar Riad staff moved our luggage to Riad Kaala without our permission and when we went for check out the luggage was gone. They thought we were with tour group and we were not. And we were not ready for checkout. They lost some our luggage and now I am getting a run around to find the luggage

The structure itself would also be nice but I made a negative review and confirm my disappointment after the response of the structure on Booking: the suite I booked was described as 32. sqm in size while in the reply I was written that my room was 20 sqm.... if they had written it on Booking I would never have booked this Riad ; it annoys me the lack of clarity and the deserved rating is what I gave and I confirm it I paid the price for a room of 32 sqm and I was assigned one of 20... how to define this thing ? I call it dishonesty

Riad  was very nice   Wanna was very  helpful
Staff very friendly and polite
Room was very clean and provided air conditioning   The room had all the amenities Located conveniently in the Medina  would recommend to others traveling in Rabat 
Breakfast was good

review title: Charm, elegance and kindness in the Medina.
review: Medhi is a charming and cultivated host who has tastefully restored this charming Ryad in the heart of the Medina of Rabat. The rooms (Jasmine for us) have enormous charm and authenticity while offering all the services expected today. The staff is very attentive to the well-being of the residents and its comfort. Delicious Moroccan breakfast. Quiet and close to the Casbah. Very good value for money. I highly recommend!

Riad Zyo is a beautiful gem tucked inside Rabat‚Äôs Medina. Recently renovated, it keeps its traditional charm while offering updated comforts. The three-story layout surrounds a peaceful central pool‚Äîperfect for cooling off on warm days. The rooftop is a lovely spot to relax with tea, read, or catch the sunset. Breakfast is classic Moroccan, fresh and nicely presented. The staff are super friendly and make you feel right at home. For what it offers, I‚Äôd say the price is very fair. It‚Äôs a calm, stylish escape in the heart of the city. I‚Äôd absolutely stay here again!

Riad is amazing, beautiful views and decorations, very nice breakfast, friendly staff and good service
we enjoyed everything right there and since it‚Äôs in the medina quarter of Rabat so it is easier for us to walk around and to see the oudayas Kasbah and enjoy the seaside

review title: Very nice Riad in the middle of Rabat
review:
Beautiful riad, the rooms are incredibly lovingly decorated.
The dinner was fantastic and homemade.
There was wine :-)
Very nice ambience and located right in the city center.
The staff was very nice and spoke English.
There is a roof terrace with great views.
Breakfast was lovingly put together.

New structure, resulting, as we have been told, from the renovation of an old post office with the annexation of an old Riad. The typical atmosphere of the Riads is given by the swimming pool in the central area, the doors and windows of the rooms and some details inside. The rooms are well finished although instead of duplicate light switches (very nice diffused light on the ceiling), we would have preferred more sockets for the now numerous items to be recharged.
The location is perfect, a few steps from an area where you can park and on one of the main streets of the Medina, which allows you to return from dinner in peace and browse through the various shops still open.
The service was efficient even if we missed the classic welcome tea...
Anyway recommended!

review title: Surprise at the end of an alleyway.
review: As we pulled up, parked the car and Mustapha started to remove our luggage, I was completely confused. Where were we going? We walked the small, crowded streets, dragging our luggage (good thing we pack light), down what appeared to be a very old part of town, then to an alleyway. Where were we going? Surprise!!! This lovely little riad is tucked away, with no clue from the outside about the lovely, warm welcoming interior. Couldn't have been happier! Comfortable beds. Delicious breakfast. Excellent service.

Modern structure that has retained some ancient parts.
Clean, with quality sheets and towels.
Friendly and helpful staff.
Breakfast served at the table, good but improveable.
Really a pleasure to stay in this Riad in the center.

review title: Time has stopped here! A haven of peace in the heart of the Medina and a stone's throw from the sea!
review:
Beauty, peace, kindness, flexibility, hospitality of yesteryear.
Our deluxe room a haven, quiet and discreet, comfortable bed and top linen, including bathrobe. Being on the ground floor it remains a bit dark and sometimes passing through, but we had a great time.
There were rowdy groups, which the very kind Mahdi apologized for offering to change rooms but we did not accept, it was certainly not his fault!
Exceptional cleanliness and rich and very good breakfast. In the heart of Medina, a starting point for visiting many beauties on foot and a stone's throw from the magnificent promenade, where you can run for km undisturbed.
Returning in the evening to our nest was one of the best moments of the day!
I forgot beautiful sun terrace overlooking the rooftops! Beautiful! Thank you Mahdi

The most beautiful ryad of our tour in Morocco BUT: very disappointing dinner, heated dishes by their own admission, on the other hand there was none of the cooks present, instead, in the morning for good breakfast. Also in the room did not work heating, making the environment extremely humid. A guy at the reception, however quite grumpy, invited me to use the blankets; however, very cold even in the common areas, in fact all‚Ä¢ wore vests during meals. Considering that it should be a high category ryad,it is not eligible. Convenient location.

Excellent location, very friendly reception, great bedroom and bathroom and finely decorated, with Moroccan motifs, quiet, comfortable and in a part of the Medina of easy access. The riad is small but very welcoming.
Breakfast very full, everything great.

review title: Good location for a night in Rabat.
review: Good location for visiting the Medina and new Rabat, near the Rabat ville station, easily doable on foot with a suitcase, small but comfortable room. Good sweet and savory breakfast, friendly staff. So good for one night. Too bad that our room faced the busy road, better to ask for one on the road to the hotel entrance.
Good location on the main avenue of Rabat. Impressive terrace with music and giant screens to follow the football. Pretty good breakfast and dinner (always missing the pork).

A central hotel, very close to the medina, clean, cozy, with bars nearby for dinner, cheap rates and most importantly, you can shower and sleep peacefully. The best breakfast, it has everything, I repeat, it has everything!!! Recommended 100%100

Nothing to say about the hotel. It's perfect. The staff is very very very pleasant. I advise . At the foot of the Rabat Ville station, the tram is at the foot of the hotel and the airport bus drops off right in front. The neighborhood is very quiet and lively at the same time. It is the ideal hotel for visiting the city

This is a good hotel in the centre of Rabat, five minutes from Rabat Ville train station and the medina. Good-sized and modern room overlooking a mosque and park in a quiet area of the city. The breakfast was average. The only down point to this were that most of the staff are fairly unfriendly and don't acknowledge you even when passing the reception desk. The doorman and cleaner are the only staff who actually have a pleasant demeanour. So apart from the staff, this is a good place to stay.

I highly recommend it as all the staff are friendly and helpful. The room was clean and have a good view on a huge garden. Basic breakfast but delicious. The hotel is near the tramway station and the old market.

The room was clean and spacious and the staff friendly. The hotel is central, it is a 5 minute walk to the Medina. There is a little supermarket next-door, ATM's in the next road and a variety of restaurants.

Although the hotel offers a to purchase coffee service for after hours, there is a lovely coffee shop 3 doors down and they make lovely crepes.

The hotel is located on the nice place near of the the downtown but the room is too small and also the tv , the remote controle doesn't work , the service is too bad , the wifi is too slow , the smells is not good then we changed the room the same things

The hotel was very nice and in a good location. A disadvantage of being in the city centre is the high noise level. The staff at the hotel were great and honest. The only hotel in Morocco that told me about the city tax accurately. One bad thing in the room was the bed; it made noise with every little movement.

review title: One of the better hotels from our Morocco trip
review:
We stayed here for 1 night as part of our tour. We thought the hotel was very nice, it is a newer and the room was very clean and comfortable. We stayed in Room 707 and had a nice view overlooking the streets below us.

It was great to hear the Call to Prayer from the window as the mosque is quite close to the hotel. Bathroom and bed were of satisfactory standard and very clean.

The shower was nice and hot and had good pressure. The hotel is located in a very nice position, close to many shops, coffee places and restaurants.

We had breakfast included in our stay and was nice and had a good variety of choice. The coffee was nice and hot. The breakfast is good and clean looking out on the street.

The WIFI had good reception and the Air Con was good. Would recommend staying here if visiting Rabat.

review title: Work in progress... and total silence on my lost ring
review: I lost my wedding ring several months ago at the hotel, in a very specific place I had indicated. They told me that they could not dismantle certain elements at that time. Today, the hotel is in the middle of construction so they had to have access to the place in question, but no one contacted me. Complete silence. As if nothing had happened. A real lack of consideration for such a symbolic object. Very disappointed.

I had a fantastic stay at this hotel, the location is ideal, the rooms are clean and comfortable, and the staff is friendly and helpful. Great facilities, including an indoors pool and a delicious breakfast buffet. Highly recommend and will return!

Nice hotel and nice room.
Very friendly check in which was also very efficient. 
Room was very nice - great comfy bed, spacious wardrobes and desk space. Bathroom very nice with nice rain and hand held shower options. Seating area also within shower enclosure. 
Bathrobes and towels a plenty. 
Room service very limited options and breakfast was also underwhelming / there is an egg station, hot local food options and cold meat cuts and salads and breads. No real international options available at breakfast. 
Housekeeping very efficient and did a great job. 
Hotel in good location for food options available around. Nice bar on 14th floor. 
Would have been five stars if a better breakfast/room service options.

review title: Disappointing experience at The View Rabat hotel
review: My stay at The View Hotel was disappointing. My wedding ring fell under the slats at the bar, creating a stressful problem. Despite my repeated calls and contact with Yliass, a manager, no concrete action has been taken. The situation remains unresolved, leaving a negative impression on customer service and problem handling.

My stay at this hotel exceeded all my expectations. Not only were the facilities impeccable, but the staff were also extremely attentive and helpful. I felt like a special guest from start to finish. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an exceptional travel experience."

The View hotel exceeded my expectations in every aspect . The service was impeccable , the staff was friendly and attentive , and the breathtaking scenery truly lived up to its name . A remarkable experience that I would highly recommend it !

Very nice hotel. Welcome at the meeting. Quality bedding. Spacious room. Standard decoration without frills. A little cold though. Excellent breakfast buffet. Very caring staff.
Ideal for professional stay.

Great hotel in Hay Rid new district of Rabat City
An incredible view of the roofs of Rabat!! The terrace is very nice, the restaurant too
Crazy lives
Delicious cocktails
A great welcome
Do not miss
The whole neighborhood is nice
A must see

I totally enjoyed my staying this amazing place.

Pros:
- located in a very nice area, near all the cafes and walkable streets.
- Friendly and supportive staff specially Moad and Waleed, thanks.
- Nice rooftop.
- Room is well organized and decorated.

CONS:
Nothing

review title: Poor service due to untrained staff
review: Tactless staff, borderline mean, disgusted with my stressful stay because of nonchalant staff, dirty carpets, have antihistamines with you! I won't set foot there again...

L‚ÄôAlcazar was the perfect place to stay during our first trip to Morocco. Stepping in off the busy street at the edge of the medina you step into a calm and quiet oasis when you enter the road. The courtyard is beautiful, with many places to sit. Our two rooms we‚Äôre comfortable and quiet - perhaps best hotel bed ever! The rooftop pool was a lovely place to cool-off in the afternoon. Location is great - easy to grab a taxi and many places within walking distance. Perhaps the best part was the staff. George and Mustafa made us feel welcome and cared for. Five stars aren‚Äôt enough!

Staff were lovely. Our Room for 3 was split into 2 rooms connected by a spiral staircase,which was no good if you slept upstairs and neede the bathroom in the night..Decor was very dated and westernised  80's.Bit depressing tbh.Breakfast was very basic.we werent offered eggs.Staff work hard.Wouldnt use again.

review title: Beautiful and convenient place to stay in Rabat
review:
This is a beautiful and convenient place to stay in Rabat. The entrance is right by the street so our tour guide dropped us off directly in front of the riad and we didn‚Äôt have to walk a long way. Our tour guide preordered beef tajine with prunes for dinner before we arrived, and it was the best tajine we have had so far in Morocco. We also had Moroccan Za'alook Salad
which was very flavorful and we scooped it up with the homemade bread. George served us dinner and spoke English well. Our room had a sitting area with a couch and the bathroom on the lower floor. The bed was up a flight of stairs, but there was no railing on the outside, so I was a bit nervous about waking in the middle of the night (thus the reason for the 4 rating). We left the bathroom light on to light our way in case we woke up. The bed was comfortable and we had a good nights sleep. Breakfast was filling - we had omelettes with yogurt and fruit and Moroccan pancakes.

review title: A "wanna-be" hotel, FAR from 5* and From ANIMAL WELL-BEING
review: Hotel standard for a 5* hotel, but it is far from this. Welcome and kindness are very good, rooms are nice, very cosy living rooms, but hairdrier was not working and was not changed, minibar is poor, swimming pool was closed as far as terrace was not working. No bar service at all, lunch not in the activities as far as restaurant for dinner. No a la carte men√π. Not a 5* without restaurant and bar. I may close an eye on not having a spa or swimmingpool...but at least a bar should always be available. Last but most relevant, hotel declares to be in the mood of nature, so they keep a couple of little parrots in a cage in the livingroom, so tiny they cannot even fly. I asked if  parrots may fly free at least once a day and reply was NO: "they poo and wee around...but we love animals! Tourists like them". I strongly doubt turisti select the hotel for parrocchiale and will not have a better esperienze from that during the stay ( a working bar should have a better effect). The ehole world is going in the opposite directory in banning zoos, in letting animals free and living as their nature is. THIS IS SUSTAINABLE, ETHICAL AND COMPLIANT, WHILE HAVING PARROTS DISPLAIED IN PUBLIC IN A CAGE IS ABOMINOUS, OLD FASHIONED AND CRUEL. THEY ARE IN JAIL AND HAVE DONE NORHING BUT BEING THEMSELVES: SINGING. This makes my esperience here quite poor and I hope these 2 parrots to be left free as Soon as possibile. THIS IS NOT NATURAL FRIENDLY, THIS IS FAR FROM MODERN CULTURE AND BY DEFINITION TO BLAME.

If you have a passion for interior design, I highly recommend this hidden gem‚Äîa classy, sophisticated beauty located in the medina of Rabat. The suite overlooking Rabat, the rooftop pool, and the rooftop terrace with both sea and city views add an extra special touch to this riad‚Äînot to mention the super kind and incredibly lovely staff. I appreciated the heating during my winter stay. It couldn‚Äôt have been better! Thank you so much, George and Mustafah, for making my stay unforgettable.

Good ryad, very pretty, in the rooms the bed is above the bathroom, despite the gain of space, I did not like, bed a little uncomfortable, piece room with shower because some only have a bathtub. Good breakfast served on a beautiful terrace, next to the market entrance.

One of the most beautiful, clean, charming and comfortable accommodations we have stayed in. Amazing breakfasts, Friendly and Pro staff, unbeatable location and huge and beautifully designed rooms. And it has a pool! It's been a little paradise for me and my family. The kids didn't want to get out of there.

We picked this place without doing much research because we were only staying one night in Rabat, and we feel like we stumbled upon a true gem. The entrance is a bit hidden but the host was waiting outside to greet us (and it‚Äôs still more accessible than the Riads that you can only access on foot - our taxi dropped us off right outside). The decor is stunning - every square inch of the place is adorned with Moroccan details. Host made us tea while he checked us in, and they surprised us with a room upgrade. The room was beautiful. Breakfast was luxurious - the courses just kept coming. Everything was delicious. We‚Äôre staying at a different (more expensive and more ‚Äúluxurious‚Äù) Riad in Tangier now, and it doesn‚Äôt compare to L‚ÄôAlcazar. My only suggestion would be to ask the host to show you the rooftop terrace and pool when you arrive - we didn‚Äôt discover it until right before we checked out. But even when we came back for our suitcases after we had already checked out, they offered us more tea and asked if we wanted to use the pool. Very hospitable staff, and their pride in the place is apparent. Location is great, too - walking distance to the Kasbah and the Andalusian Gardens. We loved our stay here and would highly recommend.

This is a lovely Riad and they go out of their way to help you with your visit and they are extremely accommodating to your requests.  Staff is very attentive and it is a beautiful setting. I highly recommend it!

review title: Beautiful riad next to the Rabat medina
review: We stayed two nights in this riad and loved it. The design and decorations are magnificently done, with pleasant light pastel colors and an airy feel, but still keeping the charm of the over 100 year old property. Right when we walked in, we were stunned by the gorgeous mosaic at the front entrance. The rooms have high ceilings and were well-appointed, and the terrace of the riad is stunning as well, with a wonderful view over Rabat town and medina. Breakfast wasn't included (we thought the added cost was a bit high), but it didn't matter because there were some wonderful stalls and shops on the boulevard nearby. Right next to the medina, and short walk to the Andalusian gardens, the kasbah, and the ocean. Wi-Fi was excellent too, and there is a small elevator that stops on the floors as well as the lower terrace. Staff were most accommodating and helpful too. Overall an excellent experience and would recommend this for a few nights in Rabat.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review:
After three stays at the Sofitel Jardin des Roses in Rabat, I can only recommend this hotel. At every visit, the welcome has always been exceptional, and the quality of service impeccable. Special thanks to Mrs Hasna, Customer Relations Manager, for her kindness and professionalism which made our stay even more enjoyable.

I would also like to thank Mrs. Nadia of Club Mill√©sime for her exceptional service and constant attention, creating a privileged experience. This hotel remains for us the perfect place whenever we visit Rabat.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review: I love the Sofitel Rabat, particularly the Club Millesmeme. The manager, Nadia is especially kind, welcoming and helpful!

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review:
I am a loyal customer of Sofitel DE Rabat, where I regularly stay during my many business trips to Morocco ‚Äî no less DE seven times last year!
But this time, I want to highlight not the hotel as a whole, but the Club Mill√©sime, one DE the major assets of this prestigious establishment.

I would particularly like to salute Madame Nadia, manager of the Club, the true soul DE this elegant place with stunning views of the neighborhood. His kindness, professionalism, attention to detail and dedication DE perfection make every visit to the Club an unforgettable moment, forever remembered as a happy memory.

I would also like to congratulate Mr Youssef DEbagh, Director of Operations and recently appointed Deputy DE Mr Mohammed MBarki, General Manager of the hotel, whom I also greet with respect.
I still do not know Mr Debagh very well, but as supervisor of the Club Mill√©sime, I can only have a very high regard for him. During DE DE last stay, I had the pleasure of meeting him, and I was touched by his kindness and proximity to the guests. I strongly encourage him to continue along this promising path.

Finally, a word for the pastry chef and chef DE cuisine, all DE them named Ebrahim, whom I have not yet had the chance to meet, but whose talent is felt every bite. The exceptional quality DE the cuisine and pastries alone is enough to justify a visit to the Club.

A big congratulations to the whole team, and a thousand apologies to those I have not mentioned but who, through their know-how and dedication, contribute to making Club Mill√©sime a true haven DE relaxation and DE refinement.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review: and Club Exceptional vintage. Many thanks to Mrs Nadia, warm and very professional , always smiling and her service DE high quality

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review title: Club Millesime Excellent experience with Mrs. Nadia Actually this is not the first time
review: Personalized service at the club , I thank Mrs. Nadia the manager DE her service and her sympathy and kindness, very nice welcome DE her

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review: The lounge of the Sofitel Jardin des Roses in Rabat. A peaceful place with a beautiful view of the tranquility DE the capital. Madame Nadia manages this place with friendliness, elegance and professionalism. We feel at home at the Sofitel lounge.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review: Excellent service at the Sofitel lounge. Madame Nadia was, as usual, in the care. A peaceful place managed with elegance, know-how and professionalism.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review:
Lovely club with a warm atmosphere, Great service and perfect spot to unwind after a long day 
Special thank to nadia
I highly recommend.

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review title: Very good experience at the vintage club
review:
The vintage club is very nice. The view is superb, the buffet is varied and the manager Mrs. Nadia is very careful.
I recommend

place name: Hotel Sofitel Rabat Jardin des Roses
review title: Pleasant passage to the vintage club
review: A good stay. Nice welcome. At the vintage club we found Mrs. Nadia who warmly welcomed us with a professional service.
Thank you Mr younes meljoum and Mme zohra I loved. My experience the ambiance is good  the staff were super  friendly and courteous to suggest a few dishes ans drinks super fresh and totally worth it

Genuinely the right place for the right meal , clean rapid and tasty . Personally i was the delighted with the customer service.
I would like to mention some names soufian , Amine, and the manager Zouhra , guys thank you for providing a lovely atmosphere .

Thank you to the whole team especially younes meljoum for the professional service your warm welcome and quality of service. And the others.
I had a wonderful time at your place. Looking forward DE coming back soon!
What a night at the Golden Fish! Thank you Salah for this beautiful outing, your sense of sharing and your kindness as always

Huge thanks to Salah for such a great evening at Golden Fish. The food was absolutely delicious, fresh, well-cooked, and full of flavor. It‚Äôs always a pleasure discovering spots like this. Can‚Äôt wait to come back!

A big thank you to Salah for the lovely time at the Golden Fish restaurant. The fish was fresh, flavorful, and perfectly cooked. The atmosphere was great, and everything came together to make it a truly enjoyable moment. Definitely a place to remember!

review title: Golden fish Rabat a pure treat
review: A real treat!every bite was a pleasure very good cuisine we feel everything is homemade excellent value for money perfect service thank you the kitchen team and Zohra for the welcome

Professional and warm team always listening to customers the staff was able to advise us perfectly on the fish of the day very welcome friendly atmosphere thanks to a dynamic team especially Zohra and younes

review title: Merci Younes et Zohra pour le service!
review: The dishes were delicious and well presented, tasty cuisine fresh produce no complaints smiling staff, and professional thank you Zohra and othmane

I thank Mrs Zohra for the welcome and service üëèüèªA beautiful setting with a splendid view of the pool, ideal for relaxing and enjoying a delicious fresh fish. The dishes are generous and perfectly prepared, the flavors of the sea are honored. The service is attentive and the atmosphere very pleasant, especially at noon I highly recommend for a sunny lunch by the pool

The perfect place for a family meal.
I had a great time at Le Golden Fish restaurant in Rabat on Wednesday, July 16. The dishes were delicious and the menu offered a nice variety. We were warmly welcomed by the waiters Younes, Omar and Zohra, who knew how to advise us with professionalism and kindness. The place is beautiful, quiet and very nice. I highly recommend this restaurant for a meal with family or friends!
I have lunch at the must-have restaurant in rabat golden fish top food I thank Mrs. zohra and her team for the welcome and service

Excellent food and service nothing wrong!!!
Special mention to Younes, Zohra and Omar who pampered us throughout the meal. Thanks to them for their sense of service their smile .....
A tip take the octopus a pure delight!!

I loved the restaurant the service was great, warm welcome. There is a beautiful view of the pool, 
Thank you Mrs. Zohra, Younes and Joud.
I highly recommend this restaurant

We had an unforgettable evening at Golden Fish in Sofitel. From the moment we walked in, the ambiance was serene and elegant, perfectly setting the tone for a refined seafood experience. The staff were warm, welcoming, and attentive without being overbearing ‚Äî a true mark of hospitality excellence.

The seafood was remarkably fresh, and each dish was presented like a work of art. The grilled sea bass was a standout, perfectly cooked with delicate seasoning that let the quality of the fish shine. The lobster thermidor and the seafood platter were also beautifully prepared and full of flavor. Even the side dishes and sauces were thoughtfully crafted to complement the main courses.

What made the experience even more special was the peaceful atmosphere by the water, adding a layer of charm and relaxation to the meal. Whether you‚Äôre a seafood lover or just looking for an elegant dining experience in a beautiful setting, Golden Fish is a must-visit.

Highly recommended ‚Äî we‚Äôll definitely be returning.

review title: A Fiasco Dinner for a Group of Great International Leaders
a restaurant, exemplary and professional staff
Simoply the best Moroccan restaurant in Rabat
Great food, cocktails and friendly staff
Delicious lunch on the terrace at Yana‚Äôs in Rabat
Fabulous place, shady terrace, delicious food. Went twice in the same day.

review: The food and service were absolutely amazing from start to finish. The starters were fresh, flavorful, and set the tone perfectly for the rest of the meal. Both the fish and meat dishes were cooked to perfection. The fish was tender and delicate, while the meat was rich, juicy, and full of flavor. Each plate was beautifully presented and seasoned just right. The staff were warm, attentive, and made the entire experience feel effortless and enjoyable. Highly recommend for a memorable meal.
Rich food, taste, service, all exceptional, we were lucky to have the restaurant just for us and it was wonderful
Compliments to the chef and staff for a delicious dinner and service on New Year‚Äôs Eve. Cheers to more successful years ahead.
Incredible food , it  was divine from starters to mains to dessert. Staff was very friendly and attentive. Would surely return very  soon. Well done to chef patron and all the team.

Tried for the first night in Rabat and immediately booked for the next day too! Fantastic dinners, excellent quality of raw materials, great care in preparation and presentation, originality of dishes (venison carpaccio with beetroot sauce and spicy Zola ) and amazing desserts (sticky toffee pudding: a paradise!). Very friendly and professional staff. Recommended for couples given the intimate size and the few covered

An excellent fine dining experience.
Service by the delightful Italian waitress was superb, and she knew the small but interesting menu intimately.  We plumped for the fish special which was a whole filleted sea bass shared between two of us with oven roast vegetables and triple cooked chips.  It was ll divine.  While waiting for our main course, we were served a freshly baked focaccia loaf with a spiced cannelloni bean dip and the best olive oil.  All was a delight.
Their wine list is massive - you can see the cellar through a large glass floor panel at the two tables near the window - but much of it was priced way more than our taste palette warranted (up to EUR700 a bottle).  We plumped for a EUR32 bottle of local Gozo white which was really good and complemented our fish dish.  (The lovely waitress tried very hard to soak off the label for us - my wife has collected bottle labels for years - but fell foul of the modern use of petrochemical glue which makes them impervious to hot water.  Thanks for trying, though!).
Would I visit again?  Yes I would,

review title: Great place to eat delicious food and socialise.
review: It's a great relaxing place to eat and socialise. My wife and I went to Townhouse No 3 following reviews and it was a very happy find! Unfortunately, I did not catch the name of the very friendly and most helpful lady that served us. She made as feel at home with a warm welcome and suggested dishes and pairing wines that we enjoyed a lot. We had the local fish lampuki tartar and a rack of lamb (for two). Everything was delicious! I highly recommend this restaurant!

Interesting venue in many ways.  Food was excellent and the staff was accomodating. Very bijou and not many seats.  Enjoyed sitting outside but was on an ordinary side road and at times felt we were in the middle of the road as people walked past.

review title: Memorable, exceptional food and service and a a real Gem. You will not be disappointed!
review:
Came across this restaurant by pure chance after a book launch in Rabat. We were welcomed with a big smile but the surprise was the manner in which the Italian waitress  went our of her way to explain the cooking behind the dishes and to vary where possible our requests as one of the party could only eat gluten free dishes. 
WE had Maccheroni (pasta) with pork cheeks, an outstanding dish full of flavour and I could easily have eaten a second plate. The cerviche was also outstanding as was the risotto with fresh red local prawns. This was followed by Creme brulee with ginger ice cream, made to perfection., all washed down with a bottle of Gavi.
Finding these gems in Malta is becoming increasingly difficult but this one was memorable. I will be returning as vthere were other dishes I wanted to try.

Our second night in Rabat and we wanted some fine dining. We weren't disappointed with Townhouse No 3.  We had tuna and octopus.  Both good but for me the tuna won.  The rack of lamb (for two) was tasty, juicy and perfectly cooked. Fine dining can sometimes mean small but not at No. 3. The portions were big enough without being too big.  We passed on desert but I'm sure it would have been delicious.

review title: Maltese cuisine in the heart of Rabat
review: Great dinner in a secluded alley in the center of Rabat. Nice restaurant with outdoor tables on a nice alley where practically no cars pass. Very fresh and well prepared fish. They also make meat dishes that we haven't tasted. Owner and Maltese cook really nice and affable. Nice Silvia and also good at advising us on the menu. Price appropriate to the quality of the products.

review title: Lives up to its excellent reputation
review: I had been meaning to give this place a try for long. I have only ever heard great things about it. Chef Malcolm has a great background, and his experience shows in the fantastic flavours and presentation of his dishes. High end food but the restaurant is very friendly and welcoming. I have booked my second visit as I long to be back.

review title: A little gem in the heart of old Malta
review:
We have been coming to Malta for 24 years and this is is the first time we have come across this restaurant in the centre of Rabat old town.
The food, wine and service is the best we have come across in all that time - we simply cannot praise the chef & staff enough. They are professional, passionate and knowledgeable about their menus - no question goes unanswered & they can make recommendations without trying to get you to order the most expensive things on the menu. 
Please try this restaurant if you get chance - you will not be disappointed

A truly special place, fantastic cuisine and refined environment. We enjoyed it so much that during our stay in Rabat we had dinner here on two consecutive evenings. 
Everything is delicious, from the bigilla to the ceviche, from the sea bass to the lamb, not to mention their cinnamon ice cream. 
The service, then, is impeccable. We were guided in our choices in an ultra-professional way and we had a wonderful experience.

Our quite exceptional dinner here was the best meal of our 10-day Maltese holiday, a trip characterised by consistently high-quality dining. The menu is wide-ranging, the international wine list exceptional. Both the chef and waitress are clearly committed to providing a gourmet experience and diners are most unlikely to be disappointed. It was lovely to be able to speak to them at length. We wish them every success and hope to return! Recommended without hesitation.
Shabby quality service. Experience very disappointing dishes infects fried too oily fish too hard!! Exorbitant prices avoid at all costs. Restaurant ideal for wasting time money and health.

Bad experience.
We ordered a sangria.
She only had the name.
Starter: goat salad. It was hot goat in a brick leaf.
Taste and flavor very limited.
Flat: holy stone net. He was a freak.
Not bad,but not what was planned 
Squid, enough rubber.
In short we are not going back
Good restaurant, very nice setting the kitchen I highly recommend it All service was excellent thank you.

review title: Restaurant Nice, located in the heart of Rabat, offers a fantastic dining experience with authentic Moroccan flavors.
review: Restaurant Nice, located in the heart of Rabat, offers a fantastic dining experience with authentic Moroccan flavors. The atmosphere is lively, capturing the vibrant essence of the city,

Very helpful and professional person. 
Good quality price. 
Two of us ate , a mixed fry and a chicken and fish paella class. It was all good. 
We will gladly return.

Ordered Paella food was cold not fresh and service slow  very disappointing had been recommended by friend as a spot for good seafood also fairly expensive for the quality of the food had better experience at the Medina

review title: Good Italian dining in a nice location
review:
Great dinner. We had fresh barbequed fish to share which was one of the best dishes we ate in Morocco. Highly recommend this. For the kids they made a simple pasta without sauce. They also have a good dessert selection (including dessert trolley)

A bit confusing with the Italian and Spanish part (separate entrances) but we were in the Italian part. We asked for fried Calamares which were not on the (Italian) menu but they did serve it (as it apparently is on the Spanish menu). 

Service was good, nice view. Both are big restaurants. They serve alcohol. Ample parking. Tramstop nearby.

Ugly lunch
The restaurant was half empty and we were left waiting 45 minutes between the starter and the main course.
In the end we were served a rubber monkfish that had just been cooked without thawing. 
Totally inedible.

Mediocre dish barely eatable so saturated with oil....even after expressing my doubt about its quality, I was told "dish conforming", so dinner rather light fact! see the photo for an opinion.
Duty off, I had to get up twice.

review title: An inferior quality than usual Lean and cold fry Undercooked gratin too liquid Raw octopus Decline while
review:
Inferior than usual quality
Lean and cold fry 
Too liquid undercooked gratin
Raw octopus
Disappointed when the quality is usually better

The food and service are excellent, the staff are courteous and professional, our server Ouadia was great in recommending the best dishes and best appetizers. 
Our business lunch was delicious and productive.

Enjoyable dinner on the Italian side of the restaurant- note the is actually two restaurants (Italian and Spanish) with same name and pretty much in same building. Good & very friendly service and recommendations from the staff - especially proposed local white wine was spot on. Large variety in menu, medium/large size of portions, good tastes in nice balance. If you‚Äôre looking for easy going dinner but with some level of higher quality, can recommend.
Tested two dishes - grilled gambas and risotto. The gamas (shrimp) were the best we had in Morocco and the risotto was amazing. Very friendly and helpful staff. We'll be back

Always pleasant to go there for a meal and especially in the evening to admire the panorama of bouregrag and Rabat with its lights.
Dinner was good except the shaved chicken with Catalan sauce that sucked! So to avoid

review title: A beautiful place for good food.
review:
Nice place. Beautiful view of the Hassan Tower and Bouregreg. Warm welcome. Friendly team.
Fine cuisine.
The Award is not given... but we get value for our money!
I recommend

I would like to express my great disappointment regarding the welcome I received at the Ibis Hotel in Meknes. Two reception staff were particularly unpleasant, with a cold, unwelcoming or even disrespectful attitude. A minimum of professionalism and courtesy is expected, especially at the reception, which is the first image of the hotel.
Lack of consideration for guests is unacceptable, and it clearly damages the property‚Äôs reputation.
I sincerely regret this experience and hope that management will be challenged to improve the quality of service.

review title: No air conditioning ... with 30¬∞ in the rooms, but it is normal...
review:
No air conditioning, and the staff really think we‚Äôre idiots... not even a bottle of water, or at least an apology... the only answer is that we can open the window... so either you don‚Äôt sleep because of the heat, or you don‚Äôt sleep because of the road noise... shabby... and shame on the manager of this hotel...
FYI, the Air Conditioning is well mentioned on the hotel features

We spent 4 very pleasant days in this hotel where we stayed with family on the occasion of a wedding. since our previous stay 3 years ago, the decoration of the rooms has been renovated and it is appreciated. The bedding has apparently been changed as well.
The staff is friendly (reception, room maintenance). The breakfasts are quite satisfying. Iron and hairdryer on request. For tea addicts, the possibility of heating water in the room with a kettle would be a little extra.

Very good hotel close to the Medina. Very comfortable room and excellent breakfast buffet. I also recommend the hotel restaurant for dinner.
It has a swimming pool and is a very relaxing space to have a drink after a day of walking.
I absolutely recommend visiting Volubilis.

review title: Refused our stay, newly married couple
review:
Me and Moroccan partner got married on 21st September 2024. We went to a few different hotels after our wedding to enjoy our honeymoon and relax. When coming back to meknes where his family stay so we could spend time with them we decided to try book the ibis as its central and close to them. We had stayed here in May earlier this year so knew it was nice and relaxing.
When arriving the girl on reception told us we could not stay, both wearing our wedding rings having photos of proof, having my certificate of impediment from the uk to show the date of marriage both me and my partners names date of birth address etc was still not enough, she asked why his passport was not the same as mine, I responded saying he does not have visa yet which is why they are different, she asked for marriage certificate I replied everything was with solicitor for visa. I then asked to speak with a manager or supervisor she said there was nobody there. Her attitude and the way she treated me and my husband was a disgrace. I will never ever return back to this hotel. We stayed at many after our wedding and was never refused or questioned. I‚Äôm disgusted that during our honeymoon period we were refused and turned away from this international hotel. I sent a complaint and 3 days later still no response which is bad customer service, this should have been responded to within 48hours

I spent 2 nights at IBIS MEKNES , 30 and 31 August. I had a great stay: cleanliness, warm welcome, quality of service really a Pension to recommend
Especially with location in the center of the city.
I'll come back.

review title: Satisfactory stay at all levels of service: affordable rates, respectful and responsive staff, cleanliness
review:
I spent 2 nights at IBIS MEKNES , July 30 and 31.
I had an excellent stay: cleanliness, warm welcome , impeccable quality of service and communication: reception , catering, bar , HK.
I recommend IBIS MEKNES for the behavioral quality of the very respectful staff and very affordable rates.

Hotel with accor prestige standard and high standard service I recommended it for my daughter for exam
She really liked the stay well done you were able to build loyalty with the whole family
Good location good dairy
Impeccable service
Recommended hotel for businessmen

A best hotel where I had a good time everything is of good quality from the reception the quality of the personal rooms too nice a varied buffet breakfast, after my stay I recommend that you try ibis Meknes in addition to its location

I give it five stars and recommend it to everyone for a restful night's sleep. very good stay with excellent service and warm welcome, the room was spacious and well decorated.. the cuisine is very delicious and varied.. thank you

review title: Beautiful view of the old town from the pool
review: This beautiful hotel offers spacious rooms with comfortable beds and free Wi-Fi. Also the outdoor area is very well maintained and from the pool you have a beautiful view of the old town of Meknes. The food in the restaurant is very good and I recommend the hotel gladly.

A hotel with a great location.
Nice view of the city, the rooms are spacious there is a balcony and the possibility to swim.
Dinner was fine, alcohol was even served.
The breakfast was good, the rooms neat and the beds fine.

It is a very nice hotel, very well located near the city center of Meknes. The staff is helpful! With a beautiful view. I did not test the rooms, just the restaurant and the pool. I usually go there and highly recommend

review title: Hotel with character ideally placed to visit Meknes
review: Seeing dire reviews of some of the 3-4 star hotels in Meknes, I initially booked the Ibis half way between the station and the old city but changed my booking to the Transatlantique as it had lovely gardens and pool in the photos.   I stayed one night and the price was only slightly more than the Ibis.  I am letting the photos speak for themselves as the hotel doesn't seem to have any recent reviews.  If you want character, space and nostalgia this is the place.  Ok, if you go down on all fours and check skirting boards you will find holes and marks but the hotel was built with quality furnishings and fittings which have lasted well.  The bedroom I had was in the newer wing and termed superior.  Classic rooms are smaller but perfectly adequate.  Breakfast was very tired and unmemorable.  Dinner was much better.  There aren't a lot of shops or places to eat in the area around the hotel but I walked down the hill to the old town in 30 mins.  Taxis are very cheap.  I hired a taxi through the hotel to take me to Volubilis and on to Fez.  One of the most interesting places I chose to stay during my tour of Morocco.

review title: Nice hotel after a busy day
review: A pleasant hotel, not in the center of Mekn√®s, but nice and quiet. Slightly old-fashioned rooms, beautiful swimming pool and terrace, decorated in local style. Friendly staff, good breakfast. Good base to get to know Mekn√®s.

Charming, classy hotel. Very welcoming staff. Comfortable rooms. very beautiful gardens and very beautiful view of the Medina. Only downside, average restaurant and breakfast. Too bad in a country offering such gastronomy‚Ä¶..::

Slept here 1 night while traveling. Old hotel, which I think was a top hotel in the good years with 2 swimming pools and nice outdoor seating areas. Now it is a far-reaching glory, because outside it doesn't really look like much anymore. Maintenance remains an issue in Morocco. The room was not bad (but very cold). The dining room is authentically decorated, but the chairs really need to be replaced (you just can't fit through them). Staff friendly, breakfast buffet not excessive but ok.

Although one can see that the place is past its glorious days, that‚Äòs exactly the charme of it. Staff was very friendly, food in the restaurant good and service at the table a remembrance of days gone by. Location somewhat far from the centre, but the garden makes it a nice location to stay. We liked it!

Disappointment, the photos no longer reflect reality at all. This hotel is aging, shabby, sad, not very clean.
The carpets in the restaurant room are very, very dirty and have a multitude of stains (see photo) just like the yellow armchairs.
In our dated room there was no chair in front of the desk to put our things on.
An armchair with more than faded colors. Faded carpets, a bathroom with moldy grout and limescale on the windows.
Empty tissue box (not replaced despite our request) 1 single mini bottle of
shower gel for 2, no bottles of water in the room when we arrived (they are chargeable).
Insulation non-existent, we were cold and enjoyed the music (from the nightclub?) until after midnight.
Meal of the same level!
Establishment to avoid

The help from the staff was faultless, and the interior was an opulence of tiling. The room was adequate although some bath salts would have been welcome. The biggest disappointment was the meal. The fillet of bass was poorly cooked and tasteless. The garlic sauce had no piquancy and was also tasteless. The small amount of vegetables were overcooked. Breakfast was a similar disappointment. M'semn, boiled eggs and small croissant. I've eaten in petrol stations and auberge all over Morocco and this was the worst meal if been given. Everybody gives you water with your food, except here. Walk into town to eat. Cheaper and much better cooked meals are available.

It was the first time we tested a Riad, and I have to say that the experience was just wonderful! The owner is extremely friendly and welcoming, which immediately set a nice atmosphere. The rooms are beautiful, tastefully decorated, and every detail of the Riad exudes charm and authenticity.

I'm not the type to leave comments, but this time I make an exception, because this stay was really worth it. Special mention for breakfast: a real favorite! Variety, hearty, tasty... I loved this moment every morning.

If I had to mention one small area for improvement, it would be access by car. The Riad is located a little inside the medina, which makes parking a little complicated. We had to walk a little bit on foot, but once arrived, it was well worth the visit.

I will return without hesitation!

Very bad experience we had at the riad Hiba, the rooms are uncomfortable and the bathrooms are in poor quality. 
Bed linen smelled bad.
Good location and easy to get to. 
Nice terrace but very poor service from the staff.

Very good stay. It is a quiet, quiet and beautiful place. A real Riad. Great breakfast. Abundant and very rich. The bathroom super clean. 
The room was great. And the lady who wears it a woman charm. Thank you for such a pleasant stay.

Wonderful.
The woman who attends is super friendly, lovely.
The rooms looked like a palace, spacious, clean, very good decoration. Very well taken care of everything in general.
The spectacular terrace, good views, with plants, sunlight,... 
Free WiFi and air conditioning are available.
Breakfast at 9am super rich.

Exceptional welcome, kind staff and beautiful Riad. We ended up in Mekn√®s on a very rainy day, they offered us delicious tea on the terrace of the Riad. The breakfast was nothing short of heavenly, I highly recommend it!!!

review title: Sublime Riad in the heart of the medina‚Ä¶
review:
A Riad where time stands still...
The rooms are beautifully arranged around the central square and on the upper floors.
The woodwork is sculpted, the plasterwork looks like fine lace, the lamps are very beautiful with their colored glasses, on the terrace side, a sheltered corner and a panoramic terrace from which you can see the peaks of Ifrane.

Very easy to access, 3 minutes from Place Ladim, once breakfast is served (coffee, tea, citrus juice, eggs and Moroccan pancakes) you will be ready to explore the medina and its many mausoleum monuments. mosques, museums where Art reigns supreme!

I loved the atmosphere of this place steeped in history and recommended it with my eyes closed‚Ä¶

The owner sometimes listens to Jacques Brel, when the sun has already set...

The staff speaks French, English, Italian.

Discreet and attentive, this place invites calm and commands respect.

Partygoers or drinkers refrain, that's not the style of the house or of Meknes in general.

At Riad Hiba, you will be completely disorientated, to try it is to adopt it!

review title: An extraordinary Riad to visit Meknes
review:
This riad has been restored respecting the Art of the 18th CENTURY, plasterwork, carved woodwork, painted ceilings, period doors and locks as in the time of its first owner Minister Ben Amar...
In this place steeped in history we are very well received and even pampered, I would even say spoiled:
For example, on the first day I was invited to change rooms and the owner himself put me in the royal room.
Royal is not just the name.
The furniture, hangings and draperies take you back to the centuries when everything was sumptuous, discreet, a suite in the dark with colored glass lanterns, splendid.
Yes the room is dark but it is exactly in this setting and this atmosphere that stays in the riads should be experienced for an authentic experience and for the light there are two floors of terraces where you can relax and sunbathe and breakfast because here in the middle of February it is cool at night and 28 degrees already during the day: all the rooms are designed to keep cool.
As for the service, it's perfectly simple and tasteful, you can choose what you prefer for breakfast, either eggs or pancakes or both, and all accompanied by coffee or tea and citrus juice.
Water is very very very precious here in Morocco, it flows generously in the bathrooms of this Riad but avoiding too long showers is a little personal advice to preserve the water reserves of the Kingdom and of Meknes in particular and around the corner. from the street there is a magnificent hammam open from Thursday to Sunday.
Lose yourself in the mazes of this medina which dates from the Renaissance and let yourself be guided by merchants and artisans of all kinds, it's just fabulous here we still weave silk in small workshops, Riad Hiba is in the heart of the medina 2 minutes walk from the Imperial City, Ladim Square, 5 minutes by blue taxi from the new town.
The museum at the end of Place Ladim is a must.
To stay local I advise you to try the succulent pastries, lots of small sellers make them in the medina, you will also find spices, olives, sun-drenched fruits...along the street markets (souks).
To fully enjoy what the medina of Meknes has to offer, 4 nights at Riad d‚ÄôHiba are recommended.
An unforgettable royal stay and the great kindness of the owner and devoted Ouda and Gyslaine will be wonderful memories.

Very elegant and refined riad, in Andalusian style very rich in details. Large rooms and en-suite bathrooms. Everything very clean. Excellent breakfast included, partly intercontinental and partly typical Moroccan. Kind and friendly owners. Possibility to leave luggage after checkout

review title: Great last minute spot in a very good location
review:
Made a last minute trip to Meknes last week and tried to make a booking on AirBnB for a riad but due to the owners not responding to our messages we found ourselves having to
Search the streets for a place to stay and we found RIAD HIBA. So glad we did. The staff were very helpful and friendly. We got a large room near the terrace for 400dh a night including breakfast. Breakfast didn‚Äôt have a massive selection but I was still very happy with everything else. The place was impeccably clean and the location was perfect being just minutes away from everything we needed. I would definitely stay again and would highly recommend it to anyone visiting Meknes.

Great and very friendly Riad- like one thousand and one nights. 
We stayed in Riad Hiba for two nights and we absolutely recommend this place:
The rooms are very beautiful, the staff very helpful and the location perfect for a stay in Meknes. You will feel like home.

review title: Pleasant hotel despite some menu flaws
review: Hotel correct for the price. Small rooms. Bathroom from another age. But clean and comfortable bedding. Catering (dinner and breakfast) quite indigent.

review title: Complaint concerning the receptionist‚Äôs behaviour and the state of hygiene
review:
I would like to write to you to express my deep dissatisfaction with my recent stay at your establishment, the Hotel Dalia.

First of all, I would like to point out the unacceptable behaviour of the receptionist who welcomed us. His attitude was haughty and imbued with a misplaced ego, which made our arrival very unpleasant. The lack of courtesy and professionalism on his part in no way reflects the image that one should expect of a hotel of your standing.

Furthermore, I would also like to bring to your attention the lamentable state of the swimming pool and the changing rooms. The pool water was visibly dirty, and the changing rooms were in a deplorable state, both in terms of cleanliness and hygiene. A foul smell prevailed there, making access very difficult, if not unbearable.

Please take the necessary steps to ensure that this kind of inconvenience does not recur, for me as for other customers. I remain waiting for a return from you and, if necessary, a commercial gesture commensurate with the inconveniences suffered.

Nice hotel, cozy (room and lobby), garden with pool. Large room with table, 2 armchairs, fridge, floor tiled, just one free outlet. Room is in very good condition and clean. Mattress very hard, bathroom big with bathtub, a bit old but clean. Large balcony. Internet extremely slow to easy to use.
Dinner (buffet for groups): well prepared but nothing special
Breakfast: Disappointing: a kind of sausage, no cheese. Jam, cornflakes, bread, coffee, tea, one type of juice

review title: Ideally located on the road to imperial cities
review: Spacious rooms, balcony, quality bedding. Clean. Great outdoors. Endorsement staff. Garden and swimming pool with children's pool. Easy access from the motorway interchange. Ideal for a stay during the circuit of imperial cities.

Incredible stay in a hotel where everything is thought for comfort. Ultra spacious room, soft bed as a cloud, breakfast on top. Special mention for the party room: wow, what a decor!
Service to small care from start to finish. A real crush! #I'll be back

The hotel is very well located. 
The rooms are large and clean.
The staff is very kind and do everything to help. 
Breakfast is good with fresh juices and Moroccan specialties. 
The pool is large and very well maintained.

Comfortable hotel: Very attentive and very helpful staff. spacious room, bright and well equipped.  Beautiful exterior with very nice pool. Hearty breakfast.  I recommend for pleasant stays with friends or family.

Super friendly hotel the setting is magical and beautiful very friendly staff and the rooms are very nice ideal setting for a family stay with a pool l hotel has rooms but also suites in an idyllic setting

This hotel offers a very pleasant experience. The decoration is refined and the garden, perfectly maintained, invites relaxation. The pool is an added asset. The staff is distinguished by their availability, friendliness and professionalism. Breakfast offers a varied and hearty buffet that will satisfy all palates. The rooms are impeccable and offer all the necessary comforts. An establishment we highly recommend.

Very well placed for who want easy access. 
Warm and pleasant welcome. 
The rooms are spacious and the bedding is good quality. 
The bar is out of time and restful. 
The reception room is whaou!
Parking is safe and large

The riad is very characteristic, indeed is situated inside Meknes Medina.
The owner is very polite and his wife make a special breakfast included in the tax and if you want she could make also a traditional dinner. 
The house has and old style but is very clean and has an amazing terrace were we saw the sunrise and sunset. 
we had a real Moroccan experience there, we felt like part of their family !
Absolutely recommend

review title: Beautiful rooms and super nice flavors during dinner
review:
Didn't sleep, but viewed the carefully decorated rooms and got to know the extremely friendly owners. We ate there on the advice of our guide and experienced super authentic flavors. You won't get them any better in Meknes.
And beautiful art shop in their road. The place you should definitely stay if you have little time and want to enjoy a peaceful sleep, beautiful views, local art treasures and super food with delicious flavors.

Abdel was very nice and welcomed us very friendly with a welcoming maroccan tea & useful information.
We had a room for 3 people and it was perfect! The room was big, had an AC and a nice clean bathroom.
The breakfast was very good.
The riad was very nice decorated & we felt comfortable to chill out there. 
Abdel and his family were so friendly, we would defenitely come again!

We booked a room via Booking, but we've got another room than was shown in the picture. The room was in the middle of the lobby, so we heard everyone come in and out of the riad. There were no curtains so the lights of the lobby were shining bright at our bed. Our toilet was right near a table where people would have breakfast. That's just weird. 

When we arrived, the owner wanted to 'show' us some family work. We, new in Morocco, interested and above all naive, were brought to some kind of special room. An hour later we were in kind of a price discussion. It was ‚Ç¨750 against 'we don't want to buy anything'. He almost forced us to write down another amount but we just stood up and left. Crazy situation. 

And if you're offered to eat with the family, prepare yourself to pay MAD 125 pp. Oh, and you don't eat with the family at all. The food was really nice, but also felt like a trick. 

Wouldn't go back here.

It was a nice place i enjoyed staying there , it was really clean , 

i was well welcomed by the manager in the riad reception its seems to be a very nice person , i will for sure visited next time with my daughters they will love it especially with that lovely view of the city and terrasse i realy enjoyed it
