We have stayed in several hotels throughout Morocco, this is the first one where we were made to feel unwelcome, a hindrance. The hotel is clean and well kept, in a decent location for the medina - although taxi cabs do not know how to find it. However, the staff are surly. I don't believe they want guests.... unless those guests buy the rugs or jewellery 'shown' as an 'exhibition' Guests are given the hard sell - and the tone becomes less friendly when the wallet is kept shut. The children are noisy and can be heard even from the top floor as they run through the house. We were 'invited' to dine as family with the family, but served separately and ignored by the family - and then charged 125  Dirham each for a meal that would have cost maybe 50 Dirham elsewhere. Our stay was miserable and we were made to feel uncomfortable. Staying with family? Perhaps - as unwanted relatives they had to tolerate, and treated poorly. We would not recommend this, even if there were nowhere else to stay. We would not return.

As the town of Meknes is relatively small and few tourists visit this place, there were not a great of options to choose from for accommodation. This riad is on the edge of the medina, which was convenient. However, it does not offer free parking, albeit hotel.com stated it has, and parking was 10 dirhams. The price of this riad was cheaper compared to the other ones I stayed in Morocco and it proved to have a difference. The room was smaller than the other riads and the basin was integrated into the shower area, which could be quite wet and troubling after a shower. Considering the options in Meknes, this place can be said to be very economical indeed.

Nice place very Moroccan, good staff, nice food (not Hotel made).

Being on the bottom floor also comes with noise of all the people moving around the dining area which is just outside your room, you don't feel a lot of privacy. Beds were as hard as they can be.

review title: all of us felt ripped off
review:
Firstly I have to say, I am a backpacker who would normally stay at cheaper style places. I accept this may be a factor in my feeling about this place. ( as someone used to far lower prices in Morocco.

We were taken to the Riad, by a man in from the Medina, with out first choice being full. We felt relieved and admired the beauty of the building, drinking the mint tea given to us. We were shown a room for the 5 of us, for 850 dirhams. Which seemed alot of us, but we agreed for the one night, we also accepted a home cooked meal later.

From then it changed. We were taken to a small hole in the wall restaurant in the Medina, where we had a basic but good meal with two nice ladies serving us. We were all shocked when a bill of 550 dirhams was given to us, far higher than any of us ever paid in the country.

We then were taken to the owner's rug show, where is somewhat agressively sold one of my fellow travellers a carpet. He then tried to take us to 'cooperative', which we all turned down. We were now worried about the meal we had ordered at the riad. Again it was good, but we were charged 120 dihrams each. 

Maybe this is what normals riads, cost but for a group of backpackers these prices seemed crazy. Also in all the hostels i stayed in before and after in Morrocco, the owner never tried to sell me anything, or take me to their shops or friends shops.

I should say that the riad, is well located, clean and quite beautiful with a nice room and terrace. It was a more a problem with the owners.

We announced are unhappiness with the final bill and 100 dirhams or so was taken of our bill. But we all left feeling really unhappy and cheated. Never once did i feel this in the other 5-6 places I stayed in Morocco.

The house is hard to find, specially because in hostelbookers.com the location is pointed wrong on the map. We crossed the whole medina at 21:00...Friendly people, but yes...they try to sell you anything. The room is nice, the view from the terrace very nice. The main reason to visit Meknes is the square at night (fun) and the Roman town of Volubilis, witch is beautiful and well preserved.

review title: A stone's throw from the Medina
Nice place close to the old city
Spectacular riad, but the dinner bill was a little too high.

review: The food itself was fine. The meatballs are very tasty. The couscous ok. We had to wait an hour for it. The domestic as always described is nice, but less so if this means crying babies and loud talking parents. We've had better nights.

We had a late lunch for two, the service wasn't fast as it's cooked largely from scratch but well worth the wait.  This was one of the tastiest meals we had in 3 weeks in Morocco and great value.  Not fancy, just good homecooked food.

We had an excellent lunch at this traditional restaurant.
The service was very kind, and the portions were more than generous at a fair price.
Highly recommended!

In this restaurant I ate the best couscous with chicken tfaya of the holiday! Abundant portion.
The restaurant is family-run, the owner's mother cooks. Service a bit slow but worth the wait!
We also had a veal tajine with plum and almonds (but it was nothing big) and the portion a bit ‚Äòpoor so I recommend the couscous.

The Zaalouk with bread is delectable! The vegetable and chicken couscous with tfaya was done to perfection. The whole experience with the mother of the son (waiter) doing the cooking, and the granddaughter being a little cutie made the experience e all the more wholesome.

Down a small alley and the door is closed. Trip advisor sign on the door. Knock or push open and welcomed by the family. Dining room is bottom floor of family home. Menu is unchanged for years and possibly the best tagine we had in the country. Salads are nice and fresh. Everything oozes homemade family dinner. Highly recommended.

Stopped in at this place off the main square. Door was closed (has a trip advisor sticker on it from 2022) but as per the other reviews, I knocked on the door and waited. A lady answered after about one minute despite the guy in the kiosk opposite telling me it was closed. Had a mountain of cous cous with chicken and veg (80dh) which was really tasty - good value. Would defo go again.

Often the best discoveries happened by chance. I came across this restaurant for lunch and, although it was clearly late, the owner with a smile made me realize that he would be available to reopen the kitchen. The wait, which punctuates the lives of many Moroccans, is a guarantee that the dishes are freshly prepared, exactly as he warned me. The chicken pastilla was simply sublime, and could very well fit into the menu of some starred restaurant where I have been lucky enough to eat over the years. In retrospect, having traveled almost 2000km around Morocco, I can say that it was the best dish tasted during my stay. Even the tagine was superb. If you plan to reach Meknes, the stop is a must.

review title: Delicious food at a good price
review: Very good Moroccan food. We ordered Harira and a vegetable tajini both delicious things. Great service. Good price.

On the gloomy floor of a private house, the setting is rather informal but the dishes are tasty. Excellent harira soup and meatball tajine with egg. We spent 220Dh (about 22 euros) for two soups and two tajines and a bottle of water. Recommended.
Would you like a light meal on a terrace overlooking Place el Hedim and its bustle? A simple place frequented by locals too? A cheap place but where will they welcome you cordially? You found him!

Small restaurant in small alley.
Delicious Friday couscous! Delighted with our visit.
Very nice waiter.  Thank you.

Typical Moroccan cuisine, excellent and freshly prepared dishes, all served in a ‚Äúhome‚Äù living room, the owners and the kitchen are located upstairs. If the door is closed just knock, we were made to have lunch even being Friday, despite the Medina was all closed. Highly recommended!!!

You have to dare to knock on the door ;-) 

(Maybe I was a little early for dinner)

But I was welcomed all the more warmly, everything was freshly prepared and very delicious and everyone was very friendly and caring.
Home cooking, express and genuine. Pretty cheap. Excellent value for money. We stayed out of hours and they cooked on the spot. Extremely positive experience.
Never go except if you want to get sick. Dish infects deplorable service. Money is their only keyword at the expense of a minimum of quality.

review title: Bad experience in Meknes, catch tourists
review:
We arrived here because only place open on an Aid day. Very expensive for quality and quantity, 100 dh for a small pastilla, and 90 dh for a dry olive chicken tagine, with 3 olives ... 
On the way up, we were brought some juice for the tagine and fries.
A place catches tourists fleeing. The most disappointing meal of our stay in Morocco.

My wife chose a chicken hamburger that was very dry. I chose a big burger while was very nice and tasty. The chips were lovely and crisp.
Very nice outlook from the terrace.

The restaurant offers only 2 menus which forces you to take 3 courses and pay accordingly. What's on the plate is mediocre. And this for the 4 different dishes we took.
The terrace is nice despite any view and smells of horse carriages waiting in the square just below

Catch a tourist. The friendly Boss is waiting for you at the entrance. Nice terrace certainly, but overpriced compared to other restaurants that also offer a beautiful viewpoint at a more reasonable price.
The food is not terrible at all.
Moreover, under the guise of taking you in sympathy and wanting to make you discover exceptional know-how, he will take you to the shops supposedly cooperatives supporting women, to sell you carpets, tablecloths... at a gold price, which you will find for 4 times cheaper in the souk.
In short, especially pass your way.
Fortunately, this character is not representative of the local population, which is generally much more caring.

Excellent, reasonable price, top view and service. Simple, hearty and well cooked. I don't have much else to say, but it takes a minimum of character to validate my opinion. We live in a world of chatter when a few clear and concise words are enough to say the essential.

Without praise or infamy.
Place recommended only for the terrace. Hearty dishes but with little flavor.
Courteous waiters and a bit slow service although everything is already ready.
I don't think I'll go back there again and advise.
We had a little break in this restaurant. With a tagine of lambs that was super good and generous a real treat. Warm welcome thank you. Avignon that greets you
Warm welcome, very nice setting, excellent tagines, reasonable price. Ideal for recharging close to exceptional sites.

Very large restaurant where many tourists are driven. The restaurant has a large terrace.

The vegetable tagine was so lala, the tagine with mutton was quite ok

Very warm and attentive welcome , excellent couscous, beautiful rooms and decoration.
Very nice terrace too but it rained5 unfortunately
Definitely I recommend Salma Rest as the foods was delicious, service was excellent from Hassan and his team. I will come back when I am in Meknes. Thank you for making my birthday so special!!!!
Shame, very bad. Don't. There are so many wonderful little places to discover to eat good Moroccan cuisine that you absolutely must flee this big catch tourist

Restaurant with a nice terrace that offers a very nice view of Meknes
Typical and hearty dish! 
Nice frame!

Super good! Hassan welcomed us very well. I highly recommend. The couscous and soup were excellent.
Thank you.

Riad well located in the center with ample parking on the front where the bikes were kept. Spacious and clean rooms with a great breakfast. On the terrace a solarium and a swimming pool to bathe in the strong sun.
Recommended.

This is a friendly and welcoming riad in the heart of Meknes. It was very quiet and comfortable, and convenient to many of the historic sites ‚Äî literally around the corner from the famous Bab Mansour, and a few minutes walk into the medina. The staff ‚Äî Asmae, Nordine, Layla, and Mohamed ‚Äî made our visit so very special.
Excellent address in Meknes. Good value for money. Tajines and exquisite couscous. 1 step from the medina. Service very good.

review title: A stone's throw from the Medina
review: Riad a few steps from the Medina but in a very quiet area where you can relax. Terrace with swimming pool, a bit small, large rooms with very large and comfortable bed. Good breakfast, friendly and friendly staff. Great prices for hammam

We had the distinct pleasure of being exceptionally welcomed by the two young ladies, with Amel standing out in particular. Her kindness is unparalleled, her general knowledge is impressive, and her flawless English adds tremendous value to this guesthouse. Amel's presence truly elevates the experience, making it a standout destination for any traveler.
I highly recommend 
Thank you
We only slept one night. Excellent property located in the center. Helpful staff and good cleaning. Typical high-quality dinner.

Riad with very good services
Impeccable and very warm service
We felt at home
Small rooftop pool area and incredible view

This road was perfectly adequate for a night in Meknes. Room was clean, though small. Our specific room did not have a full wall between the bedroom and bathroom which was a bit surprising to Westerners. If you are doing anything other than peeing, be aware there is simply a half glass swinging door between you and your roommate and the bed. Breakfast was included and was satisfactory. Not many restaurants nearby so be prepared to walk. Staff was friendly and helpful. Worked well for one night in Meknes.

Staying in the sister house a few steps away, we tried the very good cuisine. Very good reception, beautiful and delicious dishes, perfectly correct and warm service. Magnificent and typical setting. In short, an address close to a well-guarded parking lot

review title: Nice place close to the old city
review:
Great authenic Riad, but be Award thar not all rooms have a  to the outsider, a lot of the room just open up to the courtyard. And it Can be difficult to find, because of small  sign outside. We ha a great stay, and a room with a Windows to the outside. We also had dinner which was great, we choksejr the chicken tangoen with lemonade and olives..
It is very close to the old city. Nice staff who also helped with the luggage, and ther are no lifts, but a lot of stairs

review title: Spectacular riad, but the dinner bill was a little too high.
review:
We arrived at the riad the morning immediately following the earthquake that hit the High Atlas and Marrakech, and despite the obvious and very justifiable shock we were welcomed with the usual care and attention, which was not at all a given. In fact, we even started talking about what happened with a girl at the reception, who was also very kind, who made us sit down and offered us some tea. At check out, however, they were so helpful that they served us breakfast early, so as not to make us leave with a hungry stomach.
The structure is beautiful and the rooftop swimming pool completes its exceptional nature. Rooms with very refined furnishings, at times the overlap of styles and materials is almost redundant, but that's okay.
However, I cannot give 5 stars because of the dinner: served to us on the beautiful terrace, overlooking the city walls and the tree-lined square, but it proved to be very, very expensive, both in relation to the average Moroccan prices but perhaps also, for the type of ingredients and quantities, to European ones.
However, it is an absolutely top accommodation.
Riad very well located with an extraordinary welcome. Very warm, cheerful and friendly. Thank you again for your attention.

Very friendly and comfortable little Riad. We had dinner at this Riad but the local dishes really did not live up to the reputation of Moroccan gastronomy. The couscous was not good and the owner of the place did not appreciate my remark. Maybe we should have dined in town??!!
We stayed for one night and enjoyed breakfast.  The rooms were comfortable, small, but styled well.  The staff were friendly and welcoming.  The location worked well for a one night stay.

This is just an average 3-stars hotel. Yes the lobby has a nice morrocan feeling but the riad as a whole is a bit rundown. Not that much space in the room, very noisy (you will hear every single step from your neighbors in other rooms). They do not accept credit cards for payment

A beautiful recommendation from the team at Riad D'Or. This was a perfect restaurant to satisfy our appetites along with enjoying fine local wines, at very affordable prices.

The restaurant is a warm atmosphere with a very lovely and welcoming staff.

The food was a delight, they also do excellent value set menus for only 149 Dirham. We enjoyed a great starter of soup followed by Entrocote Beef which were both delicious, we couldn't help ourselves but to try the desserts and we're thankful we did. The Apple Pie was the best ever, think of apples surrounded by crepes, you can't go wrong!

There is also a lounge club downstairs open late, should you wish to have an after dinner drink and enjoy the music they have on offer.

Thank you for having us and we hope to be able to join you again one day soon.

Very good value. Food was tasty (I recommend the shrimp avocado salad). The view is super nice on Zerhoun region. Service was suprisingly kind and courteous for a restaurant of this standing. Lastly, I went to Bodega downstairs after dinner, super crowd, young and pleasant. 
All in all, undoubtedly the best place in Meknes and its region.

review title: 2nd top spot in Meknes for dinner
review:
One of the places you can go in Meknes for dinner. Very nice location uphill so you can see the old town from the table. 

We took the beef steak with local Morocco wine and that was just perfectly cooked and enough to feel good. 

At the ground floor there is a bar with drinks and big screens for sport events.

i went to the bar downstairs, it's fun friendly staff, great music love the vibe. I also went to the restaurant area at night, really was romantic, live music, really nice they sang spanish, english and french. loved it good prices for the drinks
we were in Meknes and we had our lunc in this frensh Restaurants food and services were very good, Thanks a lot
It is a wonderful restuarant with delicious food and service. The price is reasonable. I particularly enjoy the dish, steak with cheese choice.
This is a lovely, western style French restaurant.  Food was very good, prices were reasonable, and service was highly attentive.  It is not a tourist restaurant.

After so many Couscous and Tajines, in Meknes, a delicious surprise.
The real french food, very good service, unforgetable Phillipe.
Don¬¥t miss this experience while in Marocco.

Very good French food - fresh, tasty and well-presented. The service is usually spot-on. It does tend to fill later at night with boisterous groups of men, but go earlier and you will have an excellent experience.

review title: THE place to eat great food in Meknes
review: Having grown up in Meknes then moved to Europe, I know only too well how hard it is to find a decent place to eat out in the city, let alone a spot that serves tasty creative cuisine. Well, Relais de Paris does all that and it does it pretty well. I went there on a cold late october day, for lunch with husband and mum, having read positive opinions on Trip Adv. We were warmly greeted and shown to our table by Philippe, the manager. We chose from the blackboard the "suggestions du chef" rather than from the menu and we did well! Food was fantastic. We still remember the yummy goat cheese "aumoniere" and the delicious magret de canard served with "fruits caram√©lis√©s". What is also great about this place is that they use local products. Definitely worth a trip next time you happen to be in Meknes. We, for sure, will happily pay another visit!
everything about this place was a ten! the chef/owner is warm and friendly as is the rest of the staff - one of he best french meals we've EVER had.

review title: Authentic Riad at a Great Price
review: This is a good option for the price in Meknes.  It is very well situated, close to the medina and the main square.  The breakfast was good and even the coffee was decent.  The central courtyard is pretty.  I didn't love my single room -  it was quite dark and the bedspread was of poor quality.  The bathroom was sparse.

I stayed here for the fifth time in this beautiful riad I was very pleased with every visit , the rooms are very clean the staff also very friendly and very helpful the Mademoiselle Amina at the reception is particularly nice and very friendly the breakfast is typical Moroccan with various jams , honey, Moroccan crepes tea √† la menthe so that call tea with fresh mint and of course a glass with freshly squeezed oranges 
I advise anyone who comes to The City of Meknes to visit this dreamlike beautiful riad. Thanks for all the staff for your effort and great work. Keep it up and see you next time.
Abdelilah

review title: Excellent family option in the heart of Meknes
review:
We stayed at the Riad Ritaj during our family trip through Morocco, with two children aged 6 and 9, and it was quite a success. They have spacious and comfortable family rooms, perfect for lounging after a day of exploring.

The location is ideal: attached to the main square and a step from the medina. Very practical if you are traveling with children.

The riad is nice, cozy and charming. The staff is very friendly and hospitable. We loved how we were greeted with tea and pasta, a gesture that became a moment of calm and welcome.

And the breakfast... amazing: hearty, varied and with local products. A luxury to start the day like this.

Our room overlooked the street access to the medina, so there was some noise at night. If you are very sensitive to sound, you may notice. But we... fell asleep like a street babe from Meknes!

Definitely an excellent base to discover Meknes as a family. Highly recommended!

Since we arrived they were very kind to us and offered us mint tea to welcome us.
The Riad is very beautiful, the staff very warm and hospitable, large rooms and very clean.
It is located a few meters from the main square

Majestic Riad a stone's throw from the main square and in the heart of Medina.
The main room is majestic and well maintained. Furnishing in typical Moroccan style.
The rooms are spread over 2 floors.
I didn't like the room. Very gloomy decor.
No space to put your bags.
Bathroom on the edge of the acceptable.
Present only soaps, no other facilities. There is also no shower mat. Clear limescale marks on the taps.
Sockets coming off the walls. 
They could use a lot of maintenance.
Good enough breakfast.
Overall I can say that I would not stay there again.

Riad of great charm with fine furnishings. The welcome was great and our room was large and very comfortable. Excellent breakfast with fresh products and excellent quality. I would highly recommend this Riad for a stay in Meknes

This hotel is located in the heart of Meknes but within walking distance of a convenient car park. The location is privileged because the souks are just below but from the terrace you can also see the door and the main square. 
Rooms gathered around the central courtyard are furnished in Berber style with manicured furniture. The lobby, the central courtyard, is spectacular. 
The bathroom is simple but there is everything you need. From better courtesy equipment (there are only shampoo and shower bags, really a bit too minimal) 
Staff who speak very good English and very kind. They upgraded us to a suite since they had room. 
Typical breakfast, excellent and plentiful with fresh and freshly prepared products. 
Attention there is no lift. 
Unbeatable value for money (paid 43 euros for bed and breakfast).

Charming riad with beautifully decorated and comfortable rooms. Nice amenities. Gorgeous typical riad courtyard. Stunning and authentically decorated throughout.  Wonderful breakfast. Great terrace. Good service. Great location. Would highly recommend.

We stayed in this beautiful Riad for just one night. The location is strategic and the furnishings typical. But I have to make a note on the breakfast: the coffee was really too weak and the honey wasn't real honey!! It's a shame to get lost in these details, because the Riad is worth it and the lady at the reception is also very kind.

Like all Riads inside the Medina, seen from the outside nothing exceptional... but when you open the door you are left speechless by the beauty and sumptuousness of this splendid Riad in Meknes. A sumptuous hall with a fountain in the center overlooked by three floors of rooms. From the terrace, one of the highest in the area, you can admire the entire medina. Breath-taking view. Particular praise goes to Soufien, the receptionist who really amazed us with his kindness and helpfulness.
Truly unforgettable riad!

Reasonable size menu of Moroccan food.
You order starter, main and dessert fixed price.
Good service and the food comes on reasonable time (we were a group of 12 and mains were pretty much together).
The soup was very tasty and the salad was good.
The main Tagines are fairly oily and very hot (the oil was boiling).
The orange in cinnamon was better than the pastries which were quite dry.

We had dinner and breakfast here as we stayed in this riad. The dinner served consist of traditional Moroccan food. The food was average. The Vegetable couscous and the Harira was rather bland. the dessert was interesting as they serve you orange sliced in rings with cinnamon powder. Never had this interesting combination before. 
For breakfast, we were served coffee instead of the traditional mint tea. We had a spread of pancakes, baguette, flaky breads. Good average breakfast. But service is superb as the staff are all very friendly, polite and pleasant. Overage pretty ok experience

We stayed at the Riad so had dinner here. The service was prompt and respectful and the food was traditional and plentiful. Absolutely love the gorgeous surroundings.
Breakfast is also served here  as part of the room rate and was also very good.
Can't go wrong

review title: Beautiful restaurant with good Moroccan cuisine
review: We had dinner as part of a group activity.  We had a fixed price menu and were given a generous discount.  The room was beautiful and the tagines were well prepared.  We really appreciated the fact that while they did not offer alcohol we were allowed to bring in wine which they opened for us!
The place is great and the food is also delicious I recommend this wonderful and beautiful place i thank the amazing team for everything
Great food and very friendly atmosphere! Omar in particular was very helpful showing us around and giving us directions.

review title: Easy to find and pleasant environment
review: We ate here on a second visit to Meknes recently. I ate Chicken brochettes which were well seasoned and hot. THe Moroccan Salad was 5 small dishes of very different tastes. I do not think the place has a liquor licence.

A superior restaurant just off the Place El Hedim and much better quality food than the restaurant overlooking the Place (although to be fair, that one has good views).  Good service and a rare opportunity to have wine with the meal, set in a sumptuous riad.
Great food for a reasonable price. No complaints. The riad is beautiful and there is good wifi connection. Food was very fresh.
Not only is the accommodation brilliant but so is the food.... Exceptional. Please do yourself a favour and come and stay here and enjoy the food

review title: Fantastic food in a stunning setting!
review: We enjoyed some amazing traditional Moroccan dishes at Restaurant Ritaj. The service was friendly and attentive, leaving no wishes unfulfilled. Besides the gorgeous restaurant on the ground floor, make sure to check out the roof terrace for an amazing sunset over the city of Meknes!

Right off the Lahdim square and in front of Bab mansour is a great restaurant tucked away in the riad ritaj. Just eating in the beautiful architecture alone is worth the trip. This is an elegant dining option in Meknes and had lovely food and treats to taste. Services is impeccable and they are very accommodating. Must try if you are in Meknes.

My first experience of a traditional moroccan food in an amazing atmosphere. Staff were very helpful and friendly. The beautiful courtyard with the fountain was amazing. Delicious tangine , amazing tastes. Waiter was very attentive

Hint: ask the staff if you can not do spicey and you will be surprised

review title: Gorgeous traditional courtyard serving Moroccan food
review: Service is friendly but unobtrusive, and the ambience is fabulous-- beautiful courtyard with fountain, and musical entertainment. We had very good kebabs, and tangine.

Not only the food is aithentical Moroccan, also the interior of the restaurant and the hotel in which it is situated. The quality of the dishes are average, but what makes it good is the nice atmosphere, because of the beautiful interior architecture.

Hotel / riad very well located at the entrance of the medina, very close to the lively part of the city, the archaeological museum and L'Ensanche de T√©touan (architectural ensemble of the old Spanish style), very quiet hotel, magnificent suite "Aicha", staff at the top

We came to receive the new year and could not have chosen better, we had a very comfortable stay in a double suite as of the time ü•∞ we moved in time and enjoyed, it is an oasis of tranquility, it does not seem that we were in the same Medina, we enjoyed having a delicious good herbal tea at all times, in good company and pleasant talk ü§ó

A very exciting trip and to start this Riyadh was a success.
It brings together everything, beautiful, place, human team and above all warmth. Maribel and her excellent staff.
That ‚Äúhidden‚Äù patio where you have wonderful breakfast and dinner. A little paradise and always with the rumor of the source. Small room (ours) enough to rest after the corresponding kick. 
Upstairs a white roof full of light where you enjoy the peace and views. Everything is taste and details. 
RECOMMENDATION

Really good value we paid ¬£67 for a senior suite on the top floor lovely room spotless old world RIAD charm, lovely breakfast and puddings after dinner. The views from roof top are good we didn‚Äôt have the best weather but the courtyard was atmospheric. Great staff friendly and helpful.

We ate there because recommended on the internet and we are more than disappointed with the restaurant. The only positive is fruit juices. The rest, High Awards for a menu similar to all street restaurants that can be found! A bland starter surprise tomato (unripe tomato) fish of the day Cooked Archi and the burger (the worst we have eaten so far) clearly to flee.

Well located. Very clean, comfortable and very cool. 
Good food.
Very good service, both restaurant and reception. The owner (Maribel) very involved and pending everything. Helped us organize excursions, transfers, reservations, etc.

The food was very good, from the entrances to dessert. The main dish, cow tajine with plums and tamars was a delight, very well cooked. The staff was extraordinary, tremendously friendly and the price-quality ratio very good.

Riad too loud at all hours unfortunately. The rooms are not well insulated so you can even hear the ringing of the phone at the reception and the bell for entry into the riad.
Every time you walk down the guest staircase you hear a noise as if the bedroom door is open.
Accessibility to the riad is very complicated and if you are driven it is catastrophic (no parking).
The price of my night is far too expensive considering the services.
In conclusion I advise against

What a fabulous mini break, and the Riad was just perfect for our needs. The staff were very friendly and so helpful speaking several different languages. The Riad itself was extremely clean and in a fabulous location, just inside the ancient Medina, and only minutes away from the royal palace. Our rooms were bright and airy, with comfortable beds, beautiful laundered cotton sheets, fluffy towels and powerful showers. 
Make your way up to the roof terrace in the evening, to see the rooftops and a cooling breeze, perfect after a days sight seeing, or just to enjoy a mint tea after your meal.

The Riad is in a good location to visit Tetuan on foot, which is however very small. Our room was a standard room and while being quite comfortable it was very small with a queen bed and just space to put your feet down between the bed and the walls on either side. The staff is friendly.

We found a magnificent hotel, comfortable and very well located to visit the city center and its Medina, covered parking in the hotel itself, breakfast, all at a good price. Special mention to their workers who treated us as if they knew us forever. If I returned to Tetouan, I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again

This hotel is perfectly located in the center of the beautiful city of Tetouan, making it an excellent base for exploring the area. The staff are exceptionally friendly and welcoming, adding a personal touch to the stay. The restaurant offers enjoyable meals, and the rooms, while modest, are clean and equipped with all the essentials for a comfortable and pleasant visit.

review title: Basic hotel almost in the center of Tetouan
review:
I stayed with a friend at Hotel Athens to visit Tetouan for two days. The location is almost perfect, adjoining the center and relatively close to the medina and other places of interest, in a few minutes you got everywhere.

The rooms were not bad, although they were not very spacious fulfilled their function, as well as the bathroom. In general we rested well except that in the early mornings we were awakened by the sound of the mosque calling worshippers to pray.

The breakfast has nothing special, there is little variety and also served us, like the rest of guests, a couple of glasses with industrial juice that we did not want and that we had not ordered (this would be a detail to improve).

Another detail that we did not like at all was that a couple of hours before Check-out we decided to go for a last walk around the hotel, and as we left the receptionist (tall, brunette and wearing glasses) caught our attention pointing to the watch on his wrist, that we did not throw off and that we had to be prepared because the room had to leave at the stipulated time. We knew this perfectly well and had plenty of time to leave a while before the rush hour, we replied that we considered it and not to worry, and the truth is that we had no problem in the end but that gesture seemed unnecessary and somehow harassing.

They should improve that kind of detail a bit if they want to remain a 3-star hotel or even go up to 4.

The hotel is very well located in the ‚Äúnew‚Äù town of Tatouan. The staff are excellent- helpful and friendly. The rooms are basic but very adequate. No fault to them. Quibbles include the fact that the hotel does not have a bar in the accepted sense of that word. It does not serve alcohol of any description. The ‚Äúmini bar‚Äù in each room is , in fact, a very of and totally empty fridge. It is not even plugged in.
The breakfast is included in the price if the room. You would certainly have plenty to eat and would never leave while still feeling hungry. However, as we stated several nights there we learned the breakfast never changes. It is precisely the same every morning. After 4 nights it has become very boring.
The hotel - especially Mohammed in reception- organised an English speaking guide at a reasonable cost. The guide was very friendly and informative.
I would recommend the hotel without hesitation but don‚Äôt expect it to be like a European hotel.

review title: A receptionist wanted to scam us
review: We stayed at the hotel for 7 days. A reception employee, we are not sure if he is a reception manager or an employee, deceived us on several occasions. Every time we asked him for information about a place and ordered a taxi, he called someone he trusted and raised the price when a taxi on the street was much lower... he tricked us into keeping the money. This boy is short, thin and dark, I don't know his name because he didn't have an identification plate on his shirt. He has very few social skills with the client. Sometimes he spoke to us with little respect and with a lot of arrogance. He yelled at his own teammates and did not treat them well. Never in my life have I encountered a front-of-house receptionist with so little education and social skills. The other receptionists were lovely. Always with a smile and willing to help. In general, the other hotel employees were very friendly except for this man, who wanted to make a killing by deceiving the client and filling his pocket.

review title: A lovely place to stay-clean,friendly and welcoming
review: I spent 5 nights at this lovely hotel last December-2022.I can recommend it very highly.The hotel is in a central location within walking distance of many of the sights.The room I was given was large and very clean and serviced daily.I want to mention the staff who really made my stay a memorable one-Hamza,Mohammed and Nisterine,and in the dining room Abila and Mohammed.The food here was excellent and breakfast each morning really prepared me for the day ahead.The staff were what really made my stay so enjoyable as they were always available to offer help and advice.Thanks to Mohammed for his help with my luggage on the morning I was leaving and for finding me a taxi to the bus station....This place is excellent and I am happy to give it 10 out of 10.

This hotel is right in Central Tetouan, convenient to shopping and it's not expensive. The rooms are small but clean; they have Wifi and the staff are helpful and nice. It offers a good breakfast with your room. The dining room also serves dinner - there are restaurants nearby but a good many of them appear to cater only to men (some have upstairs seating) - so that was a good solution for me. I had actually rented out near the beach and found it too isolated and I had no Wifi, so coming into town made more sense. But if your purpose is mainly the beach then, you can drive from here or take taxis.

review title: OK hotel, small rooms, inexperienced staff
review: This place is right in the centre of Tetouan. It offers parking and easy access to all the main attractions. Rooms are a bit pokey but fairly clean. Staff require training and language skills are low. Breakfast is ok but nothing to write home about

Very nice hotel, it's located at the middle of Tetouan city. This is the big plus. You can leave your car at the private parking and visit the city by walking. The rooms are clean, it's a good 3 stars hotel.

A very new hotel, very clean. The service was kind and attentive. Good wifi all over. The bathrooms are very nice and have hot showers. TVs and refrigerators in the rooms. A little loud but centrally located. This is definitely not the place to stay if you're looking for a really Moroccan experience.

I spent 3 nights in this hotel, a good location by the DE la mer, good quality meals, DE medium quality rooms and also the hotel spaces are not well maintained.
Very welcoming staff

review title: Unable to sleep, nightclub in the Inn, AVOID!!
review: Worst Pension in the North! Don‚Äôt go, there‚Äôs a nightclub just above the rooms that puts on music every night until 5am. We didn‚Äôt sleep any of the nights. When we complained, the staff was useless and came out as an excuse that it was normal in the summer. These rooms shouldn't even be for sale at this Award.  In addition, the property is very dirty, there are always non-guests who accost women at night inside the Inn. The Pension is filled with screaming children by the pool (who also need cleaning). For example, a poorly educated child urinated on the poolside floor in front of us without parental reactions. DON'T LOSE YOUR MONEY

Discusting hotel. Reviews are fake.
Bunch of dishonest owners.
Stay away. You wont be able to sleep due to mosquitos and loud music. Food is mediocre and overpriced.Rooms are dirty. Towels are old and uncleaned. They will overcharge your credit cardinal.

Even though we booked a premium room we realised at 11 o'clock at night that our room was exactly below the terrace where the disco was and very loud music (crap) stopped only at 5 in the morning. We called asking to stop but nothing happened. We asked for a partial refund but nothing was given. Unfair. If you want to sleep at night don't go there. Plus the beach of the hotel is very dirty.

"We highly recommend this beautiful hotel, a diverse tour and attentive service that personalizes each client. Clean, delicious and very pleasant. Thank you Ms. Alaoui and her team"...
.............................................

The hotel is in the heart of marina smir.
We really appreciated the professionalism of the staff. Service was fantastic.
Rooms are clean.
Breakfast was nice.
Tennis court...
Don't hesitate to come over.

A very warm welcome at the reception up on arrival by Mr. Alawi made us feel like we are coming back home.
Mr. Alawi was very friendly und very professional, he offered us a room upgrade without even asking for it.
The room was very nice (decoration, clean, top quality) as the whole hotel. The area and location for the Hotel
is in a green area and in a quiet place where you can relax and enjoy yourself. The bar experience was also amazing with
a great and friendly service staff. After the bar visit, we received the next surprise from Mr. Alawi, fruit basket, water
as well as the offer for free Moroccan Hammam. Again, we felt like we are so welcome and over the Top.
Next day breakfast was a very good start with a very friendly Staff offering you every kind of food you want and as long as you want.
The Moroccan Hammam was also a very nice experience to us offered by a professional and friendly staff and in a very hygiene environment.
Because of the great experience with this Hotel we decided to stay one more night.

Overall, very nice clean and quite Hotel in a great location. Professional and friendly Staff. 
Thank you, Mr. Alawi and team, for making us feel like we are in heaven during these 2 days.
For sure we will come back to stay in your Hotel and we will recommend this Hotel to all our close friends

perfect place to be !
I stayed with my mother in the hotel Marina smir and I was very satisfied by everything. 
Very clean in all the way.
Beautiful spa and I would like to thanks the general manager of the √©tablissement Mrs Alaoui and a special thanks to the spa responsable Mrs Fatema Zahra for all the perfect job that they're doing. 
I recommend seriously this hotel for a good and relaxing stay.

The only negative aspect I can think of is the fact that we only spent one night at Marina Smir Hotel. It is by far the most charming and welcoming hotel we have visited during our stay in Morocco.

We arrived at the hotel on 19th April 2019, right in time for dinner. The food was excellent and the staff ready to help, waiting for us to settle down and enjoy our evening.

We had a very positive experience at the Marina Smir Hotel. It is set right on the beach, with a great Mediterranean view from the room balcony... just that makes for a wonderful stay. The location is also a few steps from the marina and promenade of restaurants which one can access directly from the hotel gardens, guarded 24/7 so avoid random people entering the premises.

The room was clean and well maintained, although all in all the hotel does need some upgrade and refurbishment, as there is so much potential in it. Service was good but slow at times. We went for a walk by the marina in the evening and on our return we sat down at the outside terrace of the bar. We ordered the traditional Moroccan mint tea... half an hour waiting and never came!

The architecture of this hotel provides a magical sensation, a superb example of Moorish Andalusian finishings. Marina Smir Hotel is located not far from the towns of Tetouan and Ceuta, and is housed within beautiful gardens, offering serene spirituality and helping to make it a peaceful place to relax and rest. Fully recommended.

We used to come to this hotel in the past, and actually have a pleasant stay. This year was a total shock: 
1- Dirty rooms,especially the bathroom (repulsive smells & else). 
2- two cockroaches in the shower
3- bad quality music at night keeping us up (the room they gave us was in the ground floor, so we could hear everything. 
4- we asked for a change of room the next morning; a request to which the person in charge responded positively and YET, nothing happened. 
5- while lying down in bed after a nap, we are horrified to find strangers in our room (the person in charge of taking a family in their room brought them to ours, did not knock & did not apologize late on; leaving us in complete disbelief. 
6- broken phone 
7- bad food
8- the beach in front of a hotel is one of the dirtiest Ive ever seen. 
 The list is long, but this hotel deserves a 0 star & should closed  Until they improve the situation. 
The views are nice, which is too bad because with all these issues, you just wanna leave.

review title: A terrifying experience ‚Äì no security, to flee absolutely.
review:
A terrifying experience ‚Äì no security, to flee absolutely.

We had the most frightening experience of our lives in this hotel. At 6am, a man was able to break into our room, when we were two young women asleep inside.

The most shocking thing? It was the hotel itself that gave him the information about our room and provided him with an access card. No controls, no verification, no security. This man found himself in our room, terrorizing us ‚Äî we were very afraid for our safety.

And despite the seriousness of the incident, the institution never apologized or took responsibility. No support, no empathy, no professionalism.

We're still in shock. A hotel that puts its guests at risk and protects an intruder instead of its own guests is an establishment that must absolutely be avoided. Your safety means nothing to them. A hotel that does this cannot be trusted under any circumstances.

The service is wonderful and all the staff is good and kind, and even the maid (Laila) treated us with kindness. We had a bathing ritual. I thank her for her kind treatment. I hope to return to the hotel. the location is wonderful.‚ô•Ô∏è‚ô•Ô∏è

review title: A marvel from start to finish
review:
An amazing experience, the place is beautiful, the people very warm and friendly, the view of the bedroom beautiful, the bed very comfortable, the infrastructure quite pleasant, we were treated wonderfully all the time.

I recommend living the experience once in your life.

A beautiful hotel. Abdullah at the front desk and Ayoub in room service made sure that we had a special stay. Our room was beautiful and any concerns we had were quickly taken care of. Since we visited during off-season, there were not many other guests. Service did not lack because of the low occupancy & I would recommend a stay to anyone looking for luxury in northern morocco.

The hamman and spa by Asmae was excellent! We had a great time and the kids enjoyed it too! Perfect service and gorgeous hotel we will definitely be back! I hope to be able to celebrate my 50th birthday with friends and family here in the summer....

review title: Exceptional hotel! Service way above average
review:
We stayed here for a birthday weekend and couldn't he happier.  The room was unbelievable with a dream view over the water.  It's really clean, very spacious with a modern setup and a patio.  

Taha at the front desk was awesome. He gave us recommendations for dinner, and places to visit, and it was great.  Abdellah from the restaurant was also a great host! 

Thanks!

review title: If you are not looking for something special
review:
We have been to the hotel with the family in December 2016 during a holiday break. We have selected Tamuda Beach as almost all hotels in the area were fully booked and it had a nice review. Upon arrival we noticed the huge hotel is almost empty. The facilities, shop and restaurant were closed. Dinner consists of snacks, panini or frozen pizza served in the snack bar where you get the breakfast as well. 
Rooms are big, nice and clean. Family rooms have no sea view but all overlook a big white wall with not much of the sunlight getting in. 
Personnel is nice and smiling although they wanted to ensure at all cost that we pay in advance even though they had our passports with them. 
Overall the hotel might be nice in summer but visibly they do not put the effort on off-season services although they are open. This is strange as all other hotels are full in the area so it is surely not down to a lack of potential clients.

I have just spent three nights at Tamuda beach. I am very satisfied by the service and the staff üòä It is the best place to relax thanks to the fresh and clean mediteranean air. I spent my birthday in the hotel and it was a very good choice that I will never forget. It will definely be my destination whenever I visit Tetouan.

review title: Perfect place for a nice vacation
review: I''ve stayed in Tamuda Beach for a week. It's the best place to stay in Tetouan! The hotel is nice and the staffs are attentive. It takes around 12 minutes to walk to the beach. The pools on site are quite clean. Would recommend.

Brand new hotel and very friendly staffs. The corridor is quite majestic.. 
A lot of food options available onsite. We liked the snack place and had most of meals there. Perfect place to spend a nice weekend in North Morocco

This is a modern hotel that is clean, shiny and neat. The rooms are large and have good light. They have external shutters for light control for a good nights sleep. The rooms have no heating or cooling but were comfortable in Spring when we were there. The TV is flat screen and has English channels and the wifi was the best we had in Morocco. The reception staff were friendly and helpful and the rooms were cleaned daily. The breakfast consisted of juice, tea or coffee and a croissant or bread. The hotel is a short, uphill walk from the bus station and is good value.

review title: Tetouan's TOP hotel 7 stars for me
review:
Location:  best .. 10 min walking from city centre.
Staff: top stuff
Price: dead cheap .. cheapest ever!
Cleanliness: the best there is
Amenities: all top drawer 
Spaces: plenty!
WiFi: in your face, strong and 100% available 
Every thing about this hotel is right. 

Recommended

We booked a standard room and the value of money was ok. There was no AC in the rooms so we couldn't sleep at night and had to open the windows but the noise from the street was deafening, moreover the smell of smoking kept seeping inside the room from outside. Also the rooms are not cleaned every day only when you enter or leave the room. It's a bit far from the center of the city with the old medina so you need to take a Taxi to go and come back. They have a restaurant but the prices are steep so eat outside downtown.

Needed an affordable hotel with triple room and a car park near the medina.
Chose a room away from the noisy street facing the mountains.
Bad mattress and pillow.
We had dinner in the restaurante/caf√© in the hotel and it was subpar to say the least.
In the morning we got some packaged milk, juice and twinkies because it was Ramadan and ALL caf√©s close down until sunset.

review title: Great budget hotel, good for a first-night stay
review: Having arrived at Ceuta, it was good to find this little budget hotel for a first night stay in Morocco, and it is is situated close to the railway station.   We paid just 300 dirhams for room 326 which was a very large room with 1 double and 1 single bed. However, it had a tiny bathroom.   There  was a small cafe on the first floor which served just basic refreshments but for an evening meal, we were recommended by the staff to a local cafe just 100metres down the road.    This was very much a local place, well used by locals and serving typical Moroccan food.  Not at all a smart place but provided excellent, cheap food.

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review:
From the first moment we felt at home in this hotel, thanks to the cordial and professional reception we received from hotel manager Osama. His kindness and dedication set the tone for the entire stay.

Having breakfast on the roof terrace was a fantastic experience ‚Äì in a charming, rural setting with a genuine Moroccan atmosphere. A perfect start to the day!

The room was clean, well organized and beautifully decorated with details that brought to mind the stories in One Thousand and One Nights. The hotel also offers free drinking water and fast wifi, which we really appreciated.

What really made our stay special was the staff: Osama, and the two young men Aziz and Suleiman, who were both helpful and incredibly nice. In addition, we want to highlight the two women who work with cleaning and breakfast ‚Äì very respectful and friendly.

We are grateful for everything and will be happy to come back. Highly recommended!

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review title: If I go back to Tetouan I will have no doubt where to stay. For me out of 10
review:
You can't ask for more. For my perfect
 
Beautiful Riad with an exceptional location in the Medina. Next to the Royal Palace and everything you need to visit. Very quiet area. Very nice and complete breakfast on the upper terrace with a very interesting view of the city. The rooms are very spacious with extraordinary decor and exquisite cleanliness. The best treatment of the staff, attentive to everything and willing to give you a hand as soon as you need it. A good thing to have come and if I come back I will certainly repeat.

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review title: Different and rich experience in culture
review: Friendly and warm welcome. Extraordinary breakfast. Typical Moroccan decoration, proper comfort and hygiene. Great location. Without a doubt a great experience.

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review: Perfect place inside the medina, very friendly treatment, good cleaning, Moroccan breakfast, the Royal Square is very close. Recommended 100%

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review title: Riad with charm and incredible hospitality
review:
As a visitor to Spain, I felt at home at the Riad Las Mil y Una Noches in Tetouan. The atmosphere is magical, full of Moroccan charm and a lot of tranquility. The riad is tastefully decorated and everything was very clean and cared for.

The staff was very friendly and always willing to help in everything you needed. Breakfast was delicious and served with a smile. What I liked the most was relaxing on the terrace with stunning views of the medina.

I recommend this place 100% to anyone who visits Tetouan ‚Äî especially if you come from Spain and are looking for an authentic and comfortable experience. Thanks for everything!

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review:
The best place to stay for breakfast and everything is beautiful will definitely be back 

.....................We are sixteen years old and sixteen years old and sixteen years old and sixteen years old and sixteen years old and sixteen years old.

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review title: Loved it, from Teo de la Medina but very easy to get to
review:
We loved, a surprise, an authentic Riad in the heart of the Medina, very easy to access, very close to the Puerta del
Palacio Real. The staff very attentive and willing to collaborate in your plans, Osama and his very professional and friendly colleagues. Very good breakfast. The room clean, the terrace with beautiful views. Very well preserved, we recommend it one hundred percent. We will repeat without a doubt.

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review title: Cozy riad in the medina of T√©touan
review: I stayed at Riad Mil y Una Noches in T√©touan from December 31st 2024 to January 2nd 2025 and had a wonderful time!They helped me in every way possible: arrange private transfer to Tangier, cooking class with chef Souleyman in the riad, book a hammam for a refreshing bath on New Year‚Äôs Eve. Lovely stay.

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review: Excellent stay at a stylish, well located really clean riad.  The staff were super friendly and professional.  Excellent terrace. (There's a two hundred minimum character requirement to submit a review for some reason and this sentence meets that.)

place name: Riad Las Mil y una Noches
review:
In the heart of the medina, a superbly restored riad, which lives up to its name.
The service is friendly and efficient, and the ‚ÄúMoroccan‚Äù breakfast is plentiful and tasty.
The room was rather small, and had a low ceiling.
The nearest parking lot is more than 500 m from the Riad; in the rain and when you don't know the route perfectly, it's a bit scary!
A highly recommended midday spot. The tea is normal but the AA/CC is appreciated and the place is very European and the bathrooms are very clean.
Chicken tajin with caramelized tomato a 10 something that we have not tried in any restaurant in Tetouan and spectacular shakshouka also among other magnificent dishes out there.

Terrible experience at this caf√©-restaurant. Respect for customers is simply non-existent. Some of the staff (not all, but enough to ruin the experience) are downright rude and seem to judge people based on how they dress or look ‚Äî which is absolutely disgraceful and discriminatory.

Their main focus is clearly not on customer service, but on making as much money as possible. During the summer season, they do everything they can to attract people, but once the place gets busy, their behavior changes completely. They become arrogant, unfriendly, and ‚Äî believe it or not ‚Äî they will shamelessly ask certain customers to leave if they‚Äôre not spending ‚Äúenough‚Äù money!

This kind of attitude has no place in hospitality. Tourists, please be aware: there are many other places where you‚Äôll be welcomed with kindness, respect, and professionalism. Don‚Äôt waste your time or money here. This place doesn‚Äôt deserve your business.

review title: Photos of food do not conform to reality
review: Surprisingly, there was nothing from the food photos. Seafood either. Spacious site, but does not correspond to photos of food

We stayed four days visiting Tetouan and one night we had dinner with friends at the Diamond.
The food value for money was quite good, it is a place where you can try the typical Moroccan food or pizzas or burgers European type.

Maybe 2 years ago it was the place that everyone is talking about. But in January 2025 we went to dinner and I wish it hadn‚Äôt occurred to us. Nothing to do with what everyone counts on in the comments. Extremely savory dishes, trajin with the meat of the chicken nothing tender, skewer a little raw, Moroccan salad flavored having spent too much time made in the refrigerator, inedible courtesy tapas, and individual tablecloths with quite a thick. 
We can't recommend it, sorry.

Excellent food 
Very clean 
Loved how helpful the stuff was 
Highly recommend if you want to try moroccon food 
Big thanks to the owner, who was very helpful

review title: Amazing passage must if you are in Tetouan!!!!! ‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è
review: Super restaurant!!! Tajine excellent. Hearty cheap. Super friendly staff. It is very, very good. Tagine chicken pastilla just amazing
I went to this restaurant reading after reading the reviews and seeing the photos shared. I ordered a paella and what they brought me is far from a paella. You must change its name in the menu.

This restaurant is the reason why i stopped believing tripadvisors comments and reviews! If i could give 0 star, I would! We ordered two pasta with seafood and they came back after a long time to tell us that it's not available and that we should order something else. We orders spaghetti bolognaise et it came after more than 20 minutes and the taste was just horrible. I could not eat any of it! The service was very slow despite the fact that the waiter was friendly. I confirm that person's comment who said the restaurant had no soul (endroit sans √¢me). If you see this comment before you go there, you're a lucky person.
We had a great time sharing a delicious swordfish tagine that I recommend as well as equally delicious seafood spaghetti. Do it again!

review title: Delicious food and the atmosphere was great.
review: This spot was great place to get away from the crowded streets, the food was great for t√©touan. The menu is just simple but still the food is very delicious.
idk why but the seafood were a bit uncooked the service was well but it took a long time to have your food placed and sometimes the server forget and start bringing new things from the beg

Food was very good. You can't get that good everywhere in Tetouan! Owner has chatted with us about life, art and the movie mocromafiaüòÇ
The free herbal tea of the house was a nice finish for a special restaurant and very kind Owner!
Normal for tacos pizza there is work to be done for the panin mieu to change the bread and review the saezonement especially the onion that area other than normal.

Good food at this restaurant right in the center of Tetouan. Was a tip from the host of our Riad otherwise we would have walked right past it. They have a kind of courtyard garden between the buildings where you eat. The couscous and the calimari are absolutely top notch. They also serve alcohol for the enthusiasts. Very price friendly too. We ate together (1 starter and both a main course) plus drinks for ‚Ç¨35. Only downside was that there are insects (wasps) flying around that can be irritating. Waiters are modest, can show a little more spontaneity. But all in all very satisfied!

Very nice setting and from the entrance to the restaurant we are sold the dream of exceptional dishes. Olives, eggplants and bread are very good. It's a good start. Dishes arrive cuckoos and chicken pastillas. The pastilla is correct and very nicely presented. For couscous, uh, not great. A small piece of meat, we had to ask for broth because there was none. Some vegetables and lots of semolina. No one's finished their dish. Moroccan tea was good. Conclusion we did not dream. Big disappointment.

The place is very nice. It was our first contact with Moroccan food, and I have to say no complaints, ration of cus cus of meat that we liked. Very friendly service. We would definitely repeat going back to Tetouan

review title: Good atmosphere, simple and good food, very friendly waiters. A good experience.
review: Restaurant with years of experience, and good service. Simple and rich dishes, good fish fries, alcohol is served. With beers they put snacks. Very friendly waiters.

Good food, excellent waiters, are exploited by the owners, hire few waiters who force themselves to run and duplicate to give a good service, and be able to content hardly customers. Bosses only look from the till where they are charged, the full restaurant, low minimums to meet minimums of service, do not help the waiters always very attentive and helpful. On the other hand, the waiter asked the owner, and he refused to serve me an extra onion, even paying, because they had food counted for the whole day. Very low note for exploitative owners, regrettable, this is the 21st century.

None of us have finished their dishes. full of oil. rubbery meat 
kind staff
Thank you for the bread and olives that saved the meal.

I have been in country for almost 4 weeks now travelling from southern Morocco into the Sahara and back up to Tangier, and I have to say this is one of the most disappointing meals I have had. I was tossing between this place and El Reducto. The Moroccan salad was very watery - when I finished it, there was about a inch of what I assume was ‚Äúdressing‚Äù in the bottom of the bowl, but it didn‚Äôt really have any flavour. But more disappointing was the chicken tagine. It arrrived in a lukewarm tagine (it had obviously been cooked elsewhere and then put into the tagine before serving) and there was literally a chicken leg and bit of thigh with a few olives. The chips had been cooked in oil that wasn‚Äôt hot enough - so they had soaked up the grease (although to their merit - they were hot, unlike the chicken). I literally ate here, waited an hour or so and then went and ate at El Reducto. I hadn‚Äôt planned on having dinner twice but was still hungry. The best part of the meal was the beer. Very disappointing.

review title: Lovely place selling alcohol, reasonably priced
review: Found this lovely place selling alcohol. I sat and had 2 beers in a lovely atmosphere and excellent WiFi too. Beer reasonably priced for Morocco at 30 dirham for Flag. Worth knowing about if you drink alcohol
The fresh fish on the menu one came from half a liter and then you get a de375 the only thing saved is the service not back

Restinga was Awesome. I had probably the best dinner of my life there. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The food was amazing. I had Tagine de Viande and a Moroccan salad. The food came out piping hot and the salad was very fresh. The meat was tender and practically fell apart. I really enjoyed it. My waiter was great. The atmosphere is beautiful and inviting. Prices were very reasonable. If you are ever in Tatouan do yourself a favor and check this place out.
Friendly treatment from the staff, the restaurant is quiet, and the food in our case chicken jerk and meat skewers all fine.
Very good food, but we never saw the waiter to order coffee or anything else service Rest not great.

Great restaurant however favor fish dishes that are great!! 
Warm and very pleasant atmosphere

review title: Very good restaurant in the heart of the shops of T√©touan
review: Beautiful restaurant, Moroccan salad and excellent lemon pie üòã. I recommend. Please open the bird cage...üôè

We stayed for dinner at this restaurant and I must say we were happy. Cozy place, well set and clean ... The waiters delighted us in 'waiting with olives of different flavors , delicious and a taste of tasty beans and a little' spicy but not too much ... The chicken and beef tajin arrived, we were happy for the tasty flavor , and 'needless to say that we finished everything .. Recommendation ..

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review:
Following an outing with my guests, as I always did, I offer lunch on this establishment, I was ignored in an unpleasant way as they mean we don't care about you 
I would never stop here

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review:
The place is superb and quiet.
The delicious and hearty cuisine (10 grilled sardines on the plate).
Very nice step.

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review: I went with my family on 10.08.24 due to the good reviews especially from Tetouan to have breakfast there. But the disappointment was very big üòî. We ordered 7x breakfast menus; it took forever for the waiter to serve the order. The bad thing is, they didn't serve things that belong to the menu. I had to ask the waiter several times to hand in the missing items and was simply ignored each time. My child lacked the drink for breakfast (cocoa), and even after repeated prompting, it was not served. The child cried at the end because everyone had their drinks and finished breakfast and he is still waiting for his drink üò¢. He couldn't have breakfast without a drink. Guests came after us and were completely served before us and we still had to wait for the missing things. Not even water, which is part of the menu, was served to us! After waiting more than an hour for the missing items, I freaked out and complained to the boss about the disastrous service, especially that no consideration is given to the children. When paying, things were calculated that were not served at all; just outrageous üò°. I will never visit the restaurant again!

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review title: Couscous served frozen on a Friday at 2 p.m.
review:
3 couscous ordered on a Friday at 2 p.m.
Normally little risk since all Moroccan restaurants offer couscous on Fridays at 2 p.m.
45 minute wait 
The couscous arrives, they are cold 
I touch a piece of squash that is frozen with my finger. 
No doubt the vegetables come straight from the freezer and have not been thawed sufficiently  
I call the waiter to let him know...
We get up and leave without eating and without paying. 
What a horror, never seen this in Morocco.
Couscous served frozen on a Friday guys are really serious.
Absolutely avoid. 
Fortunately we didn't get sick because we didn't eat.

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review:
Splendid. Beautiful place with delicious breakfasts. On the road between Chefchaouen and Tetouan the place is on the road. We can't miss it. Superb landscapes
I recommend +++

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review:
Very disappointing establishment. We arrive around 7 p.m. The staff does not welcome us. The tables are not cleared, the music is too loud.
We wait 10 minutes, the staff chat but don't come to take our order... We get up (not without expressing our dissatisfaction), then we leave the place.
Never seen before in Morocco!

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review title: AVOID - Poor Service, Insufficient Portions, Excessive Prices
review:
With my family, we decided to have lunch in this restaurant and ordered 2 large tagines. After several hours of waiting, we were very disappointed to receive 2 ridiculously small tagines and a salad without the necessary utensils. The quality of service really leaves something to be desired.

The final straw was when we received the bill, which was out of the norm for what we received. When we tried to object, the staff showed complete refusal. An extremely disappointing experience from start to finish. Avoid at all costs.

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review:
Excellent restaurant located on the road towards Chefchouen.
Installed on the terrace you will have a panoramic view of Lake Tetouan.
The menu is mainly composed of Moroccan specialties.
The dishes and plates served are copious and tasty.
The servers took great care of us and we really appreciated their kindness and professionalism.
I highly recommend this address!

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review: We had a wonderful time with a boss who took great care of his customers, all the staff are great üëç pleasant, gargantuan lunch üëçüëçüëç, an exceptional place with a fantastic view, thank you again for your kindness and attention üëçüëç

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review: Super romantic for a romantic evening. Small candles are left by the waiters and it gives a good atmosphere. The food is good there.

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review: Have potential but bad service kill the mood. Waited an hour for cold grilled meat. Owner doesn't understand how much this is a bad publicity for him. He say says next time u call me to make sure ur served well üßê

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review:
After we left our hotel in T√©touan, we visited this roadside restaurant on 20th April 2019 en route to Chefchaouen. We used it just as a stop during the long trip, but the breathtaking views over the lake and mountains make it really worthed.

As such this restaurant is literally in the middle of nowhere, but if you‚Äôre lucky enough to stop here, simply enjoy the stunning views, maybe while having a light snack on their terrace. It makes you wonder how such natural beauty with its serene surroundings manage to cope with the times!

Food is excellent with a nice, warm, gentle service from the owners!

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review title: A delicious break between T√©touan & Chefchaouen
review: This roadside restaurant has A magnificent view over a lake and the mountains. The owner's Belgian roots came to pass & was A friendly help figuring out the language barri√®re. This establishment has the promise of opening a hotel upstairs, is trying to grow it's own vegetables, has A playing area for Kids, clean bathroom and 10 different types of animals.

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review title: A must-see spot on the way to Chefchaouen
review: The view is stunning, this is a place we always stop at on our way to Chefchaouen, the food is very good and the staff is really amazing! last time, we forgot a wallet and a phone there, and the owner was so kind that he brought them to us the day after to Tangier, appreciated it soooo much!!!

place name: Sed Nakhla Le Restaurant Du Lac
review: Now, I‚Äôm not too sure if one will ever find this restaurant ranked #5 on tripadvisor because it‚Äôs in the middle of no where between Tangier and Chefchaouen. We found this place because we hired a guide for the day to Chefchaouen and it was one of the pit stops. We had our breakfast there. Very tasty. The views across the valley and lake is stunning. It makes you wonder how such natural beauty with its serene surroundings manage to cope with the times. But it was a good pit stop.

review title: The most bad restaurant in tetouan
review:

‚∏ª

A humiliating and shocking experience! I visited this restaurant in Tetouan with my wife, and we were greeted by an extremely rude and arrogant employee. As soon as we arrived, he would talk to the clients as if he were lecturing them. When I asked what was in a panini, he replied in a mocking tone: "Don't you know chicken means chicken?" And when I asked if they had table service, he said contemptuously: ‚ÄúAre you still small to talk about that?‚Äù

After the meal, I expressed my displeasure politely, telling him that his behavior does not make him want to come back. We came out very upset, and my wife forgot her computer. When she came back for him, he insulted her by saying: ‚ÄúYour husband is ill-educated, tell him not to talk too much.‚Äù I then called to protest, but he started threatening and insulting me on the phone: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here until 2am, come if you want.‚Äù

No professionalism, total shame. To flee absolutely!

‚∏ª

A humiliating and shocking experience! I visited this restaurant in Tetouan with my wife, and we were met with the rudest staff member I‚Äôve ever encountered. From the start, he spoke to customers in a condescending tone, as if educating them. When I asked what was in a panini, he sarcastically replied, ‚ÄúDon‚Äôt you know chicken means chicken in Arabic?‚Äù And when I inquired about table service, he mocked me saying, ‚ÄúYou‚Äôre still too young to talk about that?‚Äù

After finishing the meal, I told him that his behavior was unprofessional and that I wouldn‚Äôt come back. We left upset, and my wife accidentally left her laptop. When she returned to get it, he verbally attacked her and said, ‚ÄúYour husband is rude, tell him not to talk too much.‚Äù I called to confront him, and he started threatening and insulting me on the phone: ‚ÄúI‚Äôm here until 2 AM, come if you want.‚Äù

This restaurant is a disgrace. Completely unprofessional. Avoid it at all costs!

‚∏ª

barah klina foh kona dayzin mn tma, tardiness bzaaaf f servic + dakxiba9i khdar meadhass kayzbo ela nas+ klit tma panini seafood w Madame pizza seafoodb 2 bihom fruits khouuudar mara, tastela 3ala9a+ o9ssim bilahjani tassamom lyuma mtyah fda bssbab had resto+ghali bad experience awla w akhir mara

Vegetarian Pizza 
Pizza marga
Pizza rital 
Seafood Pizza

Indian tacos
