Sprite
The best fast restaurants in Tetouan Quality products everything is homemade fast and efficient service I highly recommend.

review title: Exceptional delicious fresh pizza‚Äôs and burgers
review: Le Rital Tetouan is a must-visit for anyone looking to enjoy delicious food. The combination of an exceptional cuisine, attentive service, and fresh products ensures a lunch experience that you won't soon forget. I look forward to returning on my next visit to Tetouan.

Surprisingly the meat was delicious, the real taste of steak! exceptional sauces! I was surprised at how generous the burger was! used to eating more fries or maybe they were so good that I had the impression that the meal was over too quickly!!! but I was satisfied Allahouma baarik, may Allah grant that we are grateful for his blessings and that we are not wasteful and ungrateful... May Allah accept from us and from you

review title: A unique concept of fresh, homemade products
review: Italian restaurant new very innovative concept nothing to say about the quality of the homemade products made to order and fresh

review title: Go there with your eyes closed
Great fancy restaurant in Tamuda Bay.

review:
I strongly advise against it. They inflate prices. No professionalism.
Scam customers with beautiful smiles!! I will not go back!!

We had dinner at this restaurant. Total disappointment. Cleanliness leaves something to be desired. Price scam. We asked for a mango juice and served us something else. No serious. I really do not recommend this restaurant

I ordered crab‚Äôs croquettes as a starter and a Moroccan chicken Tagine as a main meal‚Ä¶ 

They served me rice and zaalouk and potatoes and bread at first, all of that was cold and not suitable to eat‚Ä¶ zaalouk was okay. 

After, they served me the Tajine, and it was so poor with a lot of sauce and fries (which wasn‚Äôt mentioned on the menu)‚Ä¶ i felt stomach aches later. 

Also the waiter wasn‚Äôt nice! 

Overall, it was a very poor experience

Dirty table and not set up, after claim the waiter did not like everything as if it was my fault, a fish tagine that looked like a fish soup, in my opinion the Chef de cuisine is not the same.  A disappointment.  But the view is beautiful to the sea. I'm not going back.

Great service, great meal, fresh fish of the day, plus a superb view of the Spanish coast.
For me it's 5/5

review title: Very disappointed, I will not return
review:
I came with my parents, I ordered sushi. Once the dish was on the table, I noticed that it wasn't made just now, it was sushi that had been made for a while.
It's not fresh, be careful what you order. Luckily I noticed because the avocado was all black, and if it wasn‚Äôt fresh, I could have gotten sick ü§Æ

What a magnificent view... an affordable and succulent menu. We ate there 4 times and each dish was delicious... tagine, seafood, salad, crepe...
A BIG thank you to Jessi who was able to advise us and who celebrated a birthday with dignity..
I highly recommend
We had family dinner in the roof nice view food was amazing  excellent service special tanks to mr said the manger for his welcoming

Wow! I was looking for a nice seafood restaurant when I asked the coffee shop employee. Which restaurant across the street is better and he pointed out Olas. He was right the seafood is fresh ,plentiful and delicious not to mention service fast and friendly.Please visit you will be satisfied.

it was really bad experience for me and my family it's not the first time, now i decided to write this review... the service was really unprofessionnel at all, No smiling. exactly 30min to receive my order & in the end the food served cold ..
AM NOT GOIMG BACK THERE AND I DON'T RECOMMEND THIS PLACE.

This is the worst ‚Äúrestaurant‚Äù we have ever been in, mainly due to the bad-mannered waiters.
We visited a few times, giving them the benefit of our initial doubts, but each visit was worse! 
Twice we witnessed a waiter habing a loud and most discourteous argument with diners
and people left in tears!
Avoid it at all costs!  Surrounding restaurants are far better in every possible way!

review title: Lovely Seafood restaurant with great view
review: Visited this place on 2 occasions while in the local area for a few days. Great staff and friendly. Food and deserts very nice and fairly priced. Seafood galore for fish and seafood lovers. Nice flavour and decent menu items.
Good place for seafood. Great view of Mdiq bay, with air condition. Please take note of their selection of catches of the day at the entrance. Try to choose fresh catches.

review title: Horrible üòñ will never go there again
review:
Although the view was great and the food was nicely presented (rf pictures), the fish was tasteless and not fresh at all only heated and the salade tasted stale .. definitely not today's preparation ! A biiiiig disappointment especially after the good recommendations in TripAdvisor 
The service was good though ..

review title: Great service and amazing sea food
review: It was a pleasure.. and the service was exceeding my expectations, especially if we benchmark it to the poor quality of service in the north region. Overall highly recommended. The view was astonishing.

If the staff is charming and attitive it is not DE the same DE l infrastructure, indeed the poor and only boy who makes omelets at breakfast and on his own and has only a hob DE:Consequence you wait DE more than 1/2 hour to have a simple omelet with a tail DE 10 people minimum; the coffee, tea, milk machines systematically have a lack DE something and you only have water ... the staff does everything possible but it is not worthy of a hotel or high rate.
The room is clean but the bathroom leaves much to be desired.Brief to avoid EN high season

review title: A pleasant setting, but a very disappointing experience
review:
We had originally booked at Hotel Quemado, but upon receipt of the confirmation, we discovered that it related to Hotel Mohammed V, without any explanation. If we had not taken the time to check, we would have been very surprised when we arrived. It was necessary to call to correct the reservation, which is not normal for an establishment of this level.

The hotel‚Äôs location remains a real asset, with a beautiful sea view, but this does not compensate for the many disappointments encountered on site.

The elevator is constantly occupied by staff, which creates very long waits, especially when staying on the upper floors.

The cleanliness of the rooms clearly leaves something to be desired: dust under the beds, poorly cleaned floor, rough towels... We are far from expected standards.

The catering rates are excessive and unjustified in view of the quality offered.

Fortunately, the reception staff stands out for their professionalism and kindness. Animation for children is also a positive point to highlight.

In summary, despite some positives, I would not recommend this hotel to my loved ones.

Very nice hotel with a nice atmosphere party part l entertainment team, the view is great, direct to the beach of al hoceima extra ordinary, we will absolutely return next year with the whole family, also the port to eat fish hmmmmm

Excellent hotel, with splendid sea views.
High quality service, impeccable buffet.
I had the pleasure of staying in your establishment, a most pleasant experience........üëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëå

Hotel mercury quimado 
A warm welcome , impeccable service and exceptional quality at every moment.thank you for this unforgettable experience in your magnificent establishment...üí™üèªüí™üèªüí™üèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèª

Beautiful location by the sea , relaxing and ideal during this quiet period, especially with family. Spacious rooms with splendid views and large terrace. Helpful team, impeccable cleanliness of rooms. I highly recommend

review title: There was no experience by rules of the last century
review: Well we had reservation my partner and I and being the Moroccan and not being married did not let us leave together, we propose to rent 2 rooms and much more expensive. So we're going somewhere else. But good that this measure is from the last century, I even showed pictures to the reception boy that I had been with him for a long time and there was no way because we did not have the document to be married.  You should make the booking look at these regulations...

Thank you for the welcome and the availability of the staff especially Mr Yassine an immense pleasure spent in this beautiful establishment everything is perfect room and equipment with great view from the The room and terrace with a very beautiful view, nothing to say either.

I would like to express my sincere thanks to Yacine, the hotel's head reception. His exceptional welcome and valuable help made my stay really enjoyable. Thank you for your impeccable service!
Thank you my boss infinitely

I would like to extend a big thank you to Yacine, the head reception of the hotel. His warm welcome, professionalism and attention to detail greatly improved my stay. Thank you for your excellent service!
Thank you very much, Chief.

review title: grubby hotel, but best we found in Al Hoceima
review:
good situation in town, local restaurants in the surrounding square, especially fresh grilled sardines. would seem a Moroccan travelers area, we didn't see any foreign travelers when we were there.
The coach from Tangiers to Al Hoceima is about ten hours and there isn't a straight or level mile! we traveled on a overnight coach to Al Hoceima and it was extremely uncomfortable, almost an ordeal! we traveled back to Tangiers on a day coach and had a more comfortable time.

Centrally situated and pretty much what you would expect within this price range. Helpful service. Good enough for a one night stopover. Could have been cleaner. Bar underneath was handy for breakfast. (Not included in the price but it was pretty good).

review title: Great helpful staff. Clean. Convenient. Comfortable.
review: The city may not have much to offer the winter traveler except for an excellent tanjine, the Hotel Florido has a nice safe stop on my way further into Morocco. The staff was great. They even helped me get a SIM card! The room clean and comfortable - if a bit cold. The internet was weak, but since I didn't complain I will not hold the hotel responsible. All together, a nice inexpensive stay.

Not entirely sure why anyone would come to Al-Hoceima, but if you do, this place is ok for sleeping. It was quite clean and the street is relatively quiet. The desk clerk didnt speak a word of french or english which made things a bit difficult, but he had a smile on his face most of the time.

We stayed here for about five days and found it very friendly . well located good price and with the staff willing to help . The room we stayed in was a little tired but was airy with two balconies ,. On the ground floor is an excellent large coffee and snack bar well worth a sit .

We stayed here for a week and the hotel itself was really good. We first accepted a room on the first floor that was really noisy but we were moved the next day and all was good from there.
The rooms are well set up, beds comfortable, bathrooms clean and your room will be serviced if you leave the key when you go out.
Staff do not speak a lot of English but Mike the manager does and if in doubt ask for him.
Breakfast is served downstairs in the cafe and is good, 40dhm for a huge breakfast or 17 for a smaller version.
There are a few restaurants around for other meals although we struggled to find anyone who spoke any English (but we are in a non English speaking country is accept that is part of it) As you walk out of the hotel there is an allley with a small cafe set up the food there is excellent and very cheap, they were always welcoming and friendly when we went there. The Sardines are really good :-)

review title: good value but can be noisy
review: We only stayed in Al Hoceima for one night en route to Chefchaoeun, and the Villa Florido was certainly good value (less than 300 Dhs for a double room). We could also park for free right outside the hotel entrance. Staff were friendly, the room was clean. The fish restaurants down at the Al Hoceima port are also well worth checking out. Just be aware that the hotel is located at the junction of two busy commercial streets and Place du Rif in the city centre; light sleepers should bring ear-plugs.

review title: Well restored Hotel in Al Hoceima
review: I stayed at Villa Florido for three nights. The hotel has been well restored in Art Deco style. Rooms and bathrooms are very nice, and the whole hotel is very clean. Staff are professional, friendly and helpful.

The hotel is nice, and the staff very helpful. The location is great too, close to the main square.
Good value.

Although I have visited Morocco many times before, Al Hoceima never made my itinerary. Well, what a beautiful place. The locals are extremely friendly with absolutely zero hassle. Great sea food as you might expect from a seaside town. Great scenery in the national park to the west.

Villa Florido staff were helpful, my first room (304) was quite good, though I checked out the next morning uncertain whether I would be staying in the town. But after a day in the national park to the west I was drawn back and checked into Villa Florido again. This time the room overlooked the Place du Rif with the grand taxis and it was noisy. So when I decided to stay another night I changed to room 208 which had double aspect balconies facing the opposite direction. The hotel is reasonable value at 258dh for an ensuite with breakfast (single price), double occupancy would be cheaper per person.

place name: Suites Hotel Mohammed V by Accor
review: Nice, clean hotel with a view of the sea. Centrally located and everything within walking distance. Breakfast was OK. Staff very friendly. Unfortunately, it was very loud outside because of the holiday so you couldn't sleep. Al Hoceima is worth seeing

place name: Suites Hotel Mohammed V by Accor
review: The hotel is in a great location near the city center, overlooking ,the sea I thank the hotel staff , who dissolved in the guests' , comfort and availability , for all requirements Thank you very much

place name: Suites Hotel Mohammed V by Accor
review: This could be an amazing hotel but it is poorly maintained and dirty. Lovely views across the bay are compromised by dirty windows. Pillows smelled musty. Bed spread didn't look fresh. Throw rug next to bed snd Glasses in bath room were dirty. Miss matched warn out yellowed towels. Bathtub needed re caulking. Nicely designed building and rooms. with just a little effort this could be a "wow" hotel instead of a grimy sort of beat up feeling place. Breakfast was decent.

place name: Suites Hotel Mohammed V by Accor
review title: Helpful staff, beautiful view, modern suites
review: This is the perfect place to stay ‚Äì right off the main square (restaurants, fountains) with balconies overlooking the cliffs and beach. Quiet at night but close to everything. Kherdi at reception was extremely helpful and friendly and spoke excellent English ‚Äì which is rare! Huge suites, very modern, beds wider than they were long. Not cheap but worth it.

place name: Suites Hotel Mohammed V by Accor
review: Nice hotel beautiful view good food just one problem if you have storller you gonna suffer cause of the stairs.the city is the best place to be in summer time it s fantastic.I've been almost every where in morocco But alhociema city is different.mountains and beautiful beach wow wow I can't forget that place I would love to go there again.

place name: Suites Hotel Mohammed V by Accor
review title: Great location, good rooms, ok staff
review: We stayed two nights at thet Suites Mohammed V in Al Hoceima in August 2012. Great view (although the newly built hotel right at the beach is clogging the view a bit), good beds, friendly staff. The shower turns the bathroom into a pool because the water leaks right onto the bathroom floor (in both rooms the same problem so I presume it's in all rooms). Slightly overpriced all in all.

place name: Suites Hotel Mohammed V by Accor
review title: Decent hotel, great view, excellent location
review:
There really aren't any top level choices for hotels in Al Hoceima. The Suites Hotel Mohammed V is the best one that I have found. It is very conveniently located right next to the central square of the city, Place Mohammed VI, on the side of a hill looking directly out over the beautiful small beach of Quemada.
The rooms are all "suites" -- larger than the average room with a sitting area, flat screen television, large and very comfortable bed, balcony overlooking the beach, separate bathroom and shower/bathtub. The hotel underwent major renovation and opened just early in 2011. It is totally different than it was previously.
The hotel also has a nice restaurant on the bottom floor which also serves the complimentary breakfast. There is a bar on the main floor that had just received a liquor license and was serving a variety of drinks. Prices in the bar and the restaurant were not outrageous. Internet connectivity was provided by WIFI in the reception area and some of the rooms and then wired internet in the rooms. I stayed for two weeks for business and the internet was frustrating as it would work for a while, stop for half an hour, come back up and then go down again. Everyone in the hotel complained about the internet (which was free), but you get what you pay for.
Personnel were very friendly. There is a parking area directly in front of the hotel and had sufficient places for all those who were staying in the hotel. There was a security man around the hotel in the night time. The hotel is actually three floors. You enter on the main reception floor and then there are two floors down by elevator where the rooms are. The hotel does not have a swimming pool, nor does it have a fitness center (although they said one was being finished and the hotel brochure actually claims that there is one).
Room prices were reasonable for the quality. I did have a problem with the shower door not closing properly and water would constantly get onto the floor. It wasn't a flood, but had to be careful when stepping out of the shower onto the marble floors to be sure I didn't slip and fall.
I previously stayed in Al Hoceima at the Hotel La Perla. The Suites Hotel Mohammed V is considerably better than La Perla. I enjoyed my two week stay in the hotel and have no problems recommending it to other travelers. Because of the hotel's excellent location, there were a number of other locations to eat within easy walking distance.

place name: Suites Hotel Mohammed V by Accor
review title: Nice and new, pleasant contemporary design
review: Very nice renovation and extra large bedrooms. The quality of finishings is not up to standard though, our shower screen was badly fitted and could not close, the door handle on the balcony door was damanaged, one of the window in the corridor was loose and about to fall, one of the glass doors of the restaurant was badly cracked. Also, the restaurant floor was really dirty, which is a real shame for such an upscale establishment. One last thing: changer les deux tapis rouges du hall, there are much better ones everywhere else!

We had the opportunity to eat lunch and evening on the terrace on the 7th floor, the view is beautiful, the meal was excellent. The octopus very fresh and wonderfully well cooked and the little more I would even add a star for the waiter "simon" who welcomed us super well with impeccable service which is rare in some restaurants. This very smiling and friendly gentleman was the little plus of our evening we hope to see him again next year.

Too much waiting to order and to be served and servers not smiling. Juices not sweet and lunch not seasoned enough. In terms of cleanliness, not too much under the dirty table, chair and table the same despite it being well located.

review title: If there was a rating less than one star then I would have used it
review:
We came in with two mini dogs leashed. The waiter said welcome. Then once we were seated in the terrace.  There was an instant change of rules. A sign with `no dogs` was printed and stack on the entrance door.

Then the waiter was ignoring us. And came to say that we are denied service because we had dogs.

One the way out, we have seen the freshly printed sign denying access to dogs.

There are a million other places to drink your coffee. Don't give your money to dishonest people. (Photo not from Basilisk).

This is one of the few places for a light meal open fairly late in Al Hoceima (or so we found in early Oct 2017).  It has an attractive and large caf√© terrace on the main square of the town.   The menu is quite extensive.   Except for a caprese salad which was rather good, the food is nothing special - we had hamburgers.  Service was unattentive - although there were only two or three other tables, the waiter seemed to be doing us a favour by serving us.   It was, all in all, rather boring.  Prices quite high too, I thought, and unjustified.  One is paying for convenience and location in a town in which fastfood seems to be the main entertainment when it comes to food.   Amazing when you see all the fresh produce in the markets ...

Nice hotel overlooking the sea.
It also overlooks the main square,  so lots of activitie in the evening.
Everything you need in the rooms.
Staff friendly. 
Reception speak English.
Free WiFi. 
They serve great coffee.
Restaurant is excellent. 
R

While we didn't stay at the Hotel Basilic, we did enjoy most of our dinners in their restaurant. This place offers a lot of choice with their extensive menu, ranging from (non-alcoholic) cocktails, to Tajins.

Me and my wife were going for an evening  walk when we saw this place and decided to try out their desserts. 

I had ice cream and the wife had a pancake with banana and caramel. 

The pancake was heavy, but I guess if you like pancakes that way you will love it. Personally I like my pancakes light but that's just me :-)

The ice cream was one of the best I have had for a long time. It was creamy and delicious so if you love ice cream you should definitely try out this place. 

The WiFi is free but we didn't get it to work. 

Notice we only visited the caf√©.

review title: A 4 Star Hotel Experience at 3 Star Price
review:
This hotel is only rated 3 stars but was easily the nicest hotel we stayed in during our trip to Morocco (Casablanca, Rabat, Tangier, Hoceima). It feels very new and is in a perfect location right on the square with magnificent views of the bay.

It is best to get a room on the higher floors (5 or 6) for this view. Rooms were large, clean and modern. The bathroom was modern and comfortable. There are no king beds but we had two twins pushed together. There are not many amenities but the room is very comfortable and includes a small balcony.

Breakfast is included and is to order (much better option than a buffet with tired food). Service in the cafe was excellent and the food very tasty.

Overall, this felt much more like a 4 star experience for a 3 star price. We were very, very pleased and we travel a lot (75% of the time). You can't go wrong with this hotel.

Good position. Staff was ready to help. The Room was clean. Good vibes up in the terrace. Great view. Only must cover the roof there cause it might get chilly at night. Once that's done, the place will deserve 5 stars time. Plus chefchaouen was magic in February
A beautiful place. The reception is welcoming. The terrace is beautiful and overlooks the mountains. The breakfast is wonderful and the wireless service is fast. very clean good sttaf I recommend it.

Very nice time and The cleanliness and location is great, the manager is very friendly and helpful, and the reception is great you can meet new people I enjoyed my time so much The bed is comfortable and clean, everything is close to the Kasbah, the Spanish mosque, the waterfalls, as well as the old city. Everything is close

review title: Welcoming staff who were helpful with subsequent travel plans
review: My two friends and I stayed in the top floor 6-bed dorm room. As it was low season we had the room to ourselves for two nights and it made for a great home base while exploring the sleep town. Saada made us delicious breakfasts both mornings and was a great chat to learn about Chefchaouen and other parts of Morocco. The manager also arranged travel to Al Hoceima for us. Overall a great experience and would highly recommend for a group of friends.

I have a great stay at the hostel. I am reading some bad reviews now, but it seems those issues were left in the past. Everything was sparkling clean, in a very good location and I felt safe as a group of girls traveling. Saada was very helpful and welcoming and made our trip even nicer! Thank you Saada for your kindness and I hope we visit you again!

We only stayed for the evening because we had to change plans due to covid but the host was very helpful and caring with getting us a taxi and showing us where to visit in the city. If I ever come back to Morocco I will spend more time in Chefchaouen.

‚ÄúHostel Aline is always my best option in chefchaouen, I am a recurrent customer & I am always satisfied with the services in that beautiful hostel. It's equipped with everything you need, with great location & very beautiful authentic interior design. I am familiar with the personal & I am always happy to pass my vacation at hostel Aline‚Äù

review title: Would rather sleep on the street
review: Don‚Äôt spend your time or money here. The street would be cleaner than the beds here. We left after 20 minutes, covered in 17 bed bug bites. The receptionist Jason was the rudest person we met in Morocco.

review title: WARNING !!! HOSTEL IS HEAVILY INFESTED WITH BEDBUGS. THE HOSTEL HAVE REFUSED TO SORT THIS OUT FOR OVER A YEAR
review:
It didn‚Äôt take me long to notice that the bed I was sleeping in felt slightly itchy. I tossed and turned and listened to others in the room itching. I thought there must have been a couple of mozzies in the room.

5 hours later.. I still hadn‚Äôt slept, trying in the common room and the terrace. Everything was itchy!! I woke with at least 20 marks all over my body. Some have turned into boils and others are the size of an egg.

Looking at the edges of the beds in the morning, you can see there are eggs in the mattresses. There are many reviews saying that this hostel is heavily infested with bedbugs, some dating back to the summer of 2018 (a year later!!) This clearly demonstrates that there is no appetite to fix this problem. The hostel weren‚Äôt particularly apoplectic and tried to play it off as something normal stating that ‚ÄòPeople come and go and bring them all of the time. Nothing we can do‚Äô. I pointed out that no other hostel we have stayed in so far has had this problem. It‚Äôs a shame as the hostel its self had a lovely terrace and is located in a nice area.

Please, do not stay here. They need a reason to sort out this problem.

I have to say that- got bitten all over by bedbucks. Told the owner and he said they gonna change everything.Anyways he said: that's only bites (sure, but these little bustards just let me sleep 3 hours, so for what I am actually paying for???) Later on came back to get my luggage and checked the room- they just prepared everything for the next guest. They just don't care! Ask at breakfast for a second coffee, cause I haven't slept- "no more coffee' Floor under the bed full of dust! Blankets were smelling like cheese!
But I got charged for a full night for like 3 hours sleep and 20 bites which got swollen. Really not ok!!!

review title: Nice place to stay in Asilah
review: We got a bit scared reading the reviews even thought they were older ones but we were pleasantly surprised. Nice spacious room with recently renovated bathroom,food in the restaurant was tasty and the garden and swimmingpool were clean and really nice. They say the tapwater is drinkable, we didn't want to take the gamble and ordered a liter bottle of water but 50 Dirham or ‚Ç¨ 5 seemed a bit out of place.

review title: Avoid this Hotel - is a disaster
review:
ve stayed at this hotel three times, and each time it gets worse. This last visit was absolutely unacceptable.

‚Ä¢ No Hot Water: I asked for hot water three times, and each time I was given excuses. They claimed the water heater was broken, but it was clear they deliberately shut off the hot water when there weren‚Äôt enough guests. When a group of Asian tourists arrived, the hot water was suddenly available, but as soon as they left, it was turned off again. As a Moroccan from Canada visiting my home country, I found this treatment deeply disrespectful. It seems they prioritize foreign tourists over locals.
‚Ä¢ Terrible Rooms: The rooms are outdated, smell awful, and are not clean. The faucet in my bathroom was broken, adding to the frustration.
‚Ä¢ Inedible Breakfast: While breakfast was included, it was so bad that it was practically inedible. The cheese was spoiled, and the overall quality was extremely poor.
‚Ä¢ No Accountability: Despite all these issues, they still charged me full price without offering any discount, apology, or acknowledgment of their terrible service. The lack of consideration is shocking.

This place is a disaster. I would strongly advise anyone to avoid staying here. It‚Äôs not worth the money or the stress.

Nice hotel within walking distance from the town centre. Comfortable, clean room - the door wouldnt stay shut unless it was locked. I was looking forward to the pool, but we couldnt use it for some reason. Restaurant food was ok, service a bit slow.

A comfortable stay in this modern hotel just outside the town. Comfortable en suite rooms with balconies overlooking the sea (there is a road inbetween). We dined in the restaurant two nights and the food was very good. The pool had a problem while we were there so no able to use it which was disappointing. Staff very friendly and helpful.

we stayed at the hotel for 3 nights, upon our arrival we were poorly received by the receptionist Mustapha, no welcome or hello and after checking our reservation he told us that there is no room available with a double bed on the ground floor, although we have a baby that we carry with the stroller, he gave us a room on the 1st floor overlooking the beach but not suitable for a family since the balcony door is broken so risky for my child of 5 years in addition to the stairs, after we insisted on our request and we refused this room he gave us a room on the ground floor while initially he completely refused, when we asked for payment he gave us answered incorrectly, plus the breakfast needs to be improved

just a hotel not recommended, we were disappointed‚Ä¶
Rooms with trashed locks, not to mention the bathroom (hot water is limited to a certain time), breakfast is limited to a few foods‚Ä¶
In any case, it doesn't deserve the Four Stars.

The customer service employee was in constant contact with us on a daily basis, checking on the progress of our trip and our conditions.

Praise be to God, we did not see from them anything but excellent and credible dealings, and they were responsive to us, even in private matters that had nothing to do with them.

review title: The most welcoming and beautiful garden, pool was incredible
review: I was travelling alone and stumbled upon this place thinking I might take a drink. I had the most wonderful welcome and got taken to a table by the pool. The menu looked good, so decided to try the seafood tagine. WOW. Honestly, the best tagine I have had. The seafood was so fresh and the calamari rings were incredible. A mixture of prawns, swordfish, white fish and squid. I got chatting to the owner whilst he was tending to the garden. He obviously takes a lot of care, the garden was so beautiful and he brought me fresh flowers for the table. I ended up spending the day there and relaxed by the pool and took a swim. I wish I had booked here instead of my apartment as it is difficult for a female solo traveller to find relaxed spaces to sunbathe and feel comfortable alone at the beach. The care, attention and hospitality at this hotel is 10/10. I loved the music too that came on early evening, they were getting ready for a birthday party on the terrace overlooking the sea, so nice, what a fantastic venue for a celebration! Alcohol is not served in this part of the hotel, or the restaurant which I thought was very respectful towards the local people. I would 100% book this hotel for a future visit to Asilah and I thank you so much to the owner Sharif and his staff for looking after me so well :)

review title: Good location right along the beach and beautiful beach
review: Friendly staff. Beautiful grounds and right near the beach. Recommend just using the pool though because the beach is quite dirty and smelly. Rooms were quite spacious and had a balcony overlooking the main area where the pool was. Breakfast was basic but delicious.

Bathroom mat was soaking wet when we entered the room. The bathroom and front door don‚Äôt close properly and swing open. The worst part was the music echoing through the hotel in the middle of the night from the nightclub when you are trying to sleep :(

If the staff is charming and attitive it is not DE the same DE l infrastructure, indeed the poor and only boy who makes omelets at breakfast and on his own and has only a hob DE:Consequence you wait DE more than 1/2 hour to have a simple omelet with a tail DE 10 people minimum; the coffee, tea, milk machines systematically have a lack DE something and you only have water ... the staff does everything possible but it is not worthy of a hotel or high rate.
The room is clean but the bathroom leaves much to be desired.Brief to avoid EN high season

review title: A pleasant setting, but a very disappointing experience
review:
We had originally booked at Hotel Quemado, but upon receipt of the confirmation, we discovered that it related to Hotel Mohammed V, without any explanation. If we had not taken the time to check, we would have been very surprised when we arrived. It was necessary to call to correct the reservation, which is not normal for an establishment of this level.

The hotel‚Äôs location remains a real asset, with a beautiful sea view, but this does not compensate for the many disappointments encountered on site.

The elevator is constantly occupied by staff, which creates very long waits, especially when staying on the upper floors.

The cleanliness of the rooms clearly leaves something to be desired: dust under the beds, poorly cleaned floor, rough towels... We are far from expected standards.

The catering rates are excessive and unjustified in view of the quality offered.

Fortunately, the reception staff stands out for their professionalism and kindness. Animation for children is also a positive point to highlight.

In summary, despite some positives, I would not recommend this hotel to my loved ones.

Very nice hotel with a nice atmosphere party part l entertainment team, the view is great, direct to the beach of al hoceima extra ordinary, we will absolutely return next year with the whole family, also the port to eat fish hmmmmm

Excellent hotel, with splendid sea views.
High quality service, impeccable buffet.
I had the pleasure of staying in your establishment, a most pleasant experience........üëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëåüëå

Hotel mercury quimado 
A warm welcome , impeccable service and exceptional quality at every moment.thank you for this unforgettable experience in your magnificent establishment...üí™üèªüí™üèªüí™üèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèªüèªüí™üèª

Beautiful location by the sea , relaxing and ideal during this quiet period, especially with family. Spacious rooms with splendid views and large terrace. Helpful team, impeccable cleanliness of rooms. I highly recommend

review title: There was no experience by rules of the last century
review: Well we had reservation my partner and I and being the Moroccan and not being married did not let us leave together, we propose to rent 2 rooms and much more expensive. So we're going somewhere else. But good that this measure is from the last century, I even showed pictures to the reception boy that I had been with him for a long time and there was no way because we did not have the document to be married.  You should make the booking look at these regulations...

Thank you for the welcome and the availability of the staff especially Mr Yassine an immense pleasure spent in this beautiful establishment everything is perfect room and equipment with great view from the The room and terrace with a very beautiful view, nothing to say either.

I would like to express my sincere thanks to Yacine, the hotel's head reception. His exceptional welcome and valuable help made my stay really enjoyable. Thank you for your impeccable service!
Thank you my boss infinitely

I would like to extend a big thank you to Yacine, the head reception of the hotel. His warm welcome, professionalism and attention to detail greatly improved my stay. Thank you for your excellent service!
Thank you very much, Chief.

Your customer approach needs to be reviewed 
Dry method
High Pricing
Beautiful location but the best part 
On any first experience that was not positive
I've been here twice and not once have the waitresses not been. Worst choice !!!!!!!!!! Not a good choice
Very spacious I highly recommend there is a cafe restaurant pizzeria and a very nice view many seveur thank you
Great views and very nice cafe. The owner is very friendly and helpful. The servers are very pleasant.

Avoid in the evening if you are in a hurry. It's loooooong.
I do not recommend orange juice because it is cut with water.
The waiters do their best but the restaurant may be too big.

The place is wonderful because it overlooks the sea, but the treatment and service are below standard. I hope the project owner tries to review the comments because they may motivate him to succeed more.

review title: The best view of the Quemado Beach !!
review: Been there early morning, around 09:30am (yes it's early for the region), and enjoyed a yummy local breakfast.

Excellent position, on the top of the cliff, you can spend a moment admiring the Quemado beach and, if the horizon is clear, you can equally enjoy the view of the entire Al Hoceima Bay. Rather have a glass of Morroccan tea than lunch...
Very poor service it's not very busy it's just a no service place we had to wait and hour for our drinks

review title: Poor service and food, but a great view
review:
Located in a neighborhood with crowded streets, you'll have to walk around the many parked cars from other guests before you arrive at Espace Mirimar.

Unfortunately, this was just the start of a poor experience. The waiter forgot pieces of the 'menu complet', the guest toilets are mere holes in the ground, and flies and stray cats thrive at this place. 

It's a shame, really, because the place itself and its views on Playa Quemado and the harbor are beautiful.

review title: Amazing View - A shaded retreat from sitting on the street
review: During our visit to Al Hoceima I have been having my coffee or breakfast at street side cafes, as most people do. The Espace Mirimar offers a beautiful garden retreat overlooking the white sand beach and harbor far below. Service was wonderful and our bread, eggs and coffee were to perfection. The freshly squeezed orange juice was the best I have had. Worth a repeat trip.

I visited the Espace Mirimar with my wife and brother, we had the most wonderful coffee with side pastries and a view that made our trip even more special. If you happen to be visiting Al Hoceima I would highly recommend visiting the Miramar, you find the staff extremely pleasant and the surroundings speak for themselves ‚Ä¶ enjoy.

review title: The price is higher than service
review: I was there for one night with friends, some parts of the hotel was under construction so the atomsphere wasn't good and breakfast was poor the staff at the restaurant are not welcoming. for one night stay is ok in the day was noisy with constructions, they should improve the service more.

review title: Hotel La Perla is an absolutely NO GO
review:
Als je een grote fan bent van bedorven vlees en je maag uitkotsen dan is La Perla Hotel ideaal voor jou. 
If you enjoy rotten food and puking your guts out than La Perla Hotel is the place to be.
Hotel La Perla is an absolutely NO GO.

The Hotel Perla is very professional indeed. The front desk helpful and courteous. The room was large and very clean. The position is terrific you can certainly walk to everything. The breakfast was the usual Moroccan breakfast. There is parking in front of the hotel. A great spot for a couple of nights. Al  Hociema is a delightful small city with very friendly people.

Stayed in for 4 nights, the room is quite large, clean and the bed comfortable. The window isolation isn't that good it's a little bit noisy in the morning. The sanitary equipment need some good cleaning.
The price is fair enough and the hotel is located near to downtown.

We stumbled upon this place by coincidence as we had no plans to even stop in Hoceima on this trip. The city was full of local visitors (as it always is in the summer), so we were not lucky with two hotels before we found la Perla. We did not expect much as its exterior is fairly run-down. But what a surprise! A completely renovated interior with modern and spotlessly clean room is what was awaiting us! On the top of it the breakfast was very nice and the staff was smiling. Recommended!

For those who want to stay in Al Hoceim at the Maroccan Mediterranean coast I certainly advice you to book at La Perla.
Run by a Dutch-Maroccan manager thus hotel is excellent in terms of cleanness,  efficency and price/quality. Spending bathroom with rain type shower no bathtub. Restaurant on the first floor. Centrally situated.

review title: Good value hotel in the middle of Al Hoceima
review: I just finished a two day stay in this multi-story hotel in Al Hoceima on the northern coast of Morocco. It is a three star hotel nicely located in the middle of downtown Al Hoceima. It has about 30 rooms. The rooms are on the small side, but are clean as are the bathrooms. The restaurant was more than acceptable specializing in local fish dishes. The local calamari was excellent. The service in the hotel and the restaurant was also excellent. The hotel offers free internet in the rooms (with a cable they provide) or free WIFI in the lobby/reception area. The internet worked very well. There was plenty of hot water in the showers and the wall mounted air conditioner/heater worked well. Since the hotel is in the middle of town, and across the street from a small soccer stadium, it can be noisy at times. I didn't notice it as much as my colleagues did (and my room faced the street). There is very little choice in Al Hoceima and this hotel is perfectly suitable. Parking was available in front of the hotel on the street and a parking attendant was present to watch the cars at night. The hotel is also very convenient to the port which is only about five minutes away.

review title: A good Moroccan dinner in Tangier
review:
Friendly staff, the best couscous I have eaten in Morocco.
Hearty and well-kept dishes
Advice for those who have dinner or lunch in Tangier

review title: Unique experience as if you had dinner at someone's house!
review:
A gem in DE kasbah-medinah of Tangier üíï!
Super cozy diner with super good food. 
We have been received very warmly, every employee made us feel at home!
Definitely recommended

review title: A true Moroccan culinary journey at Kebdani!
review:
we had the chance DE dine at Restaurant Kebdani, and it was an unforgettable experience. This restaurant is a real haven DE peace, with an authentic setting, a beautiful decoration DE and a warm atmosphere.

The welcome is simply exceptional: the staff is attentive, smiling and always ready to share anecdotes about local dishes and traditions.
This is a great place.  Nice traditional food, great and friendly service. Central location for us. Good prices.  Thanks Bilal for your service.

We spent a few days in Tanger and found this little place walking around town with delicious food, good service, and cosy atmosfear. It really felt like you were invited home to one of the locals. 
We have the lamb and chicken tajin with some sides and salads, and I can say it was one of the best tajin dishes I've had. 
We finished the meal with some traditional maroccan tea, which is my absolute favourite. 
Would definitely come back here for my next visit to Tanger.
It was a wonderful experience, the food was delicious, the staff was very friendly and helpful, especially Bilal. Congratulations to the entire Kebdani team.
Very good cuisine flavored with Moroccan flavors. Very good value for money. Very friendly and attentive welcome
Really really nice atmosphere and good food! Really enjoyed the experience. We got a lot of free food, including pastries, appetizers & tea. The food is excelent and very traditional.

Just ate Couscous at Kedbani restaurant. The experience was great and unexpected. The place is inside the old town and you have to walk to get to it but once you sit you get a great service. The appetizers were tasty. And the Couscous was a good surprise because everywhere we went we were told that Couscous is only available on Fridays. Today is Sunday and this place doesn‚Äôt abide by that rule. It was a good and large meal especially the beef one. Ended the course with Moroccan tea and pastries. Paid 200 dirhams for a dinner for two including tip and it was worth it. This is less than US $25. Note that they don‚Äôt accept credit cards. Highly recommended.

review title: We loved the food and service
review:
Bilal has been an excellent waiter!
The plates are generous and delicious.
An entire experience in the beautiful city of Tangier.

We ate very well, the attention and care were excellent, the food was very good. Special mention to Bilal, very attentive and kind!
Recommended site!
The best place in Tangier to eat couscous, a pleasant and cozy place, 100% recommended. Bilal has treated us wonderfully.
I have eaten very well and Bilal has treated us very well and of the minors I have seen, I highly recommend him, you will find the best and very good.
Bilal gave us VIP treatment, attentive, professional and friendly. Furthermore, the food was yummy and the atmosphere was great. Absolutely worth visiting!
The waiters were very welcoming and the food was very good. Thank you for sharing your experience.

The Food was amazing and freshly made!!!
The waitress was very nice and friendly, the Price was more than fair.
We paid around 35MAD per Person. 
The Atmosphere was very calm and comfortable

review title: Authentic restaurant at a very good price
review: Authentic Moroccan restaurant at a very good price. No tourist scam like elsewhere. Simple, authentic and the service is great, they make you feel at home.

Tucked away in the alleys of Chefchaouen, this family-run restaurant felt like stepping into a Moroccan home. The warm welcome and heartfelt hospitality made the experience truly special.

The food was outstanding ‚Äî the fish tagine was tender and rich, the couscous light and perfectly spiced, and the zaalouk full of deep, smoky flavor. Even the mint tea, poured with care, stood out as something memorable.

If you‚Äôre nearby, don‚Äôt miss this hidden gem. It‚Äôs Morocco at its most authentic.

Caution: The restaurant is very basic and down to earth. Go here for good food and not the ambience
We found the kitchen very good, very good value for money, very nice welcome, the setting is however not very nice.
Delicious lunch in the blue city in this cozy restaurant. A bit away from the crowds we had a nice meal; couscous with chicken, minced tagine and tasty salads. Delicious!
We loved this spot enough so that my partner and I returned for a second night. The food was incredible and the couple that was running the place are so sweet to interact with.
Very cozy and authentic Moroccan restaurant. The dishes were delicious, tasty and very local. Price was very convenient and good service too!

I highly recommend the place. It's cheap and good, I felt like eating at home. We ordered harira soup, chickpeas and a spinach dish. All that plus a large bottle of water ‚Ç¨6. Besides, they gave us warm bread, oil and olives, delicious too. It is a quiet place, away from the bustle of downtown. If I ever return to Chaouen, I will definitely repeat!
Pleasant environment, nice owners, friendly and efficient! Really appetizing home cooking and great service! Recommended for anyone passing by Chefchaouen! We went back for two nights!
Restaurant very charming and very good very good I recommend and the juices is the strike üëçüèº and it is very well located in the old medina thank you for this meal

I came with my partner we have come out delighted, very family atmosphere.
We ordered a Moroccan salad, chicken couscous and rfissa.  The owners very friendly at all times.
If you want a place with homemade food and a nice atmosphere I definitely recommend you come!!

We chose this restaurant by consulting the app. 
It was a wise choice, the restaurant is simple but comfortable and warm.
The welcome lives up to the reputation of Moroccans.
The food is tasty. Moroccan mothers‚Äô cuisine without equal!
I will come back to that without hesitation.

We went 8 people to eat, the price was great. The food very good, the woman who attended us very polite and helpful.
Upon entering we were greeted with olives bread and cheese. All the food is homemade made by her
Great food and the family is really nice! One of the best couscous meals I‚Äôve ever had. I would recommend to order a fruit shake! They are all homemade.
The best lunch I have ever had in Morocco. I loved the couscous of chicken any the prices is so affordable. Soooo recommended!

The best hotel I have ever visited. It's clean, the rooms are great with everything you need, but the best part is the warmth, hospitality and helpfulness the guests are greeted with. The breakfast and Lofti's dinner are phenomenal. If you want to stay in a hotel with heart and soul, then the place is worth visiting.

review title: The best hotel in town - the owner is the most amazing person we have met in Morocco
review: An excellent hotel in Oujda, probably the best in town. Not only the location is super inside the Medina, and the rooms are wide and comfortable (more like a small apartment), the breakfast is the best we had during our 3 months stay in the country and the price is very reasonable. But above all, it is Lutfi, the owner who makes the big difference. He will come to pick you up whether you arrive by train, plane or taxi. He will take you for a walk in the old city and show you the best place to have dinner and he will constantly bring you food to eat and shakes to drink. This gentleman is just amazing. Highly, highly recommended!!

review title: Nice and quite place for night break
review: I stayedin this hotel for a night after long day travelling, it was nice night bresk the guy in the deck is nice and treat us goodroom is comfort hot shower and heater working good the price is reasonable. Locstion is good near to restaurants and shops and train station. I recomend this for travellers.

Hi, 
Morocco is a famous tourist destination among those you are into history, culture and cuisine. Among the flocks, majority miss out this beautiful city of Oujda. 
There are plenty to see and experience this city. I chose this hotel for my three night stay. It is reasonably priced. Booked via booking dot com so easy to book while I was in England. 
I booked double suite which had attached bathroom. Clean and well looked after premise. Service is of good standard. Staff friendly and helpful. You can add breakfast or meal if fancied. 
All in all recommended.

I was just rolling back into Oujda on a CTM and I wanted a nice place to sleep before catching my train the next day. I got off the bus, turned the corner, and fell in love with Hotel Hanaa. The receptionist, Rachid, was super cool. I got his second to last room. It tells you something when one hotel is booked up and the others around have plenty of rooms. The rooms on the second floor all have amazing balconies onto the square. But the third floor gives roof access to see the square below and the mosque across the street. The rooms themselves were very warm and comfortable. The beds were clean. This is a budget hotel to be sure (I paid 60 Dh. Doubles with a shower in the room are closer to 150 Dh). I was very happy to stay here for the evening!

review title: Magical place ! We will be back !
review:
From the check-in to the checkout, going through the strategical location , all the experience was great ! Oujda is such a beautiful city, and going to a Riad rather than a hotel was the best choice. The breakfast was very rich and the Moroccan hospitality at its best !
Thanks for the great experience !

review title: An address to keep very precious
review: DAR EL FASSIA: a haven of peace, in the center of the historic district of Oujda, which has its practicality, considering the difficulties to find a taxi at certain times... Small address away from the bustle of the city. From the entrance, a complete change of scenery, a small quiet nest, with a sought after and harmonious decoration. My room, well appointed and provided with a bathroom with all the equipment, was very spacious and the bedding very comfortable. I asked for a traditional breakfast that I found delicious and varied. And above all, I was pleasantly surprised by the welcome, availability and kindness of the Inn Manager, Mr. BRAHIM, whom I thank so much. In short, a place I enjoyed very much and I intend to return to as soon as possible.

Clean establishment, very well located close to souks, taxis, restaurants.
 We occupied 2 rooms for 6 days and felt at home.
 the breakfast is plentiful and delicious, the owners are very good advice, ready to help us with all our requests.

Excellent stopover to make in Oujda. Small 4 bedroom Ryad located in the center of Oujda. The boss Brahim is really very pleasant and friendly. You can park the car in front of the Ryad. Breakfast is a treat. Fresh breads and croissants.

Amazing experience. The riad is safe and 1 min walk from the historical souk and big mosque. Very quiet during the night. The hospitality of the host and his staff is so welcoming I definitely want to come back. The rooms are high standards, airco, heating, big bed and hot shower. There is lovely authentic decorations. The rooms are exceptionally clean. WiFi is good.

The hotel is small with a very nice Riad ambiance. The rooms are quite spacious and open in the patio. Friendly and helpful owner and staff. Great breakfast taken in the patio. There is a very decent wifi

Good. Stay hotel. . Good services. .. very clean. . Nice people. . Midtown location. . Very nice looking opened by friendly person. Recommended For any type of visit .. very good for family. . I have very nice Stay with lot of helps

The owner of the Riad is a very nice man; he wants to help you with everything! He picks us up from the airport and brings us to several places. The Riad is on a perfect location and they serve lovely morrocan food!

Near Oujda medina, it's clean and nice. Easy to find, with breakfast and dinner available with good honey and superbe tajine. The host is helpful and kind and the wifi works pretty much well..........

among the best Japanese restaurants in Oujda 
excellent hygiene
pleasant and warm environment
very helpful personal

review title: So nice we came back a second time!

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: Amazing food and cocktails! Highly recommend having a meal here. Service was friendly and lovely. Wild West spring rolls were my fav.

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: Juste perfect , thank you for this beautiful dinner. It is juste perfect , the personal is also perfect . The rols are delicious. Thank you

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: First time ever I‚Äôm writing a review but for the food I ate today it is completely worth it. I enjoyed every single spring rol, it was really frkng amazing. Was such a delight !  I will definitely come back for sure.

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: Delicious fresh spring rolls, great choice of mocktails (which at 7 months pregnant is ideal!) lovely staff, complimentary little drink and water is perfect. Would recommend!

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review title: Superbe combination of cocktails EN spring rolls
review: We were able to step straight from our hotel into the restaurant.  Both cocktails EN spring rolls particularly tasty.  Also very cozy place (only in DE evening DE peace was drowned out by a karaoke bar across DE street:-(

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review title: Lovely restaurant, well worth a visit
review:
I had green salad bowl with deep fried chicken spring rolls.
Food was excellent, very nice and friendly staff. I will definitely come back.

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review:
Cute concept and a great place for a family meal out. We loved the variety of spring rolls, great to see lots of vegetarian options there too. Lovely cocktails to top it off and the service from the staff was great. All set in a beautiful garden atmosphere. 
Lovely meal out for our family, highly recommended

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: For a casual night out for springs rolls this place is great! The atmosphere is amzing and the staff friendly and helpful.

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: The perfect oasis in Siem Reap. The food was super fine. The service outstanding. Even my teenage girls were impressed üòÑ.

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: Wonderfully relaxed and repeatable experience and my daughter loved it even the fresh spring rolls üòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄüòÄ

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review title: Loved it so much would go back every night!
review:
Leckere Auswahl in h√ºbscher Atmosph√§re, the greenery is pretty and the possibility to eat salat spring rolls, cheesy once and sweet ones all together made it for me even better 
You can't go hungry home, it's so good

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review:
Vild in Siem Reap isn't just a restaurant, it's a culinary experience that will redefine your perception of the humble spring roll. Forget everything you thought you knew, because this place takes the classic to dizzying new heights with an imaginative array of variations that are nothing short of genius.
From the moment you step in, you're greeted with a vibrant, inviting atmosphere. But the real magic begins when the food arrives. Each spring roll is a miniature work of art, bursting with fresh, vibrant flavors. I tried a selection, and honestly, every single one was a revelation. The fillings range from traditional to daringly innovative - and with surprisingly rich vegetarian options, and even a dessert spring roll that blew my mind. The textures are perfect, the ingredients are incredibly fresh, and the dipping sauces are crafted to complement each unique roll perfectly.
The concept of a restaurant solely dedicated to spring rolls might seem niche, but Vild proves it's a winning formula when executed with such passion and creativity. The service was attentive and knowledgeable, guiding me through the extensive menu with enthusiasm. If you're looking for an unforgettable meal in Siem Reap that's both delicious and incredibly unique, do yourself a favor and visit Vild. It's easily a 5-star experience and a must-try for any food lover!

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: Super sweet service and delicious spring rolls and cocktails! The wage bill rainbow was our favorite! Hugely recommended!! Super nice place in the middle of Siem reap:)

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: This place was incredible! From the staff to the food to the cocktails to the ambience. I was nervous drinking any spirits in Cambodia after recent deaths from cocktails but this place is totally above board with delicious cocktails. They are very clear about the quality and standard of their food and it did not disappoint. Kids wanted to go back every night we were here! Highly recommend every spring roll but the ceasar was a particular favourite. Bravo to everyone at Wild for a fabulous restaurant!

place name: WILD - Creative Bar & Spring Rolls Restaurant
review: Amazing Spring Rolls, great variety. Fantastic balance of flavour and temperature to eat. Love the cocktail menu and choose your own adventure page to select a drink. Something different.

A hotel that does not correspond at all to a 5*. I've been to 3* hotels in much, much higher.
Food varied and with little choice, even being aware that we are in Africa.
Common areas (mainly bar access to the pool) without any cleaning and with very bad smell. They only care about cleaning the floor of the buffet support bathrooms, but forget about everything else.
Spacious room, but with bad bath area, including with open door access to tubes. Taking a bath in the late afternoon is an almost impossible task, since the water has only one wire running in the shower, virtually without any pressure. Hotel deserved a very big upgrade in the bathrooms of the rooms. Gel washing hands is a very scarce.
It was appreciated by the staff of the bars (mainly the Lobby and the Moroccan bar) and some members of the animation, who seek to create good moments, as well as positively highlight the pools.
However, no one respects the hotel's rules and there's no one watching these situations.
A place to never go back, for sure.
And, as I've seen in response to other comments, the hotel says it will try to improve, but it's not what you see...

Fine animation
Great hotel
Friendly staff and friendly staff
Small minus is the DE tention of the suite we had booked EN, and the DE tention of mean DE parts but otherwise a top holiday also for the children
Little net, could serve more Mediterranean food. The gym could be more airy. The pools are good, the beach is close and the people are nice.
Hotel spectacular, good pools, varied food, bottled water (other hotels not and bottled), rooms with plenty of space, direct access to the beach which is also very good, TOP animation.

I stayed for 7 days and honestly do not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Right on the first day, the room was changed and the reception showed total disinterest in resolving the situation. During the stay, bed linen was not changed, while bath towels (used only once) were changed daily, but the foot towel was systematically forgotten. The toilet paper looked like a luxury item, it had to be ordered several times and without ever making its replacement, forcing to go to the cleaning team directly, the reception ignored it.

In the bathroom, we suffered a flood. For two days, the ‚Äúsolution‚Äù was to put towels on the floor, only on the third day they arranged the tubes from the toilet. Not to mention that I called 4 times and went personally to the reception 2 times, and not so, being obliged to contact the guide of the travel agency to resolve this matter.

Food was one of the most negative points.
Extremely repetitive and of poor quality:
‚Ä¢ Breakfast: exposed yogurts without refrigeration, in large cups, at considerable heat, without any concern for food safety. The omelettes and fried eggs were made in a dirty sheet, rarely cleaned.
‚Ä¢ Lunch and dinner: very little variety, always the same proteins day after day.
The same plywood hygiene problems persisted, without care or frequent cleaning.
‚Ä¢ Drinks and water: rarely fresh water, without worrying about serving properly. The drinks were served with a lack of hygiene that he had never witnessed in a hotel.

In the dining rooms, general hygiene was virtually nonexistent. I came to see food products packaged directly on the floor before being served, and the staff did not show any care in handling the food.

It was a very bad experience in all aspects, from hygiene to service and food quality. Clearly, a hotel that doesn't care about the guests. I do not recommend at all.
Best hotel with an impressive vibe and remarkable services, simo has been helpful since my entire stay me and my friends thank so much for their efforts

Generally very weak, 3* at most.
Good rooms, large and with good insulation, toilet with pets in the bath and in poor condition. Insufficient room cleaning as well as no shampoo or bath gel for a week.
Beach with dirty sand, no support bar or toilet. Vendors constantly bother people, who are on holiday and rest.
Pools with plenty of loungers, unfortunately there is no vigilance for the people who "reserve" loungers with towels all day and do not appear there (as set out in the hotel regulations).
Very weak animation, few activities and always repeated. Animators encourage guests to rate the Hotel on TripAdvisor.
In addition to considering a huge lack of hygiene to be allowed to enter the pool to people dressed, such as, wash the slippers at the entrance of the pool.
The staff (rescuers) are sitting under a hat, can't speak any language except Arabic and allow everything...even glasses of drinks inside the pool and after empty to serve as bars to play with the water.
Wifi only in the lobby and pool.
Crabs at the buffet and the lobby.
Last but not least the food, a lot of Moroccan variety and few other options. There are pizzas (always the same, with tomato and cheese). All food is sweet, sweet sauces, etc...
Swimming pool snack with few options, many fried, no ice cream or other possible options like dogs or hamburgers. Huge flies on the food.
Bottled water always available.
Hotel in need of many changes, I hope that the less positive reviews, serve for possible improvements for those who visit you.
Finally, I want to thank guide Mahmoud for his professionalism and constant contact.

Clogged and dirty toilet. Repeated and poor quality food. Animation almost nonexistent.
Broken taps in the room. There is no beach support nor wc nor bar.
Many employees are untrained and serve well only those who give them gratification .
Wi-Fi is almost nonexistent .
Positive public spaces
Staff 5 stars, from the reception to the fantastic animation staff. Restaurants with a great variety of food. I highly recommend!

The hotel is good for families and has good animation, the food for children could improve.
The beach is good, and close to the hotel which is comfortable for the kids.

I had a wonderful experience at the Radisson Blu Garden Sa√Ødia. The hotel is beautiful, clean, and very well-maintained, with spacious rooms and a relaxing atmosphere. The gardens and pool areas are stunning and perfect for a peaceful getaway.
One of the highlights of my stay was definitely the entertainment team they brought so much energy and joy every day! A special thanks to Hakim, without a doubt the best entertainer. His charisma, humor, and positive attitude made every activity more fun and memorable. Whether it was sports, games, or evening shows, Hakim always gave his best and created an amazing vibe.
Thank you to the whole team for making my holiday unforgettable. I‚Äôll definitely come back and recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a great time in Sa√Ødia!

Worst city, inhumain treatment of animals, horses are being constantly wipped at the beach, dogs walking with very bad injuries, cats practically dead on the streets and worst of all dogs are trapped in metal enclosures at the port in the boiling sun with no water, air and are chained.

City feels like a war zone. I do not know whether they are rebuilding or whether the city always looks like that. Beware of scammers. All taxi drivers try to do you in. Only places that was worthwhile to visit were Rick's Cafe for interior although the cocktails were horrible, La Sqala - really good food and friendly service and the big new mosque o. The waterfront. Mind boggling that they spent so much money building that mosque and the city is in a complete state of disrepair

Better plan ur trip what places to visit. You can go with group tour or private. If you go as private family tour then 1st clarify how much you are paying as tour company's driver will ask for money in advance even to pay for patrol. Also ask tour company how long you are going stay there etc. The petrol stations on the dual carriageway are excellent. You can have a nice break i.e. breakfast or a quick snack with drinks all sorts. You need haggle prices to Casablanca as some tour companies can charge ridiculous prices. You can pay up to 1300 Derhams for up to 6 people which is reasonable but plan ahead going at 7 or 8am in the morning and coming back at 16.00 or 17.00.

Slow service and the food lacked taste. The pizzas were horrible and overpriced. There are so many more better options in Saidia; like buying your own meat/fish on the market and take it to one of their restaurants. They will grill it for you for a few dirhams.

review title: As expected minimal changes over time
review:
Just thought I would update you having finished a guided tour or Casablanca decided to walk it. 6 hours later having walked down most streets in the inner Casablanca found
Nothing like the tourist brochures. 
It is congested just like India rubbish every where derelict vehicles, building in decline. 
It appears infrastructure has not kept up with the population increase. No wonder you are told not to drink the water or touch things . 
All areas outside Casablanca are worth seeing being smaller they are maintained better.
Overall the tour of Morocco was satisfying.

Loved the Hassan ll mosque, Moroccan mall , and the Anfa place mall/ Anfa hills area is beautiful . Tamaris Aqua park and Sinbad theme park  are also great for kids. Use the red petit Taxis , they are cheap. Avoid other taxis , they are rip off. Everyone speaks French .
