review title: Dinner with a large group of our family.

review:
Busy place but we were seated faster than the time they told us. Even if we hadn't- this breakfast was worth the wait!!! Its a little pricey for breakfast- but we all left stuffed! 
Our server,  Melissa, was amazing! Never ran out of drinks and when we asked for something- it was there speedy quick! And our food was delivered just as fast! 
This place has got it going on and is a must visit again!
The food was the best breakfast we have ever had. Lots of choices and plenty of food. Something for everyone and the kids loved the m&m panckes

Absolutely love this place for breakfast. Huge delicious piece of country ham with home fries and eggs. Love all their crepes too! Heather did a great job serving us making sure we had everything we needed.

review title: The food was delicious!!! The prices are great! Wonderful atmosphere. We would really recommend eating here.
review: We had breakfast here. Our server Kimberly was wonderful! They sent her three tables at once and you would‚Äôve never known it. She did a great job with getting our food and drinks out on time as well as checking back on us and giving us amazing service. We will be back again

Great place for breakfast!  We were greeted with a friendly smile and seated quickly. Our server was friendlly and attentive. We started with pineapple mimosa. I had cheesy grits, eggs, and turkey bacon. This was the best breakfast I had in Pigeon Forge. I would definitely recommend to anyone.
Sawyer‚Äôs has amazing food, friendly service, cozy atmosphere, and great prices. Highly recommend to everyone! Definitely a must!

review title: If you're in the area - go here
review: This is my favorite place to eat breakfast. You get so much food and service is always fast. We both got the Mountain Man. It was very good. I love their pancakes and biscuits and gravy. I highly recommend if you have never ate there.
Service was lightening fast!  No wait and food came out quick. Tabitha our server was amazing. Food was good and we‚Äôd go back.

Hands down my favorite food spot on our trip. The food was amazing, and Gage our server was hilarious and provided top-notch service. 

The kids had M&M pancakes which they greatly enjoyed, while I had Sawyers Mountain Man meal which was delicious. The biscuits were amazing, and they have have additional "sauces" for pancakes. Highly recommend the peanut butter.
The food is excellent.  Our server, Kairee, was great.  She visted our table several times to see if we needed anything.  This is our favorite breakfast place..

Paige, our waitress at Sawyer‚Äôs Farmhouse was the definition of Southern hospitality‚Äîfriendly, attentive, and made us feel right at home. Great service with a warm smile made our meal even better. Highly recommend!
The food was wonderful!! And our waitress (Kim) was a jewel, she was just awesome. Will definitely be going back. We were there in the middle of the week and there was no wait to be seated.
Absolutely amazing breakfast spot to go to! The crepes are massive! Also Lisa was the sweetest ever and I would go back just for her because she was so nice and welcoming!
Gage was our server. Our food and service were amazing. We had a short wait and the food came out fast. Gage was the highlight of our experience today. We will definitely be back.
Wonderful experience! We had 2 kids and it was 4th of July. We were told 40 minutes but got in after 25 minutes. Awesome gluten free choices and great waitress!
Very good service, Paula attended us very well, the food ES very good, the service ES fast, all the time they offer you drinks and the food is refilled several times
, Very delicious food, excellent care provided POR Tatiana, we felt very comfortable on our date my partner and I thanks to the good care and food

review title: Recommended the place I would love to visit again
review:
Excellent service very good service excellent place to share with family
Recommended 
I thank Carlos POR his availability DE attention and his cordiality

Excellent food, great variety DE foods in all its categories. Very rich space the live music EN the setting. 
POR another the attention DE Carlos was very very ENto in attending us and provide us with an incredible experience
We loved the attention and accompaniment DE Carlos, who attended us and DE his staff, we will come back soon and enjoy safe DE food and atmosphere
The place ES beautiful, the food ES delicious, the drinks are good quality and Tatiana tended us very well. We would definitely return

review title: Good service and DE quality food
review: The food was buffet style, all DE very good quality and well presented. Francisco and Sergio were our waiters, both very attentive and friendly throughout the visit. I'd definitely come back.
I find the place nice the atmosphere the music the way DE aten DEr and the food and the way DE celebrate a person's birthday

review title: Victor was very kind to us, very attentive always.
review:
Excellent food and service.
It's the best Brunch in Bogota by far. The waiter victor was very attentive, he was always aware that we needed.

Victor attended us like never before! 
Excellent service and willingness to each of our requirements... 
A super rich brunch, full of variety, quite an experience!
Incredible service!, the way to attend super good, spectacular brunch, recommended one hundred percent to come with the family!.
Nice place, excellent service , delicious food and great variety, clean, safe , friendly .................

review title: Vengan al Drunch del Gran Hyatt
review: Total thanks!!! Grand Hyatt for creating wonderful experiences!!! Capitalino Restaurant absolutely delicious, we will return
We attended the nightly drunch, all very rich, food for all tastes, we were very well served all night, the live music excellent, the result a 10 out of 10 experience

The experience was amazing. The food and atmosphere was perfect. 
Added to that, Victor Escandon's attention was exceptional, always attentive and willing to make us feel comfortable.

Passing for two nights on a motorcycle trip to Senegal, we were very well received by chaimae; very nice, available and attentive, she was keen to make us enjoyable. 
His enthusiasm and kindness made us very pleased.

review title: The Moroccan charm of lost Spanish time
review: A very nice hotel well placed a few steps from the central boulevard and the large squares, quiet, with spacious and clean rooms, an interior garden, delicious breakfast, varied and especially the kind and welcoming staff. Recommended!

The newly renovated Hotel Parador is highly recommended.  Rooms are comfortable, newly renovated and well equipped.  The kitchen served great food.  The courtyards are good for relaxing.  Staff and service were friendly and efficient.

At the time of writing (March 2023) the hotel was closed and bears no signs that it ever was a hotel. The guard man came out and confirmed that the building had been a hotel but had closed. We ended up at the Sahariano in town which was fine but not a parador by any means.

Hotel Parador is a classic hotel in the style of an arabic palace. Rooms are in good shape and clean. All rooms on the ground floor have a terrace. The main court yard with its fountain is very nice. The restaurant cooks excellent food but presently with a reduced menu. Fruit served on request. Coffee available during the day from the bar. Wine and beer can be ordered in the bar or in the restaurant. Laundry available with swift service. The hotel is a little worn and prices are too high. Would need an update of the whole hotel.

This once top hotel in Laayoune still has authentic charm.
Cool corridors, arched doorways into a large courtyard, huge lounge area with wonderful original ceiling and friendly helpful staff.

Food:
We had dinner at the hotel.
We were the only diners that night.
The menu is in French and as such the cuisine heavily influenced.
Fish soup was ok, the fish fillet and beef we respectively ordered as main courses was surprisingly good.
Breakfast although basic had some local bread type products which were very tasty, jams, yoghurt, good orange juice, coffee, plus the most amazing fresh goats cheese I have ever had, which had actually been made by the guy serving us.
I usually hate goats cheese but really liked this.
Eggs were cooked to order. All sufficient to start the day.

The room:
We had room 109 on the ground floor.
Initially it looked good with its marble floor and fancy sink and tap.
Free bottled water.
Firm bed and comfortable pillows.
However upon closer inspection the bath needed a good clean and the overhead shower just dribbled, to be fair there was a hand held shower which was with lots of hot water.
The wardrobe had just three plastic hangers, no safe and was dusty, as were the drawers.
There was lots of dust and cobwebs under the bed, one power socket was hanging out of the wall.
The room opened onto a garden courtyard but was unpleasant to use due to nesting pigeons and lots of pigeon poo.

This dirty hotel could be great again with very little cost by utilising a proper clean up regime and some basic maintenance.
It is quite sad that it has been left to decline to such a standard.

review title: There were no highlights but plenty of low spots.
review: Staff condescending. Food below average in a cold soulless dining room served by staff who had no idea. Couldn‚Äôt park because one official was scheduled to attend and the Police decided to conduct an operation white gloves outriders  back up vehicles and all the rest which goes with a massive overkill. It was just symptomatic.

My first day here and pleasantly surprised. Not as modern as the hotel up the road but great staff, comfortable rooms, powerful shower and good wifi. Convenient for the airport and very happy to come againüëçüëå

I was here for a business trip. The hotel is not new, amenities at hard 3! But the staff is very polite, ready to help any time. The awful was breakfast! Nothing to eat! It was interesting story connected with this hotel. A lot of Chinese people come to stay here because the Parador hotel is connected with the name of the famous Chinese author named Echo. Close to the hotel there is a house were she lived and they visited it with the tears in eyes.

review title: A thousand and one night dream,but that was before!
review: I was there many many times from when it was new 1966.It was like a dream.Big beds,splendid bathrooms,swimming pool,nice restaurant.The suite was made for" Kings and princesses".The management was Spanish and I believe the Spanish Government was the owner.So,when Hassan the II of Maroco occupied the territory,the also occupied the hotel.And from that moment everything changed to the worse.I was there a year ago.I will say,its not possible to stay there anymore!A disaster,and a very sad story..

This is the best and newest hotel in the city of Laayoune. Staff is very helpful and rooms are clean. Breakfast is weak. You may find some cakes and pastry as a breakfast. But I was happy during with my 3 days stay in a suite at the hotel.

In a remote city (Laayoune, Western Sahara), Hotel Emilio Moretti tries hard to please.  It has no airport shuttle service.  The young man at the Hotel Reception desk was most welcoming and eager to please.  My room was quiet, clean, safe, and very tiny.  Breakfast was served at a large restaurant located on the hotel's top floor.  The city view from there was lovely.  The breakfast buffet had many baked goods to accompany hard-shell boiled eggs. My breakfast latte was delicious.

review title: A very friendly and cosy stay
review:
The hotel Casamar was a well located hotel with a staff that epitomises the generosity and hospitality of Morocco.

Whatever it lacked in beauty it made up for in charm. The rooms are clean and comfortable, with hot water in the showers. And the restaurant was affordable and very filling. They made us a vegetable tagine that was huge and we couldn't finish! A filling and varied breakfast was also included.

We would also like to say thanks to Mr. Ramadan for his warmth and helpfulness.

This is probably the best hotel in the area. Rooms are clean and there is hot water. WIFI free but iffy. 

It‚Äôs a bit noisy due to a restaurant downstairs that attracts football viewers. 

Dinner was ok. They are flexible in terms of the tagines, salads, meats and French fries they make. Breakfast was a plan omelette and yummy toasted Arab mezzo bread with olives, jams and olive oil.

Decent enough place for one night but bring ear plugs.

If you are in business visit and you want a relaxing night sleep i do not recommend it at all, you could hear your neighbour showering and cars outside you won't get any peace of sleep at all , you would woken up by each passing motocycle and car outside

It's a pleasant get-out-of-town stop. The rooms are good with extremely firm beds. Wifi moderately reliable. Prices likely to fluctuate depending on if you are white : female / single! A few words of Arabic go a long way. Lovely waitress in the restaurant. Close to Antonine de Saint expert remembrance statue

I have stayed at the Casamar and it is the best in Tarfaya. You are less likely to become ill with the food and one of the main points is that due to the location you do not hear all of the noise. No mosques, animals or locals. If you require Wifi you will be required to be selective regarding your room choice. For me it is either staying here or in Laayoune. 

The owner of the hotel is Spanish so he has higher expectaions of what his hotel should be run like. 

If your require a fridge they will put one in your room.

Also, please rememeber that my ratings are that for Tarfaya, if it was scored as to what is expected in Europe it would not do so well.

A very good hotel. We were driving around the south of Morocco, heading to Laayoune and needed somewhere to crash for a night before hitting the road again in the morning. We came across Casamar. It was great value for money, 200 dirhams for a twin room, this included breakfast in the cafe. Rooms were very clean too! We also had dinner in the restaurant which was good. The fried fish was great.
Even if the preparation takes a little time, you appreciate good taste like even, and at the reception there is a beautiful girl

Sushikom in Laayune is a true standout, offering a take-out sushi experience that defies the norm. Despite limited space for table dining, this hidden gem has set an impressive standard. From the ease of ordering to the secure and visually appealing packaging, every detail reflects a commitment to excellence.

The menu boasts a variety of sushi rolls, sashimi, and nigiri, each piece showcasing fresh ingredients and meticulous preparation. The chefs' dedication to quality is evident in the impeccable taste, with the flavors and textures preserved even during transport.

What makes Sushikom  truly exceptional is its staff. Despite being a take-out joint, their proficiency in English and polite service add an unexpected charm to the experience. Sushikom  has successfully transformed the notion of sushi take-out in a city where it's not the norm.

For anyone craving an outstanding take-out sushi experience in Laayune, Sushikom  is a must-try. Their ability to deliver top-notch quality and service, even without a dine-in option, has undoubtedly elevated the sushi scene in the city. I'm already looking forward to my next sushi adventure with Sushikom

Unfortunately, I missed snapping photos, but Sushikom¬¥s sushi lived up to its online visuals with meticulous presentation and a delightful experience.

review title: Highly recommend for best Sushi in the Sahara
review: Best sushi in Laayoune and highly recommend. Very fresh fish and great tastes by their excellent master chef.

review title: Cash only, new building, poorly trained staff
review:
This hotel and the adjoining Hotel Rio are operated as a single property. Both buildings are new and have fairly large rooms.

No heating (a problem in the winter), and "the credit card machine is broken" (in other words, the hotel does not want to accept credit cards - they take cash only).

Located in a quiet area.  Beds are very hard, even by Moroccan standards.

Staff are very poorly trained, with no understanding of the hotel / hospitality business at all.

That notwithstanding, it is suitable for a business traveler,

A local hotel in a residential area close to centre.taxis readily available.staff are friendly & helpful.there is a bar serving cafe/drinks.The open lobby has plenty of seats.open area patio on front.there are toilets/lift/Free WiFi.Room was standard size with desk/chair/aircon .comfortable bed.Bathroom is small old style.Lighting mixed .Housekeeping & breakfast incl.no credit cards accepted(cash only).prices are reasonable.no restaurant on site.

The room was nice and large, although the toilet, which was clean, didn't respect the standards that the price of the room requires. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Location is not perfect but in a nice area and the most alive part of the city can be easily reached with a 15' walk.

Located on the wrong side of town and about 1km from the middle of the city. OK if you're visiting the university, the courts or the military barracks alongside. The neighbourhood is safe enough if you keep to the main road and well lit streets. Try to avoid entering the residential district opposite and to the left. Otherwise the local area is safe enough and the local people friendly and eager to offer assistance, although maybe only in Arabic, French or maybe Spanish and English only if you're very lucky, as I was.

I had room 317, the suite, at no extra charge. Sumptuous by local standards and just 26 ‚Ç¨ a night. Very clean in general throughout the hotel, the room was air conditioned, the sheets crisp, towels still white and the elegance of the towel origami on the bed and the provision of a prayer mat an unexpected touch.

The bathroom was serviceable although the water pressure at times was a dribble, especially during power cuts, when the Wi-Fi, air con, lighting and lifts also were out of service. This I believe is unusual, and was the result during my stay of torrential rains (in the Sahara!). The receptionists were very courteous and helpful. I was even offered a candle during the power cut (bring a lighter) and escorted to my room by mobile phone torch.

Breakfast is lots of cut baguette, and typical hotel packed individual butter, marmalade, a pot of yogurt, plus a dish of olive oil and another of olives. The coffee is espresso but the cappuccino almost all froth, as is customary here. Try the local tea, it's quite a ceremony, watch and learn!

I won't be going back to El Aaiun in a hurry, if ever, but I'd stay here again, for the price.

review title: Great, traditional restaurant with good food!
review: Simply delicious food! Everything was good from starter (Moroccan soup), to tagine vegetarian as main course to DE yoghurt with honey EN almonds for dessert. Good bedi ENing and very cozy atmosphere. Recommended!!

Very nice place with typical decoration.
Family cuisine, hearty and very tasty with menus from 95 to 110 dirhams ... possibility to take √† la carte. 
HOME very attentive , thank you for the small attentions.
An excellent address

review title: Go ahead with your eyes closed.
review:
Discreet restaurant, Moroccan decoration, very attentive staff, and menu at 95 dirham (9.5‚Ç¨)
Excellent and hearty 
Value for money ... 
unbeatable
Very welcome, the waiters are professional, the restaurant is very clean.  Excellent food, We ate couscous. Discover

review title: Riad recommendation: really very tasty cuisine
review:
I feasted on lemon chicken tagine with Moroccan soup as a starter and orange cinnamon salad for dessert, so we came back for a meat tagine just as delicious.
Excellent value for money.

Best tagine of our lives!
A restaurant recommended by our hotel and we were not disappointed. In a word: EXCELLENT 
High quality service and dishes with a thousand flavors. To be tested absolutely!

The best dinner we had in Morocco! Very friendly service, they took care of us from the moment we arrived at the door till we left the place. One could see the waiters are doing their best to make the clients feel good. Very good food, everything we had was delicious, especially I liked the chicken tagine with caramel onions, the steak was good with pepper sauce and a special treat was the homemade yogurt. Very highly recommended!

A delight both in food and staff.We have been the last four nights and are going back tonight.If you want the best in Morocco  come to this  restaurant. The boss is charming and helpful and the prices are such value  and not like those boring old tagines of Marrakech. 100% From us.
Warm welcome, great quality food, excellent atmosphere. The owner takes the time to explain the dishes to his guests

review title: A tagine not to be missed
review:
Simply the best tagine we ate in Morocco!

Intimate setting, fast and warm service. This restaurant nestled in the heart of the medina of Essaouira is a nugget. You will eat very good dishes for only 9‚Ç¨ the menu starter, main course, dessert. 

The chicken tagine with grapes and caramelized onions is exquisite! We recommend this restaurant to everyone who goes to Essaouira and we are not the only ones, many locals and regulars go there and we understand the reason!

A very good typical restaurant 
The service very good
Very typical decoration
Correct prices
Very discreet ambient music

Typical setting, Exceptional welcome and Moroccan cuisine of very high standard...up to the perfume and taste sought after chilli sauces 

When it comes to value for money: just fabulous

A very good place to taste typical Moroccan dishes. 
A warm welcome in a pleasant atmosphere for more than reasonable prices.

We ate yesterday in this typical restaurant and loved it. Very good both the vegetable tajone and the Royal couscous. The owner super nice and very helpful. It is very well decorated and very welcoming. Very good price, with closed menus. Highly recommended.

Very good Moroccan cuisine, very nice welcome.the team is professional We had a great time. And besides, they offer us a verbena. 
Value for money, Award, unbeatable.
Thank you very much. 
Choukran
A good variety of fish, pizza and local food. Take out on order. Delivery. Nice interior, small patio.
Beginning to explore Laayoune. Found this place on Google Maps. Not bad. Ate late afternoon but guess this place is full in the evening.

I thank the staff very much for their kindness, the waiter, the housekeeper, the head reception for his welcome, the hotel is very clean, the PD buffet is very well organized,
The only thing I didn't appreciate was the quality of the towels, but other than everything is nickel,
Good luck, and I'll probably go back.

review title: Bad experience ‚Äì disappointing for bikers on their way to a big event
review:
We are a group of bikers from several African countries, having come a long way from Dakar to participate in the Road to Marrakech event. Unfortunately, our stay at this property was an unpleasant surprise.

We arrived a little late, tired of the road, but at the reception we were required to pay immediately, without offering any means of payment by card (no TPE). In addition, we were charged an extra room in error, and despite our claims, no refund was given.

This is unfortunate because we always try to promote hospitality and responsible tourism through our travels. This kind of attitude goes against the values of welcome and respect that travellers expect.

We hope this property will improve its service in the future.

review title: Don‚Äôt book deluxe - window opens into hallway
review:
Upon arrival, we were given three room options:

Basic / no window
Deluxe/ window
Suite

We went for the deluxe option specifically to have a window for light and fresh air. Paid 150 dh more per night than the basic option would be. Turns out that the ‚Äúwindow‚Äù opens into an air shaft with no air circulation and hardly any sunlight. People walking along the hallway can look right onto our bed when the blinds aren‚Äôt drawn. So no use at all.

We went back down to reception where we were told that for them, this is a perfectly adequate window and there are no other rooms with proper windows available. We then asked to switch to an economy room (because why pay extra for this?) - no dice. Staff refused to change our booking and kept repeating that we wanted a window and got one. Pretty rude and useless.

It‚Äôs like advertising a fridge in the room (and charging for that privilege) that‚Äôs not connected to the power. Shame because apart from that the room is fine but from such a high-priced hotel I expect more transparency and honesty.

While we stayed here we heard another two guests complain about the same issue to reception - again, staff did not care and would not change the booking to another category.

Great location but lots of false expectations. Just the Abdelbaset boy from reception and his colleague Majda were more than adorable.
Problem on arrival Reservation error despite messages sent and surcharge requested. I found myself in a room with no windows. The host had no commercial move. Problem 2 with friends picking me up the manager was horrible to them and spoke to me very badly as if we were together on the street. Then she sulked and was unprofessional. The last problem was that my Check-out date had been set but I had to leave the Pension a day earlier. No breakfast and wifi regularly down. I do not recommend the place at all

review title: The best visit to the city of Laayoune and Sahriano is the best choice
review: I had a wonderful stay. I did not expect the city of Laayoune and its hotels to be of this quality. Sahriano Hotel has a desert touch. I recommend visiting it. The staff is beyond amazing. They make you feel welcome and like they are your family. They advise you on the best restaurants in the city and where you can spend your vacation.

All the staff are very nice and helpful, the location is ideal close to McDonald's and other interesting places to eat, as well as being a very nice part of town. Fresh, fluffy towels and bedding, all extremely clean. I liked it

I had a more than wonderful experience. The hotel is located in the city center. You can find everything you want near you. The hotel staff is a wonderful team. The rooms are clean and smell good. I recommend it to all tourists. To visit it, it's worth it.

Great services, they make you feel like you are a really important guest, friendly staff, who always care about customer satisfaction. The rooms are distinctive, luxurious and elegant , The location of this hotel is in the center of laayoune . I will definitely stay in this hotel again when I return to Laayoune .

Actually the staff are very friendly and helpful with a perfect location, and facilities very multi and nice.
The room was very clean with a wonderful view. The room and beds very comfortable.
BTW the price was very good for the value. Impeccable hotel

the exceptional comfort, the quality of services, and the professionalism of the staff have significantly contributed to making my stay memorable. An establishment that I highly recommend, impeccable cleanliness,helpful and always present

Short review: The Hotel Laayoune appears to be very very new and modern. The flatscreen TV in our room still had protection screen film on. The rooms are enormous! The bathroom alone is the size of my kitchen. :)

Long review: My friend and I are on a motorcycle adventure tour from Denmark to Dakhla and back. When we first passed through Laayoune almost a week ago, we stayed at the H√¥tel Al Massira. I regret that now - we should have definitely stayed here both times! The rooms are big and modern, the staff was super helpful and we got to see different rooms in the hotel and choose which one to stay in for the night. Great service!
Moreover, we were initially told to park our motorcycles right outside their big glass windows at the reception for the night. However, the staff later suggested and encouraged us to take the motorcycles inside their (very nice) reception! Very much appreciated and definitely helps keep them more safe during the night.
Mind you, this was done while the reception / caf√© area was still crowded with customers having a late night cup of coffee or tea.

When I was going to West Sahara, people told me that everybody are really hospitable because they descend from nomads. I could feel it when I arrived at this hotel.
Sometimes the hotel you stay it¬¥s one of the best parts of the whole trip. It was like that staying at Grande Care hotel. Not so many times I felt so good and so welcomed staying in this hotel. 
The owner couldn¬¥t speak English, but even like that he was very nice and always calling the staff that works for him and that speaks a perfect English.
They explained everything I would see, do, walk around. Well, my friend. They were really nice and, even I staying one day, It seems that we are friends from decades!
Wanna an advice? Go to Laayoune and stay at Grande Care hotel!

review title: Not quite finished, but will be very nice
review: The hotel hasn't quite finished being built, and neither is has the (international) Grand Gare station opposite been opened yet. Eventually I think there will be a cafe/restaurant for breakfast and so on. Despite this, our room was very clean and comfortable with en suite, and hot water all day and in the evening. Wifi was throughout the building, but slightly stronger in the corridors. The young chap working on the reception was really nice and incredibly helpful. When the hotel opens properly he apparently will no longer have a job there, which is a shame as he a credit to the hotel and couldn't do enough to ensure we had a good stay.

We have been here for breakfast and dinner and can‚Äôt recommend it enough. Everything is fresh and delicious! The service is amazing! We had Jos√©, Juan and Alfrad today who provided a five star experience. We can‚Äôt wait to come here again!

Chef Elvia prepared the most amazing dishes for our group. For starters I had a breaded oyster taco that was too die for, then bouliabaise, followed up by an amazing red snapper. What an epicurian experience!

review title: Dinner with a large group of our family.
review: I've been all over the world and coming to Mexico for 25 years this was the best food I've ever had in Mexico and top seven restaurants I've ever had in my life and I've been to Michelin star restaurants. The.fod is on par with that level. W even asked the chef to come out. Chef Elvia  came out and our whole table applauded her. And what really hit home was how she said she makes all these meals with so much love and you can taste it! Seriously . It was absolutely incredible,  I don't even have the right adjectives for it,  it's that good!!! Go before sunset for the view is spectacular.

The staff at this resort is unbelievable. They are so attentive, so kind, and will go out of their way to make your experience just that much better. Specifically, I can‚Äôt say enough amazing compliments about Alfredo, Jorge and Erasmo. Every morning at breakfast, they remember my family, their likes, and my allergies and took such amazing care of us. We always look so forward to visiting here and even more so for them. Thank you for a wonderful experience!

Daniel was a great server! Was attentive and very knowledgeable about the menu. He surprised us on our last day with a Mexican coffee performance. Definitely will ask for him to serve us when we return!

Delicious breakfast at Anica. Lots of healthy options like vegan chia pudding along with standard eggs. Two for one mimosas till 11am. Alfredo and Juan were our excellent servers and always attentive!
Excellent food and service. Juan and Alfredo were attentive at all times and made the breakfast experience a 5-star. Highly recommended.
Raymundo made our dining experience delightful! Our dishes were beautifully plated and delicious! Portion sizes were a larger than expected.
It was a great visit. Alfredo, Erasmo and Esteban made breakfast very pleasant. They were quick, attentive and knowledgeable.

Had a wonderful stay at Pacific Dunes. The meals at Anica were all delicious. We had dinner and breakfast there multiple times. Menu had a variety of options and the service was great. They accommodated one of our guests who had gluten sensitivity. The team of Alfredo, Juan and Esteban were exceptional. We highly recommend.
Daniel, Eduardo, Edgar, and all the staff at Anica provided great dinner service. The food was wonderful. The braised beef ribs with mole was our favorite. The Mexican coffee show was also fun.

The lunches are delicious. And the boys who atien DE are excellent Alfredo, Jose, Luis and Luz always with a smile and very attentive make us feel very comfortable and confident , I wholeheartedly recommend them 100%
Luis, Alfredo, and Jose provided excellent service at Anika during our stay. They constantly checked in with us and made sure everything was right and went well.
Jose, Alfredo, and Luis provided excellent service at Anica during our stay. Food was great and service was amazing, highly recommend.
The food and service were absolutely amazing! Our waiters, Alfredo, Jorge, and Esteban were very diligent and thorough with our breakfast! I highly recommend!

A must for lovers of luxury without work, everything is neat, the staff is admirable of kindness and kindness. When I checked out, I was unfortunately present when a couple of local customers complained about the price of the meal (30 euros!), I invite these people to travel more often, I was amazed by the virulence and vulgarity of these people. No, go with your eyes closed, a place like this deserves and respects itself. Thank you to mamadou and hicham for their valuable advice.

review title: Luxury, Tranquility, fresh organic dinning at palais rhoul
review: palais rhoul is a absolute gem ! The stunning location, impeccable service, and serene atmosphere make it a perfect retreat. the staff goes above and beyond to ensure a memorable stay, and the fresh, organic food, tranquility, and exceptional dining by the sea.  Highly recommend for anyone looking for luxury.

Bah Bah Bah.... it is even more of a heavy, it is still elsewhere, a thing ouffissim this house, you can not believe your eyes everywhere you look, a museum on the water with paintings everywhere but super modern, like an old factory completely redone by a fashionable architect lol  
super efficient fraternal service with beautiful guys, and mentally ill rooms. everything is enough in there. dinner by the water for 35 euros, it is free considering the quality and service, I love egg:

We spent the Easter holidays here... the structure, the room, the restaurant (great food and... at least some wine... not found anywhere else) the pool... all beautiful!
Staff always present and very kind and the regent .... the beautiful JEANNE.... always present for every request and need ... at any time!

A piece of paradise on earth.
We have spent four days in that wonderful hotel and everything is perfect. Elegant decor, unsurpassed food and staff who serve you brilliantly. Our ocean view suite was very nice and spacious with a large shower overlooking. Special mention for Jeanne, always aware of everything you need to make your stay unforgettable, excursions, transfers, shopping, visits, thank you very much for your kindness and our Spanglish to understand us. I also want to mention Ben in the restaurant always with a smile and attentive to everything you want to eat and drink, thank you for your effort in speaking Spanish with us apart from English, and also a special memory to Fatima for her affection and to all the other staff who made us feel like you were home. Everything about this hotel is perfect.
Thank you all very much.

This hotel is a place where silence has the taste of luxury and where every breath of the wind tells a story of beauty. Facing the peaceful immensity of the lagoon, this elegant sanctuary invites you to let go between golden skies and silky sand. 
An enchanted parenthesis suspended between dream and reality.

My solo stay at the Rhoul Palace in dakhla was absolutely incredible! The highlight of this trip was undoubtedly the Spa, the atmosphere was so so soothing, and I treated myself to some of the best massages I ever received. The therapists were incredibly competent, a big thank you to Marie for her care provided with extreme kindness, to the Thai masseur for repairing my body and to Hayat for his gentleness. The spa is a true sanctuary perfect for recharging after a day of Kitesurfing. The Hotel itself is beautiful with a relaxing atmosphere and super welcoming staff. I felt really pampered and well looked after throughout my holiday. I can't wait to get back to it.

review title: The best place I have ever been to
review: I had an amazing time kitesurfing at this boutique hotel. The location is absolutely stunning with perfect wind conditions with cristal clear waters. The team there was super friendly and helpful making sure I had anything I needed to enjoy my session.The spot is ideal for experienced riders and the vibe is super chill, definetely one of the best places to kitesurf I have ever been to. I can't wait to come back.

an invitation to poetry, this small hotel or hot house from the end of the world is a haven of peace and happiness, everything is poetic in this place off the beaten track and the expected. the prices are reasonable, the boarding menu has 300 dirhams is right and the perfect location. I learned the wingfoil from the beach of the house, an absolute luxury. this house is a gift, thank you to all the team and especially to Jean for its availability. To do solo or as a couple for a crazy experience

Magical solo experience with rhoul palis! A sublime setting between desert and lagoon, a peaceful atmosphere and a service with little care. Delicious cuisine, just incredible massages with a crazy masseur, and a charming decoration pain. A real haven of peace, I would definitely return with my little family next year. For the record, you can learn winging on the spot, only good what!

I have just returned from an exceptional stay in Dakhla, and I could not fail to share my experience, everything was absolutely perfect from start to finish! 

Upon arrival, we were greeted with great warmth and attentive service. The team is super professional, always smiling, good mood, I have rarely seen such a quality of service. 

The bungalow was spacious, tastefully decorated, with stunning sea views: pure happiness to get up every morning üòç. The bed and pillows were super comfortable! 

Special mention for the kitchen, the meals were simply delicious and everything was super clean as at home! 

As for activities, it is a true paradise for nature lovers, sports and relaxation. The hotel offers surf lessons, kite surfing, yoga and a magical spa to relax. The instructors, the yoga teacher and the masseuses are just great! 

Thank you to the whole team for this magical stay üôèüèª

I had an amazing experience at Oc√©an Vagabond in Dakhla! The surfing was incredible, with perfect waves and great instructors who made the experience even more enjoyable thanks to Kamal and Youssef. The staff was extremely friendly and welcoming, making me feel right at home. The room was super clean and cozy, providing a perfect retreat after a day out on the water. I highly recommend this place for anyone looking for a fantastic surf getaway!

Wandering Ocean Lassarga is nothing less than a true little piece of paradise. The spot is sublime, the accommodation very comfortable but above all all all all the staff is taking care of your stay (and I don't even talk about the varied food, a treat!)
It is also the perfect place for kiting: 2 different spots (ocean and lagoon). A great nautical club with a staff at the top (thanks especially to Jamal and Momo!). 
In short, do not hesitate to go, you will not be disappointed;)

review title: Amazing place for kitesurf, surf and mote watersports while fully relaxing!
review: Amazing place to fully unwind, relax and do daily watersports! Must visit when you are looking for a place to kitesurf/ surf. Vagabond takes fully care of everything and the staff is always at your service. Amazing food, very good quality and different dishes every day of the week. The bungalows are very specious, clean and comfortable. Also the quality of the kite school is very good, high quality equipment and we had great lessons from Jamal. As beginners in kitesurf, Jamal assisted us along the week to progress a lot: making clean lines, going upwind and smooth turning. We will be back!

I spent a week here with a group of friends. The staff is incredibly kind, attentive and helpful. 
I have been taking kite surfing lessons all week with Abdilah, he is a very patient teacher, teacher, and always in a good mood. In a week I have made tremendous progress. I recommend it 100%.

7 days incredible! We came with my spouse for 7 days to do a Kite internship! Never practiced both and in 1 week thanks to Jamal we kiffed! Everything was perfect! Jamal's pedagogy that made us enjoy this new sport! The beautiful spot with a beautiful beach and so relaxing! We had the sun, the wind and all the conditions to be on top! The Bungalows are great, clean and the bedding is very comfortable.
The buffet and menus are excellent, congratulations to the chef! Yoga every morning with Tiff with an idyllic view.
Thank you to the whole team and your kindness throughout this stay.
We can't wait to get back! 
Lucia and Nicolas

Exceptional stay! An idyllic setting, cocooning. Flawless teams whether it is a restaurant (healthy and balanced buffet and gourmet .... excellent every day), at the boat club for wing lessons (we were able to fly with 1 week of lessons!), at the spa (intense and delicate massages)! A real bubble of oxygen and benevolence for 1 week!  We'll be right back. We were with our 5-month-old baby!

An amazing experience! If the site may seem a bit difficult at first for the less experienced kite/wingers, it is finally very accessible and you can navigate safely with few people on the water.
For the rest, hands magi An amazing experience! If the site may seem a bit difficult at first for the less experienced kite/wingers, it is finally very accessible and you can navigate safely with few people on the water.
For the rest , Tina‚Äôs magic hands will unravel your back tensions, unless it‚Äôs the yoga postures that Tiff will teach you every morning , Sami watching you from the beach will give you the advice that will allow you to stabilize your foil and make your first jibe , the boss with his big smile calls everyone by first name with a nice little word , the buffets compete in different flavors every night, the bungalows are super comfortable and with a breathtaking view of the ocean, and DJ Ahshraf will ignite your evenings! No doubt your stay will be unforgettable. Many thanks to the whole team and see you soon!

As every year, perfect stay in Lassarga with friends.
Beautiful spot, trip lagoon, white dune and speed spot 
Special mention to Amine, Zacharia, Younes and of course our Mouss guide 
This year even more than last time a big bravo and a special thank you to the chef and his team: probably the best table in Dakhla!
Great next year ü§©

Great welcome, food, bedding, cleanliness, kite equipment, wellness areaüòÅüòÅüëÅüëçüëçüëç the center is super well placed to kite + surf, few wings in the water, family atmosphere and young, ideal to sympathize, rest, make friends

I stayed at the Hotel Erraha for almost a week. When arriving, I did not have any plans, but Charly (and one of his friends) made it sure there was something going on every day.
The hotel is ideally located (althought it may not be evident from the map), at the end of the corniche. facing the park and the mosque.
My room was large (it was actually a small appartment, with 3 separate spaces), nice and clean, with the balcony overlooking the park and (a little further) the sea. 
With wi-fi in the room (and on the balcony) and breakfast included, I found the price to be very reasonable.
I enjoyed my stay in Dakhla a lot and will return to Hotel Erraha for sure.

Charly, Charles and his team are helpful and honest people. If you have a problem they look for a smart solution, not the most expensive one. Breakfast is fine and upon request an omelette is available. 
The whole hotel is very  windy with a lot of ghost-house noises and clapping windows. Charly: will be looked after ! Big rooms for ‚Ç¨18 /night 1 person occupancy. Short shower, has small boiler. Alltogether it is the best hotel in Dakhla, value for money wise.

Stayed at the Erraha for a couple of nights over the Xmas break. Charly the hotel owner was the perfect host, offering to pick me up from the airport in Dakhla without charge. The hotel is clean and comfortable and a great location with wifi. I was traveling alone and was offered a room with 2 single beds with a clean toilet and shower. Evenhad a kitchen area. The room was big, satellite TV with hundreds of channels and a fantastic view. Located 10 minutes walk from the centre very near the coast. The room was 200 dirhams per night. Charly is able to help out with local trips and arrange transportation further afield to Mauritania. I felt very safe and comfortable and would have no hesitation to recommend the hotel to others. Went to several other hotels to have a look at their facilities, but for value and comfort the Erraha was certainly the best choice. Can't wait to visit the Erraha again. Dakhla is a fantastic place to stay. Excellent weather, friendly, cheap with no hassles you get in the North. If you are looking for a perfect getaway to unwind look no further than Dakhla and stay at the Erraha. Don't expect 5 star accomodation, it doesn't exist. This is the Western Sahara. What you will get a fantastic experience. Well done Charly and your team.

The rooms are large, clean and pleasant. The staff is very kind and helpful. The hotel is located only a short walk away from the seafront. The restaurant serves decent food and the lounge provides free access to the Internet. There isn't always warm water but who cares unless you plan to stay there in winter. The mosque can be seen (and heard) from the balcony. There's a garage for you to park your motorbike.
Fatima is a great host with a lovely hotel with a beautiful view and location, thank you for your wonderful hospitality.

a little gem made with love where the owners are available, friendly and smile. go there especially if you are a solo kiter like me to discover the city in a family atmosphere. I'm going back there in December already because I enjoyed Dakhla and this hotel so much.

review title: Best Choice of Accommodations in Dakhla
review: Words cannot describe how happy and satisfied we were with our visit to this lovely Riad. The marvelous owner personally came to the airport with her private car to meet us and transfer us quickly to the property without any waste of time. She made sure we had all the information we needed for our stay. The rooms in the riad are absolutely gorgeous, well maintained with just the right decorations to make you feel you are at home in a special place. The breakfast is generous and made to order, and the view of sunrise over the ocean during breakfast is a big plus. We cannot wait to return to Dakhla and repeat this experience. Thank you very much to the lovely owners.

review title: The best place to stay in Dakhla
review: We stayed in Dar el Oro and enjoyed every minute of it. The place is located right on the seashore with amazing view of the lagoon. The lady owner Fatima is sweet and caring, and furnishes you with all the information you need. The rooms are spacious and super clean and have all the necessary amenities. Breakfast is fabulous and fresh and pick up and drop off at the airport are free of charge. What else can you ask for? Highly highly recommended!!

I stayed in Dar Rio Oro for 10 nights in December 2019. It was a very welcoming place run by Fatima and Phillipe, with flexibility and humour. Beautifully decorated, wonderfully situated, with staff who bent over backwards to help, it is situated right in the centre of Dakhla and is a good base of operations. Two of us used it as a base to explore the wildlife of the surrounding desert. We were gone by 11:00am and often did not get back until after 1:00am, but there was never a problem, as Uthman was always there to let us in. Great view over the lagoon in Dakhla. Highly recommended for any time spent in Dakhla.

Fatima and Philip are incredibly hospitable. Had a great 4x4 tour of the sand dues with them.

My luggage was left in Casablanca by Royal Air Maroc, next day Hicham from the hotel staff went to the airport and picked it up, no need for me to go, great service. Hicham also arranged for a car to Mauritania for the next part of my trip.

Good breakfast provided every day upstairs.

Had a room (no. 6) with a shared bath this worked out well, no problems with unavailable bathroom.

Room was a bit cold for me, its very windy in Dakhla and room was on the north/back side of the building. There is no heating which is the norm in these places.

Rio Oro a place well located in a quiet neighborhood, the owner is really friendly and will go out of his way to help you, affordable pricing with comfortable bed and hot shower. The balcony view at night is just breath taken.

We had a really nice stay at Rio Dar Oro and ending up extending our time here. The apartments are unique and beautifully designed, the beds comfortable. We didn‚Äôt have a chance to try the meals on offer but the breakfast was very nice and there‚Äôs beer available in the bar on the terrace with lovely views over the inner lagune. We‚Äôd be happy to be back here.

Airport pick up and drop off included.
Fatima very helpful.
Clean rooms, good beds, great shower.
Poor WiFi in room.
Nice location but in very dull city.
Car hire available at hotel. 
Breakfast standard fare.
A little expensive for what is offered.

I stayed there with my girlfriend in August. The hotel was fairly close to the centre (a 8 min walk) and immediately next to the lagoon, with nice views. 

What made it special is that we felt that we're living in a house with "heart". Starting from our chaffeur at the transfer, through the chefs till the hotel director, Daniel (who was substituting the owners at that time), everyone was extremely nice and proactively working on to make our stay exciting in the calm and hollow - albeit very charming - Dakhla. This meant we got a car to drive around (for a very fair price), we could order a home made dinner whenever we wanted, Daniel made us a free quick tour around the city, and he helped us organizing a jeep excursion deep into the Saharan desert, which happened to be our best day in the country, with lots to see, again at a fair price. We felt the staff is really curious about our well-being, maybe because the place is not yet that touristy, but it felt really nice. 

The hotel itself is built in a nice Moroccan style, the room was clean and spacious. I cannot recommend this place enough to anyone who's willing to visit Dakhla - even if you're there just for kitesurfing, it's worth to spend 1-2 nights there, to feel the real atmosphere. :)

The setting is pretty. 
We had a salad of sinners and squid as a starter that were pretty good. 
But disaster comes at the time of the dishes. "Fish grill" a horror. Fish not fresh at all hard with a strong smell. Vegetables have water, and fries with an oil smell used repeatedly. 
64th for eating only starters. 
We were not happy and the service leaves something to be desired.

review title: Excellent from your point of view
review:
Really great address, modern and high quality cuisine, good wines.
Not very expensive.
One of my best restaurants in Morocco

Nice place in this city construction site and destroy.. very slow service, you have to ask everything. Overcooked fish damage hearty plate. Little Moroccan cuisine. Lots of chic tables... European prices

review title: to try at lunch with the view
review: especially a bar, not great decoration and tasteless food but rather nice atmosphere with waiters available and smiling. It was oasis hotel Dakhla that advised us the address, to try for lunch next time.
Realy delicious well served & presented dishes french cuisine, realy rafine cuisine, with beautifull view on the lagoon , most chily & best food of dakhla

We had a great time, on the terrace a quiet lunch. The service was impeccable, the waiter was diligent and kind.
We tasted the oysters (excellent) and a lemon camel tagine, a nice surprise. I expected more vegetable choices but otherwise it was perfect
Restaurant with panoramic views, welcome and top service with delicious dishes, thanks to the chef who found us easily taxi to go to Pension

Great place the kitchen is excellent the welcome is very simpa
We spend a very pleasant time there 
And if you want to listen to good food you have an intimate lounge bar.
very good for the price, the view is pretty and the service pleasant. you just have to avoid it in the evening or it becomes more of a poorly frequented bar with a not very friendly atmosphere.
to do if no choice, friendly and helpful staff, kitsch and tasteless decoration, nice view, very gloomy alcohol clientele, tasteless dishes, best for having a beer
girls' bar, poorly attended; hostile limit, frozen food, frozen lobsters, frozen meats, to do if you are looking for company for the night, but be careful because it can quickly turn into a bad story

Great city spot! Beautiful seating next to the lagoon. A great selection of dishes, even a camel shepard's pie. Wine list available too.

Recommend if you're in Dakhla city, and want to try something different from the camps.

Magnificent place, among my best addresses in Dakhla.
I recommend it, they offer diverse dishes.
The restaurant is great, fast service, delicious dishes, we asked the chef for Roquefort cream patties, he was very nice, I recommend
tired place, super kitsch decoration, mediocre food, freshly frozen/defrosted and poorly cooked meat, very nice owner but not enough to make up for this mediocre restaurant

i find the place a very cool area where to chill with friends or weither with family, the staff are very welcoming and warm, to be honest i have visited all places at dakhla, i find this one the best because of their professionnalism and effort to satisfy clients, also dishes are tasty ad HELLLL and well cooked. Just wonderful place.

We have been there already on our last trip to Dakhla in May 2018 and came back this time. Most of the food is good and tasty, but honestly, sometimes we just popped in for dessert. Crema catalana is my personal favorite, but also the other desserts are delicious.

A unique and unforgettable experience. Having access to a SPA center with such excellent professionals truly saved my week, allowing me to recover properly and give my best in the next session. They have a physiotherapist, and the manager (Bouchra) speaks Spanish as well as English and is attentive to every detail

Incredible experience!
Incre√≠ble staff, best place to learn kite or improve your skills!
Best instructor ever, Abdo, language skills and best teacher ever!

Coming back soon, 100% recommend this place!
 
Thanks Dahkla Attitued! Thanks Abdo for this amazing experience

Highly recommended!
Bouchra, the manager, speaks five languages and is absolutely lovely. The massages are amazing, especially after kitesurfing sessions. On top of that, Bouchra is a physiotherapist ‚Äî she personally helped me recover from an injury so I could keep enjoying the kite trip.
Totally worth it. A 10/10 experience.

Great hotel and great spot DE wingfoil. Team DE wingfoil at the top. The Saad sports coach gives DE advice well suited to training alongside sailing and to prepare. He is very encouraging and smiling.

Taking classes of kite was awesome
First time in a board, from 0 to a 100 only in 10 hours of class with Toufik. Amazing instructor. Very recommended experience.
Thank you Toufik for making me able to enjoy it 100%

Abdo is the best, professional , always with a smile. If you want to have a good experience you have to go with him .

Thanks to abdo! 
Thanks d√°mela attitude hotel for this unique experience.
Nice spot. Good facilities. They now have padel court for non windy days. Big thanks to Saad aka THE COACH for his kindness.

Great Kitesurf h√¥tel. Came here one week with my family to learn to kite and I can say that the experience was great ! Special thanks to my kite instructor Momo !!
Will be back soon !

review title: WARNING! Disco Music and party Groups n√©ctar to Drag√≥n Camp bungallows. Impossible to sleep
review:
WARNING.!!!! They now accept groups who come to party and play very loud music in the bar area next to the Dragon Camp area. It's impossible to sleep until 3 a.m. some days. You pay ‚Ç¨180 a night to endure loud music, people shouting and screaming. Attitude is growing rapidly and is no longer the quiet place to relax and kitesurf. After complaining several times at reception, we were told that "it was what it was" and there was nothing they could do. We asked them to turn the music down a bit, but they told us that the partygoers would complain (and it was a large group).

si buscas hacer kite es el sitio. si buscas tranquilidad y descanso junto con hacer kite hay dos opciones: ir a otro sitio ( hay mucho en la zona) o preguntar si en la zona del Drag√≥n Camp van a tener grupos organizados que vienen a tener fiesta por la noche.

The most curious thing is that the hotel itself has signs asking guests to refrain from making noise or playing music after 11 a.m. (which is understandable). It seems like it's no longer the Dakhla Attitude it once was, and they're moving on to other things.

We have an exceptional stay.
The hotel beautiful these little blue bungalows in the dunes, the rooms are made ts days with care.
The beach is breathtaking because it is so beautiful.
A warm welcome thank you to Adam and the buttock üòâ always smiling listening EN ttt to satisfy customers.

The restaurant, DE quality, ts the days lunch and evening different menu.
The amazing waiters always the same if it is a buffet , of a kind ü•π again üôèüèª thank you.

Thanks to Mohamed our driver who was very there.

And finally, Wish no one respectful, and knows his work with a kindness nothing overplayed like the others too. What a pleasure DE sharing moments with people like that.

I'll be back Inshaallah 

Thank you all again.
Fatima is a great host with a lovely hotel with a beautiful view and location, thank you for your wonderful hospitality.

a little gem made with love where the owners are available, friendly and smile. go there especially if you are a solo kiter like me to discover the city in a family atmosphere. I'm going back there in December already because I enjoyed Dakhla and this hotel so much.
